  1904                                  ; DEVSYM.INC
  1905                                  ;============================================================================
  1906                                  ; 07/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
  1907                                  ; 30/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (DEVSYM.INC, MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
  1908                                  ; 21/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
  1909                                  
  1910                                  ;**	DevSym.inc - Device Symbols
  1911                                  
  1912                                  ; The device table list has the form:
  1913                                  struc	SYSDEV
  1914 00000000 ????????                .NEXT:		resd 1		;Pointer to next device header
  1915 00000004 ????                    .ATT:		resw 1		;Attributes of the device
  1916 00000006 ????                    .STRAT:		resw 1		;Strategy entry point
  1917 00000008 ????                    .INT:		resw 1		;Interrupt entry point
  1918 0000000A ????????????????        .NAME:		resb 8		;Name of device (only first byte used for block)
  1919                                  .size:
  1920                                  endstruc
  1921                                  
  1922                                  ;
  1923                                  ; ATTRIBUTE BIT MASKS
  1924                                  ;
  1925                                  ; CHARACTER DEVICES:
  1926                                  ;
  1927                                  ; BIT 15 -> MUST BE 1
  1928                                  ;     14 -> 1 IF THE DEVICE UNDERSTANDS IOCTL CONTROL STRINGS
  1929                                  ;     13 -> 1 IF THE DEVICE SUPPORTS OUTPUT-UNTIL-BUSY
  1930                                  ;     12 -> UNUSED
  1931                                  ;     11 -> 1 IF THE DEVICE UNDERSTANDS OPEN/CLOSE
  1932                                  ;     10 -> MUST BE 0
  1933                                  ;      9 -> MUST BE 0
  1934                                  ;      8 -> UNUSED
  1935                                  ;      7 -> UNUSED
  1936                                  ;      6 -> UNUSED
  1937                                  ;      5 -> UNUSED
  1938                                  ;      4 -> 1 IF DEVICE IS RECIPIENT OF INT 29H
  1939                                  ;      3 -> 1 IF DEVICE IS CLOCK DEVICE
  1940                                  ;      2 -> 1 IF DEVICE IS NULL DEVICE
  1941                                  ;      1 -> 1 IF DEVICE IS CONSOLE OUTPUT
  1942                                  ;      0 -> 1 IF DEVICE IS CONSOLE INPUT
  1943                                  ;
  1944                                  ; BLOCK DEVICES:
  1945                                  ;
  1946                                  ; BIT 15 -> MUST BE 0
  1947                                  ;     14 -> 1 IF THE DEVICE UNDERSTANDS IOCTL CONTROL STRINGS
  1948                                  ;     13 -> 1 IF THE DEVICE DETERMINES MEDIA BY EXAMINING THE FAT ID BYTE.
  1949                                  ;	    THIS REQUIRES THE FIRST SECTOR OF THE FAT TO *ALWAYS* RESIDE IN
  1950                                  ;	    THE SAME PLACE.
  1951                                  ;     12 -> UNUSED
  1952                                  ;     11 -> 1 IF THE DEVICE UNDERSTANDS OPEN/CLOSE/REMOVABLE MEDIA
  1953                                  ;     10 -> MUST BE 0
  1954                                  ;      9 -> MUST BE 0
  1955                                  ;      8 -> UNUSED
  1956                                  ;      7 -> UNUSED
  1957                                  ;      6 -> IF DEVICE HAS SUPPORT FOR GETMAP/SETMAP OF LOGICAL DRIVES.
  1958                                  ;	    IF THE DEVICE UNDERSTANDS GENERIC IOCTL FUNCTION CALLS.
  1959                                  ;      5 -> UNUSED
  1960                                  ;      4 -> UNUSED
  1961                                  ;      3 -> UNUSED
  1962                                  ;      2 -> UNUSED
  1963                                  ;      1 -> UNUSED
  1964                                  ;      0 -> UNUSED
  1965                                  ;
  1966                                  
  1967                                  ;Attribute bit masks
  1968                                  DEVTYP	EQU     8000H           ;Bit 15 - 1 if Char, 0 if block
  1969                                  DEVIOCTL EQU    4000H           ;Bit 14 - CONTROL mode bit
  1970                                  ISFATBYDEV EQU  2000H           ;Bit 13 - Device uses FAT ID bytes, comp media.
  1971                                  
  1972                                  ; 09/07/2018 - Retro DOS (DEVSYM.INC, MSDOS 3.3, 1987) 
  1973                                  
  1974                                  OUTTILBUSY EQU	2000H		; OUTPUT UNTIL BUSY IS ENABLED
  1975                                  ISNET	   EQU	1000H		; BIT 12 - 1 IF A NET DEVICE, 0 IF
  1976                                  				;  NOT.  CURRENTLY BLOCK ONLY.
  1977                                  DEVOPCL    EQU	0800H		; BIT 11 - 1 IF THIS DEVICE HAS
  1978                                  				;  OPEN,CLOSE AND REMOVABLE MEDIA
  1979                                  				;  ENTRY POINTS, 0 IF NOT
  1980                                  
  1981                                  EXTENTBIT  EQU	0400H		; BIT 10 - CURRENTLY 0 ON ALL DEVS
  1982                                  				;  THIS BIT IS RESERVED FOR FUTURE USE
  1983                                  				;  TO EXTEND THE DEVICE HEADER BEYOND
  1984                                  				;  ITS CURRENT FORM.
  1985                                  
  1986                                  ; NOTE BIT 9 IS CURRENTLY USED ON IBM SYSTEMS TO INDICATE "DRIVE IS SHARED".
  1987                                  ;    SEE IOCTL FUNCTION 9. THIS USE IS NOT DOCUMENTED, IT IS USED BY SOME
  1988                                  ;    OF THE UTILITIES WHICH ARE SUPPOSED TO FAIL ON SHARED DRIVES ON SERVER
  1989                                  ;    MACHINES (FORMAT,CHKDSK,RECOVER,..).
  1990                                  
  1991                                  IOQUERY	EQU	0080H		;Bit 7 - Supports generic IOCtl query
  1992                                  
  1993                                  DEV320	EQU	0040H		;BIT 6 - FOR BLOCK DEVICES, THIS
  1994                                  				;DEVICE SUPPORTS SET/GET MAP OF
  1995                                  				;LOGICAL DRIVES, AND SUPPORTS
  1996                                  				;GENERIC IOCTL CALLS.
  1997                                  				;FOR CHARACTER DEVICES, THIS
  1998                                  				;DEVICE SUPPORTS GENERIC IOCTL.
  1999                                  				;THIS IS A DOS 3.2 DEVICE DRIVER.
  2000                                  
  2001                                  ISSPEC	EQU     0010H		;Bit 4 - This device is special ; 15/03/2018
  2002                                  ;ISIBM	EQU     0010H		;Bit 4 - This device is special
  2003                                  ISCLOCK EQU     0008H           ;Bit 3 - This device is the clock device.
  2004                                  ISNULL  EQU     0004H           ;Bit 2 - This device is the null device.
  2005                                  ISCOUT  EQU     0002H           ;Bit 1 - This device is the console output.
  2006                                  ISCIN   EQU     0001H           ;Bit 0 - This device is the console input.
  2007                                  
  2008                                  EXTDRVR	EQU	0002h		;BIT 1 - BLOCK DEVICE EXTENDED DRIVER
  2009                                  				; (MSDOS 6.0, DEVSYM.INC, 1991) ; 30/04/2019
  2010                                  
  2011                                  ;Static Reguest Header
  2012                                  struc	SRHEAD
  2013 00000000 ??                      .REQLEN:	resb 1		;Length in bytes of request block
  2014 00000001 ??                      .REQUNIT:	resb 1		;Device unit number
  2015 00000002 ??                      .REQFUNC:	resb 1		;Type of request
  2016 00000003 ????                    .REQSTAT:	resw 1		;Status Word
  2017 00000005 ????????????????                	resb 8		;Reserved for queue links
  2018                                  .size:
  2019                                  endstruc
  2020                                  
  2021                                  ;Status word masks
  2022                                  STERR   EQU     8000H           ;Bit 15 - Error
  2023                                  STBUI   EQU     0200H           ;Bit 9 - Buisy
  2024                                  STDON   EQU     0100H           ;Bit 8 - Done
  2025                                  STECODE EQU     00FFH           ;Error code
  2026                                  WRECODE EQU     0
  2027                                  
  2028                                  ;Function codes
  2029                                  DINITHL EQU     26              ;Size of init header
  2030                                  DMEDHL  EQU     15              ;Size of media check header
  2031                                  DBPBHL  EQU     22              ;Size of Get BPB header
  2032                                  DRDWRHL EQU     22              ;Size of RD/WR header
  2033                                  DRDNDHL EQU     14              ;Size of non destructive read header
  2034                                  DSTATHL EQU     13              ;Size of status header
  2035                                  ; 21/02/2024
  2036                                  ;DFLSHL EQU     15              ;Size of flush header
  2037                                  DFLSHL	equ	13	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM  ; 21/02/2024
  2038                                  
  2039                                  DEVINIT EQU     0               ;Initialization
  2040                                  DEVMDCH EQU     1               ;Media check
  2041                                  DEVBPB  EQU     2               ;Get BPB
  2042                                  DEVRDIOCTL EQU  3               ;IOCTL read
  2043                                  DEVRD   EQU     4               ;Read
  2044                                  DEVRDND EQU     5               ;Non destructive read no wait (character devs)
  2045                                  DEVIST  EQU     6               ;Input status
  2046                                  DEVIFL  EQU     7               ;Input flush
  2047                                  DEVWRT  EQU     8               ;Write
  2048                                  DEVWRTV EQU     9               ;Write with verify
  2049                                  DEVOST  EQU     10              ;Output status
  2050                                  DEVOFL  EQU     11              ;Output flush
  2051                                  DEVWRIOCTL EQU  12              ;IOCTL write
  2052                                  
  2053                                  ; 09/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0 (DEVSYM.INC, MSDOS 3.3, 1987) 
  2054                                  DEVOPN	EQU	13		;DEVICE OPEN
  2055                                  DEVCLS	EQU	14		;DEVICE CLOSE
  2056                                  DOPCLHL EQU	13		;SIZE OF OPEN/CLOSE HEADER
  2057                                  DEVRMD	EQU	15		;REMOVABLE MEDIA
  2058                                  ; 07/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
  2059                                  REMHL	EQU	13		;SIZE OF REMOVABLE MEDIA HEADER
  2060                                  GENIOCTL EQU	19
  2061                                  
  2062                                  ; THE NEXT THREE ARE USED IN DOS 4.0
  2063                                  ;		     20
  2064                                  ;		     21
  2065                                  ;		     22
  2066                                  
  2067                                  DEVGETOWN      EQU   23		;GET DEVICE OWNER
  2068                                  DEVSETOWN      EQU   24		;SET DEVICE OWNER
  2069                                  ; 18/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  2070                                  IOCTL_QUERY    EQU   25		;Query generic ioctl support
  2071                                  
  2072                                  OWNHL	       EQU   13		;SIZE OF DEVICE OWNER HEADER
  2073                                  
  2074                                  DEVOUT	       EQU   16		; OUTPUT UNTIL BUSY.
  2075                                  DEVOUTL        EQU   DEVWRT	; LENGTH OF OUTPUT UNTIL BUSY
  2076

  2135                                  ;============================================================================
  2136                                  ; ERROR.INC (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
  2137                                  ;============================================================================
  2138                                  ; 16/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0 
  2139                                  
  2140                                  ;**	ERROR.INC - DOS Error Codes
  2141                                  ;
  2142                                  ;    The newer (DOS 2.0 and above) "XENIX-style" calls
  2143                                  ;    return error codes through AX. If an error occurred then
  2144                                  ;    the carry bit will be set and the error code is in AX. If no error
  2145                                  ;    occurred then the carry bit is reset and AX contains returned info.
  2146                                  ;
  2147                                  ;    Since the set of error codes is being extended as we extend the operating
  2148                                  ;    system, we have provided a means for applications to ask the system for a
  2149                                  ;    recommended course of action when they receive an error.
  2150                                  ;
  2151                                  ;    The GetExtendedError system call returns a universal error, an error
  2152                                  ;    location and a recommended course of action. The universal error code is
  2153                                  ;    a symptom of the error REGARDLESS of the context in which GetExtendedError
  2154                                  ;    is issued.
  2155                                  
  2156                                  ;	2.0 error codes
  2157                                  
  2158                                  error_invalid_function		EQU	1
  2159                                  error_file_not_found		EQU	2

  2301                                  ;============================================================================
  2302                                  ; INT2A.INC (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
  2303                                  ;============================================================================
  2304                                  ; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  2305                                  
  2306                                  ;**	Int 2A functions
  2307                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  2308                                  ;	Int 2A is an interface to the network code; it's also overloaded
  2309                                  ;		as a critical section handler since critical sections
  2310                                  ;		were originally created to support the net.
  2311                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  2312                                  
  2313                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  2314                                  ;**	This table was created by examining the source and may not be
  2315                                  ;	complete or completely accurate - JGL
  2316                                  ;
  2317                                  ;	M010	MD	8/31/90 - Added definition for AH = 5
  2318                                  
  2319                                  ;	(ah) = 0	installation check
  2320                                  ;			   (returns ah !=0 if installed)
  2321                                  ;	(ah) = 1	cooked net bios call
  2322                                  ;	(ah) = 3	query drive shared
  2323                                  ;			   (ds:si) = "n:" asciz string
  2324                                  ;	(ah) = 4	net bios
  2325                                  ;	       (al) = 0	   cooked net bios call
  2326                                  ;	       (al) = 1	   raw net bios call
  2327                                  ;	       (al) = 2	   ???
  2328                                  ;
  2329                                  ;	(ah) = 5	Get Net Adaptor Resources. CX returns the number of
  2330                                  ;			NCBs available/outstanding. DX returns the number of
  2331                                  ;			sessions. Supposedly, this is documented in an old
  2332                                  ;			IBM PC-LAN reference. Lotus Notes uses it. DOS LAN
  2333                                  ;			Manager 2.0 Enhanced responds to it. But it should
  2334                                  ;			not be used, as it is a hack, only to get Lotus
  2335                                  ;			Notes running.
  2336                                  ;
  2337                                  ;	(ah) = 80h	enter critical section
  2338                                  ;	(ah) = 81h	leave critical section
  2339                                  ;	(ah) = 82h	free all critical sections (Leave-all)
  2340                                  ;	(ah) = 84h	entering idle loop (don't understand how this works)
  2341                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  2342                                  
  2343                                  ;**	Critical section definitions
  2344                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  2345                                  ;	Although DOS is not designed to be reentrant there are some hacks
  2346                                  ;	which various programs use to make it so, in a limited fashion.
  2347                                  ;	Both WIN386 and some servers block copy a section of the DOS data
  2348                                  ;	area so that DOS can be reentered on behalf of another thread/program.
  2349                                  ;	DOS's global data structures, such as the memory arena, are not
  2350                                  ;	in this area, so critical section indicators are used to protect
  2351                                  ;	those areas.  DOS flags a critical section by issuing an INT_IBM
  2352                                  ;	(int 2Ah) at each critical section entry and exit.  Some clients
  2353                                  ;	(such as WIN386) just don't "context switch" the DOS when one
  2354                                  ;	of these is in effect, others, such as the IBM server, go ahead
  2355                                  ;	and reenter the DOS and if they get an int 2A to reenter the same
  2356                                  ;	critical section they then switch away from that second thread and
  2357                                  ;	let the first one finish and exit the section.
  2358                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  2359                                  
  2360                                  ; These below are subject to leave-all sections
  2361                                  critDisk    EQU     1			; Disk I/O critical section
  2362                                  critShare   EQU     1			; Sharer I/O critical section
  2363                                  critMem     EQU     1			; memory maintenance critical section
  2364                                  critSFT     EQU     1			; sft table allocation
  2365                                  critDevice  EQU     2			; Device I/O critical section
  2366                                  critNet     EQU     5			; network critical section
  2367                                  critIFS     EQU     6			; ifsfunc critical section
  2368                                  ; These below are not subject to leave-all sections
  2369                                  critASSIGN  EQU     8			; Assign has munged a system call
  2370                                  
  2371                                  ;============================================================================
  2372                                  ; MULT.INC (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)

  2374                                  ; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0

  2378                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  2379                                  ; The current set of defined multiplex channels is (* means documented):
  2380                                  ;
  2381                                  ;   Channel(h)  Issuer          Receiver    Function
  2382                                  ;      00       server          PSPRINT     print job control
  2383                                  ;     *01       print/apps      PRINT       Queueing of files
  2384                                  ;      02       BIOS            REDIR       signal open/close of printers
  2385                                  ;
  2386                                  ;      05       command         REDIR       obtain text of net int 24 message
  2387                                  ;     *06       server/assign   ASSIGN      Install check
  2388                                  ;
  2389                                  ;      08       external driver IBMBIO      interface to internal routines
  2390                                  ;
  2391                                  ;      10       sharer/server   Sharer      install check
  2392                                  ;      11       DOS/server      Redir       install check/redirection funcs
  2393                                  ;      12       sharer/redir    DOS         dos functions and structure maint
  2394                                  ;      13       MSNET           MSNET       movement of NCBs
  2395                                  ;      13       external driver IBMBIO      Reset_Int_13, allows installation
  2396                                  ;                                           of alternative INT_13 drivers after
  2397                                  ;                                           boot_up

  2581                                      ;	0   NLSInstall
  2582                                      ;	1   ChgCodePage

  2586                                  
  2587                                  multANSI    EQU     1Ah                 ; ANSI multiplex number
  2588                                      ;   0   INSTALL_CHECK               ; install check for ANSI
  2589                                      ;   1   IOCTL_2F                    ; 2F interface to IOCTL
  2590                                      ;   2   DA_INFO_2F                  ; J.K. Information passing to ANSI.
  2591                                  
  2592                                  multMULT        EQU     4Ah
  2593                                  multMAGIC       EQU     256*multMULT + 11h
  2594                                  multMULTRPLTOM  EQU     06h
  2595                                  
  2596                                      ;   0   swap disk function for single floppy drive m/cs
  2597                                      ;       BIOS broadcasts with cx==0, and apps who handle
  2598                                      ;       swap disk messaging set cx == -1. BIOS sets dl == requested
  2599                                      ;       drive
  2600                                      ;
  2601                                      ;   1   Get available HMA & pointer to it. Returns in BX & ES:DI
  2602                                      ;   2   Allocate HMA. BX == number of bytes in HMA to be allocated
  2603                                      ;       returns pointer in ES:DI
  2604                                      ;
  2605                                      ;   3-4 currently used by nobody
  2606                                      ;   5   Switcher API
  2607                                      ;   6   Top of Memory for RPL.
  2608                                      ;           BIOS issues INT 2f AX=4a06 & DX = Top of Mem and any RPL
  2609                                      ;           code present in TOM should respond with a new TOM in DX
  2610                                      ;           to protect itself from MSLOAD & SYSINIT tromping over it.
  2611                                      ;           SYSINIT builds an arena with owner type 8 & name 'RPL' to
  2612                                      ;           protect the RPL code from COMMAND.COM transient protion.
  2613                                      ;           It is the responsibility of RPL program to release the mem.
  2614                                      ;   7   Reserved for PROTMAN support.
  2615                                      ;  10   smartdrv 4.0
  2616                                      ;  11   dblspace api
  2617                                      ;  12   MRCI     api
  2618                                      ;  13   dblspace/mrci stealth packet api
  2619                                  
  2620                                  MultAPM     EQU     4ch             ; Obselete ???
  2621                                      ;       00h     APM_VER_CHK
  2622                                      ;       01h     APM_SUS_SYS_REQ
  2623                                      ;       FFh     APM_SUS_RES_BATT_NOTIFY
  2624                                  
  2625                                  MultPWR_BRDCST  EQU     53h     ; Used by POWER.EXE to broadcast      ; M036

  2764                                  ;============================================================================
  2765                                  ; CURDIR.INC (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
  2766                                  ;============================================================================
  2767                                  ; 25/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  2768                                  ; 09/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0 (CURDIR.INC, MSDOS 3.3, 1987)
  2769                                  
  2770                                  ;BREAK <Current directory list structure>
  2771                                  
  2772                                  ;----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----;
  2773                                  ;	     C	A  V  E  A  T	  P  R	O  G  R  A  M  M  E  R		   ;
  2774                                  ;									   ;
  2775                                  ; CDS items are used bu the internal routines to store cluster numbers and ;
  2776                                  ; network identifiers for each logical name.  The ID field is used dually, ;
  2777                                  ; both as net ID and for a cluster number for local devices.  In the case  ;
  2778                                  ; of local devices, the cluster number will be -1 if there is a potential  ;
  2779                                  ; of the disk being changed or if the path must be recracked.		   ;
  2780                                  ;
  2781                                  ;	Some pathnames have special preambles, such as
  2782                                  ;
  2783                                  ;		\\machine\sharename\...
  2784                                  ;	For these pathnames we can't allow ".." processing to back us
  2785                                  ;	up into the special front part of the name.  The CURDIR_END field
  2786                                  ;	holds the address of the seperator character which marks
  2787                                  ;	the split between the special preamble and the regular
  2788                                  ;	path list; ".." processing isn't allowed to back us up past
  2789                                  ;	(i.e., before) CURDIR_END
  2790                                  ;	For the root, it points at the leading /.  For net
  2791                                  ;	assignments it points at the end (nul) of the initial assignment:
  2792                                  ;	A:/	\\foo\bar	    \\foo\bar\blech\bozo
  2793                                  ;	  ^		 ^		     ^
  2794                                  
  2795                                  DIRSTRLEN	EQU	64+3		; Max length in bytes of directory strings
  2796                                  
  2797                                  TEMPLEN 	EQU	DIRSTRLEN*2
  2798                                  
  2799                                  struc curdir	; curdir_list
  2800 00000000 <res 43h>               .text:		resb DIRSTRLEN		; text of assignment and curdir
  2801 00000043 ????                    .flags:		resw 1			; various flags
  2802 00000045 ????????                .devptr:	resd 1			; local pointer to DPB or net device
  2803 00000049 ????????                .ID:		resw 2			; cluster of current dir (net ID)
  2804 0000004D ????                    .user_word:	resw 1
  2805 0000004F ????                    .end:		resw 1			; index to ".." backup limit - see above
  2806                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
  2807 00000051 ??                      .type:		resb 1			; IFS drive (2=ifs, 4=netuse)
  2808 00000052 ????????                .ifs_hdr:	resd 1			; Ptr to File System Header
  2809 00000056 ????                    .fsda:		resb 2			; File System Dependent Data Area
  2810                                  .size:
  2811                                  endstruc
  2812                                  
  2813                                  curdirLen	EQU curdir.size	; 88	; Needed for screwed up
  2814                                  
  2815                                  %define curdir_netID curdir_ID  ; dword
  2816                                  
  2817                                  ;**	Flag values for CURDIR_FLAGS
  2818                                  
  2819                                  curdir_isnet	EQU	1000000000000000B
  2820                                  CURDIR_isifs	EQU	1000000000000000B ; MSDOS 6.0	
  2821                                  curdir_inuse	EQU	0100000000000000B
  2822                                  curdir_splice	EQU	0010000000000000B
  2823                                  curdir_local	EQU	0001000000000000B
  2824                                  
  2825                                  ;									   ;
  2826                                  ;	     C	A  V  E  A  T	  P  R	O  G  R  A  M  M  E  R		   ;
  2827                                  ;----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----;
  2828                                  
  2829                                  ;============================================================================
  2830                                  ; CPMFCB.INC (MSDOS 3.3, 1987)
  2831                                  ;============================================================================
  2832                                  ; 09/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
  2833                                  
  2834                                  ;BREAK <File Control Block definition>
  2835                                  
  2836                                  ;
  2837                                  ; Field definition for FCBs
  2838                                  ; The FCB has the following structure:
  2839                                  ;
  2840                                  ;	+---------------------------+
  2841                                  ;	|   Drive indicator(byte)   |
  2842                                  ;	+---------------------------+
  2843                                  ;	|    Filename (8 chars)     |
  2844                                  ;	+---------------------------+
  2845                                  ;	|    Extension (3 chars)    |
  2846                                  ;	+---------------------------+
  2847                                  ;	|   Current Extent(word)    |
  2848                                  ;	+---------------------------+
  2849                                  ;	|    Record size (word)     |
  2850                                  ;	+---------------------------+
  2851                                  ;	|    File Size (2 words)    |
  2852                                  ;	+---------------------------+
  2853                                  ;	|	Date of write	    |
  2854                                  ;	+---------------------------+
  2855                                  ;	|	Time of write	    |
  2856                                  ;	+---------------------------+
  2857                                  ;----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----;
  2858                                  ;	     C	A  V  E  A  T	  P  R	O  G  R  A  M  M  E  R		   ;
  2859                                  ;									   ;
  2860                                  ;	+---------------------------+
  2861                                  ;	|   8 bytes reserved	    |
  2862                                  ;	+---------------------------+
  2863                                  ;									   ;
  2864                                  ;	     C	A  V  E  A  T	  P  R	O  G  R  A  M  M  E  R		   ;
  2865                                  ;----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----;
  2866                                  ;	|    next record number     |
  2867                                  ;	+---------------------------+
  2868                                  ;	|   random record number    |
  2869                                  ;	+---------------------------+
  2870                                  ;
  2871                                  
  2872                                  struc	SYS_FCB
  2873 00000000 ??                      .drive:	resb 1
  2874 00000001 ????????????????        .name:	resb 8
  2875 00000009 ??????                  .ext:	resb 3
  2876 0000000C ????                    .EXTENT: resw 1
  2877 0000000E ????                    .RECSIZ: resw 1			; Size of record (user settable)
  2878 00000010 ????                    .FILSIZ: resw 1			; Size of file in bytes; used with the
  2879                                  				; following word
  2880 00000012 ????                    .DRVBP:	resw 1			; BP for SEARCH FIRST and SEARCH NEXT
  2881 00000014 ????                    .FDATE:	resw 1			; Date of last writing
  2882 00000016 ????                    .FTIME:	resw 1			; Time of last writing
  2883                                  ;----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----;
  2884                                  ;	     C	A  V  E  A  T	  P  R	O  G  R  A  M  M  E  R		   ;
  2885                                  ;									   ;
  2886 00000018 ????????????????        .reserved: resb 8		; RESERVED
  2887                                  ;									   ;
  2888                                  ;	     C	A  V  E  A  T	  P  R	O  G  R  A  M  M  E  R		   ;
  2889                                  ;----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----+----;
  2890 00000020 ??                      .NR:	resb 1			; Next record
  2891 00000021 ????????                .RR:	resb 4			; Random record
  2892                                  .size:
  2893                                  endstruc
  2894                                  
  2895                                  FILDIRENT EQU SYS_FCB.FILSIZ	; Used only by SEARCH FIRST and SEARCH
  2896                                  				; NEXT
  2897                                  ; 20/07/2018
  2898                                  %define fcb_sfn	SYS_FCB.reserved ; byte
  2899                                  
  2900                                  ; Note that fcb_net_handle, fcb_nsl_drive, fcb_nsld_drive and fcb_l_drive
  2901                                  ; all must point to the same byte.  Otherwise, the FCBRegen will fail.
  2902                                  ; NOTE about this byte (fcb_nsl_drive)
  2903                                  ;   The high two bits of this byte are used as follows to indicate the FCB type
  2904                                  ;	00 means a local file or device with sharing loaded
  2905                                  ;	10 means a remote (network) file
  2906                                  ;	01 means a local file with no sharing loaded
  2907                                  ;	11 means a local device with no sharing loaded
  2908                                  
  2909                                  ; 20/07/2018
  2910                                  
  2911                                  ;
  2912                                  ; Network FCB
  2913                                  ;
  2914                                  
  2915                                  %define fcb_net_drive	SYS_FCB.reserved+1  ; byte
  2916                                  %define fcb_net_handle	SYS_FCB.reserved+2  ; word
  2917                                  %define fcb_netID	SYS_FCB.reserved+4  ; dword		
  2918                                  
  2919                                  ;
  2920                                  ; No sharing local file FCB
  2921                                  ;
  2922                                  
  2923                                  %define fcb_nsl_drive	SYS_FCB.reserved+1  ; byte
  2924                                  %define fcb_nsl_bits	SYS_FCB.reserved+2  ; byte	
  2925                                  %define fcb_nsl_firclus SYS_FCB.reserved+3  ; word	
  2926                                  %define fcb_nsl_dirsec	SYS_FCB.reserved+5  ; word
  2927                                  %define fcb_nsl_dirpos  SYS_FCB.reserved+7  ; byte
  2928                                  
  2929                                  ;
  2930                                  ; No sharing local device FCB
  2931                                  ;
  2932                                  
  2933                                  %define fcb_nsld_drive	SYS_FCB.reserved+1  ; byte	
  2934                                  %define fcb_nsld_drvptr SYS_FCB.reserved+2  ; dword
  2935                                  
  2936                                  ;
  2937                                  ; Sharing local FCB
  2938                                  ;
  2939                                  
  2940                                  %define fcb_l_drive	SYS_FCB.reserved+1  ; byte
  2941                                  %define fcb_l_firclus	SYS_FCB.reserved+2  ; word
  2942                                  %define fcb_l_mfs	SYS_FCB.reserved+4  ; word
  2943                                  %define fcb_l_attr	SYS_FCB.reserved+6  ; byte
  2944                                  
  2945                                  ;
  2946                                  ; Bogusness:  the four cases are:
  2947                                  ;
  2948                                  ;   local file	    00
  2949                                  ;   local device    40
  2950                                  ;   local sharing   C0
  2951                                  ;   network	    80
  2952                                  ;
  2953                                  ; Since sharing and network collide, we cannot use a test instruction for
  2954                                  ; deciding whether a network or a share check in involved
  2955                                  ;
  2956                                  FCBDEVICE   EQU 040h
  2957                                  FCBNETWORK  EQU 080h
  2958                                  FCBSHARE    EQU 0C0h
  2959                                  
  2960                                  ; FCBSPECIAL must be able to mask off both net and share
  2961                                  FCBSPECIAL  EQU 080h
  2962                                  FCBMASK     EQU 0C0h
  2963                                  
  2964                                  ;============================================================================

  3141                                  ; DOSCODE
  3142                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  3143                                  ; 04/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
  3144                                  
  3145                                  ;============================================================================
  3146                                  ; MSHEAD.ASM (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
  3147                                  ;============================================================================
  3148                                  ; 16/07/2018 - Retro DOS 3.0
  3149                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  3150                                  ; 24/04/2019 - Retro DOS 4.0
  3151                                  
  3152                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
  3153                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  3154                                  ; FILE : ORIGIN.INC
  3155                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  3156                                  ; This is included in origin.asm and mshead.asm. Contains the equate that
  3157                                  ; is used for ORGing the DOS code.
  3158                                  ;
  3159                                  ; Brief Description of the necessacity of this ORG:
  3160                                  ; -------------------------------------------------
  3161                                  ;
  3162                                  ; A special problem exits when running out of the HMA. The HMA starts at 
  3163                                  ; address FFFF:10. There is no place in the HMA with an offset of zero.
  3164                                  ; This means programs running out off the HMA must use non-zero offset base
  3165                                  ; addresses. It also means that if we're running multiple programs from the
  3166                                  ; HMA, the base offset of each segment must atleast be as big as all of the
  3167                                  ; HMA segments that precede it.
  3168                                  ; 
  3169                                  ; One solution to this problem to ORG each module at 64K minus its size.
  3170                                  ; For instance a code segment 1234h bytes in length would org'd at edcbh.
  3171                                  ; This gives max. flexibility regarding it's location in the HMA. By 
  3172                                  ; selecting segment values between f124h and ffffh it could be located 
  3173                                  ; anywhere in the HMA. The problem with this is that programs with such 
  3174                                  ; high ORGs would not be able to run in low RAM.
  3175                                  ;
  3176                                  ; A compromise solution is to set the ORG address somewhere between 0010h
  3177                                  ; and ffffh - their size. In the particular case of the BIOS and the DOS 
  3178                                  ; the following solution has been implemented:
  3179                                  ;
  3180                                  ; The Bios Code segment will have a very small offset and run at the very
  3181                                  ; front of the HMA, after the VDISK header. THE Dos Code segment will have 
  3182                                  ; a base offset of (700+<min. size off RAM based BIOS>+<min. size of the DOS
  3183                                  ; DATA segment when DOS is running low>). This will reflect the lowest 
  3184                                  ; possible physical address at which DOS code will run, while still providing
  3185                                  ; max. possible flexibility in HMA positioning. This offset MUST NOT be 
  3186                                  ; smaller then that 20+size of Bios Code segment when running high. This is 
  3187                                  ; mostly true.
  3188                                  ;
  3189                                  ; Also this ORG'd value must be communicated to the BIOS. This is done by
  3190                                  ; putting this value after the first jmp instruction in the DOS code in
  3191                                  ; mshead.asm. 
  3192                                  ;
  3193                                  ; In order for the stripz utility to know how many zeroes to be stripped 
  3194                                  ; out, this value is placed at the beginning of the binary in origin.asm.
  3195                                  ;
  3196                                  ; Revision History:
  3197                                  ;
  3198                                  ; Currently this is being done manually. Therefore any change in the DOS DATA
  3199                                  ; Size or the BIOS size should be reflected here. --- Feb 90
  3200                                  ;
  3201                                  ; BDSIZE.INC contains the equates for BIODATASIZE, BIOCODESIZ and DOSDATASIZ.
  3202                                  ; A utility called getsize will obtain the corresponding values from msdos
  3203                                  ; and msbio.map and update the values in BDSIZ.INC if they are different. 
  3204                                  ; DOS should now be built using the batch file makedos.bat which invokes this
  3205                                  ; utility. The FORMAT of BDSIZE.INC should not be changed as getsize is 
  3206                                  ; dependant on that.				  --- Apr 3 '90
  3207                                  ;
  3208                                  ; For ROMDOS, however, there is no need to org the doscode to any location
  3209                                  ; other than zero.  Therefore the stripz utility will not need to be used,
  3210                                  ; so the offset will not need to be included at the beginning of the code
  3211                                  ; segment.  Also, the BIOS can just assume that the resident code begins
  3212                                  ; at offset zero within the segment.
  3213                                  ; 
  3214                                  ;
  3215                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
  3216                                  
  3217                                  BIODATASTART	EQU	00700h
  3218                                  ;include	bdsize.inc	; this sets the values:
  3219                                  				;	BIODATASIZ
  3220                                  				;	BIOCODESIZ
  3221                                  				;	DOSDATASIZ
  3222                                  
  3223                                  ; 05/12/2022
  3224                                  ;BIODATASIZ EQU 00910H	; 0900h for MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS
  3225                                  			; 0900h for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS
  3226                                  ;BIOCODESIZ EQU 01A70H	; 1A70h for MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS
  3227                                  			; 1A60h for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS
  3228                                  ;DOSDATASIZ EQU 01370H	; 1370h for MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS
  3229                                  			; 1370h for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS
  3230                                  ;ifndef ROMDOS
  3231                                  ;
  3232                                  ;BYTSTART	EQU    	BIODATASTART+BIODATASIZ+BIOCODESIZ+DOSDATASIZ
  3233                                  ;PARASTART	EQU	(BYTSTART + 0FH) AND (NOT 0FH)	
  3234                                  ;
  3235                                  ;else
  3236                                  ;
  3237                                  ;BYTSTART	EQU	0
  3238                                  ;PARASTART	EQU	0
  3239                                  ;
  3240                                  ;endif ; ROMDOS
  3241

  3243                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------
  3244                                  ;MSDAT001E equ 136Ah ; 4970 ; for MSDOS 6.21	
  3245                                  ;MSDAT001E equ 1370h ; 4976 ; for Retro DOS v4.0 modif. 25/05/2019	
  3246                                  ;DOSDATASIZE equ MSDAT001E
  3247                                  ; 05/12/2022
  3248                                  ;DOSDATASIZE equ $ ; 29/04/2019 ; -only- for RETRO DOS v4.0 :
  3249                                  ;_PARASTART_ equ DOSDATASIZE ; segment value will point to start of
  3250                                  			    ; of DOSDATA (in low memory) while
  3251                                  			    ; dos/kernel code starts just after 
  3252                                  			    ; this data block ((org = DOSDATASIZE))
  3253                                  			    ; (in low memory or in HMA)

  3326                                  ; MSTABLE.ASM (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
  3327                                  ;============================================================================
  3328                                  ; 16/07/2018 - Retro DOS 3.0
  3329                                  ; 29/04/2019 - Retro DOS 4.0
  3330                                  
  3331                                  	; (MSDOS version)
  3332                                  	; DOSCODE:3DE9h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
  3333                                  	;db	6
  3334                                  	;db	20
  3335                                  	; 04/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS) 
  3336                                  	; DOSCODE:3DD9h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
  3337                                  	;db	5
  3338                                  	;db	0	
  3339                                  
  3340                                  	; Offset 0C78h in IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987)
  3341                                  MSVERS:				; MS-DOS version in hex for $GET_VERSION
  3342 00000009 07                      MSMAJOR: DB	MAJOR_VERSION	; DOS_MAJOR_VERSION
  3343 0000000A 0A                      MSMINOR: DB	MINOR_VERSION	; DOS_MINOR_VERSION  
  3344                                  
  3345                                  ;;hkn YRTAB & MONTAB moved to DOSDATA in ms_data.asm
  3346                                  ;	I_am	YRTAB,8,<200,166,200,165,200,165,200,165>   ; [SYSTEM]
  3347                                  ;	I_am	MONTAB,12,<31,28,31,30,31,30,31,31,30,31,30,31> ; [SYSTEM]
  3348                                  
  3349                                  ; DOSTAB.ASM (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
  3350                                  ; YRTAB & MONTAB moved from TABLE segment in ms_table.asm
  3351                                  ;
  3352                                  ;	I_am    YRTAB,8,<200,166,200,165,200,165,200,165>   
  3353                                  ;	I_am    MONTAB,12,<31,28,31,30,31,30,31,31,30,31,30,31> 
  3354                                  
  3355                                  ; This is the error code mapping table for INT 21 errors. This table defines
  3356                                  ; those error codes which are "allowed" for each system call. If the error
  3357                                  ; code ABOUT to be returned is not "allowed" for the call, the correct action
  3358                                  ; is to return the "real" error via Extended error, and one of the allowed
  3359                                  ; errors on the actual call.
  3360                                  ;
  3361                                  ; The table is organized as follows:
  3362                                  ;
  3363                                  ;    Each entry in the table is of variable size, but the first
  3364                                  ;       two bytes are always:
  3365                                  ;
  3366                                  ;       Call#,Cnt of bytes following this byte
  3367                                  ;
  3368                                  ; EXAMPLE:
  3369                                  ;       Call 61 (OPEN)
  3370                                  ;
  3371                                  ;       DB      61,5,12,3,2,4,5
  3372                                  ;
  3373                                  ;       61 is the AH INT 21 call value for OPEN.
  3374                                  ;        5 indicates that there are 5 bytes after this byte (12,3,2,4,5).
  3375                                  ;       Next five bytes are those error codes which are "allowed" on OPEN.
  3376                                  ;       The order of these values is not important EXCEPT FOR THE LAST ONE (in
  3377                                  ;       this case 5).  The last value will be the one returned on the call if
  3378                                  ;       the "real" error is not one of the allowed ones.
  3379                                  ;
  3380                                  ; There are a number of calls (for instance all of the FCB calls) for which
  3381                                  ;   there is NO entry.  This means that NO error codes are returned on this
  3382                                  ;   call, so set up an Extended error and leave the current error code alone.
  3383                                  ;
  3384                                  ; The table is terminated by a call value of 0FFh
  3385                                  
  3386                                  ;PUBLIC I21_MAP_E_TAB
  3387                                  	; 10/08/2018
  3388                                  
  3389                                  ; 29/04/2019
  3390                                  ; DOSCODE:3DE9h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
  3391                                  ; 04/11/2022
  3392                                  ; DOSCODE:3DDBh	(MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
  3393                                  ; 01/01/2024
  3394                                  ; DOSCODE:3F1Bh	(PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
  3395                                  
  3396                                  I21_MAP_E_TAB:	; LABEL	BYTE
  3397 0000000B 38020102                    DB  INTERNATIONAL,2,error_invalid_function,error_file_not_found
  3398 0000000F 3903030205                  DB  MKDIR,3,error_path_not_found,error_file_not_found,error_access_denied
  3399 00000014 3A041003                    DB  RMDIR,4,error_current_directory,error_path_not_found

  3992                                  ; DosCode SEGMENT
  3993                                  
  3994                                  ; ==========================================================================
  3995                                  ;
  3996                                  ; $Set_CTRL_C_Trapping
  3997                                  ;
  3998                                  ; Function:
  3999                                  ;	Enable disable ^C checking in dispatcher
  4000                                  ;
  4001                                  ; Inputs:
  4002                                  ;		AL = 0 read ^C status
  4003                                  ;		AL = 1 Set ^C status, DL = 0/1 for ^C off/on
  4004                                  ;		AL = 2 Set ^C status to contents of DL.	Output is old state.
  4005                                  ;		AL = 5 get DOS boot drive
  4006                                  ;		AL = 6 Get version number
  4007                                  ;			RETURNS:
  4008                                  ;				BH = Minor version number
  4009                                  ;				BL = Major version number
  4010                                  ;				DL = DOS internal revision
  4011                                  ;				DH = DOS type flags
  4012                                  ;					Bit 3 	- DOS in ROM
  4013                                  ;					Bit 4 	- DOS in HMA
  4014                                  ;					Bit 0-2, 5-7 - Reserved
  4015                                  ; Outputs:
  4016                                  ;		If AL = 0 then DL = 0/1 for ^C off/on
  4017                                  ;
  4018                                  ; History:
  4019                                  ;      removed	AL = 3 Get CPSW state to DL	    DOS 3.4
  4020                                  ;      removed	AL = 4 Set CPSW state from DL	    DOS 3.4
  4021                                  ; ==========================================================================
  4022                                  
  4023                                  ; 04/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
  4024                                  ; DOSCODE:4045h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
  4025                                  
  4026                                  ; 01/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
  4027                                  ; DOSCODE:4123h (PCDOS 7.1, IBMDOS.COM)
  4028                                  
  4029                                  _$SET_CTRL_C_TRAPPING:
  4030                                  	; 01/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  4031                                  
  4032 0000023D 3C07                    	cmp	al,7	; 01/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
  4033                                  	;cmp	AL,6			; Is this a valid subfunction?
  4034 0000023F 7603                    	jbe	short scct_1		; If yes continue processing
  4035                                  
  4036 00000241 B0FF                    	mov	AL,0FFh			; Else set AL to -1 and
  4037 00000243 CF                      	iret
  4038                                  scct_1:
  4039 00000244 1E                      	push	DS
  4040                                  
  4041                                  	;getdseg <DS>			; DS -> DosData, ASSUME DS:DosSeg
  4042 00000245 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
  4043                                  	
  4044 0000024A 50                      	push	AX			; DL only register that can change
  4045 0000024B 56                      	push	SI
  4046                                  
  4047 0000024C BE[3703]                	mov	SI,CNTCFLAG		; DS:SI --> Ctrl C Status byte
  4048 0000024F 30E4                    	xor	AH,AH			; Clear high byte of AX
  4049 00000251 09C0                    	or	AX,AX			; Check for subfunction 0
  4050 00000253 7504                    	jnz	short scct_2		; If not 0 jmp to next check
  4051                                  
  4052 00000255 8A14                    	mov	DL,[SI]			; Else move current ctrl C status
  4053 00000257 EB32                    	jmp	SHORT scct_9s		; into DL and jmp to exit
  4054                                  scct_2:
  4055 00000259 48                      	dec	AX			; Now dec AX and see if it was 1
  4056 0000025A 7507                    	jnz	short scct_3		; If not 0 it wasn't 1 so do next chk
  4057                                  
  4058 0000025C 80E201                  	and	DL,1			; Else mask off bit 0 of DL and
  4059 0000025F 8814                    	mov	[SI],DL			; save it as new Ctrl C status
  4060 00000261 EB28                    	jmp	SHORT scct_9s		; Jmp to exit
  4061                                  scct_3:
  4062 00000263 48                      	dec	AX			; Dec AX again to see if it was 2
  4063 00000264 7507                    	jnz	short scct_4		; If not 0 wasn't 2 so go to next chk
  4064                                  
  4065 00000266 80E201                  	and	DL,1			; Else mask off bit 0 of DL and
  4066 00000269 8614                    	xchg	[SI],DL			; Exchange DL with old status byte
  4067 0000026B EB1E                    	jmp	SHORT scct_9s		; Jump to exit (returning old status)
  4068                                  scct_4:
  4069 0000026D 3C03                    	cmp	al,3 ; 01/01/2024
  4070                                  	;cmp	AX,3 			; Test for 5 after it was dec twice
  4071 0000026F 7506                    	jne	short scct_5		; If not equal then not get boot drv
  4072 00000271 8A16[6900]              	mov	DL,[BOOTDRIVE]		; Else return boot drive in DL
  4073 00000275 EB14                    	jmp	SHORT scct_9s		; Jump to exit (returning boot drive)
  4074                                  scct_5:
  4075                                  	; 01/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
  4076 00000277 7212                    	jb	short scct_9s ; PCDOS 7.1
  4077                                  	;
  4078 00000279 3C04                    	cmp	al,4 ; 01/01/2024
  4079                                  	;cmp	AX,4 			; Test for 6 after it was dec twice
  4080                                  	;jne	short scct_9s		; If not equal then not get version
  4081 0000027B 7512                    	jne	short scct_6 ; 01/01/2024 ; PCDOS 7.1	
  4082                                  
  4083                                  	;mov	BX,(Minor_Version SHL 8) + Major_Version
  4084                                  
  4085                                  	;;mov	bx,1406h ; 6.20	; DOSCODE:4092h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
  4086                                  	;;mov	bx,1606h ; 6.22	; DOSCODE:4092h (MSDOS 6.22, MSDOS.SYS)
  4087                                  
  4088                                  	;mov	bx,0A07h ; 7.10	; DOSCODE:4163h (PCDOS 7.1, IMBDOS.COM)
  4089 0000027D BB070A                  	mov	bx,(MINOR_VERSION<<8)+MAJOR_VERSION  ; true dos version
  4090                                  	
  4091                                  	;mov	dl,0			; revision 0
  4092                                  	;mov	DL,DOSREVNM ; 0
  4093                                  
  4094                                  	;xor	dh,dh			; assume vanilla DOS
  4095                                  	; 01/01/2024
  4096 00000280 BA0000                  	mov	dx,0	
  4097 00000283 3836[870D]              	cmp	byte [DosHasHMA],dh ; 0
  4098                                  	;cmp	byte [DosHasHMA],0	; is DOS in HMA?  (M021)
  4099                                  	;;je	short @F
  4100                                  	;je	short scct_6
  4101 00000287 7402                    	je	short scct_9s ; 01/01/2024	
  4102                                  	; 01/01/2024
  4103 00000289 B610                    	mov	dh,10h			; version flags bit 4
  4104                                  	;or	DH,DOSINHMA ; 10h	; 'DOS in HMA' status
  4105                                  ;@@:
  4106                                  ;scct_6:
  4107                                  ;ifdef ROMDOS
  4108                                  ;	or	DH,DOSINROM ; 08h
  4109                                  ;endif ; ROMDOS
  4110                                  
  4111                                  	; 01/01/2024 (PCDOS 7.1)
  4112                                  	;jmp	short short scct_9s
  4113                                  
  4114                                  	; 01/01/2024
  4115                                  ;scct_6:
  4116                                  	; ....
  4117                                  
  4118                                  scct_9s:
  4119 0000028B 5E                      	pop	SI
  4120 0000028C 58                      	pop	AX
  4121 0000028D 1F                      	pop	DS
  4122                                  scct_9f:
  4123 0000028E CF                      	iret
  4124                                  
  4125                                  	; 01/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
  4126                                  scct_6:
  4127 0000028F 8026[8600]DF            	and	byte [DOS_FLAG],0DFh	; clear bit 5 of DOS flag
  4128 00000294 80FA01                  	cmp	dl, 1
  4129 00000297 75F2                    	jne	short scct_9s
  4130 00000299 800E[8600]20            	or	byte [DOS_FLAG],20h	; set bit 5 of DOS flag
  4131 0000029E EBEB                    	jmp	short scct_9s
  4132                                  
  4133                                  SetCtrlShortEntry:			; This allows a conditional entry
  4134                                  					; from main dispatch code
  4135 000002A0 EB9B                    	jmp	SHORT _$SET_CTRL_C_TRAPPING
  4136                                  
  4137                                  ; ==========================================================================
  4138                                  ;
  4139                                  ; The following two routines are dispatched to directly with ints disabled
  4140                                  ; immediately after the int 21h entry.	no DIS state is set.
  4141                                  ;
  4142                                  ; $Set_current_PDB takes BX and sets it to be the current process
  4143                                  ;   *** THIS FUNCTION CALL IS SUBJECT TO CHANGE!!! ***
  4144                                  ;
  4145                                  ; ==========================================================================
  4146                                  
  4147                                  _$SET_CURRENT_PDB:
  4148 000002A2 1E                      	push	DS
  4149                                  	;getdseg <DS>			; DS -> DosData, ASSUME DS:DosSeg
  4150 000002A3 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
  4151 000002A8 891E[3003]              	mov	[CurrentPDB],BX		; Set new PSP segment from caller's BX
  4152 000002AC 1F                      	pop	DS
  4153 000002AD CF                      	iret
  4154                                  
  4155                                  ; ==========================================================================
  4156                                  ;
  4157                                  ; $get_current_PDB returns in BX the current process
  4158                                  ;   *** THIS FUNCTION CALL IS SUBJECT TO CHANGE!!! ***
  4159                                  ;
  4160                                  ; ==========================================================================
  4161                                  
  4162                                  _$GET_CURRENT_PDB:
  4163 000002AE 1E                      	push	DS
  4164                                  	;getdseg <DS>			; DS -> DosData, ASSUME DS:DosSeg
  4165 000002AF 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
  4166 000002B4 8B1E[3003]              	mov	BX,[CurrentPDB]		; Return current PSP segment in BX
  4167 000002B8 1F                      	pop	DS
  4168 000002B9 CF                      	iret
  4169                                  
  4170                                  ; ==========================================================================
  4171                                  ;
  4172                                  ; Sets the Printer Flag to whatever is in AL.
  4173                                  ; NOTE: THIS PROCEDURE IS SUBJECT TO CHANGE!!!
  4174                                  ;
  4175                                  ; ==========================================================================
  4176                                  
  4177                                  _$SET_PRINTER_FLAG:
  4178 000002BA 1E                      	push	ds
  4179                                  	;getdseg <DS>			; DS -> DosData, ASSUME DS:DosSeg
  4180 000002BB 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
  4181 000002C0 A2[A00A]                	mov	[PRINTER_FLAG],AL 	; Set printer flag from caller's AL
  4182 000002C3 1F                      	pop	ds
  4183 000002C4 CF                      	iret
  4184                                  
  4185                                  ; 01/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  4186                                  ; 08/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
  4187                                  ; (MSDISP.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
  4188                                  
  4189                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4190                                  ; BREAK   <System call entry points and dispatcher>
  4191                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4192                                  
  4193                                  ; DOSCODE:40CCh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
  4194                                  
  4195                                  ; ==========================================================================
  4196                                  ;
  4197                                  ; The Quit entry point is where all INT 20h's come from. These are old- style
  4198                                  ; exit system calls. The CS of the caller indicates which Process is dying.
  4199                                  ; The error code is presumed to be 0. We simulate an ABORT system call.
  4200                                  ;
  4201                                  ; ==========================================================================
  4202                                  
  4203                                  SYSTEM_CALL:    ; PROC NEAR
  4204                                  
  4205                                  ; 04/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
  4206                                  ; DOSCODE:40BFh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
  4207                                  
  4208                                  ;entry	QUIT				
  4209                                  QUIT:				; INT 20H entry point	
  4210                                  	;MOV	AH,0
  4211 000002C5 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah ; 08/07/2018
  4212 000002C7 EB36                    	JMP     SHORT SAVREGS
  4213                                  
  4214                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4215                                  
  4216                                  	; The system call in AH is out of the range that we know how
  4217                                  	; to handle. We arbitrarily set the contents of AL to 0 and
  4218                                  	; IRET. Note that we CANNOT set the carry flag to indicate an
  4219                                  	; error as this may break some programs compatability.
  4220                                  
  4221                                  BADCALL:
  4222                                          ;MOV	AL,0
  4223 000002C9 30C0                    	xor	al,al ; 08/07/2018
  4224                                  IRETT:	; 06/05/2019
  4225                                  _IRET:
  4226 000002CB CF                              IRET
  4227                                  
  4228                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4229                                  
  4230                                  ; 01/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  4231                                  ; DOSCODE:40D3h (MSDOS 6.21 MSDOS.SYS)
  4232                                  ; 04/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
  4233                                  ; DOSCODE:40C6h (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
  4234                                  
  4235                                  	; An alternative method of entering the system is to perform a
  4236                                  	; CALL 5 in the program segment prefix with the contents of CL
  4237                                  	; indicating what system call the user would like. A subset of
  4238                                  	; the possible system calls is allowed here only the
  4239                                  	; CPM-compatible calls may get dispatched.
  4240                                  
  4241                                  		; System call entry point and dispatcher
  4242                                  CALL_ENTRY:
  4243 000002CC 1E                      	push	DS

  4660 0000042D 8B1E[6300]              	mov	bx,[A20OFF_PSP]		; bx = PSP for which a20 to be off'd
  4661 00000431 3B1E[3003]              	cmp	bx,[CurrentPDB]		; Q: do the PSP's match
  4662 00000435 75CC                    	jne	short LeaveA20On	; N: don't clear bit and don't turn 
  4663                                  					;    a20 off
  4664                                  					; Y: turn a20 off and dec a20off_count
  4665 00000437 FE0E[8500]              	dec	byte [A20OFF_COUNT]	; M068 - End
  4666                                   					; Start - M004
  4667 0000043B 1E                      	push	ds			; segment of stub
  4668 0000043C BB[7911]                	mov	bx,disa20_iret		; offset in stub
  4669 0000043F 53                      	push	bx
  4670 00000440 CB                      	retf	  			; go to stub
  4671                                  					; End - M004
  4672                                  ;SYSTEM_CALL ENDP
  4673                                  
  4674                                  ; DOSCODE:424Ch (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
  4675                                  ; 04/11/2022
  4676                                  ; DOSCODE:423Fh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
  4677                                  
  4678                                  ; ==========================================================================
  4679                                  ;
  4680                                  ; Restore_World restores all registers ('cept SS:SP, CS:IP, flags) from
  4681                                  ; the stack prior to giving the user control
  4682                                  ;

  4687                                          ;procedure restore_world,NEAR
  4688                                  restore_world:
  4689                                  	;getdseg <es>		; es -> dosdata
  4690 00000441 2E8E06[0700]            	mov	es,[cs:DosDSeg]
  4691                                  
  4692 00000446 268F06[EE05]                    POP	WORD [ES:RESTORE_TMP]
  4693                                  
  4694 0000044B 58                              POP     AX
  4695 0000044C 5B                              POP     BX
  4696 0000044D 59                              POP     CX
  4697 0000044E 5A                              POP     DX
  4698 0000044F 5E                              POP     SI
  4699 00000450 5F                              POP     DI
  4700 00000451 5D                              POP     BP
  4701 00000452 1F                              POP     DS
  4702                                  
  4703 00000453 26FF26[EE05]                   	jmp	word [ES:RESTORE_TMP]
  4704                                  
  4705                                  ;restore_world	ENDP

  4911                                  ERRIN:
  4912 000004CE 02                      	DB	2			; NO RESPONSE
  4913 000004CF 06                      	DB	6			; SEEK FAILURE
  4914 000004D0 0C                      	DB	12			; GENERAL ERROR
  4915 000004D1 04                      	DB	4			; BAD CRC
  4916 000004D2 08                      	DB	8			; SECTOR NOT FOUND
  4917 000004D3 00                      	DB	0			; WRITE ATTEMPT ON WRITE-PROTECT DISK
  4918                                  ERROUT:
  4919                                  ; DISK ERRORS RETURNED FROM INT 25 and 26
  4920 000004D4 80                      	DB	80H			; NO RESPONSE
  4921 000004D5 40                      	DB	40H			; Seek failure
  4922 000004D6 02                      	DB	2			; Address Mark not found
  4923 000004D7 10                      	DB	10H			; BAD CRC
  4924 000004D8 04                      	DB	4			; SECTOR NOT FOUND
  4925 000004D9 03                      	DB	3			; WRITE ATTEMPT TO WRITE-PROTECT DISK
  4926                                  
  4927                                  NUMERR	EQU	$-ERROUT
  4928                                  	;ENDIF

  4946                                  AbsSetup:
  4947                                  	; 02/01/2024 (PCDOS 7.1, Retro DOS 5.0)
  4948                                  	;;;
  4949                                  	;
  4950 000004DA 1E                      	push	ds ; *
  4951 000004DB 16                      	push	ss
  4952 000004DC 1F                      	pop	ds
  4953                                  	;
  4954 000004DD 8826[E20A]              	mov	[absdrw_extd],ah
  4955                                  	;mov	[ss:absdrw_extd],ah	; Extended ABS Disk Read/Write flag
  4956                                  					; (AH=1 for INT 21h ax=7305h function)
  4957 000004E1 08E4                    	or	ah,ah
  4958 000004E3 7508                    	jnz	short AbsSetup1		; INT 21h AX=7305h
  4959                                  
  4960                                  	; INT 25h
  4961 000004E5 FE06[E113]              	inc	byte [INDOS_FLAG]
  4962                                  	;inc	byte [ss:INDOS_FLAG]	; Windows DOSBOX's INDOS flag ?
  4963                                  	;;;
  4964 000004E9 FE06[2103]              	inc	byte [INDOS]
  4965                                  	;INC	byte [SS:INDOS]		; SS override
  4966                                  AbsSetup1:

  4968 000004EE FC                      	CLD

  4971                                  	;push	ss

  4973 000004EF E83A01                  	CALL	GETBP
