  4990                                  					; SS override
  4991 000004F5 36C706[0706]0000        	MOV	word [SS:HIGH_SECTOR],0 ;>32mb	from API		;AN000;
  4992 000004FC E8BF04                  	CALL	RW32_CONVERT		;>32mb convert 32bit format to 16bit ;AN000;
  4993                                  	;jc	short AbsSetup_retn

  4997                                  	;call	null_sub ; retn	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM

  5000 00000501 1E                      	PUSH	DS

  5019                                  		;    only drive specifier--must include the colon)
  5020                                  		; Return: CF clear if absolute disk access allowed
  5021

  5037                                  
  5038                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5039                                  ;
  5040                                  ; Procedure Name : ABSDRD
  5041                                  ;
  5042                                  ; Interrupt 25 handler. Performs absolute disk read.
  5043                                  ; Inputs:	AL - 0-based drive number
  5044                                  ;		DS:BX point to destination buffer
  5045                                  ;		CX number of logical sectors to read
  5046                                  ;		DX starting logical sector number (0-based)
  5047                                  ; Outputs:	Original flags still on stack
  5048                                  ;		Carry set
  5049                                  ;		    AH error from BIOS
  5050                                  ;		    AL same as low byte of DI from INT 24
  5051                                  ;
  5052                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5053                                          ;procedure   ABSDRD,FAR
  5054                                  ABSDRD:
  5055                                  	; 15/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  5056                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 (DOSCODE:42E5h)
  5057                                  	; 04/11/2022
  5058                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 (DOSCODE:42D8h)
  5059                                  
  5060                                  	; 02/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
  5061                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:43C4h
  5062                                  	
  5063                                  	;;;
  5064 0000052D 30E4                    	xor     ah,ah	; ah=0		; Interrupt 25h handler (ah=0)
  5065 0000052F 31F6                    	xor     si,si	; si=0		; clear read/write mode flags
  5066                                  					; (used with INT 21h ax=7305h)
  5067                                  FAT32_ABSDRD:	; ah=1 si=0 cf=0 (jump from '_$FAT32EXT')
  5068 00000531 FA                      	cli
  5069                                  	;clc ; not necessary
  5070                                  				; INT 21h
  5071                                  				;	AX = 7305h
  5072                                  				; FAT32 - EXTENDED ABSOLUTE DISK READ/WRITE
  5073                                  				;	CX = FFFFh
  5074                                  				;	DL = drive number (01h=A:, etc.)
  5075                                  				;	SI = read/write mode flags
  5076                                  				;	DS:BX -> disk I/O packet
  5077                                  				;
  5078                                  				; Extended Absolute Disk Read/Write mode flags:
  5079                                  				;
  5080                                  				;	Bit(s)  Description
  5081                                  				;	0	direction (0=read, 1=write)
  5082                                  				;	12-1	reserved (0)
  5083                                  				;	14-13	write type (should be 00 on reads).
  5084                                  				;		00 unknown data.
  5085                                  				;		01 FAT data.
  5086                                  				;		10 directory data.
  5087                                  				;		11 file data
  5088                                  				;	15     reserved (0)
  5089                                  				;
  5090                                  				; Format of disk read/write packet:
  5091                                  				;
  5092                                  				;	Offset Size    Description
  5093                                  				;	00h    DWORD   sector number
  5094                                  				;	04h    WORD    number of sectors to r/w
  5095                                  				;	06h    DWORD   transfer address
  5096                                  				;
  5097                                  				; ref: Ralf Brown's Interrupt List
  5098                                  	;;;
  5099                                  absdrd_1:
  5100                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
  5101                                  	;CLI
  5102                                  	
  5103                                  ;	set up ds to point to DOSDATA
  5104                                  
  5105 00000532 50                      	push	ax			; preserve AX value
  5106 00000533 8CD8                    	mov	ax,ds			; store DS value in AX
  5107                                  	;getdseg <ds>
  5108 00000535 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
  5109 0000053A A3[840D]                	mov	[TEMPSEG],ax		; store DS value in TEMPSEG
  5110 0000053D 58                      	pop	ax			; restore AX value
  5111                                  
  5112                                  	; M072:
  5113                                  	; We shall save es on the user stack here. We need to use ES in
  5114                                  	; order to access the DOSDATA variables AbsRdWr_SS/SP at exit 
  5115                                  	; time in order to restore the user stack.
  5116                                  
  5117 0000053E 06                      	push	es  ; ****		; M072
  5118                                  
  5119                                  	; 02/01/2024 - Retrodos v5.0 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
  5120                                  	;;;
  5121                                  	; 02/01/2024
  5122 0000053F 9C                      	pushf	; !*!
  5123 00000540 7300                    	jnc	short absdrd_2		; (not jumped from ABSDWRT) absolute disk read
  5124                                  	
  5125                                  	;(jumped from ABSDRWT)
  5126                                  	; 02/01/2023 ; (!*!)
  5127                                  	;or	ah,ah
  5128                                  	;stc				; absolute disk write
  5129                                  	;jmp	short absdrd_3
  5130                                  absdrd_2:
  5131 00000542 08E4                    	or	ah,ah
  5132                                  absdrd_3:
  5133 00000544 7510                    	jnz	short absdrd_4		; EXTENDED ABSOLUTE DISK READ/WRITE
  5134                                  	;;;
  5135                                  
  5136 00000546 8C16[1B06]              	MOV	[AbsRdWr_SS],SS		; M013
  5137 0000054A 8926[1D06]              	MOV	[AbsRdWr_SP],SP		; M013
  5138                                  
  5139                                  ; 	set up ss to point to DOSDATA
  5140                                  ;
  5141                                  ; NOTE! Due to an obscure bug in the 80286, you cannot use the ROMDOS
  5142                                  ; version of the getdseg macro with the SS register! An interrupt will

  5181                                  
  5182                                  	; Here is a gross temporary fix to get around a serious design flaw in
  5183                                  	;  the secondary cache. The secondary cache does not check for media
  5184                                  	;  changed (it should). Hence, you can change disks, do an absolute
  5185                                  	;  read, and get data from the previous disk. To get around this,
  5186                                  	;  we just won't use the secondary cache for absolute disk reads.
  5187                                  	;                                                      -mw 8/5/88

  5189                                  	;EnterCrit critDisk

  5201 00000582 36891E[0C06]                    mov     [ss:TEMP_VAR],bx
  5202                                  
  5203                                  ;       CX = # of contiguous sectors read. (These constitute a block of
  5204                                  ;            sectors, also termed an "Extent".)
  5205                                  ;       [HIGH_SECTOR]:DX = physical sector # of first sector in extent.
  5206                                  ;       [TEMP_VAR2]:[TEMP_VAR] = Transfer address (destination data address).
  5207                                  ;       ES:BP -> Drive Parameter Block (DPB).
  5208                                  ;
  5209                                  ;	The Buffer Queue must now be scanned: the contents of any dirty
  5210                                  ;	buffers must be "read" into the transfer memory block, so that the
  5211                                  ;       transfer memory reflects the most recent data.

  5288                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5289                                  ;
  5290                                  ; Procedure Name : ABSDWRT
  5291                                  ;
  5292                                  ; Interrupt 26 handler. Performs absolute disk write.
  5293                                  ; Inputs:	AL - 0-based drive number
  5294                                  ;		DS:BX point to source buffer
  5295                                  ;		CX number of logical sectors to write
  5296                                  ;		DX starting logical sector number (0-based)
  5297                                  ; Outputs:	Original flags still on stack
  5298                                  ;		Carry set
  5299                                  ;		    AH error from BIOS
  5300                                  ;		    AL same as low byte of DI from INT 24
  5301                                  ;
  5302                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5303                                          ;procedure   ABSDWRT,FAR
  5304                                  ABSDWRT:
  5305                                  	; 15/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  5306                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 (DOSCODE:436Ch)
  5307                                  	; 04/11/2022
  5308                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 (DOSCODE:435Fh)
  5309                                  
  5310                                  	; 03/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
  5311                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:4477h
  5312                                  
  5313                                  	;;;
  5314 000005DC 30E4                    	xor     ah,ah	; ah=0		; Interrupt 26h handler (ah=0)
  5315 000005DE BE0100                  	mov	si,1			; set direction flag/bit to write
  5316                                  					; (used with INT 21h ax=7305h)
  5317                                  FAT32_ABSDWRT:	; ah=1 si=1 cf=0 (jump from '_$FAT32EXT')
  5318                                  
  5319                                  				; INT 21h
  5320                                  				;	AX = 7305h
  5321                                  				; FAT32 - EXTENDED ABSOLUTE DISK READ/WRITE
  5322                                  				;	CX = FFFFh
  5323                                  				;	DL = drive number (01h=A:, etc.)
  5324                                  				;	SI = read/write mode flags
  5325                                  				;	DS:BX -> disk I/O packet
  5326                                  				;
  5327                                  				; Extended Absolute Disk Read/Write mode flags:
  5328                                  				;
  5329                                  				;	Bit(s)  Description
  5330                                  				;	0	direction (0=read, 1=write)
  5331                                  				;	12-1	reserved (0)
  5332                                  				;	14-13	write type (should be 00 on reads).
  5333                                  				;		00 unknown data.
  5334                                  				;		01 FAT data.
  5335                                  				;		10 directory data.
  5336                                  				;		11 file data
  5337                                  				;	15     reserved (0)
  5338                                  				;
  5339                                  				; Format of disk read/write packet:
  5340                                  				;
  5341                                  				;	Offset Size    Description
  5342                                  				;	00h    DWORD   sector number
  5343                                  				;	04h    WORD    number of sectors to r/w
  5344                                  				;	06h    DWORD   transfer address
  5345                                  				;
  5346                                  				; ref: Ralf Brown's Interrupt List
  5347 000005E1 3C02                    	cmp	al,2
  5348 000005E3 7220                    	jb	short absdrwt_2	; floppy disk
  5349                                  	; hard disk
  5350 000005E5 53                      	push	bx
  5351 000005E6 1E                      	push	ds
  5352 000005E7 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
  5353 000005EC 30FF                    	xor	bh,bh
  5354 000005EE 88C3                    	mov	bl,al			;
  5355                                  					; NOTE: PCDOS 7.1 kernel does not set
  5356                                  					; DOS_FLAG bit 6 or drive_flags bit 7
  5357                                  					; (It appears that these bits are set
  5358                                  					; by Windows or a system utility or
  5359                                  					; driver that knows the addresses of
  5360                                  					; these FLAGs in the DOSDATA segment.)
  5361                                  					; Erdogan Tan - 03/01/2024
  5362                                  					;
  5363 000005F0 F687[3114]80            	test	byte [drive_flags+bx],80h 
  5364                                  					; test bit 7 (locked bit) ; 29/01/2024
  5365 000005F5 7505                    	jnz	short absdwrt_1		; locked (logical drive) -allowed to abs write-
  5366                                  					; NOTE: lock/unlock are MSDOS/PCDOS 7 extd functions
  5367 000005F7 F606[8600]40            	test	byte [DOS_FLAG],40h	; test bit 6 (large disk support -windows- bit?)
  5368                                  					; (Windows OS running bit ?) ; 23/02/2024

  5370                                  absdwrt_1:

  5395                                  	; We shall save es on the user stack here. We need to use ES in
  5396                                  	; order to access the DOSDATA variables AbsRdWr_SS/SP at exit 
  5397                                  	; time in order to restore the user stack.
  5398                                  
  5399                                  	push	es ; ****		; M072
  5400                                  
  5401                                  	MOV	[AbsRdWr_SS],SS		; M013
  5402                                  	MOV	[AbsRdWr_SP],SP		; M013
  5403                                  
  5404                                  	; set up ss to point to DOSDATA
  5405                                  	;
  5406                                  	; NOTE! Due to an obscure bug in the 80286, you cannot use the 
  5407                                  	; ROMDOS version of the getdseg macro with the SS register!
  5408                                  	; An interrupt will sneak through.
  5409                                  
  5410                                  ;ifndef ROMDOS
  5411                                  	;getdseg <ss>			; cli in entry of routine
  5412                                  	mov     ss,[cs:DosDSeg]
  5413                                  ;else
  5414                                  ;	mov	ds, cs:[BioDataSeg]
  5415                                  ;	assume	ds:bdata
  5416                                  ;
  5417                                  ;	mov	ss, ds:[DosDataSg]
  5418                                  ;	assume	ss:DOSDATA
  5419                                  ;
  5420                                  ;endif ; ROMDOS
  5421                                  
  5422                                  	MOV	SP,DSKSTACK
  5423                                  		; we are now switched to DOS's disk stack
  5424

  5426                                  
  5427                                  	push	es ; *** (MSDOS 6.21)
  5428

  5430                                  
  5431                                  	PUSH	ES ; **
  5432                                  %endif

  5453                                  	;LeaveCrit critDisk

  5455                                  
  5456                                  ;M039
  5457                                  ;       DS:BX = transfer address (source data address).
  5458                                  ;       CX = # of contiguous sectors to write. (These constitute a block of
  5459                                  ;	     sectors, also termed an "Extent".)
  5460                                  ;       [HIGH_SECTOR]:DX = physical sector # of first sector in extent.
  5461                                  ;       ES:BP -> Drive Parameter Block (DPB).
  5462                                  ;       [CURSC_DRIVE] = -1 (invalid drive).
  5463                                  ;
  5464                                  ;       Free any buffered sectors which are in Extent; they are being over-
  5465                                  ;       written. Note that all the above registers are preserved for
  5466                                  ;       DSKWRITE.

  5479                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5480                                  ;
  5481                                  ; Procedure Name : GETBP
  5482                                  ;
  5483                                  ; Inputs:
  5484                                  ;	AL = Logical unit number (A = 0)
  5485                                  ; Function:
  5486                                  ;	Find Drive Parameter Block
  5487                                  ; Outputs:
  5488                                  ;	ES:BP points to DPB
  5489                                  ;	[THISDPB] = ES:BP
  5490                                  ;	Carry set if unit number bad or unit is a NET device.
  5491                                  ;		Later case sets extended error error_I24_not_supported
  5492                                  ; No other registers alteredjjj
  5493                                  ;
  5494                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5495                                  
  5496                                  	; 07/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
  5497                                  	; 04/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
  5498                                  	; PCDOS 76.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:44C7h
  5499                                  GETBP:
  5500                                  	; 15/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  5501                                  	; 11/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
  5502 0000062C 50                      	PUSH	AX

  5504 0000062F 7216                    	JC	SHORT SKIPGET
  5505 00000631 E86372                  	CALL	GETTHISDRV

  5507 00000634 7311                    	JNC	SHORT SKIPGET		;PM. good drive		;AN000;
  5508 00000636 30E4                    	XOR	AH,AH			;DCR. ax= error code 	;AN000;
  5509 00000638 83F81A                  	CMP	AX,error_not_DOS_disk	;DCR. is unknown media ? ;AN000;
  5510 0000063B 740A                    	JZ	SHORT SKIPGET 		;DCR. yes, let it go 	;AN000;
  5511 0000063D F9                      	STC				;DCR.			;AN000;
  5512 0000063E A3[2403]                	MOV	[EXTERR],AX	;PM. invalid drive or Non DOS drive ;AN000;
  5513 00000641 C706[0A0E]0102          	MOV	WORD [AbsDskErr],201h
  5514                                  SKIPGET:
  5515 00000647 58                      	POP	AX
  5516 00000648 7212                    	JC	SHORT GETBP_RETN ; 15/12/2022
  5517                                  	; 07/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
  5518                                  	;jnc	short getbp_t
  5519                                  	;retn
  5520                                  getbp_t:

  5524                                  	; 07/12/2022
  5525                                  	;TEST	WORD [ES:BP+43H],8000H
  5526                                  	;TEST	WORD [ES:BP+curdir.flags],curdir_isnet ; Clears carry
  5527 00000653 7408                    	JZ	SHORT GETBP_CDS

  5529 00000655 C706[2403]3200          	MOV	WORD [EXTERR],error_not_supported  ; 32h
  5530 0000065B F9                      	STC
  5531                                  GETBP_RETN:
  5532 0000065C C3                      	RETN
  5533                                  
  5534                                  GETBP_CDS:
  5535                                  	;LES	BP,[ES:BP+45H]
  5536 0000065D 26C46E45                	LES	BP,[ES:BP+curdir.devptr]
  5537                                  	; 04/01/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
  5538                                  	;;;

  5540 00000662 09E8                    	or	ax,bp

  5553                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5554                                  ;
  5555                                  ; Procedure Name : SYS_RETURN
  5556                                  ;
  5557                                  ; These are the general system call exit mechanisms. All internal system
  5558                                  ; calls will transfer (jump) to one of these at the end. Their sole purpose
  5559                                  ; is to set the user's flags and set his AX register for return.
  5560                                  ;
  5561                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  5562                                  
  5563                                          ;procedure   SYS_RETURN,NEAR
  5564                                  SYS_RETURN:        
  5565                                          ;entry	SYS_RET_OK
  5566                                  SYS_RET_OK:   
  5567 00000670 E804FE                  	call    Get_User_Stack
  5568                                  		; turn off user's carry flag
  5569                                  SYS_RET_OK_clc: ; 25/06/2019 
  5570                                          ;;and	word [SI+16h],0FFFEh 
  5571                                  	;and	word [SI+user_env.user_F],~f_Carry 
  5572                                          ; 25/06/2019
  5573 00000673 806416FE                	and	byte [SI+user_env.user_F],~f_Carry ; 0FEh
  5574                                  	; 04/01/2024
  5575                                  	;JMP	SHORT DO_RET
  5576                                  DO_RET:
  5577                                          ;MOV	[SI+user_env.user_AX],AX ; Really only sets AH
  5578 00000677 8904                    	MOV	[SI],AX
  5579 00000679 C3                      	RETN
  5580                                  
  5581                                          ;entry   SYS_RET_ERR
  5582                                  SYS_RET_ERR:

  5584 0000067C E86B00                  	call	ETAB_LK 	; Make sure code is OK, EXTERR gets set

  5587                                  	;entry	From_GetSet
  5588                                  From_GetSet:

  5590                                  		 ; signal carry to user
  5591                                  	;;or	word [SI+16h],1
  5592                                  	;OR	word [SI+user_env.user_F],f_Carry

  5961                                  ; We have received a message from Win386. There are three possible
  5962                                  ; messages we could get from Win386:
  5963                                  ;
  5964                                  ; Init 		- for this, we set the IsWin386 flag and return a pointer
  5965                                  ;		  to the Win386 startup info structure.
  5966                                  ; Exit		- for this, we clear the IsWin386 flag.

  5968                                  ;		  has already been handled. this is indicated by setting
  5969                                  ;		  CX to a non-zero value.

  6504 0000095A 74F9                    	jz	short PopIret		; no, unknown structure -- return

  6507 0000095F EBEE                    	jmp	short win386_done	; return with the size

  6510                                  %if 0
  6511                                  win386_inst:
  6512                                  	; WIN386 check to see if DOS has identified the CDS,SFT and device
  6513                                  	; chain as instance data. Currently, we let the WIN386 DOSMGR handle
  6514                                  	; this by returning a status of not previously instanced. The basic
  6515                                  	; structure of these things have not changed and so the current 
  6516                                  	; DOSMGR code should be able to work it out
  6517

  6536                                  
  6537                                  ; 15/05/2019
  6538                                  
  6539                                  ;M044; Start of changes
  6540                                  ; Winoldap has a bug in that its calculations for the Windows memory image
  6541                                  ; to save is off by 1 para. This para can happen to be a Windows arena if the
  6542                                  ; DOS top of memory happens to be at an odd boundary (as is the case when
  6543                                  ; UMBs are present). This is because Windows builds its arenas only at even
  6544                                  ; para boundaries. This arena now gets trashed when Windows is swapped back
  6545                                  ; in leading to a crash. Winoldap issues callouts when it swaps Windows out
  6546                                  ; and back in. We sit on these callouts. On the Windows swapout, we save the
  6547                                  ; last para of the Windows memory block and then restore this para on the
  6548                                  ; Windows swapin callout. 
  6549                                  
  6550                                  getwinlast:
  6551                                  	; 07/12/2022
  6552 00000961 8B36[3003]              	mov	si,[CurrentPDB]
  6553 00000965 4E                      	dec	si
  6554 00000966 8EC6                    	mov	es,si
  6555 00000968 2603360300              	add	si,[es:3]
  6556 0000096D C3                      	retn
  6557                                  
  6558                                  ; 15/12/2022
  6559                                  %if 0
  6560                                  winold_swap:
  6561                                  	push	ds
  6562                                  	push	es
  6563                                  	push	si
  6564                                  	push	di
  6565                                  	push	cx
  6566                                  
  6567                                  	;getdseg <ds>			;ds = DOSDATA
  6568                                  	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
  6569                                  
  6570                                  	cmp	al,1			;swap Windows out call
  6571                                  	jne	short swapin		;no, check if Swap in call
  6572                                  	call	getwinlast
  6573                                  	push	ds
  6574                                  	pop	es
  6575                                  	mov	ds,si			;ds = memory arena of Windows
  6576                                  	xor	si,si
  6577                                  	mov	di,WinoldPatch1
  6578                                  	mov	cx,8
  6579                                  	cld
  6580                                  	push	cx
  6581                                  	rep	movsb			;save first 8 bytes
  6582                                  	pop	cx
  6583                                  	mov	di,WinoldPatch2
  6584                                  	rep	movsb			;save next 8 bytes
  6585                                  	jmp	short winold_done
  6586                                  swapin:
  6587                                  	cmp	al,2			;swap Windows in call?
  6588                                  	jne	short winold_done	;no, something else, pass it on
  6589                                  	call	getwinlast
  6590                                  	mov	es,si
  6591                                  	xor	di,di
  6592                                  	mov	si,WinoldPatch1
  6593                                  	mov	cx,8
  6594                                  	cld
  6595                                  	push	cx
  6596                                  	rep	movsb			;restore first 8 bytes
  6597                                  	pop	cx
  6598                                  	mov	si,WinoldPatch2
  6599                                  	rep	movsb			;restore next 8 bytes
  6600                                  winold_done:
  6601                                  	pop	cx
  6602                                  	pop	di
  6603                                  	pop	si
  6604                                  	pop	es
  6605                                  	pop	ds
  6606                                  	jmp	next_i2f		;chain on
  6607                                  
  6608                                  %endif
  6609                                  
  6610                                  ;M044; End of changes
  6611

  6887                                  ; DOSCODE:47F4h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
  6888                                  ; DOSCODE:47E7h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS) - 05/11/2022 -
  6889                                  
  6890                                  ;SUBTTL EDIT FUNCTION ASSIGNMENTS AND HEADERS
  6891                                  
  6892                                  ; The following two tables implement the current buffered input editing
  6893                                  ; routines. The tables are pairwise associated in reverse order for ease
  6894                                  ; in indexing. That is; The first entry in ESCTAB corresponds to the last
  6895                                  ; entry in ESCFUNC, and the last entry in ESCTAB to the first entry in ESCFUNC.
  6896                                  
  6897                                  	;PUBLIC	CANCHAR
  6898                                  CANCHAR:
  6899 00000A95 1B                      	DB	CANCEL	; 1Bh	;Cancel line character
  6900                                  	
  6901                                  	;PUBLIC	ESCCHAR
  6902                                  ESCCHAR:
  6903 00000A96 00                      	DB	ESCCH	; 0	;Lead-in character for escape sequences
  6904                                  	
  6905                                  	;IF	NOT Rainbow
  6906                                  
  6907                                  ESCTAB:	; LABEL BYTE
  6908                                  
  6909                                  	;IF	IBM
  6910 00000A97 40                      	DB	64		; Ctrl-Z - F6
  6911 00000A98 4D                      	DB	77		; Copy one char - -->
  6912 00000A99 3B                      	DB	59		; Copy one char - F1
  6913 00000A9A 53                      	DB	83		; Skip one char - DEL
  6914 00000A9B 3C                      	DB	60		; Copy to char - F2
  6915 00000A9C 3E                      	DB	62		; Skip to char - F4
  6916 00000A9D 3D                      	DB	61		; Copy line - F3
  6917 00000A9E 3D                      	DB	61		; Kill line (no change to template ) - Not used
  6918 00000A9F 3F                      	DB	63		; Reedit line (new template) - F5
  6919 00000AA0 4B                      	DB	75		; Backspace - <--
  6920 00000AA1 52                      	DB	82		; Enter insert mode - INS (toggle)
  6921 00000AA2 52                      	DB	82		; Exit insert mode - INS (toggle)
  6922 00000AA3 41                      	DB	65		; Escape character - F7
  6923 00000AA4 41                      	DB	65		; End of table
  6924                                  	;ENDIF
  6925                                  
  6926                                  ESCEND: ; LABEL BYTE
  6927                                  
  6928                                  ESCTABLEN EQU ESCEND-ESCTAB
  6929                                  
  6930                                  ESCFUNC: ; LABEL WORD
  6931                                  	
  6932 00000AA5 [E719]                  	short_addr  GETCH	; Ignore the escape sequence
  6933 00000AA7 [641A]                  	short_addr  TWOESC
  6934 00000AA9 [591B]                  	short_addr  EXITINS
  6935 00000AAB [591B]                  	short_addr  ENTERINS
  6936 00000AAD [5F1A]                  	short_addr  BACKSP
  6937 00000AAF [451B]                  	short_addr  REEDIT
  6938 00000AB1 [4C1A]                  	short_addr  KILNEW
  6939 00000AB3 [DB1A]                  	short_addr  COPYLIN
  6940 00000AB5 [0D1B]                  	short_addr  SKIPSTR
  6941 00000AB7 [E11A]                  	short_addr  COPYSTR
  6942 00000AB9 [041B]                  	short_addr  SKIPONE
  6943 00000ABB [E61A]                  	short_addr  COPYONE

  6948                                  
  6949                                  ; DOSMES.INC (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
  6950                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6951                                  ; DOSMES.ASM (MSDOS 2.11, 1983)
  6952                                  
  6953                                  ; OEMFunction key is expected to process a single function
  6954                                  ;   key input from a device and dispatch to the proper
  6955                                  ;   routines leaving all registers UNTOUCHED.
  6956                                  ;
  6957                                  ; Inputs:   CS, SS are DOSGROUP
  6958                                  ; Outputs:  None. This function is expected to JMP to onw of
  6959                                  ;           the following labels:
  6960                                  ;
  6961                                  ;           GetCh       - ignore the sequence
  6962                                  ;           TwoEsc      - insert an ESCChar in the buffer
  6963                                  ;           ExitIns     - toggle insert mode
  6964                                  ;           EnterIns    - toggle insert mode
  6965                                  ;           BackSp      - move backwards one space
  6966                                  ;           ReEdit      - reedit the line with a new template
  6967                                  ;           KilNew      - discard the current line and start from scratch
  6968                                  ;           CopyLin     - copy the rest of the template into the line
  6969                                  ;           SkipStr     - read the next character and skip to it in the template
  6970                                  ;           CopyStr     - read next char and copy from template to line until char
  6971                                  ;           SkipOne     - advance position in template one character
  6972                                  ;           CopyOne     - copy next character in template into line
  6973                                  ;           CtrlZ       - place a ^Z into the template
  6974                                  ; Registers that are allowed to be modified by this function are:
  6975                                  ;           AX, CX, BP
  6976                                  
  6977                                  ; 13/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  6978                                  ; -------------------------------------
  6979                                  ; DOSCODE:4820h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
  6980                                  
  6981                                  ; 05/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
  6982                                  ; -------------------------------------
  6983                                  ; DOSCODE:4813h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
  6984                                  
  6985                                  ; 06/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
  6986                                  ; -------------------------------------
  6987                                  ; DOSCODE:4967h (PCDOS 7.1, IBMDOS.COM)
  6988                                  
  6989                                  OEMFunctionKey:
  6990 00000AC1 E8850E                  	CALL	_$STD_CON_INPUT_NO_ECHO	; Get the second byte of the sequence
  6991 00000AC4 B10E                    	MOV     CL,ESCTABLEN ; 14	; length of table for scan
  6992 00000AC6 57                      	PUSH    DI                      ; save DI (cannot change it!)
  6993 00000AC7 BF[970A]                	MOV     DI,ESCTAB		; offset of second byte table
  6994 00000ACA 06                      	push	es
  6995 00000ACB 0E                      	push	cs
  6996 00000ACC 07                      	pop	es
  6997 00000ACD F2AE                    	REPNE   SCASB                   ; Look it up in the table
  6998 00000ACF 07                      	pop	es
  6999 00000AD0 5F                      	POP     DI                      ; restore DI
  7000 00000AD1 D1E1                    	SHL     CX,1                    ; convert byte offset to word
  7001 00000AD3 89CD                    	MOV     BP,CX                   ; move to indexable register
  7002                                  	;JMP	word [BP+ESCFUNC]	; Go to the right routine
  7003 00000AD5 2EFFA6[A50A]            	JMP	word [CS:BP+ESCFUNC]
  7004                                  
  7005                                  ;DOSCODE ENDS
  7006

  7456                                  ; 29/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0

  7461                                  ;TITLE	GETSET - GETting and SETting MS-DOS system calls
  7462                                  ;NAME	GETSET
  7463                                  
  7464                                  ;CODE	SEGMENT BYTE PUBLIC  'CODE'

  7467                                  ;USERNUM:

  7479                                  ;MSMINOR: DB	MINOR_VERSION	; DOS_MINOR_VERSION

  7481                                  ;BREAK <$Get_Version -- Return MSDOS version number>
  7482                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7483                                  
  7484                                  ; 05/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
  7485                                  ; DOSCODE:4A0Fh (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
  7486                                  
  7487                                  ; 06/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
  7488                                  ; DOSCODE:4B5Fh (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
  7489                                  
  7490                                  _$GET_VERSION:
  7491                                  
  7492                                  ; Inputs:
  7493                                  ;       None
  7494                                  ; Function:
  7495                                  ;       Return MS-DOS version number
  7496                                  ; Outputs:
  7497                                  ;       OEM number in BH
  7498                                  ;       User number in BL:CX (24 bits)
  7499                                  ;       Version number as AL.AH in binary
  7500                                  ;       NOTE: On pre 1.28 DOSs AL will be zero
  7501                                  
  7502                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
  7503                                  ;
  7504                                  ;	Fake_Count is used to lie about the version numbers to support
  7505                                  ;	old binarys. See ms_table.asm for more info.
  7506                                  ;
  7507                                  ;		if input al = 00
  7508                                  ;		  (bh) = OEM number			
  7509                                  ;		else if input al = 01
  7510                                  ;		  (bh) = version flags
  7511                                  ;		 
  7512                                  ;		       	 bits 0-2 = DOS internal revision
  7513                                  ;		       	 bits 3-7 = DOS type flags
  7514                                  ;		              bit 3    = DOS is in ROM
  7515                                  ;		              bit 4    = DOS in in HMA
  7516                                  ;		              bits 5-7 = reserved
  7517                                  ;               M007 change - only bit 3 is now valid. Other bits
  7518                                  ;               are 0 when AL = 1
  7519                                  
  7520                                  	; 06/01/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
  7521 00000C9C 36C50E[B203]            	lds	cx, [ss:USERNUM]
  7522 00000CA1 8CDB                    	mov	bx, ds
  7523                                  
  7524                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (IBMDOS.COM, offset 196Dh)
  7525                                  	;--------------------------------------
  7526                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 (MSDOS.SYS, DOSCODE:4A1Ch)
  7527                                  
  7528 00000CA3 16                              PUSH    SS
  7529 00000CA4 1F                              POP     DS
  7530                                          
  7531                                  	; 06/01/2024
  7532                                  	;MOV	BX,[USERNUM+2]
  7533                                          ;MOV	CX,[USERNUM]
  7534                                  
  7535                                  	; 13/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  7536                                  
  7537                                  	;If AL == 1, ROMDOS will return BH = dos internal version # &
  7538                                  	;DOS flags
  7539                                  
  7540 00000CA5 3C01                    	cmp	AL,1
  7541 00000CA7 7502                    	jne	short Norm_Vers
  7542                                  
  7543                                  ;ifdef ROMDOS
  7544                                  ;	mov	BH,DOSINROM 	; Just set the bit for ROM version
  7545                                  ;				(DOSINROM = 8)
  7546                                  ;else
  7547 00000CA9 30FF                            xor     bh,bh		; Otherwise return 0
  7548                                  ;endif				;M007 end
  7549                                  
  7550                                  Norm_Vers:
  7551                                  	;MOV	AX,[MSVERS]  ; MSDOS 3.3
  7552                                  
  7553                                          	; MSDOS 6.0	; MSVERS is a label in TABLE segment	
  7554                                  	; 13/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  7555 00000CAB 1E                      	push	ds		; Get the version number from the
  7556 00000CAC 8E1E[3003]              	mov	ds,[CurrentPDB]	; current app's PSP segment
  7557                                  	;mov	ax,[40h]
  7558 00000CB0 A14000                  	mov	ax,[PDB.Version] ; AX = DOS version number	
  7559                                  	; 07/12/2022
  7560 00000CB3 1F                      	pop	ds
  7561 00000CB4 E8C0F7                  	call	Get_User_Stack
  7562                                  				; Put values for return registers
  7563                                  				; in the proper place on the user's	 
  7564                                  				; stack addressed by DS:SI
  7565                                  	; 06/01/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
  7566                                  gdrvfspc_ret:
  7567                                          ;MOV	[SI+user_env.user_AX],AX
  7568 00000CB7 8904                            MOV	[SI],AX
  7569                                          ;MOV	[SI+4],CX
  7570 00000CB9 894C04                  	mov	[SI+user_env.user_CX],CX
  7571                                  set_user_bx:
  7572                                  	;MOV	[SI+2],BX
  7573 00000CBC 895C02                  	mov	[SI+user_env.user_BX],BX
  7574                                  
  7575 00000CBF C3                      	RETN
  7576                                  
  7577                                  ; 18/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
  7578                                  
  7579                                  ;BREAK <$Get/Set_Verify_on_Write - return/set verify-after-write flag>
  7580                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7581                                  
  7582                                  ;**	$Get_Verify_On_Write - Get Status of Verify on write flag
  7583                                  ;

  7611                                  ;BREAK <$International - return country-dependent information>
  7612                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7613                                  ;
  7614                                  ; Procedure Name : $INTERNATIONAL
  7615                                  ;
  7616                                  ; Inputs:
  7617                                  ;	MOV	AH,International
  7618                                  ;	MOV	AL,country	(al = 0 => current country)
  7619                                  ;      [MOV	BX,country]
  7620                                  ;	LDS	DX,block
  7621                                  ;	INT	21
  7622                                  ; Function:
  7623                                  ;	give users an idea of what country the application is running
  7624                                  ; Outputs:
  7625                                  ;	IF DX != -1 on input (get country)
  7626                                  ;	  AL = 0 means return current country table.
  7627                                  ;	  0<AL<0FFH means return country table for country AL
  7628                                  ;	  AL = 0FF means return country table for country BX
  7629                                  ;	  No Carry:
  7630                                  ;	     Register BX will contain the 16-bit country code.
  7631                                  ;	     Register AL will contain the low 8 bits of the country code.
  7632                                  ;	     The block pointed to by DS:DX is filled in with the information
  7633                                  ;	     for the particular country.
  7634                                  ;		BYTE  Size of this table excluding this byte and the next
  7635                                  ;		BYTE  Country code represented by this table
  7636                                  ;			A sequence of n bytes, where n is the number specified
  7637                                  ;			by the first byte above and is not > internat_block_max,
  7638                                  ;			in the correct order for being returned by the
  7639                                  ;			INTERNATIONAL call as follows:
  7640                                  ;		WORD	Date format 0=mdy, 1=dmy, 2=ymd
  7641                                  ;		5 BYTE	Currency symbol null terminated
  7642                                  ;		2 BYTE	thousands separator null terminated
  7643                                  ;		2 BYTE	Decimal point null terminated
  7644                                  ;		2 BYTE	Date separator null terminated
  7645                                  ;		2 BYTE	Time separator null terminated
  7646                                  ;		1 BYTE	Bit field.  Currency format.
  7647                                  ;			Bit 0.	=0 $ before #  =1 $ after #
  7648                                  ;			Bit 1.	no. of spaces between # and $ (0 or 1)
  7649                                  ;		1 BYTE	No. of significant decimal digits in currency
  7650                                  ;		1 BYTE	Bit field.  Time format.
  7651                                  ;			Bit 0.	=0 12 hour clock  =1 24 hour
  7652                                  ;		DWORD	Call address of case conversion routine
  7653                                  ;		2 BYTE	Data list separator null terminated.
  7654                                  ;	  Carry:
  7655                                  ;	     Register AX has the error code.
  7656                                  ;	IF DX = -1 on input (set current country)
  7657                                  ;	  AL = 0 is an error
  7658                                  ;	  0<AL<0FFH means set current country to country AL
  7659                                  ;	  AL = 0FF means set current country to country BX
  7660                                  ;	  No Carry:
  7661                                  ;	    Current country SET
  7662                                  ;	    Register AL will contain the low 8 bits of the country code.
  7663                                  ;	  Carry:
  7664                                  ;	     Register AX has the error code.
  7665                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7666                                  
  7667                                  ;procedure   $INTERNATIONAL,NEAR   ; DOS 3.3
  7668                                  
  7669                                  ; 13/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  7670                                  ; DOSCODE:4A4Dh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
  7671                                  
  7672                                  ; 05/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
  7673                                  ; DOSCODE:4A40h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
  7674                                  
  7675                                  ; 06/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 PCDOS.COM)
  7676                                  ; DOSCODE:4B8Dh (PCDOS 7.1, IBMDOS.COM)
  7677                                  
  7678                                  _$INTERNATIONAL:  ; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3), offset 1992h
  7679                                  	 
  7680 00000CCC 3CFF                    	CMP	AL,0FFH
  7681 00000CCE 7404                    	JZ	short BX_HAS_CODE	; -1 means country code is in BX
  7682 00000CD0 88C3                    	MOV	BL,AL			; Put AL country code in BX

  7728                                  	;jz	short RET27

  7870                                  _$ExtCountryInfo:
  7871                                  			; INT 21h, AH = 70h
  7872                                  			; GET/SET INTERNATIONALIZATION INFORMATION
  7873                                  			; ****
  7874                                  			; AL = subfunction
  7875                                  			; 00h SET general internationalization info
  7876                                  			;    CX = buffer size (up to 38 bytes)
  7877                                  			;    DS:SI -> buffer containing internationalization info
  7878                                  			;  first three bytes are skipped, the rest is copied to
  7879                                  			;  somewhere in the DOS data segment
  7880                                  			; 01h SET extended internationalization info
  7881                                  			;    CX = number of bytes to set (up to 58 bytes)
  7882                                  			;    DS:SI -> buffer containing internationalization info
  7883                                  			; 02h GET extended internationalization info
  7884                                  			;    CX = buffer size in bytes (up to 58 bytes used)
  7885                                  			;    ES:DI -> buffer
  7886                                  			; ****
  7887                                  			; (Ref: Ralf Brown's Interrupt List) - had some mistakes -
  7888 00000D4F 3C02                    	cmp	al,2 
  7889 00000D51 77F8                    	ja	short errtn2
  7890 00000D53 06                      	push    es
  7891 00000D54 16                      	push    ss
  7892 00000D55 750F                    	jnz	short ext_cntry_inf_1
  7893 00000D57 07                      	pop	es		; AX = GET 35 bytes info (from offset 3 to 37)
  7894                                  				; (38 bytes buffer is used)
  7895 00000D58 BF[BB13]                	mov	di,_COUNTRY_ID
  7896 00000D5B 268B45FE                	mov	ax,[es:di-2]	; NEW_COUNTRY_SIZE = 38
  7897 00000D5F BB0300                  	mov	bx,3		; skip the 1st 3 bytes of the buffer
  7898 00000D62 01DE                    	add	si,bx
  7899 00000D64 EB13                    	jmp	short ext_cntry_inf_4
  7900                                  
  7901                                  ext_cntry_inf_1:
  7902 00000D66 FEC8                    	dec	al
  7903 00000D68 7506                    	jnz	short ext_cntry_inf_2 ; AX = 2
  7904                                  				; AX = 1 (set)
  7905 00000D6A 07                      	pop	es
  7906 00000D6B BF[E313]                	mov	di,_ENU		; "ENU"
  7907 00000D6E EB04                    	jmp	short ext_cntry_inf_3
  7908                                  
  7909                                  ext_cntry_inf_2:
  7910 00000D70 1F                      	pop	ds		; AX = 2 (get)
  7911 00000D71 BE[E313]                	mov	si,_ENU		; "ENU"
  7912                                  
  7913                                  ext_cntry_inf_3:		; CODE XREF: DOSCODE:4C2F^j
  7914 00000D74 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx		; 0
  7915 00000D76 B83A00                  	mov	ax,58		; 3Ah
  7916

  7920 00000D7B 7602                    	jna	short ext_cntry_inf_5 ; 06/01/2024

  7934                                  ;BREAK <$GetExtCntry - return extended country-dependent information>
  7935                                  
  7936                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7937                                  ;
  7938                                  ; Procedure Name : $GetExtCntry
  7939                                  ;
  7940                                  ; Inputs:
  7941                                  ;	if AL >= 20H
  7942                                  ;	  AL= 20H    capitalize single char, DL= char
  7943                                  ;	      21H    capitalize string, CX= string length
  7944                                  ;	      22H    capitalize ASCIIZ string
  7945                                  ;	      23H    YES/NO check, DL=1st char DH= 2nd char (DBCS)
  7946                                  ;	      80H bit 0 = use normal upper case table
  7947                                  ;		      1 = use file upper case table
  7948                                  ;	   DS:DX points to string
  7949                                  ;
  7950                                  ;	else
  7951                                  ;
  7952                                  ;	MOV	AH,GetExtCntry	 ; DOS 3.3
  7953                                  ;	MOV	AL,INFO_ID	( info type,-1 selects all )
  7954                                  ;	MOV	BX,CODE_PAGE	( -1 = active code page )
  7955                                  ;	MOV	DX,COUNTRY_ID	( -1 = active country )
  7956                                  ;	MOV	CX,SIZE 	( amount of data to return )
  7957                                  ;	LES	DI,COUNTRY_INFO ( buffer for returned data )
  7958                                  ;	INT	21
  7959                                  ; Function:
  7960                                  ;	give users extended country dependent information
  7961                                  ;	or capitalize chars
  7962                                  ; Outputs:
  7963                                  ;	  No Carry:
  7964                                  ;	     extended country info is succesfully returned
  7965                                  ;	  Carry:
  7966                                  ;	     Register AX has the error code.
  7967                                  ;	     AX=0, NO	 for YES/NO CHECK
  7968                                  ;		1, YES
  7969                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7970

  8636                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8637                                  
  8638                                  ;**	$Char_Oper - Manipulate Switch Character
  8639                                  ;
  8640                                  ;	This function was put in to facilitate XENIX path/switch compatibility
  8641                                  ;
  8642                                  ;	ENTRY	AL = function:
  8643                                  ;		    0 - read switch char
  8644                                  ;		    1 - set switch char (char in DL)
  8645                                  ;		    2 - read device availability
  8646                                  ;			Always returns available
  8647                                  ;		    3 - set device availability
  8648                                  ;			No longer supported (NOP)
  8649                                  ;	EXIT	(al) = 0xff iff error
  8650                                  ;		(al) != 0xff if ok
  8651                                  ;		  (dl) = character/flag, if "read switch char" subfunction
  8652                                  ;	USES	AL, DL
  8653                                  ;
  8654                                  ;	NOTE	This already obsolete function has been deactivated in DOS 5.0
  8655                                  ;		The character / is always returned for subfunction 0,
  8656                                  ;		subfunction 2 always returns -1, all other subfunctions are ignored.
  8657                                  
  8658                                  ; 13/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  8659                                  ; DOSCODE:4CC9h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
  8660                                  
  8661                                  ; 06/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
  8662                                  ; DOSCODE:4CBCh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
  8663                                  
  8664                                  _$CHAR_OPER:
  8665                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
  8666 00000FA3 08C0                    	or	al,al				; get switch?
  8667 00000FA5 B22F                    	mov	dl,'/'				; assume yes
  8668 00000FA7 7407                    	jz	short chop_1			; jump if yes
  8669 00000FA9 3C02                    	cmp	al,2				; check device availability?
  8670 00000FAB B2FF                    	mov	dl,-1				; assume yes
  8671 00000FAD 7401                    	jz	short chop_1			; jump if yes
  8672 00000FAF C3                      	retn					; otherwise just quit
  8673                                  
  8674                                  ; subfunctions requiring return of value to user come here. DL holds
  8675                                  ; value to return
  8676                                  
  8677                                  chop_1:
  8678 00000FB0 E8C4F4                  	call	Get_User_Stack
  8679 00000FB3 895406                  	mov	[SI+user_env.user_DX],dx	; store value for user
  8680 00000FB6 C3                      	retn
  8681

  8683                                  	; Offset 1B87h in IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3), 1987

  8686                                  	;cmp	al,1

  8688                                  	;jz	short chop_2

  8708                                  ;**	$GetExtendedError - Return Extended error code
  8709                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8710                                  ;	This function reads up the extended error info from the static
  8711                                  ;	variables where it was stored.
  8712                                  ;
  8713                                  ;	ENTRY	none
  8714                                  ;	EXIT	AX = Extended error code (0 means no extended error)
  8715                                  ;		BL = recommended action
  8716                                  ;		BH = class of error
  8717                                  ;		CH = locus of error
  8718                                  ;		ES:DI = may be pointer
  8719                                  ;	USES	ALL
  8720                                  
  8721                                  	; 06/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
  8722

  9323                                  ; System calls for parsing command lines
  9324                                  ;
  9325                                  ;   $PARSE_FILE_DESCRIPTOR
  9326                                  ;
  9327                                  ;   Modification history:
  9328                                  ;
  9329                                  ;       Created: ARR 30 March 1983
  9330                                  ;               EE PathParse 10 Sept 1983
  9331                                  ;
  9332                                  
  9333                                  ;BREAK <$Parse_File_Descriptor -- Parse an arbitrary string into an FCB>
  9334                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9335                                  ; Inputs:
  9336                                  ;       DS:SI Points to a command line
  9337                                  ;       ES:DI Points to an empty FCB
  9338                                  ;       Bit 0 of AL = 1 At most one leading separator scanned off
  9339                                  ;                   = 0 Parse stops if separator encountered
  9340                                  ;       Bit 1 of AL = 1 If drive field blank in command line - leave FCB
  9341                                  ;                   = 0  "    "    "     "         "      "  - put 0 in FCB
  9342                                  ;       Bit 2 of AL = 1 If filename field blank - leave FCB
  9343                                  ;                   = 0  "       "      "       - put blanks in FCB
  9344                                  ;       Bit 3 of AL = 1 If extension field blank - leave FCB
  9345                                  ;                   = 0  "       "      "        - put blanks in FCB
  9346                                  ; Function:
  9347                                  ;       Parse command line into FCB
  9348                                  ; Returns:
  9349                                  ;       AL = 1 if '*' or '?' in filename or extension, 0 otherwise
  9350                                  ;       DS:SI points to first character after filename
  9351                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9352                                  
  9353                                  	; 13/01/2024
  9354                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:51BFh
  9355                                  	; MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:4D22h
  9356                                  
  9357                                  _$PARSE_FILE_DESCRIPTOR:
  9358 000012D0 E8C449                  	call	MAKEFCB
  9359 000012D3 56                      	PUSH    SI
  9360 000012D4 E8A0F1                  	call	Get_User_Stack
  9361                                  	;pop	word [si+8]
  9362 000012D7 8F4408                  	POP     word [SI+user_env.user_SI]
  9363 000012DA C3                      	retn
  9364                                  
  9365                                  ; --------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9366                                  ; 13/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:51CAh)
  9367                                  ; --------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9368                                  
  9369                                  set_exerr_locus_unk:

  9374 000012E2 58                              pop	ax
  9375 000012E3 C3                              retn
  9376

  9409                                  ;**	$SLEAZEFUNC - Get a Pointer to the Media Byte
  9410                                  ;
  9411                                  ;	Return Stuff sort of like old get fat call
  9412                                  ;
  9413                                  ;	ENTRY	none
  9414                                  ;	EXIT	DS:BX = Points to FAT ID byte (IBM only)
  9415                                  ;			GOD help anyone who tries to do ANYTHING except
  9416                                  ;			READ this ONE byte.
  9417                                  ;		DX = Total Number of allocation units on disk
  9418                                  ;		CX = Sector size
  9419                                  ;		AL = Sectors per allocation unit
  9420                                  ;		   = -1 if bad drive specified
  9421                                  ;	USES	all
  9422                                  ;
  9423                                  ;**	$SLEAZEFUNCDL - Get a Pointer to the Media Byte
  9424                                  ;
  9425                                  ;	Identical to $SLEAZEFUNC except (dl) = drive
  9426                                  ;
  9427                                  ;	ENTRY	(dl) = drive (0=default, 1=A, 2=B, etc.)
  9428                                  ;	EXIT	DS:BX = Points to FAT ID byte (IBM only)
  9429                                  ;			GOD help anyone who tries to do ANYTHING except
  9430                                  ;			READ this ONE byte.
  9431                                  ;		DX = Total Number of allocation units on disk
  9432                                  ;		CX = Sector size
  9433                                  ;		AL = Sectors per allocation unit
  9434                                  ;		   = -1 if bad drive specified
  9435                                  ;	USES	all
  9436                                  ;
  9437                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9438                                  ;
  9439                                  	; 10/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
  9440                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:51E2h
  9441

  9443                                  	; 15/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  9444 000012F3 B200                    	MOV	DL,0
  9445                                  _$SLEAZEFUNCDL:
  9446 000012F5 16                      	push	ss
  9447 000012F6 1F                      	pop	ds
  9448                                  	
  9449 000012F7 88D0                    	MOV	AL,DL
  9450 000012F9 E89B65                  	call	GETTHISDRV		; Get CDS structure
  9451                                  SET_AL_RET:
  9452                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
  9453                                  	;;mov	al, 0Fh
  9454                                  	;MOV	AL,error_invalid_drive	; Assume error	;AC000;
  9455                                  	
  9456                                  	; MSDOS 6.0 & MSDOS 3.3
  9457 000012FC 7229                    	JC	short BADSLDRIVE
  9458                                  
  9459 000012FE E86920                  	call	DISK_INFO
  9460                                  	;JC	short SET_AL_RET	; User FAILed to I 24
  9461 00001301 7224                    	jc	short BADSLDRIVE
  9462 00001303 8826[9805]              	MOV	[FATBYTE],AH	; FAT (MEDIA) ID byte
  9463                                  
  9464                                  	; 10/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (PCDOS 7.1)
  9465                                  	;;;
  9466 00001307 30E4                    	xor     ah, ah		; AH = 0
  9467                                  				; AL = sectors per cluster
  9468 00001309 57                      	push    di		; di:bx = number of clusters
  9469 0000130A E81A05                  	call    TestNet
  9470 0000130D 5F                      	pop     di
  9471 0000130E 7205                    	jc      short sleazefunc1
  9472 00001310 51                      	push    cx		; bytes per sector
  9473 00001311 E85A21                  	call    modify_cluster_count
  9474 00001314 59                      	pop     cx		; ax = sectors per cluster (modified)
  9475                                  				; dx = number of clusters (modified)
  9476                                  				; if bytes per cluster > 16384
  9477                                  				;    and hw of cluster count > 0
  9478                                  				;    bx = 0FFFEh (invalidated parm sign)
  9479                                  sleazefunc1:
  9480                                  	;;;
  9481                                  
  9482                                  ; NOTE THAT A FIXED MEMORY CELL IS USED --> THIS CALL IS NOT
  9483                                  ; RE-ENTRANT. USERS BETTER GET THE ID BYTE BEFORE THEY MAKE THE
  9484                                  ; CALL AGAIN
  9485                                  
  9486                                  	;MOV	DI,FATBYTE
  9487                                  	; 10/01/2024 
  9488                                  	;XOR	AH,AH			; AL has sectors/cluster
  9489 00001315 E85FF1                  	call	Get_User_Stack
  9490                                  	;mov	[si+4],cx
  9491                                  	;mov	[si+6],bx
  9492                                  	;mov	[si+2],di
  9493 00001318 894C04                  	MOV	[SI+user_env.user_CX],CX
  9494 0000131B 895C06                  	MOV	[SI+user_env.user_DX],BX
  9495                                  	;MOV	[SI+user_env.user_BX],DI
  9496                                  	; 10/01/2024
  9497 0000131E C74402[9805]            	MOV	word [SI+user_env.user_BX],FATBYTE
  9498                                  	
  9499                                  	;mov	[si+0Eh],ss
  9500 00001323 8C540E                  	MOV     [SI+user_env.user_DS],SS ; stash correct pointer
  9501                                  
  9502 00001326 C3                      	retn
  9503                                  
  9504                                  BADSLDRIVE:
  9505 00001327 E965F3                  	jmp	FCB_RET_ERR
