 10120                                  setend:
 10121                                  ;	M008 - CAS
 10122                                  ;
 10123                                  	; 15/12/2022
 10124                                  	inc	bx
 10125                                  	;INC	AX			; +2 (reserved), -1 (count -> max)
 10126                                  ;
 10127                                  ;	There has been a bug in our fatsize calculation for so long
 10128                                  ;	  that we can't correct it now without causing some user to
 10129                                  ;	  experience data loss. There are even cases where allowing
 10130                                  ;	  the number of clusters to exceed the fats is the optimal
 10131                                  ;	  case -- where adding 2 more fat sectors would make the
 10132                                  ;	  data field smaller so that there's nothing to use the extra
 10133                                  ;	  fat sectors for.
 10134                                  ;
 10135                                  ;	Note that this bug had very minor known symptoms. CHKDSK would
 10136                                  ;	  still report that there was a cluster left when the disk was
 10137                                  ;	  actually full. Very graceful failure for a corrupt system
 10138                                  ;	  configuration. There may be worse cases that were never
 10139                                  ;	  properly traced back to this bug. The problem cases only
 10140                                  ;	  occurred when partition sizes were very near FAT sector
 10141                                  ;	  rounding boundaries, which were rare cases.
 10142                                  ;
 10143                                  ;	Also, it's possible that some third-party partition program might
 10144                                  ;	  create a partition that had a less-than-perfect FAT calculation
 10145                                  ;	  scheme. In this hypothetical case, the number of allocation
 10146                                  ;	  clusters which don't actually have FAT entries to represent
 10147                                  ;	  them might be larger and might create a more catastrophic
 10148                                  ;	  failure. So we'll provide the safeguard of limiting the
 10149                                  ;	  max_cluster to the amount that will fit in the FATs.
 10150                                  ;
 10151                                  ;	ax = maximum legal cluster, ES:BP -> dpb
 10152                                  
 10153                                  ;	make sure the number of fat sectors is actually enough to
 10154                                  ;	  hold that many clusters. otherwise, back the number of
 10155                                  ;	  clusters down
 10156                                  
 10157                                  	; 15/12/2022
 10158                                  	; bx = number of clusters
 10159                                  
 10160                                  	; 19/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 10161                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 10162                                  	; 15/12/2022
 10163                                  	;mov	bx,ax			; remember calculated # clusters
 10164                                  
 10165                                  	; 01/08/2018 (MSDOS 3.3)
 10166                                  	;mov	al,[ES:BP+DPB.FAT_SIZE]
 10167                                  	;xor	ah,ah 
 10168                                  
 10169                                  	; 10/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 10170                                  	;mov	ax,[ES:BP+0Fh]
 10171                                  	mov	ax,[ES:BP+DPB.FAT_SIZE]
 10172                                  
 10173                                  	;mul	word [es:bp+2]	
 10174                                  	mul	word [ES:BP+DPB.SECTOR_SIZE] ; how big is the FAT?
 10175                                  	cmp	bx,4096-10  ; 0FF6h	; test for 12 vs. 16 bit fat
 10176                                  	jb	short setend_fat12
 10177                                  	shr	dx,1
 10178                                  
 10179                                  ; 06/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 10180                                  	; 15/12/2022
 10181                                  ;cs3 7/2/92
 10182                                  	jnz	short setend_faterr	; some bonehead gave us more fatspace
 10183                                  					; than enough for the maximum FAT,
 10184                                  					; so go ahead and use the calculated
 10185                                  					; number of clusters.
 10186                                  ;cs3 7/2/92
 10187                                  
 10188                                  	rcr	ax,1			; find number of entries
 10189                                  	cmp	ax,4096-10+1		; would this truncation move us
 10190                                  ;					;  into 12-bit fatland?
 10191                                  	jb	short setend_faterr	; then go ahead and let the
 10192                                  ;					;  inconsistency pass through
 10193                                  ;					;  rather than lose data by
 10194                                  ;					;  correcting the fat type
 10195                                  	jmp	short setend_fat16
 10196                                  
 10197                                  setend_fat12:
 10198                                  	add	ax,ax			; (fatsiz*2)/3 = # of fat entries
 10199                                  	adc	dx,dx
 10200                                  
 10201                                  ; 06/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 10202                                  ;cs3 7/2/92
 10203                                  	; 15/12/2022
 10204                                  	cmp	dx,3			; if our fatspace is WAY more than
 10205                                  	jnb	short setend_faterr	; we need, we may get an overflow
 10206                                  					; here. Check for it and use
 10207                                  					; the calculated size in this case.
 10208                                  ;cs3 7/2/92
 10209                                  
 10210                                  	div	word [cs:word3]
 10211                                  
 10212                                  setend_fat16:
 10213                                  	dec	ax			; limit at 1
 10214                                  	cmp	ax,bx			; is fat big enough?
 10215                                  	jbe	short setend_fat	; use max value that'll fit
 10216                                  
 10217                                  setend_faterr:
 10218                                  	mov	ax,bx			; use calculated value
 10219                                  
 10220                                  setend_fat:
 10221                                  
 10222                                  ;	now ax = maximum legal cluster
 10223                                  
 10224                                  ;	end M008

 10713                                  
 10714                                  	;entry	SETMEM
 10715                                  
 10716                                  	; 17/12/2022
 10717                                  	; cx = 0
 10718                                  
 10719                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10720                                  ; Inputs:
 10721                                  ;	AX = Size of memory in paragraphs
 10722                                  ;	DX = Segment
 10723                                  ; Function:
 10724                                  ;	Completely prepares a program base at the
 10725                                  ;	specified segment.
 10726                                  ; Called at DOS init
 10727                                  ; Outputs:
 10728                                  ;	DS = DX
 10729                                  ;	ES = DX
 10730                                  ;	[0] has INT int_abort
 10731                                  ;	[2] = First unavailable segment
 10732                                  ;	[5] to [9] form a long call to the entry point
 10733                                  ;	[10] to [13] have exit address (from int_terminate)
 10734                                  ;	[14] to [17] have ctrl-C exit address (from int_ctrl_c)
 10735                                  ;	[18] to [21] have fatal error address (from int_fatal_abort)
 10736                                  ; DX,BP unchanged. All other registers destroyed.
 10737                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10738                                  
 10739                                  SETMEM:
 10740                                  	;XOR	CX,CX
 10741                                  	; 17/12/2022
 10742                                  	; cx = 0
 10743 000016C3 8ED9                    	MOV	DS,CX
 10744 000016C5 8EC2                    	MOV	ES,DX
 10745                                  	;mov	si,88h
 10746 000016C7 BE8800                  	MOV	SI,addr_int_terminate
 10747                                  	;mov	di,10 ; 0Ah
 10748 000016CA BF0A00                  	MOV	DI,SAVEXIT
 10749                                  	;MOV	CX,6
 10750                                  	; 15/12/2022
 10751 000016CD B106                    	mov	cl,6
 10752 000016CF F3A5                    	REP	MOVSW
 10753 000016D1 26A30200                	MOV	[ES:2],AX
 10754 000016D5 29D0                    	SUB	AX,DX
 10755 000016D7 3DFF0F                  	CMP	AX,MAXDIF ; 0FFFh
 10756 000016DA 7603                    	JBE	short HAVDIF
 10757 000016DC B8FF0F                  	MOV	AX,MAXDIF
 10758                                  HAVDIF:
 10759 000016DF 83E810                  	SUB	AX,10h			; Allow for 100h byte "stack"
 10760 000016E2 BB0C00                  	MOV	BX,ENTRYPOINTSEG ; 0Ch	;	in .COM files
 10761 000016E5 29C3                    	SUB	BX,AX
 10762 000016E7 B104                    	MOV	CL,4
 10763 000016E9 D3E0                    	SHL	AX,CL
 10764 000016EB 8EDA                    	MOV	DS,DX
 10765                                  
 10766                                  	; (MSDOS 6.0 note)
 10767                                  	;
 10768                                  	; The address in BX:AX will be F01D:FEF0 if there is 64K or more 
 10769                                  	; memory in the system. This is equivalent to 0:c0 if A20 is OFF.
 10770                                  	; If DOS is in HMA this equivalence is no longer valid as A20 is ON.
 10771                                  	; But the BIOS which now resides in FFFF:30 has 5 bytes in FFFF:D0
 10772                                  	; (F01D:FEF0) which is the same as the ones in 0:C0, thereby 
 10773                                  	; making this equvalence valid for this particular case. If however
 10774                                  	; there is less than 64K remaining the address in BX:AX will not 
 10775                                  	; be the same as above. We will then stuff 0:c0, the call 5 address
 10776                                  	; into the PSP.
 10777                                  	;
 10778                                  	; Therefore for the case where there is less than 64K remaining in 
 10779                                  	; the system old CPM Apps that look at PSP:6 to determine memory
 10780                                  	; requirements will not work. Call 5, however will continue to work
 10781                                  	; for all cases.
 10782                                  	;
 10783                                  
 10784                                  	;mov	[6],ax
 10785                                  	;mov	[8],bx
 10786                                  
 10787 000016ED A30600                  	MOV	[PDB.CPM_CALL+1],AX
 10788 000016F0 891E0800                	MOV	[PDB.CPM_CALL+3],BX
 10789                                  
 10790                                  	; 06/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 10791 000016F4 3DF0FE                  	cmp	ax,WRAPOFFSET ; 0FEF0h	; Q: does the system have >= 64k of
 10792                                  					;    memory left
 10793 000016F7 740C                    	je	short addr_ok		; Y: the above calculated address is
 10794                                  					;    OK
 10795                                  					; N: 
 10796                                  
 10797 000016F9 C7060600C000            	MOV	WORD [PDB.CPM_CALL+1],0C0h
 10798 000016FF C70608000000            	MOV	WORD [PDB.CPM_CALL+3],0
 10799                                  addr_ok:
 10800                                  	;mov	word [0],20CDh
 10801 00001705 C7060000CD20            	MOV	word [PDB.EXIT_CALL],(int_abort*256) + mi_INT
 10802                                  	;mov	byte [5],9Ah
 10803 0000170B C60605009A              	MOV	BYTE [PDB.CPM_CALL],mi_Long_CALL
 10804                                  	;mov	word [50h],21CDh
 10805 00001710 C7065000CD21            	MOV	WORD [PDB.CALL_SYSTEM],(int_command*256) + mi_INT
 10806                                  	;mov	byte [52h],0CBh
 10807 00001716 C6065200CB              	MOV	BYTE [PDB.CALL_SYSTEM+2],mi_Long_RET
 10808                                  	;mov	word [34h],18h
 10809 0000171B C70634001800            	MOV	WORD [PDB.JFN_Pointer],PDB.JFN_TABLE
 10810                                  	;mov	word [36h],ds
 10811 00001721 8C1E3600                	MOV	WORD [PDB.JFN_Pointer+2],DS
 10812                                  	;mov	word [32h],20
 10813 00001725 C70632001400            	MOV	WORD [PDB.JFN_Length],FILPERPROC
 10814                                  ;
 10815                                  ; The server runs several PDB's without creating them VIA EXEC.  We need to
 10816                                  ; enumerate all PDB's at CPS time in order to find all references to a
 10817                                  ; particular SFT.  We perform this by requiring that the server link together
 10818                                  ; for us all sub-PDB's that he creates. The requirement for us, now, is to
 10819                                  ; initialize this pointer.
 10820                                  ;
 10821                                   	;mov	word [38h],-1
 10822 0000172B C7063800FFFF            	MOV	word [PDB.Next_PDB],-1
 10823                                  	;mov	word [3Ah],-1
 10824 00001731 C7063A00FFFF            	MOV	word [PDB.Next_PDB+2],-1
 10825                                  
 10826                                  	; 06/05/2019
 10827                                  	; Set the real version number in the PSP - 5.00
 10828                                  
 10829                                  	;mov	word [es:PDB.Version],1406h ; MSDOS 6.21 (DOSCODE:4FB6h)
 10830                                  	; 07/12/2022
 10831 00001737 26C7064000070A          	mov	word [ES:PDB.Version],(MINOR_VERSION*256)+MAJOR_VERSION
 10832                                  
 10833 0000173E C3                      	retn
 10834                                  
 10835                                  ; 29/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 10836                                  
 10837                                  ;BREAK <$GSetMediaID -- get set media ID>
 10838                                  
 10839                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10840                                  ; Inputs:
 10841                                  ;	BL= drive number as defined in IOCTL
 10842                                  ;	AL= 0 get media ID
 10843                                  ;	    1 set media ID
 10844                                  ;	DS:DX= buffer containing information

 10960                                  ; Break <STRCMP - compare two ASCIZ strings DS:SI to ES:DI>
 10961                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10962                                  ;
 10963                                  ;   Strcmp - compare ASCIZ DS:SI to ES:DI. Case INSENSITIVE. '/' = '\'
 10964                                  ;	     Strings of different lengths don't match.
 10965                                  ;   Inputs:  DS:SI - pointer to source string  ES:DI - pointer to dest string
 10966                                  ;   Outputs: Z if strings same, NZ if different
 10967                                  ;   Registers modified: NONE
 10968                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10969                                  
 10970                                  	; 07/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 10971                                  
 10972                                  	; 14/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 10973                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM DOSCODE:56B6h)
 10974                                  	; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS DOSCODE:4FD7h)
 10975                                  StrCmp:
 10976 0000178D 56                      	push	si
 10977 0000178E 57                      	push	di
 10978 0000178F 50                      	push	ax
 10979                                  Cmplp:
 10980 00001790 AC                      	LODSB
 10981 00001791 E83646                  	call	UCase			; convert to upper case
 10982 00001794 E88646                  	call	PATHCHRCMP		; convert '/' to '\' ; 07/12/2022 ('\')
 10983 00001797 88C4                    	MOV	AH,AL
 10984 00001799 268A05                  	MOV	AL,[ES:DI]
 10985 0000179C 47                      	INC	DI
 10986 0000179D E82A46                  	call	UCase			; convert to upper case
 10987 000017A0 E87A46                  	call	PATHCHRCMP		; convert '/' to '\' ; 07/12/2022 ('\')
 10988 000017A3 38C4                    	CMP	AH,AL
 10989 000017A5 7504                    	JNZ	short PopRet		; Strings dif
 10990                                  
 10991 000017A7 08C0                    	OR	AL,AL
 10992 000017A9 75E5                    	JNZ	short Cmplp		; More string
 10993                                  PopRet:
 10994 000017AB 58                      	pop	ax
 10995 000017AC 5F                      	pop	di
 10996 000017AD 5E                      	pop	si
 10997 000017AE C3                      	retn

 11003                                  ;   FStrcpy - copy an ASCIZ string from DS:SI to ES:DI. no modification of
 11004                                  ;	characters.
 11005                                  ;

 11139                                  ;Break	<TableDispatch - dispatch to a table>
 11140                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11141                                  ;
 11142                                  ;   TableDispatch - given a table and an index, jmp to the approptiate
 11143                                  ;   routine. Preserve all input registers to the routine.
 11144                                  ;
 11145                                  ;   Inputs:	Push	return address
 11146                                  ;		Push	Table address
 11147                                  ;		Push	index (byte)
 11148                                  ;   Outputs:	appropriate routine gets jumped to.
 11149                                  ;		return indicates invalid index
 11150                                  ;   Registers modified: none.
 11151                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11152                                  
 11153                                  struc TFrame	 ; TableFrame
 11154 00000000 ????                    .OldBP:	 resw 1  ; 0
 11155 00000002 ????                    .OldRet: resw 1  ; 2
 11156 00000004 ??                      .Index:	 resb 1  ; 4
 11157 00000005 ??                      .Pad:	 resb 1  ; 5  
 11158 00000006 ????                    .Tab:	 resw 1  ; 6
 11159 00000008 ????                    .NewRet: resw 1  ; 8
 11160                                  endstruc

 11162                                  TableDispatch:

 11349                                  ;Break	<NLS_OPEN - do $open for NLSFUNC>
 11350                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11351                                  ;   DOS 3.3   6/10/86
 11352                                  ;   NLS_OPEN	- call $OPEN for NLSFUNC
 11353                                  ;
 11354                                  ;   Inputs:	Same input as $OPEN except CL = mode
 11355                                  ;   Outputs:	same output as $OPEN
 11356                                  ;
 11357                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11358                                  
 11359                                  ;hkn; NOTE! SS MUST HAVE BEEN SET UP TO DOSDATA BY THE TIME THESE
 11360                                  ;hkn; NLS FUNCTIONS ARE CALLED!!! THERE FORE WE WILL USE SS OVERRIDES
 11361                                  ;hkn; IN ORDER TO ACCESS DOS DATA VARIABLES!
 11362                                  
 11363                                  NLS_OPEN:
 11364                                  ;	MOV	BL,[CPSWFLAG]	 ; disable code page matching logic
 11365                                  ;	MOV	BYTE [CPSWFLAG],0
 11366                                  ;	PUSH	BX		 ; save current state
 11367

 11369 00001886 E85464                  	call	_$OPEN
 11370                                  
 11371                                  ;	POP	BX		 ; restore current state
 11372                                  ;	MOV	[CPSWFLAG],BL
 11373                                  
 11374 00001889 C3                      	RETN

 11471                                  ;Break	<MSG_RETRIEVAL- get beginning addr of system and parser messages>
 11472                                  
 11473                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11474                                  ;   DOS 4.00
 11475                                  ;
 11476                                  ;   Inputs:	DL=0 get extended error message addr
 11477                                  ;		  =1 set extended error message addr
 11478                                  ;		  =2 get parser error message addr
 11479                                  ;		  =3 set parser error message addr
 11480                                  ;		  =4 get critical error message addr
 11481                                  ;		  =5 set critical error message addr
 11482                                  ;		  =6 get file system error message addr
 11483                                  ;		  =7 set file system error message addr
 11484                                  ;		  =8 get address for code reduction
 11485                                  ;		  =9 set address for code reduction
 11486                                  ;   Function:	get/set message address
 11487                                  ;   Outputs:	ES:DI points to addr when get
 11488                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11489                                  
 11490                                  ;Procedure MSG_RETRIEVAL,NEAR
 11491                                  ;	ASSUME	CS:DOSCODE,SS:NOTHING
 11492                                  
 11493                                  ; 23/09/2023
 11494                                  ;MSG_RETRIEVAL:
 11495                                  
 11496                                  ;;	NOTE:  This function lives in command.com resident code now.
 11497                                  ;;	If the int 2F ever gets this far, we'll return registers
 11498                                  ;;	unchanged, which produces the same result as before, if
 11499                                  ;;	command.com wasn't present (and therefore no messages available).
 11500                                  ;;
 11501                                  ;;	I didn't point the entry in the 2F table to No_Op because
 11502                                  ;;	No_Op zeroes AL.
 11503                                  ;;
 11504                                  ;;;hkn; set up ds to point to DOSDATA
 11505                                  ;;	push	ds
 11506                                  ;;	getdseg	<ds>			; ds -> dosdata
 11507                                  ;;
 11508                                  ;;	PUSH	AX		    ;AN000;;MS. save regs
 11509                                  ;;	PUSH	SI		    ;AN000;;MS. save regs
 11510                                  ;;	MOV	AX,DX		    ;AN000;;MS.
 11511                                  ;;	MOV	SI,OFFSET DOSDATA:MSG_EXTERROR ;AN000;;MS.
 11512                                  ;;	test	AL,1		    ;AN000;;MS. get ?
 11513                                  ;;	JZ	toget		    ;AN000;;MS. yes
 11514                                  ;;	DEC	AL		    ;AN000;;MS.
 11515                                  ;;toget:				    ;AN000;
 11516                                  ;;	SHL	AL,1		    ;AN000;;MS. times 2
 11517                                  ;;	XOR	AH,AH		    ;AN000;;MS.
 11518                                  ;;	ADD	SI,AX		    ;AN000;;MS. position to the entry
 11519                                  ;;	test	DL,1		    ;AN000;;MS. get ?
 11520                                  ;;	JZ	getget			     ;AN000;;MS. yes
 11521                                  ;;	MOV	WORD PTR DS:[SI],DI    ;AN000;;MS. set MSG
 11522                                  ;;	MOV	WORD PTR DS:[SI+2],ES  ;AN000;;MS. address to ES:DI
 11523                                  ;;	JMP	SHORT MSGret		     ;AN000;;MS. exit
 11524                                  ;;getget: 				     ;AN000;
 11525                                  ;;	LES	DI,DWORD PTR DS:[SI]	     ;AN000;;MS. get msg addr
 11526                                  ;;MSGret: 				     ;AN000;
 11527                                  ;;	POP	SI			     ;AN000;;MS.
 11528                                  ;;	POP	AX			     ;AN000;;MS.
 11529                                  ;;
 11530                                  ;;	pop	ds
 11531                                  
 11532                                  ;	return				     ;AN000;;MS. exit
 11533                                  
 11534                                  ; 23/09/2023
 11535                                  ;	retn	; 29/04/2019

 11593                                  ;============================================================================
 11594                                  ; CRIT.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 11595                                  ;============================================================================
 11596                                  ; 12/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 11597                                  
 11598                                  ; Critical Section Routines
 11599                                  
 11600                                  ; MSDOS 6.21 - MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:513Ah
 11601                                  
 11602                                  ; 06/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 11603                                  ; DOSCODE:5126h (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 11604                                  
 11605                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11606                                  ; Each handler must leave everything untouched; including flags!
 11607                                  ;
 11608                                  ; Sleaze for time savings: first instruction is a return. This is patched
 11609                                  ; by the sharer to be a PUSH AX to complete the correct routines.
 11610                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11611                                  
 11612                                  ; (DOSMAC.INC, MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
 11613                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11614                                  ; Some old versions of the 80286 have a bug in the chip. The popf instruction
 11615                                  ; will enable interrupts. Therefore in a section of code with interrupts
 11616                                  ; disabled and you need a popf instruction use the 'popff' macro instead.
 11617                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11618                                  
 11619                                  ;%macro POPFF 0
 11620                                  ;	jmp	$+3
 11621                                  ;	iret
 11622                                  ;	push	cs
 11623                                  ;	call	$-2
 11624                                  ;%endmacro
 11625                                  
 11626                                  ; ---------------------------
 11627                                  
 11628                                  ; 14/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 11629                                  %if 0
 11630                                  
 11631                                  ;Procedure  ECritDisk,NEAR
 11632                                  	;public  ECritMEM
 11633                                  	;public  ECritSFT
 11634                                  ECritMEM:
 11635                                  ECritSFT:
 11636                                  ;
 11637                                  ECritDisk:
 11638                                  
 11639                                  ;SR; Check if critical section is to be entered
 11640                                  
 11641                                  	pushf
 11642                                  	cmp	byte [ss:redir_patch],0
 11643                                  	jz	short ECritDisk_2
 11644                                  
 11645                                  ; 06/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 11646                                  ;	;popff  ; * (macro)
 11647                                  ;	jmp	short ECritDisk_1 ; *
 11648                                  ;
 11649                                  ;ECritDisk_iret: ; *
 11650                                  ;	iret ; *
 11651                                  
 11652                                  	; 16/12/2022
 11653                                  	; 13/11/2022
 11654                                  	;jmp	short ECritDisk_1
 11655                                  	; 06/11/2022
 11656                                  ;ECritDisk_iret:
 11657                                  ;	iret	
 11658                                  
 11659                                  	; 06/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 11660                                  ECritDisk_1:
 11661                                  	push	cs ; *
 11662                                  	call	ECritDisk_iret ; *		
 11663                                  	
 11664                                  ECritDisk_0:
 11665                                  	PUSH    AX
 11666                                  	;MOV	AX,8000h+critDisk
 11667                                  	;INT	int_IBM
 11668                                  	mov	ax,8001h
 11669                                  	int	2Ah	; Microsoft Networks - BEGIN DOS CRITICAL SECTION
 11670                                  			; AL = critical section number (00h-0Fh)
 11671                                  	POP     AX
 11672                                  	retn
 11673                                  
 11674                                  	; 16/12/2022
 11675                                  	; 13/11/2022
 11676                                  ECritDisk_iret:  ; 12/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 11677                                  LCritDisk_iret: 
 11678                                  	iret
 11679                                  
 11680                                  ECritDisk_2:
 11681                                  	;;popff ; *
 11682                                  	;;retn
 11683                                  ;	jmp	short ECritDisk_3 ; *
 11684                                  ;ECritDisk_iret2: ; *
 11685                                  ;	iret
 11686                                  	
 11687                                  	; 16/12/2022
 11688                                  	; 13/11/2022
 11689                                  	;jmp	short ECritDisk_3
 11690                                  ;ECritDisk_iret2:
 11691                                  	;iret
 11692

 11917 000018E9 51                      	push	cx
 11918 000018EA B500                    	mov	ch,0
 11919 000018EC 368A0E[860D]            	mov	cl,[ss:redir_patch]
 11920 000018F1 E321                    	jcxz	ECritDisk_3
 11921 000018F3 59                      	pop	cx
 11922 000018F4 50                      	push	ax
 11923 000018F5 B80180                  	mov	ax,8001h	; BEGIN DOS CRITICAL SECTION
 11924                                  				; AL = critical section number (01h)
 11925                                  ECritDisk_1:
 11926                                  ; ----------------------------------------
 11927                                  LCritDisk_1:
 11928                                  ECritDevice_1:
 11929                                  LCritDevice_1:
 11930 000018F8 51                      	push	cx
 11931 000018F9 B500                    	mov	ch,0

 11933 00001900 E305                    	jcxz	ECritDisk2
 11934 00001902 59                      	pop	cx
 11935 00001903 CD2A                    	int	2Ah		; Microsoft Networks - BEGIN DOS CRITICAL SECTION
 11936                                  				; AL = critical section number (00h-0Fh)
 11937 00001905 58                      	pop	ax
 11938 00001906 C3                      	retn
 11939                                  
 11940                                  ECritDisk2:
 11941 00001907 06                      	push	es
 11942                                  	;mov	cx,0
 11943                                  	; 15/01/2024
 11944                                  	; cx = 0
 11945 00001908 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx
 11946 0000190A 9C                      	pushf			; simulate INT 2Ah
 11947 0000190B 26FF1EA800              	call	far [es:00A8h]	; call far (INT 2Ah vector)
 11948 00001910 07                      	pop	es
 11949 00001911 59                      	pop	cx
 11950 00001912 58                      	pop	ax
 11951 00001913 C3                      	retn
 11952

 11955                                  LCritDisk_3:

 12086                                  
 12087                                  ;**	Standard device IO for MSDOS (first 12 function calls)
 12088                                  ;
 12089                                  ;	TITLE	IBMCPMIO - device IO for MSDOS
 12090                                  ;	NAME	IBMCPMIO
 12091                                  
 12092                                  ;	Old style CP/M 1-12 system calls to talk to reserved devices
 12093                                  ;
 12094                                  ;	$Std_Con_Input_No_Echo
 12095                                  ;	$Std_Con_String_Output
 12096                                  ;	$Std_Con_String_Input
 12097                                  ;	$RawConIO
 12098                                  ;	$RawConInput
 12099                                  ;	RAWOUT
 12100                                  ;	RAWOUT2
 12101                                  ;
 12102                                  
 12103                                  ; The following routines form the console I/O group (funcs 1,2,6,7,8,9,10,11).
 12104                                  ; They assume ES and DS NOTHING, while not strictly correct, this forces data
 12105                                  ; references to be SS or CS relative which is desired.
 12106                                  
 12107                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12108                                  
 12109                                  ;	TITLE	CPMIO2 - device IO for MSDOS
 12110                                  ;	NAME	CPMIO2
 12111                                  
 12112                                  ;
 12113                                  ;	Microsoft Confidential
 12114                                  ;	Copyright (C) Microsoft Corporation 1991
 12115                                  ;	All Rights Reserved.
 12116                                  ;
 12117                                  
 12118                                  ;**	Old style CP/M 1-12 system calls to talk to reserved devices
 12119                                  ;
 12120                                  ;	$Std_Con_Input
 12121                                  ;	$Std_Con_Output
 12122                                  ;	OUTT
 12123                                  ;	TAB
 12124                                  ;	BUFOUT
 12125                                  ;	$Std_Aux_Input
 12126                                  ;	$Std_Aux_Output
 12127                                  ;	$Std_Printer_Output
 12128                                  ;	$Std_Con_Input_Status
 12129                                  ;	$Std_Con_Input_Flush
 12130                                  ;
 12131                                  ;	Revision History:
 12132                                  ;
 12133                                  ;	  AN000	 version 4.00 - Jan. 1988
 12134                                  
 12135                                  ; The following routines form the console I/O group (funcs 1,2,6,7,8,9,10,11).
 12136                                  ; They assume ES and DS NOTHING, while not strictly correct, this forces data
 12137                                  ; references to be SS or CS relative which is desired.
 12138                                  
 12139                                  ;DOSCODE SEGMENT
 12140                                  ;	ASSUME	SS:DOSDATA,CS:DOSCODE
 12141                                  
 12142                                  
 12143                                  ;hkn; 	All the variables use SS override or DS. Therefore there is
 12144                                  ;hkn;	no need to specifically set up any seg regs unless SS assumption is
 12145                                  ;hkn;	not valid. 
 12146                                  
 12147                                  ; DOSCODE:51BAh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 12148                                  ; 08/11/2022
 12149                                  ; DOSCODE:51A6h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 12150                                  
 12151                                  ;
 12152                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12153                                  ;
 12154                                  ; Procedure : $Std_Con_Input_No_Echo
 12155                                  ;
 12156                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12157                                  ;
 12158                                  
 12159                                  _$STD_CON_INPUT_NO_ECHO:   ;System call 8
 12160                                  
 12161                                  ; Inputs:
 12162                                  ;	None
 12163                                  ; Function:
 12164                                  ;	Input character from console, no echo
 12165                                  ; Returns:
 12166                                  ;	AL = character
 12167                                  
 12168 00001949 1E                      	push	ds
 12169 0000194A 56                      	push	si
 12170                                  INTEST:
 12171 0000194B E89745                  	call	STATCHK
 12172 0000194E 753B                    	jnz	short GET ; 08/09/2018
 12173                                  ;*************************************************************************
 12174                                  ;hkn; SS override
 12175 00001950 36803E[A00A]00          	cmp	byte [SS:PRINTER_FLAG],0  ; is printer idle?
 12176 00001956 7505                    	jnz	short no_sys_wait
 12177 00001958 B405                    	mov	ah,5			; get input status with system wait
 12178 0000195A E89137                  	call	IOFUNC
 12179                                  no_sys_wait:
 12180                                  ;**************************************************************************
 12181 0000195D B484                    	MOV	AH,84h		; (Microsoft Networks - KEYBOARD BUSY LOOP)
 12182 0000195F CD2A                    	INT	int_IBM	 ; int 2Ah
 12183                                  
 12184                                  ;;; 7/15/86  update the date in the idle loop
 12185                                  ;;; Dec 19, 1986 D.C.L. changed following CMP to Byte Ptr from Word Ptr
 12186                                  ;;;;		 to shorten loop in consideration of the PC Convertible
 12187                                  
 12188                                  ;hkn; SS override
 12189 00001961 36803E[E40D]FF          	CMP	byte [SS:DATE_FLAG],-1	; date is updated may be every
 12190 00001967 751B                    	JNZ	short NoUpdate		; 65535 x ? ms if no one calls
 12191                                  
 12192 00001969 50                      	PUSH	AX
 12193 0000196A 53                      	PUSH	BX			; following is tricky,
 12194 0000196B 51                      	PUSH	CX			; it may be called by critical handler
 12195 0000196C 52                      	PUSH	DX			; at that time, DEVCALL is used by
 12196                                  					; other's READ or WRITE
 12197 0000196D 1E                      	PUSH	DS			; save DS = SFT's segment
 12198                                  
 12199                                  ;hkn; READTIME must use ds = DOSDATA
 12200                                  ;hkn;	PUSH	CS			; READTIME must use DS=CS
 12201                                  
 12202 0000196E 16                      	PUSH	SS ; 04/05/2019
 12203 0000196F 1F                      	POP	DS
 12204                                  
 12205 00001970 B80000                  	MOV	AX,0			; therefore, we save DEVCALL
 12206 00001973 E89402                  	CALL	Save_Restore_Packet	; save DEVCALL packet
 12207                                  	;invoke	READTIME		; readtime
 12208 00001976 E813F2                  	call	READTIME
 12209 00001979 B80100                  	MOV	AX,1
 12210 0000197C E88B02                  	CALL	Save_Restore_Packet	; restore DEVCALL packet
 12211                                  
 12212                                  ;	; MSDOS 3.3 (IBMDOS.COM, Offset 1F8Ch)
 12213                                  ;	; (MSDOS 6.0 code does not contain IBM DOS FETCHI_TAG check)
 12214                                  ;	push	bx
 12215                                  ;	mov	bx,DATE_FLAG
 12216                                  ;	add	bx,2  ; mov bx,FETCHI_FLAG
 12217                                  ;	cmp	word [cs:bx],5872h
 12218                                  ;	jz	short FETCHI_TAG_chk_ok
 12219                                  ;	call	DOSINIT
 12220                                  ;FETCHI_TAG_chk_ok:
 12221                                  ;	pop	bx
 12222                                  
 12223 0000197F 1F                      	POP	DS			; restore DS
 12224 00001980 5A                      	POP	DX
 12225 00001981 59                      	POP	CX
 12226 00001982 5B                      	POP	BX
 12227 00001983 58                      	POP	AX
 12228                                  NoUpdate:
 12229                                  
 12230                                  ;hkn; SS override
 12231 00001984 36FF06[E40D]            	INC	word [SS:DATE_FLAG]
 12232                                  
 12233                                  ;;; 7/15/86 ;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;;
 12234 00001989 EBC0                    	JMP	short INTEST
 12235                                  GET:
 12236 0000198B 30E4                    	XOR	AH,AH
 12237 0000198D E85E37                  	call	IOFUNC
 12238 00001990 5E                      	POP	SI
 12239 00001991 1F                      	POP	DS
 12240                                  ;;; 7/15/86
 12241                                  
 12242                                  ;hkn; SS override
 12243                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 12244 00001992 36C606[E30D]00          	MOV	BYTE [SS:SCAN_FLAG],0
 12245                                  	;
 12246 00001998 3C00                    	CMP	AL,0	    ; extended code ( AL )
 12247 0000199A 7505                    	JNZ	short noscan
 12248                                  
 12249                                  ;hkn; SS override
 12250                                  	;MOV	BYTE [SS:SCAN_FLAG],1 ; set this flag for ALT_Q key
 12251                                  	; 20/06/2023
 12252 0000199C 36FE06[E30D]            	inc	byte [SS:SCAN_FLAG]
 12253                                  noscan:
 12254 000019A1 C3                      	retn
 12255                                  ;
 12256                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12257                                  ;
 12258                                  ;**	$STD_CON_STRING_OUTPUT - Console String Output
 12259                                  ;
 12260                                  ;
 12261                                  ;	ENTRY	(DS:DX) Point to output string '$' terminated
 12262                                  ;	EXIT	none
 12263                                  ;	USES	ALL
 12264                                  ;
 12265                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12266                                  ;
 12267                                  
 12268                                  _$STD_CON_STRING_OUTPUT:	;System call 9
 12269                                  
 12270 000019A2 89D6                    	mov	si,dx
 12271                                  STRING_OUT1:	
 12272 000019A4 AC                      	lodsb
 12273 000019A5 3C24                    	cmp	al,'$'
 12274 000019A7 74F8                    	je	short noscan
 12275                                  NEXT_STR1:
 12276 000019A9 E88702                  	call	OUTT
 12277 000019AC EBF6                    	jmp	short STRING_OUT1
 12278                                  
 12279                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12280                                  ;
 12281                                  ;**	$STD_CON_STRING_INPUT - Input Line from Console
 12282                                  ;
 12283                                  ;	$STD_CON_STRING_INPUT Fills a buffer from console input until CR
 12284                                  ;
 12285                                  ;	ENTRY	(ds:dx) = input buffer
 12286                                  ;	EXIT	none
 12287                                  ;	USES	ALL
 12288                                  ;
 12289                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12290                                  
 12291                                  	; 15/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 12292                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:58D4h
 12293                                  
 12294                                  _$STD_CON_STRING_INPUT:		;System call 10
 12295                                  
 12296                                  	; 15/01/2024
 12297                                  	;mov	ax,ss
 12298                                  	;mov	es,ax
 12299 000019AE 16                      	push	ss
 12300 000019AF 07                      	pop	es
 12301                                  
 12302 000019B0 89D6                    	mov	si,dx
 12303 000019B2 30ED                    	xor	ch,ch
 12304 000019B4 AD                      	lodsw
 12305                                  
 12306                                  ;	(AL) = the buffer length
 12307                                  ;	(AH) = the template length
 12308                                  
 12309 000019B5 08C0                            or	al,al
 12310 000019B7 74E8                            jz	short noscan	;Buffer is 0 length!!?
 12311 000019B9 88E3                    	mov	bl,ah		;Init template counter
 12312 000019BB 88EF                            mov	bh,ch		;Init template counter
 12313                                  
 12314                                  ;	(BL) = the number of bytes in the template
 12315                                  
 12316 000019BD 38D8                            cmp	al,bl
 12317 000019BF 7605                            jbe	short NOEDIT	;If length of buffer inconsistent with contents
 12318 000019C1 80380D                          cmp	byte [bx+si],c_CR ; 0Dh
 12319 000019C4 7402                            jz	short EDITON	;If CR correctly placed EDIT is OK
 12320                                  
 12321                                  ; The number of chars in the template is >= the number of chars in buffer or
 12322                                  ; there is no CR at the end of the template. This is an inconsistant state
 12323                                  ; of affairs. Pretend that the template was empty:
 12324                                  ;
 12325                                  
 12326                                  NOEDIT:	
 12327 000019C6 88EB                    	mov	bl,ch		;Reset buffer
 12328                                  EDITON: 
 12329 000019C8 88C2                    	mov	dl,al
 12330 000019CA 4A                      	dec	dx		;DL is # of bytes we can put in the buffer
 12331                                  
 12332                                  ;	Top level. We begin to read a line in.
 12333                                  
 12334                                  NEWLIN: 
 12335 000019CB 36A0[F901]              	mov	al,[SS:CARPOS]
 12336 000019CF 36A2[FA01]              	mov	[SS:STARTPOS],al ;Remember position in raw buffer
 12337                                  
 12338 000019D3 56                      	push	si
 12339 000019D4 BF[FB01]                	mov	di,INBUF ;Build the new line here
 12340 000019D7 36882E[7905]            	mov	byte [SS:INSMODE],ch ;Insert mode off
 12341 000019DC 88EF                    	mov	bh,ch		;No chars from template yet
 12342 000019DE 88EE                    	mov	dh,ch		;No chars to new line yet
 12343 000019E0 E866FF                  	call	_$STD_CON_INPUT_NO_ECHO ;Get first char
 12344 000019E3 3C0A                    	cmp	al,c_LF		; 0Ah	;Linefeed 
 12345 000019E5 7503                    	jnz	short GOTCH
 12346                                  
 12347                                  ;	This is the main loop of reading in a character and processing it.
 12348                                  ;
 12349                                  ;	(BH) = the index of the next byte in the template
 12350                                  ;	(BL) = the length of the template
 12351                                  ;	(DH) = the number of bytes in the buffer
 12352                                  ;	(DL) = the length of the buffer
 12353                                  
 12354                                  GETCH:
 12355 000019E7 E85FFF                  	call	_$STD_CON_INPUT_NO_ECHO
 12356                                  GOTCH:
 12357                                  ;
 12358                                  ; Brain-damaged Tim Patterson ignored ^F in case his BIOS did not flush the
 12359                                  ; input queue.
 12360                                  ;
 12361 000019EA 3C06                            cmp	al,"F"-"@"  ; CMP AL, 6  ; Ignore ^F
 12362 000019EC 74F9                    	jz	short GETCH
 12363                                  
 12364                                  ;	If the leading char is the function-key lead byte
 12365                                  
 12366                                  	;cmp	al,[SS:ESCCHAR]
 12367                                  
 12368                                  	; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 12369                                  
 12370                                  ;hkn; 	ESCCHAR is in TABLE seg (DOSCODE)
 12371                                  
 12372 000019EE 2E3A06[960A]            	CMP	AL,[cs:ESCCHAR]
 12373 000019F3 7439                            jz	short ESCAPE	;change reserved keyword DBM 5-7-87
 12374                                  
 12375                                  ;	Rubout and ^H are both destructive backspaces.
 12376                                  
 12377 000019F5 3C7F                            cmp	al,c_DEL ; 7FH
 12378                                          ;jz	short BACKSPJ
 12379                                          ; 15/01/2024
 12380 000019F7 7466                    	je	short BACKSP
 12381 000019F9 3C08                    	cmp	al,c_BS  ; 8
 12382                                          ;jz	short BACKSPJ
 12383                                          ; 15/01/2024
 12384 000019FB 7462                    	je	short BACKSP
 12385                                  
 12386                                  	; 04/05/2019 -	MSDOS 6.0, also MSDOS 6.21 has bug (bullshit) here.
 12387                                  	;		Two NOPs -instead of a JMP short, as two bytes-
 12388                                  	;	   	after CMP and a CMP again!
 12389                                  	;		
 12390                                  	;		-It would be better if they use a 'JMP short' to 
 12391                                  	;	      	DOSCODE:5279h from DOSCODE:5271h and leave NOPs
 12392                                  	;		between them. Then, they would be able use a patch
 12393                                  	;		between 5271h and 5279h when if it will be required.
 12394                                  	;		I think Tim Patterson would not do this CMP mistake!-
 12395                                  	;	
 12396                                  	; (MSDOS.SYS, from DOSCODE:5271h to DOSCODE:5279h)
 12397                                  
 12398                                  	; 08/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 12399                                  	;
 12400                                  	; (Note: nops below might be used for patching code for Windows 3.1)
 12401                                  
 12402                                  ;DOSCODE:526D	cmp     al, 8
 12403                                  ;DOSCODE:526F	jz      short BACKSPJ
 12404                                  ;DOSCODE:5271	cmp     al, 17h
 12405                                  ;DOSCODE:5273	nop
 12406                                  ;DOSCODE:5274	nop
 12407                                  ;DOSCODE:5275	cmp     al, 15h
 12408                                  ;DOSCODE:5277	nop
 12409                                  ;DOSCODE:5278	nop
 12410                                  ;DOSCODE:5279	cmp     al, 0Dh
 12411                                  ;DOSCODE:527B	jz      short ENDLIN
 12412                                  ;DOSCODE:527D	cmp     al, 0Ah
 12413                                  ;DOSCODE:527F	jz      short PHYCRLF
 12414                                  	
 12415                                  	; 08/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 12416                                  	; DOSCODE:525Dh
 12417                                  
 12418                                  ; 16/12/2022
 12419                                  %if 0
 12420                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 12421                                  ;	^W deletes backward once and then backs up until a letter is before the
 12422                                  ;	cursor
 12423                                  
 12424                                  	CMP     AL,"W"-"@" ; 17h
 12425                                  
 12426                                  ;	The removal of the comment characters before the jump statement will
 12427                                  ;	cause ^W to backup a word.
 12428                                  
 12429                                  ;***	JZ	short WordDel
 12430                                  	NOP
 12431                                  	NOP
 12432                                  
 12433                                  	CMP     AL,"U"-"@" ; 15h
 12434                                  
 12435                                  ;	The removal of the comment characters before the jump statement will
 12436                                  ;	cause ^U to clear a line.
 12437                                  
 12438                                  ;***	JZ	short LineDel
 12439                                  	NOP
 12440                                  	NOP
 12441                                  
 12442                                  %endif
 12443                                  
 12444                                  ;	CR terminates the line.
 12445                                  
 12446 000019FD 3C0D                            cmp	al,c_CR ; 0Dh
 12447 000019FF 7430                            jz	short ENDLIN
 12448                                  
 12449                                  ;	LF goes to a new line and keeps on reading.
 12450                                  
 12451 00001A01 3C0A                            cmp	al,c_LF ; 0Ah
 12452 00001A03 7442                    	jz	short PHYCRLF
 12453                                  
 12454                                  ;	^X (or ESC) deletes the line and starts over
 12455                                  
 12456                                  	; MSDOS 3.3

 12479 00001A16 36803E[7905]00                  cmp	byte [SS:INSMODE], 0

 12507                                  COPYNEW:
 12508                                  	; (IBMDOS.COM, MSDOS 2.0, STRIN.ASM)
 12509                                  	;mov	bp, es

 12519                                  	; (IBMDOS.COM, MSDOS 3.3, Offset 2061h)

 12522 00001A3C 06                      	PUSH	ES
 12523                                  	;RESTORE <DS,ES>		; XCHG ES,DS

 12531                                  OLDBAK_RETN:

 12538 00001A4A EB9B                            JMP	short GETCH
 12539                                  
 12540                                  	; MSDOS 6.0 (& MSDOS 3.3, IBMDOS.COM, 1987)

 12613                                  ; DOSCODE:52F3h (MSDOS 621, MSDOS.SYS)
 12614                                  
 12615                                  ; The user wants to throw away what he's typed in and wants to start over.
 12616                                  ; We print the backslash and then go to the next line and tab to the correct
 12617                                  ; spot to begin the buffered input.
 12618                                  
 12619                                  KILNEW:
 12620 00001A4C B05C                            mov	al,'\'
 12621 00001A4E E8E201                          call	OUTT            ;Print the CANCEL indicator
 12622 00001A51 5E                              pop	si		;Remember start of edit buffer
 12623                                  PUTNEW:
 12624 00001A52 E81001                  	call	CRLF            ;Go to next line on screen
 12625 00001A55 36A0[FA01]              	mov	al,[SS:STARTPOS]
 12626 00001A59 E84B02                  	call	TAB             ;Tab over
 12627 00001A5C E96CFF                          JMP     NEWLIN		;Start over again
 12628                                  
 12629                                  ;	Destructively back up one character position
 12630                                  
 12631                                  BACKSP:
 12632                                  	; 09/09/2018
 12633 00001A5F E80800                  	Call    BackSpace
 12634 00001A62 EB83                    	JMP     short GETCH	; 15/01/2024
 12635                                  
 12636                                  	; 15/01/2024
 12637                                  ;User really wants an ESC character in his line
 12638                                  TWOESC:	
 12639 00001A64 2EA0[960A]              	mov	al,[cs:ESCCHAR] ; 10/06/2019
 12640 00001A68 EBA2                    	jmp	short SAVCH
 12641                                  
 12642                                  BackSpace:
 12643 00001A6A 08F6                    	or	dh,dh
 12644 00001A6C 7419                    	jz	short OLDBAK	;No chars in line, do nothing to line
 12645 00001A6E E85800                  	call	BACKUP          ;Do the backup
 12646 00001A71 268A05                  	mov	al,[es:di]	;Get the deleted char
 12647 00001A74 3C20                            cmp	al,20h	; ' '
 12648 00001A76 730F                    	jnb	short OLDBAK	;Was a normal char
 12649 00001A78 3C09                            cmp	al,c_HT ; 9
 12650 00001A7A 741B                    	jz	short BAKTAB	;Was a tab, fix up users display
 12651                                  ;; 9/27/86 fix for ctrl-U backspace
 12652 00001A7C 3C15                    	CMP     AL,"U"-"@" ; 15h ; ctrl-U is a section symbol not ^U
 12653 00001A7E 7407                    	JZ	short OLDBAK
 12654 00001A80 3C14                           	CMP     AL,"T"-"@" ; 14h ; ctrl-T is a paragraphs symbol not ^T
 12655 00001A82 7403                    	JZ	short OLDBAK
 12656                                  ;; 9/27/86 fix for ctrl-U backspace
 12657 00001A84 E84500                          call	BACKMES         ;Was a control char, zap the '^'
 12658                                  OLDBAK:
 12659 00001A87 36803E[7905]00                  cmp	byte [SS:INSMODE], 0

 12661 00001A8F 08FF                    	or	bh,bh
 12662 00001A91 74B3                            jz	short OLDBAK_RETN 
 12663                                  				;Not advanced in template, stay where we are
 12664 00001A93 FECF                    	dec	bh		;Go back in template
 12665 00001A95 4E                              dec	si
 12666 00001A96 C3                      	retn
 12667                                  BAKTAB:
 12668 00001A97 57                              push	di
 12669 00001A98 4F                              dec	di		;Back up one char
 12670 00001A99 FD                              std			;Go backward
 12671 00001A9A 88F1                            mov	cl,dh		;Number of chars currently in line
 12672 00001A9C B020                            mov	al,20h	; ' '
 12673 00001A9E 53                              push	bx
 12674 00001A9F B307                            mov	bl,7		;Max
 12675 00001AA1 E30E                            jcxz	FIGTAB		;At start, do nothing
 12676                                  FNDPOS:
 12677 00001AA3 AE                              scasb			;Look back
 12678 00001AA4 7609                    	jbe	short CHKCNT
 12679 00001AA6 26807D0109              	cmp	byte [es:di+1],9
 12680 00001AAB 7409                    	jz	short HAVTAB	;Found a tab
 12681 00001AAD FECB                    	dec	bl		;Back one char if non tab control char
 12682                                  CHKCNT:
 12683 00001AAF E2F2                            loop	FNDPOS
 12684                                  FIGTAB:		
 12685 00001AB1 362A1E[FA01]            	sub	bl,[SS:STARTPOS]
 12686                                  HAVTAB:
 12687 00001AB6 28F3                    	sub	bl,dh
 12688 00001AB8 00D9                    	add	cl,bl
 12689 00001ABA 80E107                  	and	cl,7		;CX has correct number to erase
 12690 00001ABD FC                      	cld			;Back to normal
 12691 00001ABE 5B                      	pop	bx
 12692 00001ABF 5F                      	pop	di
 12693 00001AC0 74C5                    	jz	short OLDBAK	;Nothing to erase
 12694                                  TABBAK:

 12696 00001AC5 E2FB                    	loop	TABBAK		;Erase correct number of chars
 12697 00001AC7 EBBE                    	jmp	short OLDBAK
 12698                                  
 12699                                  BACKUP:
 12700 00001AC9 FECE                            dec	dh		;Back up in line
 12701 00001ACB 4F                              dec	di
 12702                                  BACKMES:
 12703 00001ACC B008                            mov	al,c_BS ; 8	;Backspace
 12704 00001ACE E86201                          call	OUTT
 12705 00001AD1 B020                            mov	al,20h ; ' '	;Erase
 12706 00001AD3 E85D01                          call	OUTT
 12707 00001AD6 B008                            mov	al,c_BS ; 8	;Backspace
 12708 00001AD8 E95801                  	jmp	OUTT		;Done
 12709                                  
 12710                                  	; 15/01/2024
 12711                                  ;User really wants an ESC character in his line
 12712                                  ;TWOESC:	
 12713                                  ;	mov	al,[cs:ESCCHAR] ; 10/06/2019
 12714                                  ;	jmp	SAVCH
 12715                                  
 12716                                  ;Copy the rest of the template
 12717                                  COPYLIN:
 12718 00001ADB 88D9                            mov	cl,bl		;Total size of template
 12719 00001ADD 28F9                    	sub	cl,bh		;Minus position in template, is number to move
 12720 00001ADF EB07                            jmp	short COPYEACH
 12721                                  
 12722                                  COPYSTR:

 12724 00001AE4 EB02                    	jmp	short COPYEACH  ;Copy up to it
 12725                                  
 12726                                  ;Copy one char from template to line
 12727                                  COPYONE:
 12728 00001AE6 B101                            mov	cl,1
 12729                                  ;Copy CX chars from template to line
 12730                                  COPYEACH:
 12731 00001AE8 36C606[7905]00                  mov	byte [SS:INSMODE],0	;All copies turn off insert mode
 12732 00001AEE 38D6                    	cmp	dh,dl
 12733 00001AF0 740F                            jz	short GETCH2		;At end of line, can't do anything
 12734 00001AF2 38DF                            cmp	bh,bl
 12735 00001AF4 740B                            jz	short GETCH2		;At end of template, can't do anything
 12736 00001AF6 AC                              lodsb
 12737 00001AF7 AA                              stosb
 12738 00001AF8 E8CC01                  	call	BUFOUT

 12742                                  GETCH2:

 12744                                  
 12745                                  ;Skip one char in template
 12746                                  SKIPONE:

 12748 00001B06 74F9                    	jz	short GETCH2		;At end of template

 12755                                  SKIPSTR:

 12757 00001B10 01CE                            add	si,cx			;Go there
 12758 00001B12 00CF                            add	bh,cl
 12759                                          ;jmp	GETCH
 12760                                  	; 15/01/2024
 12761 00001B14 EBEB                    	jmp	short GETCH2
 12762                                  
 12763                                  ;Get the next user char, and look ahead in template for a match
 12764                                  ;CX indicates how many chars to skip to get there on output
 12765                                  ;NOTE: WARNING: If the operation cannot be done, the return
 12766                                  ;       address is popped off and a jump to GETCH is taken.
 12767                                  ;       Make sure nothing extra on stack when this routine
 12768                                  ;       is called!!! (no PUSHes before calling it).
 12769                                  
 12770                                  FINDOLD:
 12771 00001B16 E830FE                          call	_$STD_CON_INPUT_NO_ECHO
 12772                                  
 12773                                  	; STRIN.ASM (MSDOS 2.11, 19/07/2018) 
 12774                                  
 12775                                  	;CMP     AL,[SS:ESCCHAR]	
 12776                                  	;JNZ     SHORT FINDSETUP
 12777                                  
 12778                                  	; CPMIO.ASM (MSDOS 6.0, 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0)
 12779                                  
 12780                                  ;hkn; ESCCHAR is in TABLE seg (DOSCODE), so CS override
 12781                                  
 12782 00001B19 2E3A06[960A]            	CMP	AL,[CS:ESCCHAR]		; did he type a function key?
 12783 00001B1E 7505                    	JNZ	SHORT FINDSETUP		; no, set up for scan
 12784                                  
 12785 00001B20 E826FE                  	CALL	_$STD_CON_INPUT_NO_ECHO	; eat next char
 12786 00001B23 EB1D                            JMP	SHORT NOTFND		; go try again
 12787                                  FINDSETUP:
 12788 00001B25 88D9                    	mov	cl,bl
 12789 00001B27 28F9                            sub	cl,bh		;CX is number of chars to end of template
 12790 00001B29 7417                    	jz	short NOTFND	;At end of template
 12791 00001B2B 49                              dec	cx		;Cannot point past end, limit search
 12792 00001B2C 7414                            jz	short NOTFND	;If only one char in template, forget it
 12793 00001B2E 06                      	push	es
 12794 00001B2F 1E                      	push	ds
 12795 00001B30 07                      	pop	es
 12796 00001B31 57                      	push	di
 12797 00001B32 89F7                    	mov	di,si		;Template to ES:DI
 12798 00001B34 47                      	inc	di
 12799 00001B35 F2AE                    	repne	scasb		;Look
 12800 00001B37 5F                      	pop	di
 12801 00001B38 07                      	pop	es
 12802 00001B39 7507                    	jnz	short NOTFND	;Didn't find the char
 12803 00001B3B F6D1                            not	cl		;Turn how far to go into how far we went
 12804 00001B3D 00D9                            add	cl,bl		;Add size of template
 12805 00001B3F 28F9                            sub	cl,bh		;Subtract current pos, result distance to skip
 12806                                  FINDOLD_RETN:
 12807 00001B41 C3                      	retn
 12808                                  
 12809                                  NOTFND:
 12810 00001B42 5D                      	pop	bp              ;Chuck return address
 12811                                  	;jmp	GETCH

 12851                                  ;
 12852                                  ;**	$RAW_CON_IO - Do Raw Console I/O
 12853                                  ;
 12854                                  ;	Input or output raw character from console, no echo
 12855                                  ;
 12856                                  ;	ENTRY	DL = -1 if input
 12857                                  ;		   =  output character if output
 12858                                  ;	EXIT	(AL) = input character if input
 12859                                  ;	USES	all
 12860                                  ;
 12861                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12862                                  ; 20/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 12863                                  
 12864                                  ; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 12865                                  ; DOSCODE:541Ch (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 12866                                  
 12867                                  ; 08/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 12868                                  ; DOSCODE:5408h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 12869                                  
 12870                                  _$RAW_CON_IO:			; System call 6
 12871                                  
 12872 00001B6F 88D0                            MOV	AL,DL
 12873 00001B71 3CFF                            CMP	AL,-1
 12874 00001B73 7541                    	JNZ	SHORT RAWOUT ; 16/12/2022
 12875                                  	; 08/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 12876                                  	;jz	short rci1
 12877                                  	;jmp	short RAWOUT
 12878                                  	; 16/12/202
 12879                                  	; 07/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 12880                                  	;nop
 12881                                  rci1:
 12882                                  			; Get pointer to register save area
 12883 00001B75 36C43E[8405]            	LES	DI,[SS:USER_SP] ; 12/03/2018
 12884 00001B7A 31DB                    	XOR	BX,BX
 12885                                      	;CALL	GET_IO_FCB	; MSDOS 2.11 (Retro DOS v2.0)
 12886 00001B7C E85523                  	CALL	GET_IO_SFT	; MSDOS 3.3 & MSDOS 6.0
 12887                                          ;JC	SHORT RET17
 12888 00001B7F 72C0                            jc	short FINDOLD_RETN
 12889 00001B81 B401                    	MOV	AH,1
 12890 00001B83 E86835                  	CALL	IOFUNC
 12891 00001B86 750B                    	JNZ	SHORT RESFLG
 12892 00001B88 E82C43                  	CALL	SPOOLINT
 12893                                  	;OR	BYTE [ES:DI+16H],40H
 12894 00001B8B 26804D1640              	OR	BYTE [ES:DI+user_env.user_F],40H ; Set user's zero flag
 12895 00001B90 30C0                    	XOR	AL,AL
 12896                                  RET17:
 12897 00001B92 C3                      	RETN
 12898                                  
 12899                                  RESFLG:
 12900                                  	;AND	BYTE [ES:DI+16H],0FFH-40H  ; 0BFh
 12901 00001B93 26806516BF              	AND	BYTE [ES:DI+user_env.user_F],0FFH-40H
 12902                                  				; Reset user's zero flag
 12903                                  ;RILP:
 12904                                  rci0:
 12905 00001B98 E81C43                       	CALL	SPOOLINT
 12906                                  ;
 12907                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12908                                  ;
 12909                                  ;**	$Raw_CON_INPUT - Raw Console Input
 12910                                  ;
 12911                                  ;	Input raw character from console, no echo
 12912                                  ;
 12913                                  ;	ENTRY	none
 12914                                  ;	EXIT	(al) = character
 12915                                  ;	USES	all
 12916                                  ;
 12917                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12918                                  ;
 12919                                  
 12920                                  ;rci0:	invoke	SPOOLINT
 12921                                  
 12922                                  	;entry	$RAW_CON_INPUT
 12923                                  
 12924                                  	; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 12925                                  
 12926                                  ; DOSCODE:544Bh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 12927                                  
 12928                                  	; 15/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 12929                                  
 12930                                  ; DOSCODE:5ACBh (PCDOS 7.1, IBMDOS.COM)
 12931                                  
 12932                                  _$RAW_CON_INPUT:		; System call 7
 12933 00001B9B 53                      	push	bx
 12934 00001B9C 31DB                    	XOR	BX,BX
 12935                                  	;CALL	GET_IO_FCB	; MSDOS 2.11 (Retro DOS v2.0)
 12936 00001B9E E83323                  	CALL	GET_IO_SFT	; MSDOS 3.3 & MSDOS 6.0
 12937 00001BA1 5B                      	pop	bx
 12938 00001BA2 72EE                    	JC	SHORT RET17
 12939 00001BA4 B401                    	MOV	AH,1
 12940 00001BA6 E84535                  	CALL	IOFUNC
 12941                                  	;JZ	SHORT RILP	; MSDOS 2.11
 12942                                  	;XOR	AH,AH
 12943                                          ;CALL	IOFUNC

 12945 00001BA9 7506                    	jnz	short rci5	; MSDOS 3.3 & MSDOS 6.0
