 13094                                  
 13095                                  ;
 13096                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13097                                  ;
 13098                                  ; Inputs:
 13099                                  ;	AX=0 save the DEVCALL request packet
 13100                                  ;	  =1 restore the DEVCALL request packet
 13101                                  ; Function:
 13102                                  ;	save or restore the DEVCALL packet
 13103                                  ; Returns:
 13104                                  ;	none
 13105                                  ;
 13106                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13107                                  ;
 13108                                  
 13109                                  ; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 13110                                  ; DOSCODE:54B9h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 13111                                  
 13112                                  ; 08/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 13113                                  ; DOSCODE:54A5h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 13114                                  
 13115                                  ; 12/05/2019
 13116                                  
 13117                                  	; 15/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 13118                                  	; DOSCODE:5B42h (PCDOS 7.1, IBMDOS.COM)
 13119                                  
 13120                                  Save_Restore_Packet:
 13121 00001C0A 1E                      	PUSH	DS
 13122 00001C0B 06                      	PUSH	ES
 13123 00001C0C 56                      	PUSH	SI
 13124 00001C0D 57                      	PUSH	DI
 13125

 13128                                  	; 09/09/2018

 13130 00001C11 BE[5A03]                	mov	si,DEVCALL
 13131                                  	;
 13132                                  	; 21/09/2023
 13133 00001C14 09C0                    	or	ax,ax 
 13134                                  	;CMP	AX,0		; save packet
 13135 00001C16 7402                    	JZ	short save_packet ; 16/12/2022
 13136                                  	;je	short set_seg
 13137                                  
 13138                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 13139                                  restore_packet:
 13140                                  ;	MOV	SI,OFFSET DOSDATA:Packet_Temp	;source
 13141                                  ;	MOV	DI,OFFSET DOSDATA:DEVCALL	;destination
 13142                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 13143                                  	;mov	si,FAKE_STACK_2F ; DOS_TEMP ; Packed_Temp 
 13144                                  	;mov	di,DEVCALL  ; 09/09/2018
 13145                                  	;
 13146                                  	;JMP	short set_seg
 13147                                  
 13148                                  	; 16/12/2022	
 13149                                  	; 09/09/2018
 13150 00001C18 87F7                    	xchg	si,di  ; DI = offset DEVCALL, SI = offset FAKE_STACK_2F
 13151                                  
 13152                                  ; 16/12/2022
 13153                                  %if 0
 13154                                  	; 08/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 13155                                  	cmp	ax,0		; save packet
 13156                                  	jz	short save_packet
 13157                                  	mov	si,FAKE_STACK_2F ; 07/12/2022
 13158                                  	mov	di,DEVCALL 
 13159                                  	jmp	short set_seg
 13160                                  
 13161                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 13162                                  save_packet:
 13163                                  ;	MOV	DI,OFFSET DOSDATA:Packet_Temp	;destination
 13164                                  ;	MOV	SI,OFFSET DOSDATA:DEVCALL	;source
 13165                                  	; 09/09/2018
 13166                                  	; MSDOS 3.3

 13173                                  %endif
 13174                                  
 13175                                  ; 16/12/2022
 13176                                  save_packet:
 13177                                  ;set_seg:
 13178                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 13179                                  	;mov	ax,cs
 13180

 13182                                  	;MOV	AX,SS		; set DS,ES to DOSDATA
 13183                                  	;MOV	DS,AX
 13184                                  	;MOV	ES,AX

 13608                                  ;
 13609                                  ;		Created: ARR 4 April 1983"
 13610                                  ;			 MZ  6 June  1983 completion of functions
 13611                                  ;			 MZ 15 Dec   1983 Brain damaged programs close FCBs multiple
 13612                                  ;					  times.  Change so successive closes work by
 13613                                  ;					  always returning OK.	Also, detect I/O to
 13614                                  ;					  already closed FCB and return EOF.

 13620                                  ;Break <$Get_FCB_Position - set random record fields to current pos>
 13621                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13622                                  ;
 13623                                  ;   $Get_FCB_Position - look at an FCB, retrieve the current position from the
 13624                                  ;	extent and next record field and set the random record field to point
 13625                                  ;	to that record
 13626                                  ;
 13627                                  ;   Inputs:	DS:DX point to a possible extended FCB
 13628                                  ;   Outputs:	The random record field of the FCB is set to the current record
 13629                                  ;   Registers modified: all
 13630                                  ;
 13631                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13632                                  ;
 13633                                  
 13634                                  _$GET_FCB_POSITION:
 13635 00001D4E E80605                  	call	GetExtended		; point to FCB
 13636 00001D51 E8D704                  	call	GetExtent		; DX:AX is current record
 13637                                  	;mov	[si+21h],ax
 13638 00001D54 894421                  	MOV	[SI+SYS_FCB.RR],AX 	; drop in low order piece
 13639                                  	;mov	[si+23h],dl
 13640 00001D57 885423                  	MOV	[SI+SYS_FCB.RR+2],DL	; drop in high order piece
 13641                                  	;cmp	word [si+0Eh],64
 13642 00001D5A 837C0E40                	CMP	word [SI+SYS_FCB.RECSIZ],64
 13643 00001D5E 7303                    	JAE	short GetFCBBye
 13644                                  	;mov	[si+24h],dh
 13645 00001D60 887424                  	MOV	[SI+SYS_FCB.RR+2+1],DH	; Set 4th byte only if record size < 64
 13646                                  GoodPath:	; 16/12/2022
 13647                                  GetFCBBye:
 13648 00001D63 E926E9                  	jmp	FCB_RET_OK
 13649                                  
 13650                                  ;Break <$FCB_Delete - remove several files that match the input FCB>
 13651                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13652                                  ;
 13653                                  ;**	$FCB_Delete - Delete from FCB Template
 13654                                  ;
 13655                                  ;	given an FCB, remove all directory entries in the current
 13656                                  ;	directory that have names that match the FCB's ?  marks.
 13657                                  ;
 13658                                  ;	ENTRY	(DS:DX) = address of FCB
 13659                                  ;	EXIT	entries matching the FCB are deleted
 13660                                  ;		(al) = ff iff no entries were deleted
 13661                                  ;	USES	all
 13662                                  ;
 13663                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13664                                  ;
 13665                                  	; 08/11/2022 Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 13666                                  
 13667                                  _$FCB_DELETE:		; System call 19
 13668                                  					; OpenBuf is in DOSDATA
 13669 00001D66 BF[BE03]                	MOV	DI,OPENBUF 		; appropriate place 
 13670                                  
 13671 00001D69 E8A05B                  	call	TransFCB		; convert FCB to path
 13672 00001D6C 7207                    	JC	short BadPath 		; signal no deletions
 13673                                  
 13674 00001D6E 16                      	push	SS
 13675 00001D6F 1F                      	pop	DS			; SS is DOSDATA
 13676                                  
 13677 00001D70 E8F80D                  	call	DOS_DELETE		; wham
 13678                                  	;JC	short BadPath
 13679                                  	; 16/12/2022
 13680 00001D73 73EE                    	jnc 	short GoodPath
 13681                                  ;GoodPath:
 13682                                  ;	;jmp	FCB_RET_OK		; do a good return
 13683                                  ;	; 08/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 13684                                  ;	jmp	short GetFCBBye
 13685                                  
 13686                                  BadPath:
 13687                                  	; Error code is in AX
 13688                                  
 13689 00001D75 E917E9                  	jmp	FCB_RET_ERR		; let someone else signal the error
 13690                                  
 13691                                  ;Break <$Get_FCB_File_Length - return the length of a file>
 13692                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13693                                  ;
 13694                                  ;   $Get_FCB_File_Length - set the random record field to the length of the
 13695                                  ;	file in records (rounded up if partial).
 13696                                  ;
 13697                                  ;   Inputs:	DS:DX - point to a possible extended FCB
 13698                                  ;   Outputs:	Random record field updated to reflect the number of records
 13699                                  ;   Registers modified: all
 13700                                  ;
 13701                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13702                                  ;
 13703                                  	; 15/01/2024 - Retrodos v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 13704

 13706                                  
 13707 00001D78 E8DC04                  	call	GetExtended		; get real FCB pointer
 13708                                  					; DX points to Input FCB
 13709                                  
 13710                                  					; OpenBuf is in DOSDATA
 13711 00001D7B BF[BE03]                	MOV	DI,OPENBUF		; appropriate buffer
 13712                                  
 13713 00001D7E 1E                      	push	ds			; save pointer to true FCB
 13714 00001D7F 56                      	push	si
 13715 00001D80 E8895B                  	call	TransFCB		; Trans name DS:DX, sets SATTRIB
 13716 00001D83 5E                      	pop	si
 13717 00001D84 1F                      	pop	ds
 13718 00001D85 72EE                    	JC	short BadPath
 13719 00001D87 1E                      	push	ds			; save pointer
 13720 00001D88 56                      	push	si
 13721 00001D89 16                      	push	ss		
 13722 00001D8A 1F                      	pop	ds

 13724 00001D8E 5E                      	pop	si			; get pointer back
 13725 00001D8F 1F                      	pop	ds
 13726 00001D90 72E3                    	JC	short BadPath 		; invalid something
 13727                                  	; 15/01/2024
 13728                                  	;MOV	DX,BX (*)		; get high order size
 13729                                  	;MOV	AX,DI (**)		; get low order size
 13730 00001D92 89D8                    	mov	ax,bx ; hw of file size
 13731                                  	;
 13732                                  	;mov	bx,[si+0Eh]
 13733 00001D94 8B5C0E                  	MOV	BX,[SI+SYS_FCB.RECSIZ]	; get his record size
 13734 00001D97 09DB                    	OR	BX,BX			; empty record => 0 size for file
 13735 00001D99 7502                    	JNZ	short GetSize 		; not empty
 13736                                  	;MOV	BX,128
 13737 00001D9B B380                    	mov	bl,128	; 15/01/2024
 13738                                  GetSize:
 13739                                  	; 15/01/2024
 13740                                  	;MOV	DI,AX			; save low order word
 13741                                  	;MOV	AX,DX			; move high order for divide
 13742                                  	;xchg	ax,dx ; (*)
 13743                                  	; ax = hw of file size
 13744                                  
 13745 00001D9D 31D2                    	XOR	DX,DX			; clear out high
 13746 00001D9F F7F3                    	DIV	BX			; wham
 13747 00001DA1 50                      	PUSH	AX			; save dividend
 13748 00001DA2 89F8                    	MOV	AX,DI ; (**)		; get low order piece
 13749 00001DA4 F7F3                    	DIV	BX			; wham
 13750 00001DA6 89D1                    	MOV	CX,DX			; save remainder
 13751 00001DA8 5A                      	POP	DX			; get high order dividend
 13752 00001DA9 E306                    	JCXZ	LengthStore		; no roundup
 13753 00001DAB 83C001                  	ADD	AX,1
 13754 00001DAE 83D200                  	ADC	DX,0			; 32-bit increment
 13755                                  LengthStore:
 13756                                  	;mov	[si+21h],ax
 13757 00001DB1 894421                  	MOV	[SI+SYS_FCB.RR],AX	; store low order
 13758                                  	;mov	[si+23h],dl
 13759 00001DB4 885423                  	MOV	[SI+SYS_FCB.RR+2],DL	; store high order
 13760 00001DB7 08F6                    	OR	DH,DH
 13761 00001DB9 74A8                    	JZ	short GoodPath		; not storing insignificant zero
 13762                                  	;mov	[si+24h],dh
 13763 00001DBB 887424                  	MOV	[SI+SYS_FCB.RR+3],DH	; save that high piece
 13764                                  	; 16/12/2022
 13765                                  GoodRet:
 13766                                  	;jmp	FCB_RET_OK
 13767 00001DBE EBA3                    	jmp	short GoodPath

 13769                                  ;Break <$FCB_Close - close a file>
 13770                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13771                                  ;
 13772                                  ;   $FCB_Close - given an FCB, look up the SFN and close it. Do not free it
 13773                                  ;	as the FCB may be used for further I/O
 13774                                  ;
 13775                                  ;   Inputs:	DS:DX point to FCB
 13776                                  ;   Outputs:	AL = FF if file was not found on disk
 13777                                  ;   Registers modified: all
 13778                                  ;
 13779                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13780                                  ;
 13781                                  	; 16/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 13782                                  
 13783                                  _$FCB_CLOSE:		; System call 16
 13784                                  
 13785 00001DC0 30C0                    	XOR	AL,AL			; default search attributes
 13786 00001DC2 E89204                  	call	GetExtended		; DS:SI point to real FCB
 13787 00001DC5 7403                    	JZ	short NoAttr		; not extended
 13788 00001DC7 8A44FF                  	MOV	AL,[SI-1]		; get attributes
 13789                                  NoAttr:

 13791 00001DCA 36A2[6B05]              	MOV	[SS:ATTRIB],AL		; stash away found attributes
 13792 00001DCE E8D903                  	call	SFTFromFCB
 13793 00001DD1 72EB                    	JC	short GoodRet 		; MZ 16 Jan Assume death
 13794                                  
 13795                                  	; If the sharer is present, then the SFT is not regenable. Thus, 
 13796                                  	; there is no need to set the SFT's attribute.
 13797

 13799                                  	;;; done
 13800                                  
 13801                                  	;mov	al,[es:di+4]
 13802 00001DD3 268A4504                	MOV	AL,[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_attr]
 13803 00001DD7 30E4                    	XOR	AH,AH
 13804 00001DD9 50                      	PUSH	AX
 13805

 13810 00001DDD 7508                    	JNZ	short NoStash
 13811 00001DDF 36A0[6B05]              	MOV	AL,[SS:ATTRIB]
 13812                                  	;mov	[es:di+4],al
 13813 00001DE3 26884504                	MOV	[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_attr],AL ; attempted attribute for close
 13814                                  NoStash:
 13815                                  
 13816                                  ; 16/01/2024
 13817                                  %if 0
 13818                                  	;mov	ax,[si+14h]
 13819                                  	MOV	AX,[SI+SYS_FCB.FDATE] ; move in the time and date
 13820                                  	;mov	[es:di+0Fh],ax
 13821                                  	MOV	[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_date],AX
 13822                                  	;mov	ax,[si+16h]

 13824                                  	;mov	[es:di+0Dh],ax

 13830                                  	;mov	ax,[si+12h]

 13832                                  	;mov	[es:di+13h],ax
 13833                                  	MOV	[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_size+2],AX
 13834                                  	;or	word [es:di+5],4000h

 13837                                  	;OR	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_flags],sf_close_nodate

 13840 00001DE7 1E                      	push	ds
 13841                                  	;lds	ax,[si+14h]
 13842 00001DE8 C54414                  	lds	ax,[si+SYS_FCB.FDATE]	; move in the time and date

 13858                                  %endif

 13895                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13896                                  ;
 13897                                  ;**	$FCB_Rename - Rename a File
 13898                                  ;
 13899                                  ;	$FCB_Rename - rename a file in place within a directory. Renames
 13900                                  ;	multiple files copying from the meta characters.
 13901                                  ;
 13902                                  ;	ENTRY	DS:DX point to an FCB. The normal name field is the source
 13903                                  ;		    name of the files to be renamed. Starting at offset 11h
 13904                                  ;		    in the FCB is the destination name.
 13905                                  ;	EXIT	AL = 0 -> no error occurred and all files were renamed
 13906                                  ;		AL = FF -> some files may have been renamed but:
 13907                                  ;			rename to existing file or source file not found
 13908                                  ;	USES	ALL
 13909                                  ;
 13910                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13911                                  ;
 13912                                  	; 08/11/2022 Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 13913                                  	; 16/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 13914                                  
 13915                                  _$FCB_RENAME:		; System call 23
 13916                                  
 13917 00001E2C E82804                  	call	GetExtended		; get pointer to real FCB
 13918 00001E2F 52                      	push	dx
 13919 00001E30 8A04                    	MOV	AL,[SI] 		; get drive byte
 13920 00001E32 83C610                  	ADD	SI,10h			; point to destination
 13921                                  
 13922                                  					; RenBuf is in DOSDATA
 13923 00001E35 BF[3E04]                	MOV	DI,RENBUF		; point to destination buffer
 13924 00001E38 FF34                    	push	word [SI]
 13925 00001E3A 1E                      	push	ds
 13926                                  	;push	di			; save source pointer for TransFCB
 13927                                  	; 16/01/2024 (Retro DOS v4 BugFix!)
 13928 00001E3B 56                      	push	si
 13929 00001E3C 8804                    	MOV	[SI],AL			; drop in real drive
 13930 00001E3E 89F2                    	MOV	DX,SI			; let TransFCB know where the FCB is
 13931 00001E40 E8C95A                  	call	TransFCB		; munch this pathname
 13932 00001E43 5E                      	pop	si
 13933 00001E44 1F                      	pop	ds	
 13934 00001E45 8F04                    	pop	WORD [SI]		; get path back
 13935 00001E47 5A                      	pop	dx			; Original FCB pointer
 13936 00001E48 72DF                    	JC	short fren90		; bad path -> error
 13937                                  
 13938                                  					; SS override for WFP_Start & Ren_WFP
 13939 00001E4A 368B36[B205]            	MOV	SI,[ss:WFP_START]	; get pointer

 13966                                  ;	;jmp	FCB_RET_ERR
 13967                                  ;	; 08/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 13968                                  ;	jmp	short fcb_close_err
 13969                                  
 13970                                  ;Break <Misbehavior fixers>
 13971                                  ;
 13972                                  ;   FCBs suffer from several problems. First, they are maintained in the
 13973                                  ;   user's space so he may move them at will. Second, they have a small
 13974                                  ;   reserved area that may be used for system information. Third, there was
 13975                                  ;   never any "rules for behavior" for FCBs; there was no protocol for their
 13976                                  ;   usage.
 13977                                  ;
 13978                                  ;   This results in the following misbehavior:
 13979                                  ;
 13980                                  ;	infinite opens of the same file:
 13981                                  ;
 13982                                  ;	While (TRUE) {			While (TRUE) {
 13983                                  ;	    FCBOpen (FCB);		    FCBOpen (FCB);
 13984                                  ;	    Read (FCB); 		    Write (FCB);
 13985                                  ;	    }				    }
 13986                                  ;
 13987                                  ;	infinite opens of different files:
 13988                                  ;
 13989                                  ;	While (TRUE) {			While (TRUE) {
 13990                                  ;	    FCBOpen (FCB[i++]); 	    FCBOpen (FCB[i++]);
 13991                                  ;	    Read (FCB); 		    Write (FCB);
 13992                                  ;	    }				    }
 13993                                  ;
 13994                                  ;	multiple closes of the same file:
 13995                                  ;
 13996                                  ;	FCBOpen (FCB);
 13997                                  ;	while (TRUE)
 13998                                  ;	    FCBClose (FCB);
 13999                                  ;
 14000                                  ;	I/O after closing file:
 14001                                  ;
 14002                                  ;	FCBOpen (FCB);
 14003                                  ;	while (TRUE) {
 14004                                  ;	    FCBWrite (FCB);
 14005                                  ;	    FCBClose (FCB);
 14006                                  ;	    }
 14007                                  ;
 14008                                  ;   The following is am implementation of a methodology for emulating the
 14009                                  ;   above with the exception of I/O after close. We are NOT attempting to
 14010                                  ;   resolve that particular misbehavior. We will enforce correct behaviour in
 14011                                  ;   FCBs when they refer to a network file or when there is file sharing on
 14012                                  ;   the local machine.
 14013                                  ;
 14014                                  ;   The reserved fields of the FCB (10 bytes worth) is divided up into various
 14015                                  ;   structures depending on the file itself and the state of operations of the
 14016                                  ;   OS. The information contained in this reserved field is enough to
 14017                                  ;   regenerate the SFT for the local non-shared file. It is assumed that this
 14018                                  ;   regeneration procedure may be expensive. The SFT for the FCB is
 14019                                  ;   maintained in a LRU cache as the ONLY performance inprovement.
 14020                                  ;
 14021                                  ;   No regeneration of SFTs is attempted for network FCBs.
 14022                                  ;
 14023                                  ;   To regenerate the SFT for a local FCB, it is necessary to determine if the
 14024                                  ;   file sharer is working. If the file sharer is present then the SFT is not
 14025                                  ;   regenerated.
 14026                                  ;
 14027                                  ;   Finally, if there is no local sharing, the full name of the file is no
 14028                                  ;   longer available. We can make up for this by using the following
 14029                                  ;   information:
 14030                                  ;
 14031                                  ;	The Drive number (from the DPB).
 14032                                  ;	The physical sector of the directory that contains the entry.
 14033                                  ;	The relative position of the entry in the sector.
 14034                                  ;	The first cluster field.
 14035                                  ;	The last used SFT.
 14036                                  ;      OR In the case of a device FCB
 14037                                  ;	The low 6 bits of sf_flags (indicating device type)
 14038                                  ;	The pointer to the device header
 14039                                  ;
 14040                                  ;   We read in the particular directory sector and examine the indicated
 14041                                  ;   directory entry. If it matches, then we are kosher; otherwise, we fail.
 14042                                  ;
 14043                                  ;   Some key items need to be remembered:
 14044                                  ;
 14045                                  ;	Even though we are caching SFTs, they may contain useful sharing
 14046                                  ;	information. We enforce good behavior on the FCBs.
 14047                                  ;
 14048                                  ;	Network support must not treat FCBs as impacting the ref counts on
 14049                                  ;	open VCs. The VCs may be closed only at process termination.
 14050                                  ;
 14051                                  ;	If this is not an installed version of the DOS, file sharing will
 14052                                  ;	always be present.
 14053                                  ;
 14054                                  ;	We MUST always initialize lstclus to = firclus when regenerating a
 14055                                  ;	file. Otherwise we start allocating clusters up the wazoo.
 14056                                  ;
 14057                                  ;	Always initialize, during regeneration, the mode field to both isFCB
 14058                                  ;	and open_for_both. This is so the FCB code in the sharer can find the
 14059                                  ;	proper OI record.
 14060                                  ;
 14061                                  ;   The test bits are:
 14062                                  ;
 14063                                  ;	00 -> local file
 14064                                  ;	40 -> sharing local
 14065                                  ;	80 -> network
 14066                                  ;	C0 -> local device
 14067                                  
 14068                                  ;Break	<SaveFCBInfo - store pertinent information from an SFT into the FCB>
 14069                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14070                                  ;
 14071                                  ;   SaveFCBInfo - given an FCB and its associated SFT, copy the relevant
 14072                                  ;	pieces of information into the FCB to allow for subsequent
 14073                                  ;	regeneration. Poke LRU also.
 14074                                  ;
 14075                                  ;   Inputs:	ThisSFT points to a complete SFT.
 14076                                  ;		DS:SI point to the FCB (not an extended one)
 14077                                  ;   Outputs:	The relevant reserved fields in the FCB are filled in.
 14078                                  ;		DS:SI preserved
 14079                                  ;		ES:DI point to sft
 14080                                  ;   Registers modified: All
 14081                                  ;
 14082                                  ;
 14083                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14084                                  ;
 14085                                  
 14086                                  	; 08/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 14087                                  	; 20/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)

 14297                                  ;Break	<ResetLRU - reset overflowed lru counts>
 14298                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14299                                  ;
 14300                                  ;   ResetLRU - during lru updates, we may wrap at 64K. We must walk the
 14301                                  ;   entire set of SFTs and subtract 8000h from their lru counts and truncate
 14302                                  ;   at 0.
 14303                                  ;
 14304                                  ;   Inputs:	BX is offset into SFT field where lru firld is kept
 14305                                  ;		ES:DI point to SFT currently being updated
 14306                                  ;   Outputs:	All FCB SFTs have their lru fields truncated
 14307                                  ;		AX has 8000h
 14308                                  ;   Registers modified: none
 14309                                  ;
 14310                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14311                                  ;
 14312                                  
 14313                                  	; 17/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 14314                                  ResetLRU:
 14315                                  	; ResetLRU is only called from fcbio.asm. So SS can be assumed to be 
 14316                                  	; DOSDATA
 14317                                  
 14318 00001F14 B80080                  	MOV	AX,8000h
 14319 00001F17 06                      	push	es
 14320 00001F18 57                      	push	di
 14321                                  	;LES	DI,[CS:SFTFCB]		; get pointer to head
 14322 00001F19 36C43E[4000]            	LES	DI,[SS:SFTFCB] ; MSDOS 6.0
 14323                                  	;mov	cx,[es:di+4]
 14324 00001F1E 268B4D04                	MOV	CX,[ES:DI+SFT.SFCount]
 14325                                  	;lea	di,[di+6]
 14326 00001F22 8D7D06                  	LEA	DI,[DI+SFT.SFTable] 	; point at table
 14327                                  ovScan:
 14328 00001F25 262901                  	SUB	[ES:DI+BX],AX		; decrement lru count
 14329 00001F28 7703                    	JA	short ovLoop
 14330 00001F2A 268901                  	MOV	[ES:DI+BX],AX		; truncate at 0
 14331                                  ovLoop:
 14332                                  	;;add	di,53	; MSDOS 3.3
 14333                                  	;add	di,59	; MSDOS 6.0	
 14334 00001F2D 83C73B                  	ADD	DI,SF_ENTRY.size	; advance to next
 14335 00001F30 E2F3                    	LOOP	ovScan
 14336 00001F32 5F                      	pop	di
 14337 00001F33 07                      	pop	es
 14338 00001F34 268901                  	MOV	[ES:DI+BX],AX
 14339 00001F37 C3                      	retn

 14379                                  ; 21/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 14380                                  ; LRUFCB for MSDOS 6.0 !
 14381                                  
 14382                                  ;Break	<LRUFCB - perform LRU on FCB sfts>
 14383                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14384                                  ;
 14385                                  ;   LRUFCB - find LRU fcb in cache. Set ThisSFT and return it. We preserve
 14386                                  ;	the first keepcount sfts if they are network sfts or if sharing is
 14387                                  ;	loaded.  If carry is set then NO BLASTING is NECESSARY.
 14388                                  ;
 14389                                  ;   Inputs:	none
 14390                                  ;   Outputs:	ES:DI point to SFT
 14391                                  ;		ThisSFT points to SFT
 14392                                  ;		SFT is zeroed
 14393                                  ;		Carry set of closes failed
 14394                                  ;   Registers modified: none
 14395                                  ;
 14396                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14397                                  ;
 14398                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 14399                                  ;IF 0	; rewritten this routine
 14400                                  ;
 14401                                  ;LRUFCB: ; MSDOS 3.3 - IBMDOS.COM (1987) - Offset 25ADh
 14402                                  ;	call	save_world
 14403                                  ;	
 14404                                  ; Find nth oldest NET/SHARE FCB. We want to find its age for the second scan
 14405                                  ; to find the lease recently used one that is younger than the open age.  We
 14406                                  ; operate be scanning the list n times finding the least age that is greater
 14407                                  ; or equal to the previous minimum age.
 14408                                  ;
 14409                                  ;   BP is the count of times we need to go through this loop.
 14410                                  ;   AX is the current acceptable minimum age to consider
 14411                                  ;
 14412                                  ;	mov	bp,[CS:KEEPCOUNT]	; k = keepcount;
 14413                                  ;	XOR	AX,AX			; low = 0;
 14414                                  ;
 14415                                  ; If we've scanned the table n times, then we are done.
 14416                                  ;
 14417                                  ;lru1:
 14418                                  ;	CMP	bp,0			; while (k--) {

 14495                                  ; set then threshold value to this new minimum + 1. Otherwise, the scan is
 14496                                  ; complete.  Go find LRU.
 14497                                  ;

 14500                                  ;	jz	short lru75		; no, done with everything

 14521                                  ; then check for lru.

 14538                                  ;

 14555                                  ; out. The conditions here are:
 14556                                  ;
 14557                                  ;  No local-no-shares AND all net/share entries are older than threshold
 14558                                  ;
 14559                                  ;lru10:

 14568                                  ; is 0.

 14579                                  ;

 14609                                  
 14610                                  ; 17/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 14611                                  ; LRUFCB for MSDOS 6.0 !
 14612                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14613                                  ;
 14614                                  ; LruFCB -- allocate the LRU SFT from the SFT Table. The LRU scheme
 14615                                  ; maintains separate counts for net/Share and local SFTs. We allocate a 
 14616                                  ; net/Share SFT only if we do not find a local SFT. This helps keep
 14617                                  ; net/Share SFTs which cannot be regenerated for as long as possible. We
 14618                                  ; optimize regeneration operations by keeping track of the current local
 14619                                  ; SFT. This avoids scanning of the SFTs as long as we have at least one 
 14620                                  ; local SFT in the SFT Block.
 14621                                  ;
 14622                                  ; Inputs: al = 0 => Regenerate SFT operation
 14623                                  ;	    = 1 => Allocate new SFT for Open/Create
 14624                                  ;
 14625                                  ; Outputs: Carry clear
 14626                                  ;	 	es:di = Address of allocated SFT
 14627                                  ;	  	ThisSFT = Address of allocated SFT
 14628                                  ;
 14629                                  ;	  carry set if closes of net/Share files failed 
 14630                                  ;		al = error_FCB_unavailable
 14631                                  ;
 14632                                  ; Registers affected: None
 14633                                  ;
 14634                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14635                                  
 14636                                  ;LruFCB	PROC	NEAR
 14637                                  LRUFCB:
 14638                                  	; 17/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 14639                                  	; DOSCODE:5805h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 14640                                  
 14641                                  	; 08/11/2022 Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 14642                                  	; DOSCODE:57F1h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 14643                                  
 14644                                  	; 20/01/2024 Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMMDOS.COM)
 14645                                  	; DOSCODE:5E7Ch (PCDOS 7.1, IBMDOS.COM)
 14646                                  
 14647 00001F38 06                      	push	es	; * (MSDOS 6.21)
 14648                                  	
 14649 00001F39 E81CE5                  	call	save_world
 14650                                  	
 14651                                  	;getdseg <ds>		;ds = DOSDATA
 14652 00001F3C 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
 14653                                  
 14654 00001F41 08C0                    	or	al,al		;Check if regenerate allocation
 14655 00001F43 7516                    	jnz	short lru1	;Try to find SFT to use
 14656                                  
 14657                                  	; This is a regen call. If LocalSFT contains the address of a valid 
 14658                                  	; local SFT, just return that SFT to reuse
 14659                                  
 14660                                  	; 20/01/2024
 14661                                  	;mov	di,[LocalSFT]
 14662                                  	;or	di,[LocalSFT+2]	;is address == 0?
 14663                                  	;jz	short lru1	;invalid local SFT, find one
 14664                                  
 14665                                  	; We have found a valid local SFT. Recycle this SFT
 14666                                  
 14667 00001F45 C43E[A910]              	les	di,[LocalSFT]
 14668                                  
 14669                                  	; 20/01/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 14670 00001F49 8CC1                    	mov	cx,es
 14671 00001F4B 09F9                    	or	cx,di		; is address == 0?
 14672 00001F4D 740C                    	jz	short lru1	; invalid local SFT, find one
 14673                                  
 14674                                  gotlocalSFT:
 14675 00001F4F 893E[9E05]              	mov	[THISSFT],di
 14676 00001F53 8C06[A005]              	mov	[THISSFT+2],es
 14677 00001F57 F8                      	clc
 14678 00001F58 E9A900                  	jmp	LRUDone		;clear up SFT and return
 14679                                  
 14680                                  lru1:
 14681 00001F5B C43E[4000]              	les	di,[SFTFCB]	;es:di = SF Table for FCBs
 14682                                  	;mov	cx,[es:di+4]
 14683 00001F5F 268B4D04                	mov	cx,[es:di+SFT.SFCount]	;cx = number of SFTs
 14684                                  	;lea	di,[di+6]
 14685 00001F63 8D7D06                  	lea	di,[di+SFT.SFTable]	;es:di = first SFT
 14686                                  
 14687                                  	; We scan through all the SFTs scanning for a free one. It also 
 14688                                  	; remembers the LRU SFT for net/Share SFTs and local SFTs separately. 
 14689                                  	; bx = min. LRU for local SFTs
 14690                                  	; si = pos. of local SFT with min. LRU
 14691                                  	; dx = min. LRU for net/Share SFTs
 14692                                  	; bp = pos. of net/Share SFT with min. LRU
 14693                                  
 14694 00001F66 BBFFFF                  	mov	bx,-1		; init. to 0xffff ( max. LRU value )
 14695 00001F69 89DE                    	mov	si,bx
 14696 00001F6B 89DA                    	mov	dx,bx
 14697 00001F6D 89DD                    	mov	bp,bx
 14698                                  
 14699                                  findSFT:
 14700                                  	;See if this SFT is a free one. If so, return it
 14701 00001F6F 26830D00                	or	word [es:di],0
 14702                                  	;or	word [es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count],0 ;reference count = 0 ?
 14703 00001F73 744C                    	jz	short gotSFT	;yes, SFT is free
 14704                                  	;;cmp	word [es:di],-1
 14705                                  	;cmp	word [es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count],sf_busy ;Is it busy?
 14706 00001F75 26833DFF                	cmp	word [es:di],sf_busy ; -1 
 14707 00001F79 7446                    	jz	short gotSFT	;no, can use it
 14708                                  
 14709                                  	; Check if this SFT is local and store its address in LocalSFT. Can be 
 14710                                  	; used for a later regen.
 14711                                  
 14712                                  	; 16/12/2022
 14713                                  	; 08/11/2022
 14714                                  	;test	byte [es:di+6],80h
 14715 00001F7B 26F6450680              	test	byte [es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_flags+1],(sf_isnet>>8) ; 80h
 14716                                  	; 08/11/2022 Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 14717                                  	;;test	word [es:di+5],8000h
 14718                                  	;test	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_flags],sf_isnet ; network SFT?
 14719 00001F80 7531                    	jnz	short lru5	;yes, get net/Share LRU
 14720                                  
 14721                                  ;IF installed
 14722 00001F82 E8B361                  	call	CheckShare	;Share present?
 14723                                  ;ENDIF
 14724 00001F85 752C                    	jnz	short lru5	;yes, get net/Share LRU
 14725                                  
 14726                                  	;Local SFT, register its address
 14727                                  
 14728                                  	; !!HACK!!!
 14729                                  	; There is a slightly dirty hack out here in a desperate bid to save  
 14730                                  	; code space. There is similar code duplicated at label 'gotSFT'. We 
 14731                                  	; enter from there if al = 0, update the LocalSFT variable, and since 
 14732                                  	; al = 0, we jump out of the loop to the exit point. I have commented 
 14733                                  	; out the code that previously existed at label 'gotSFT'
 14734                                  
 14735                                  hackpoint:
 14736 00001F87 893E[A910]              	mov	[LocalSFT],di
 14737 00001F8B 8C06[AB10]              	mov	[LocalSFT+2],es	;store local SFT address
 14738                                  
 14739 00001F8F 08C0                    	or	al,al		;Is operation = REGEN?
 14740 00001F91 74BC                    	jz	short gotlocalSFT ;yes, return this SFT for reuse
 14741                                  
 14742                                  	;Get LRU for local files
 14743                                  	
 14744                                  	;cmp	[es:di+15h],bx
 14745 00001F93 26395D15                	cmp	[es:di+sf_LRU],bx ;SFT.LRU < min?
 14746 00001F97 7306                    	jae	short lru4	;no, skip 
 14747                                  
 14748                                  	;mov	bx,[es:di+15h]
 14749 00001F99 268B5D15                	mov	bx,[es:di+sf_LRU] ;yes, store new minimum
 14750 00001F9D 89FE                    	mov	si,di		;store SFT position
 14751                                  lru4:
 14752                                  	;add	di,59
 14753 00001F9F 83C73B                  	add	di,SF_ENTRY.size ;go to next SFT
 14754 00001FA2 E2CB                    	loop	findSFT
 14755                                  	
 14756                                  	; 20/01/2024
 14757 00001FA4 49                      	dec	cx ; -1
 14758                                  
 14759                                  	; Check whether we got a net/Share or local SFT. If local SFT
 14760                                  	; available, we will reuse it instead of net/Share LRU
 14761                                  
 14762 00001FA5 89F7                    	mov	di,si
 14763                                  	;cmp	si,-1		;local SFT available?
 14764 00001FA7 39CE                    	cmp	si,cx ; 20/01/2024
 14765 00001FA9 7516                    	jnz	short gotSFT	;yes, return it
 14766                                  
 14767                                  	;No local SFT, see if we got a net/Share SFT
 14768                                  
 14769 00001FAB 89EF                    	mov	di,bp
 14770                                  
 14771 00001FAD 39CD                    	cmp	bp,cx ; -1 ; 20/01/2024
 14772                                  	;cmp	bp,-1		;net/Share SFT available?
 14773 00001FAF 752D                    	jnz	short gotnetSFT	;yes, return it
 14774                                  noSFT:
 14775                                  	; NB: This error should never occur. We always must have an LRU SFT.
 14776                                  	; This error can occur only if the SFT has been corrupted or the LRU
 14777                                  	; count is not maintained properly.
 14778                                  
 14779 00001FB1 EB4E                    	jmp	short errorbadSFT ;error, no FCB available.
 14780                                  
 14781                                  	; Handle the LRU for net/Share SFTs
 14782                                  lru5:
 14783                                  	;cmp	[es:di+15h],dx
 14784 00001FB3 26395515                	cmp	[es:di+sf_LRU],dx ;SFT.LRU < min?
 14785 00001FB7 73E6                    	jae	short lru4	;no, skip
 14786                                  
 14787                                  	;mov	dx,[es:di+15h]
 14788 00001FB9 268B5515                	mov	dx,[es:di+sf_LRU] ;yes, store new minimum
 14789                                  
 14790 00001FBD 89FD                    	mov	bp,di		;store SFT position
 14791 00001FBF EBDE                    	jmp	short lru4	;continue with next SFT
 14792                                  
 14793                                  gotSFT:
 14794 00001FC1 08C0                    	or	al,al
 14795 00001FC3 74C2                    	jz	short hackpoint	;save es:di in LocalSFT
 14796                                  
 14797                                  	; HACK!!!
 14798                                  	; The code here differs from the code at 'hackpoint' only in the 
 14799                                  	; order of the check for al. If al = 0, we can jump to 'hackpoint'
 14800                                  	; and then from there jump out to 'gotlocalSFT'. The original code
 14801                                  	; has been commented out below and replaced by the code just above.
 14802                                  
 14803                                  ;If regen, then this SFT can be registered as a local one ( even if free ).
 14804                                  ;
 14805                                  ;	or	al,al		  ;Regen?
 14806                                  ;	jnz	short notlocaluse ;yes, register it and return
 14807                                  ;
 14808                                  ;Register this SFT as a local one
 14809                                  ;
 14810                                  ;	mov	[LocalSFT],di
 14811                                  ;	mov	[LocalSFT+2],es
 14812                                  ;	jmp	gotlocalSFT	;return to caller
 14813                                  ;
 14814                                  ;notlocaluse:
 14815                                  
 14816                                  	; The caller is probably going to use this SFT for a net/Share file.
 14817                                  	; We will come here only on a Open/Create when the caller($FCB_OPEN)
 14818                                  	; does not really know whether it is a local file or not. We
 14819                                  	; invalidate LocalSFT if the SFT we are going to use was previously
 14820                                  	; registered as a local SFT that can be recycled.
 14821                                  
 14822 00001FC5 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es
 14823 00001FC7 393E[A910]              	cmp	[LocalSFT],di		;Offset same?
 14824 00001FCB 750E                    	jne	short notinvalid
 14825 00001FCD 3906[AB10]              	cmp	[LocalSFT+2],ax		;Segments same?
 14826                                  	;je	short zerolocalSFT	;no, no need to invalidate
 14827                                  	; 20/01/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 14828 00001FD1 7508                    	jne	short notinvalid
 14829                                  zerolocalSFT:	
 14830 00001FD3 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax ; 0
 14831 00001FD5 A3[A910]                	mov	[LocalSFT],ax
 14832 00001FD8 A3[AB10]                	mov	[LocalSFT+2],ax
 14833                                  	
 14834                                  notinvalid:
 14835 00001FDB E971FF                  	jmp	gotlocalSFT
 14836                                  
 14837                                  	; The SFT we are going to use was registered in the LocalSFT variable.
 14838                                  	; Invalidate this variable i.e LocalSFT = NULL
 14839                                  
 14840                                  ;zerolocalSFT:
 14841                                  	;xor	ax,ax ; 0
 14842                                  	;mov	[LocalSFT],ax
 14843                                  	;mov	[LocalSFT+2],ax
 14844                                  	;
 14845                                  	;jmp	gotlocalSFT
 14846                                  
 14847                                  gotnetSFT:
 14848                                  	; We have an SFT that is currently net/Share. If it is going to be
 14849                                  	; used for a regen, we know it has to be a local SFT. Update the
 14850                                  	; LocalSFT variable
 14851                                  
 14852 00001FDE 08C0                    	or	al,al
 14853 00001FE0 7508                    	jnz	short closenet
 14854                                  
 14855 00001FE2 893E[A910]              	mov	[LocalSFT],di
 14856 00001FE6 8C06[AB10]              	mov	[LocalSFT+2],es	;store local SFT address
 14857                                  closenet:
 14858 00001FEA 893E[9E05]              	mov	[THISSFT],di	; set thissft
 14859 00001FEE 8C06[A005]              	mov	[THISSFT+2],es	
 14860                                  
 14861                                  	; If we have sharing or thisSFT is a net sft, then close it until ref
 14862                                  	; count is 0.
 14863                                  	; NB: We come here only if it is a net/Share SFT that is going to be
 14864                                  	; recycled -- no need to check for this.
 14865                                  
 14866                                  LRUClose:
 14867 00001FF2 26833D00                	cmp	word [es:di],0
 14868                                  	;cmp	word [es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count],0 ; is ref count still <> 0?
 14869 00001FF6 740C                    	jz	short LRUDone	; nope, all done
 14870                                  
 14871 00001FF8 E82C17                  	call	DOS_CLOSE
 14872 00001FFB 73F5                    	jnc	short LRUClose	; no error => clean up
 14873                                  
 14874                                  	; Bugbug: I dont know why we are trying to close after we get an
 14875                                  	; error closing. Seems like we could have a potential infinite loop
 14876                                  	; here. This has to be verified.
 14877                                  
 14878 00001FFD 3C06                    	cmp	al,error_invalid_handle ; 6
 14879 00001FFF 74F1                    	je	short LRUClose
 14880                                  errorbadSFT:
 14881 00002001 F9                      	stc
 14882 00002002 EB05                    	JMP	short LRUDead
 14883                                  LRUDone:
 14884 00002004 30C0                    	XOR	AL,AL
 14885 00002006 E81B01                  	call	BlastSFT		; fill SFT with 0 (AL), 'C' cleared

 14917                                  ; --------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14918                                  ;**** RegenCopyName -- This function copies the filename from the FCB to
 14919                                  ; SFT and also to DOS local buffers. There was duplicate code in FCBRegen
 14920                                  ; to copy the name to different destinations
 14921                                  ;
 14922                                  ; Inputs: ds:si = source string
 14923                                  ;	 es:di = destination string
 14924                                  ;	 cx = length of string
 14925                                  ;
 14926                                  ; Outputs: String copied to destination
 14927                                  ;
 14928                                  ; Registers affected: cx,di,si
 14929                                  ; --------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14930                                  
 14931                                  RegenCopyName:
 14932                                  CopyName:
 14933 0000201C AC                      	lodsb			;load character
 14934 0000201D E8AA3D                  	call	UCase		; convert char to upper case
 14935                                  StuffChar2:
 14936 00002020 AA                      	STOSB			;store converted character
 14937 00002021 E2F9                    	LOOP	CopyName	;
 14938                                  DoneName:
 14939 00002023 C3                      	retn
 14940                                  
 14941                                  ; --------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14942                                  
 14943                                  	; 09/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 14944                                  	; 21/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 14945                                  
 14946                                  FCBRegen:
 14947                                  	; called from SFTFromFCB. SS already DOSDATA
 14948                                  
 14949                                  	; General data filling. Mode is sf_isFCB + open_for_both, date/time 
 14950                                  	; we do not fill, size we do no fill, position we do not fill,
 14951                                  	; bit 14 of flags = TRUE, other bits = FALSE
 14952                                  
 14953                                  	;mov	al,[si+19h]
 14954 00002024 8A4419                  	MOV	AL,[SI+fcb_l_drive]
 14955                                  
 14956                                  	; We discriminate based on the first two bits in the reserved field.
 14957                                  	
 14958                                  	;test	al,80h
 14959 00002027 A880                    	test	AL,FCBSPECIAL		; check for no sharing test
 14960 00002029 741C                    	JZ	short RegenNoSharing	; yes, go regen from no sharing
 14961                                  
 14962                                  	; The FCB is for a network or a sharing based system. At this point 
 14963                                  	; we have already closed the SFT for this guy and reconnection is 
 14964                                  	; impossible.
 14965                                  	;
 14966                                  	; Remember that he may have given us a FCB with bogus information in
 14967                                  	; it. Check to see if sharing is present or if the redir is present.
 14968                                  	; If either is around, presume that we have cycled out the FCB and 
 14969                                  	; give the hard error. Otherwise, just return with carry set.
 14970                                  
 14971 0000202B E80A61                  	call	CheckShare		; test for sharer
 14972 0000202E 7509                    	JNZ	short RegenFail		; yep, fail this.
 14973                                  	
 14974                                  	;mov	ax,1100h
 14975 00002030 B80011                  	MOV	AX,MultNET<<8		; install check on multnet
 14976 00002033 CD2F                    	int     2Fh	; Multiplex - NETWORK REDIRECTOR - INSTALLATION CHECK
 14977                                  			; Return: AL = 00h  not installed, OK to install
 14978                                  			; 01h  not installed, not OK to install
 14979                                  			; FFh  installed
 14980 00002035 08C0                    	OR	AL,AL			; is it there?
 14981 00002037 740C                    	JZ	short RegenDead		; no, just fail the operation
 14982                                  RegenFail:
 14983                                  	; 17/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 14984                                  	;MOV	AX,[CS:USER_IN_AX]	; SS override
 14985 00002039 36A1[3A03]              	mov	ax,[SS:USER_IN_AX] ; MSDOS 6.0
 14986

 15212                                  ;**	BlastSFT - FIll SFT with Garbage
 15213                                  ; --------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15214                                  ;	BlastSFT is used when an SFT is no longer needed; it's called with
 15215                                  ;	various garbage values to put into the SFT.  I don't know why,
 15216                                  ;	presumably to help with debugging (jgl).  We clear the few fields
 15217                                  ;	necessary to show that the SFT is free after filling it.
 15218                                  ;
 15219                                  ;	ENTRY	(es:di) = address of SFT
 15220                                  ;		(al) = fill character
 15221                                  ;	EXIT	(ax) = -1
 15222                                  ;		'C' clear
 15223                                  ;	USES	AX, CX, Flags
 15224                                  
 15225                                  BlastSFT:
 15226                                  	; 21/01/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 15227                                  	;;;
 15228 00002124 E8DA29                  	call	SFT_FREE
 15229                                  	;;;
 15230 00002127 57                      	push	di
 15231                                  	;mov	cx,53 ; MSDOS 3.3
 15232                                  	;mov	cx,59 ; MSDOS 6.0
 15233 00002128 B93B00                  	mov	cx,SF_ENTRY.size
 15234 0000212B F3AA                    	rep	stosb
 15235 0000212D 5F                      	pop	di
 15236 0000212E 29C0                    	sub	ax,ax	; 0		; clear 'C'-----------------;
 15237 00002130 268905                  	mov	[es:di],ax
 15238                                  	;mov	[es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count],ax ; set ref count    ;
 15239                                  	;mov	[es:di+15h],ax
 15240 00002133 26894515                	mov	[es:di+sf_LRU],ax	; set lru		    ;
 15241 00002137 48                      	dec	ax	; -1					    ;
 15242                                  	;mov	[es:di+17h],ax ; 0FFFFh ; -1
 15243 00002138 26894517                	mov	[es:di+sf_OpenAge],ax	; set open age to -1	    ;
 15244                                  BlastSFT_retn:
 15245 0000213C C3                      	retn				; return with 'C' clear     ;
 15246                                  
 15247                                  ;Break	<CheckFCB - see if the SFT pointed to by the FCB is still OK>
 15248                                  ; --------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15249                                  ;
 15250                                  ;   CheckFCB - examine an FCB and its contents to see if it needs to be
 15251                                  ;   regenerated.
 15252                                  ;
 15253                                  ;   Inputs:	DS:SI point to FCB (not extended)
 15254                                  ;		AL is SFT index
 15255                                  ;   Outputs:	Carry Set - FCB needs to be regened
 15256                                  ;		Carry clear - FCB is OK. ES:DI point to SFT
 15257                                  ;   Registers modified: AX and BX
 15258                                  ;
 15259                                  ; --------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15260                                  
 15261                                  	; 09/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 15262                                  	; DOSCODE:59F0h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 15263                                  
 15264                                  	; 21/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 15265                                  	; DOSCODE:607Eh (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 15266                                  CheckFCB:
 15267                                  		
 15268                                  	; called from $fcb_open and sftfromfcb. SS already set up to DOSDATA
 15269                                  
 15270                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 15271                                  
 15272                                  	; LES	DI,[CS:SFTFCB]
 15273                                  
 15274                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 15275                                  	
 15276                                  	; SR;
 15277                                  	; We check if the given FCB is for a local file. If so, we return a 
 15278                                  	; bad SFT status forcing the caller to regenerate the SFT.
 15279                                  
 15280                                  	;test	byte [si+19h],0C0h
 15281 0000213D F64419C0                	test	byte [si+fcb_l_drive],FCBNETWORK|FCBSHARE|FCBDEVICE
 15282 00002141 7447                    	jz	short BadSFT		;Local file, return bad SFT
 15283 00002143 36C43E[4000]            	LES     DI,[SS:SFTFCB]		; SS override
 15284                                  
 15285                                  	; MSDOS 6.0 (& MSDOS 3.3)
 15286                                  	;cmp	[es:di+4],al
 15287 00002148 26384504                	CMP	[ES:DI+SFT.SFCount],AL
 15288 0000214C 723C                    	JC	short BadSFT
 15289                                  	;;mov	bl,53 ; MSDOS 3.3
 15290                                  	;mov	bl,59 ; MSDOS 6.0
 15291 0000214E B33B                    	MOV	BL,SF_ENTRY.size
 15292 00002150 F6E3                    	MUL	BL
 15293                                  	;lea	di,[di+6]
 15294 00002152 8D7D06                  	LEA	DI,[DI+SFT.SFTable]
 15295 00002155 01C7                    	ADD	DI,AX
 15296                                  	;MOV	AX,[CS:PROC_ID]	; MSDOS 3.3
 15297 00002157 36A1[3C03]              	mov	ax,[SS:PROC_ID] ; MSDOS 6.0  ; SS override
 15298                                  	;cmp	[es:di+31h],ax
 15299 0000215B 26394531                	CMP	[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_PID],AX
 15300 0000215F 7529                    	JNZ	short BadSFT		; must match process
 15301 00002161 26833D00                	cmp	word [es:di],0
 15302                                  	;CMP	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count],0
 15303 00002165 7423                    	JZ	short BadSFT		; must also be in use
 15304                                  	;mov	al,[si+19h]
 15305 00002167 8A4419                  	MOV	AL,[SI+fcb_l_drive]
 15306                                  	;test	al,80h
 15307 0000216A A880                    	test	AL,FCBSPECIAL		; a special FCB?
 15308 0000216C 7428                    	JZ	short CheckNoShare	; No. try local or device
 15309                                  
 15310                                  	; Since we are a special FCB, try NOT to use a bogus test instruction.
 15311                                  	; FCBSHARE is a superset of FCBNETWORK.
 15312                                  
 15313 0000216E 50                      	PUSH	AX
 15314                                  	;and	al,0C0h
 15315 0000216F 24C0                    	AND	AL,FCBMASK
 15316                                  	;cmp	al,0C0h
 15317 00002171 3CC0                    	CMP	AL,FCBSHARE		; net FCB?
 15318 00002173 58                      	POP	AX
 15319 00002174 7516                    	JNZ	short CheckNet		; no
 15320                                  					; yes
 15321                                  ;
 15322                                  ;----- In share support -----
 15323                                  ;
 15324                                  	;call	far [cs:JShare+(11*4)]
 15325 00002176 36FF1E[BC00]            	Call    far [ss:JShare+(11*4)] ; 11 = ShChk ; SS Override
 15326 0000217B 720D                    	JC	short BadSFT
 15327                                  
 15328                                  ; 21/01/2024
 15329                                  %if 0
 15330                                  	JMP	SHORT CheckD
 15331                                  ;
 15332                                  ;----- End in share support -----
 15333                                  ;
 15334                                  	; 09/11/2022
 15335                                  	; (There is not any procedure/sub
 15336                                  	;  which calls or jumps to CheckFirClus here)
 15337                                  	;;;
 15338                                  CheckFirClus:
 15339                                  	;cmp     bx,[es:di+0Bh]
 15340                                  	; 07/12/2022
 15341                                  	CMP	BX,[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_firclus]
 15342                                  	JNZ	short BadSFT
 15343                                  	;;;
 15344                                  %endif
 15345

 15463                                  ;Break	<SFTFromFCB - take a FCB and obtain a SFT from it>
 15464                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15465                                  ;
 15466                                  ;   SFTFromFCB - the workhorse of this compatability crap. Check to see if
 15467                                  ;	the SFT for the FCB is Good. If so, make ThisSFT point to it. If not
 15468                                  ;	good, get one from the cache and regenerate it. Overlay the LRU field
 15469                                  ;	with PID
 15470                                  ;
 15471                                  ;   Inputs:	DS:SI point to FCB
 15472                                  ;   Outputs:	ThisSFT point to appropriate SFT
 15473                                  ;		Carry clear -> OK ES:DI -> SFT
 15474                                  ;		Carry set -> error in ax
 15475                                  ;   Registers modified: ES,DI, AX
 15476                                  ;
 15477                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15478                                  
 15479                                  SFTFromFCB:
 15480                                  	; called from fcbio and $fcb_close. SS already set up to DOSDATA
 15481

 15490 000021B3 58                      	pop	ax

 15495 000021BE 7311                    	JNC	short Set_SFT		; no problems, just set thissft
 15496

 15595                                  ;	Revision history:
 15596                                  ;
 15597                                  ;		Created: ARR 4 April 1983
 15598                                  ;			 MZ  6 June  1983 completion of functions
 15599                                  ;			 MZ 15 Dec   1983 Brain damaged programs close FCBs multiple
 15600                                  ;				  times.  Change so successive closes work by
 15601                                  ;				  always returning OK.	Also, detect I/O to
 15602                                  ;				  already closed FCB and return EOF.
 15603                                  ;		 MZ 16 Jan   1984 More braindamage.  Need to separate info
 15604                                  ;				  out of sft into FCB for reconnection
