 15608                                  ; Defintions for FCBOp flags
 15609                                  
 15610                                  RANDOM	equ 2				; random operation
 15611                                  FCBREAD equ 4				; doing a read
 15612                                  BLOCK	equ 8				; doing a block I/O
 15613                                  
 15614                                  ;Break <GetRR - return the random record field in DX:AX>
 15615                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15616                                  ;
 15617                                  ;   GetRR - correctly load DX:AX with the random record field (3 or 4 bytes)
 15618                                  ;	from the FCB pointed to by DS:SI
 15619                                  ;
 15620                                  ;   Inputs:	DS:SI point to an FCB
 15621                                  ;		BX has record size
 15622                                  ;   Outputs:	DX:AX contain the contents of the random record field
 15623                                  ;   Registers modified: none
 15624                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15625                                  
 15626                                  GetRR:
 15627                                  	;mov	ax,[si+21h]
 15628 0000221D 8B4421                  	MOV	AX,[SI+SYS_FCB.RR]	; get low order part
 15629                                  	;mov	dx,[si+23h]
 15630 00002220 8B5423                  	MOV	DX,[SI+SYS_FCB.RR+2]	; get high order part
 15631 00002223 83FB40                  	CMP	BX,64			; ignore MSB of RR if recsiz > 64
 15632 00002226 7202                    	JB	short GetRRBye
 15633                                  GetExtent_bye:	; 21/01/2024
 15634 00002228 30F6                    	XOR	DH,DH
 15635                                  GetRRBye:
 15636 0000222A C3                      	retn
 15637                                  
 15638                                  ;Break <GetExtent - retrieve next location for sequential IO>
 15639                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15640                                  ;
 15641                                  ;   GetExtent - Construct the next record to perform I/O from the EXTENT and
 15642                                  ;	NR fields in the FCB.
 15643                                  ;
 15644                                  ;   Inputs:	DS:SI - point to FCB
 15645                                  ;   Outputs:	DX:AX contain the contents of the random record field
 15646                                  ;   Registers modified: none
 15647                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15648                                  
 15649                                  GetExtent:
 15650                                  	;mov	al,[si+20h]
 15651 0000222B 8A4420                  	MOV	AL,[SI+SYS_FCB.NR]	; get low order piece
 15652                                  	;mov	dx,[si+0Ch]
 15653 0000222E 8B540C                  	MOV	DX,[SI+SYS_FCB.EXTENT]	; get high order piece
 15654 00002231 D0E0                    	SHL	AL,1
 15655 00002233 D1EA                    	SHR	DX,1
 15656 00002235 D0D8                    	RCR	AL,1	; move low order bit of DL to high order of AH
 15657 00002237 88D4                    	MOV	AH,DL
 15658 00002239 88F2                    	MOV	DL,DH
 15659                                  	; 21/01/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 15660                                  	;XOR	DH,DH
 15661                                  	;retn
 15662 0000223B EBEB                    	jmp	short GetExtent_bye
 15663                                  
 15664                                  ;Break <SetExtent - update the extent/NR field>
 15665                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15666                                  ;
 15667                                  ;   SetExtent - change the position of an FCB by filling in the extent/NR
 15668                                  ;	fields
 15669                                  ;
 15670                                  ;   Inputs:	DS:SI point to FCB
 15671                                  ;		DX:AX is a record location in file
 15672                                  ;   Outputs:	Extent/NR fields are filled in
 15673                                  ;   Registers modified: CX
 15674                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15675                                  
 15676                                  SetExtent:
 15677 0000223D 50                      	push	ax
 15678 0000223E 52                      	push	dx
 15679 0000223F 89C1                    	MOV	CX,AX
 15680 00002241 247F                    	AND	AL,7FH			; next rec field
 15681                                  	;mov	[si+20h],al
 15682 00002243 884420                  	MOV	[SI+SYS_FCB.NR],AL
 15683 00002246 80E180                  	AND	CL,80H			; save upper bit
 15684 00002249 D1E1                    	SHL	CX,1
 15685 0000224B D1D2                    	RCL	DX,1			; move high bit of CX to low bit of DX
 15686 0000224D 88E8                    	MOV	AL,CH
 15687 0000224F 88D4                    	MOV	AH,DL
 15688                                  	;mov	[si+0Ch], ax
 15689 00002251 89440C                  	MOV	[SI+SYS_FCB.EXTENT],AX	; all done
 15690 00002254 5A                      	pop	dx
 15691 00002255 58                      	pop	ax
 15692 00002256 C3                      	retn
 15693                                  
 15694                                  ;Break <GetExtended - find FCB in potential extended fcb>
 15695                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15696                                  ;
 15697                                  ;   GetExtended - Make DS:SI point to FCB from DS:DX
 15698                                  ;
 15699                                  ;   Inputs:	DS:DX point to a possible extended FCB
 15700                                  ;   Outputs:	DS:SI point to the FCB part
 15701                                  ;		zeroflag set if not extended fcb
 15702                                  ;   Registers modified: SI
 15703                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 15704                                  
 15705                                  GetExtended:
 15706 00002257 89D6                    	MOV	SI,DX			; point to Something
 15707 00002259 803CFF                  	CMP	BYTE [SI],-1		; look for extention
 15708 0000225C 7503                    	JNZ	short GetBye		; not there
 15709 0000225E 83C607                  	ADD	SI,7			; point to FCB
 15710                                  GetBye:
 15711 00002261 39D6                    	CMP	SI,DX			; set condition codes
 15712                                  getextd_retn:
 15713 00002263 C3                      	retn

 15718                                  ;   GetRecSize - return in BX the record size from the FCB at DS:SI
 15719                                  ;
 15720                                  ;   Inputs:	DS:SI point to a non-extended FCB
 15721                                  ;   Outputs:	BX contains the record size

 15738 00002270 C3                      	retn

 16194                                  ;Break <$FCB_Open - open an old-style FCB>
 16195                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 16196                                  ;
 16197                                  ;   $FCB_Open - CPM compatability file open. The user has formatted an FCB
 16198                                  ;	for us and asked to have the rest filled in.
 16199                                  ;
 16200                                  ;   Inputs:	DS:DX point to an unopenned FCB
 16201                                  ;   Outputs:	AL indicates status 0 is ok FF is error
 16202                                  ;		FCB has the following fields filled in:
 16203                                  ;		    Time/Date Extent/NR Size
 16204                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 16205                                  
 16206                                  	; 23/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 16207                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:6362h

 16213

 16216                                  
 16217                                  ; The following is common code for Creation and openning of FCBs. AX is
 16218                                  ; either attributes (for create) or open mode (for open)... DS:DX points to
 16219                                  ; the FCB
 16220                                  
 16221                                  DoAccess:

 16414                                  
 16415                                  ; We must scan the set of FCB SFTs for one that appears to match the current
 16416                                  ; one.	We cheat and use CheckFCB to match the FCBs.
 16417                                  
 16418                                  ;hkn; 	SS override
 16419 000024E4 36C43E[4000]            	LES	DI,[SS:SFTFCB]		; get the pointer to head of the list
 16420                                  	;mov	ah,[es:di+4]
 16421 000024E9 268A6504                	MOV	AH,[ES:DI+SFT.SFCount]	; get number of SFTs to scan
 16422                                  OpenScan:
 16423                                  	;cmp	al,[si+18h]
 16424 000024ED 3A4418                  	CMP	AL,[SI+fcb_sfn]		; don't compare ourselves
 16425 000024F0 7407                    	JZ	short SkipCheck
 16426 000024F2 50                      	push	ax			; preserve count
 16427 000024F3 E847FC                  	call	CheckFCB		; do they match
 16428 000024F6 58                      	pop	ax			; get count back
 16429 000024F7 7309                    	JNC	short OpenFound		; found a match!
 16430                                  SkipCheck:
 16431 000024F9 FEC0                    	INC	AL			; advance to next FCB
 16432 000024FB 38E0                    	CMP	AL,AH			; table full?
 16433 000024FD 75EE                    	JNZ	short OpenScan		; no, go for more
 16434                                  OpenDone:
 16435 000024FF 30C0                    	xor	al,al			; return success
 16436 00002501 C3                      	retn
 16437                                  
 16438                                  ; The SFT at ES:DI is the one that is already in use for this FCB. We set the
 16439                                  ; FCB to use this one. We increment its ref count. We do NOT close it at all.
 16440                                  ; Consider:
 16441                                  ;
 16442                                  ;   open (foo)	delete (foo) open (bar)
 16443                                  ;
 16444                                  ; This causes us to recycle (potentially) bar through the same local SFT as
 16445                                  ; foo even though foo is no longer needed; this is due to the server closing
 16446                                  ; foo for us when we delete it. Unfortunately, we cannot see this closure.
 16447                                  ; If we were to CLOSE bar, the server would then close the only reference to
 16448                                  ; bar and subsequent I/O would be lost to the redirector.
 16449                                  ;
 16450                                  ; This gets solved by NOT closing the sft, but zeroing the ref count
 16451                                  ; (effectively freeing the SFT) and informing the sharer (if relevant) that
 16452                                  ; the SFT is no longer in use. Note that the SHARER MUST keep its ref counts
 16453                                  ; around. This will allow us to access the same file through multiple network
 16454                                  ; connections and NOT prematurely terminate when the ref count on one
 16455                                  ; connection goes to zero.
 16456                                  
 16457                                  OpenFound:
 16458                                  	;mov	[si+18h],al
 16459 00002502 884418                  	MOV	[SI+fcb_sfn],AL 	; assign with this
 16460 00002505 26FF05                  	inc	word [es:di]
 16461                                  	;INC	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count]
 16462                                  					; remember this new invocation
 16463                                  	; 23/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 16464                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 16465                                  	;;;
 16466 00002508 E82325                  	call	set_sftfcb_entry
 16467                                  	;;;
 16468                                  
 16469                                  	; 24/01/2024
 16470 0000250B 16                      	push	ss
 16471 0000250C 1F                      	pop	ds
 16472                                  	
 16473                                  	;MOV	AX,[SS:FCBLRU]		; update LRU counts
 16474 0000250D A1[1000]                	mov	ax,[FCBLRU] ; 24/01/2024
 16475                                  	;mov	[es:di+15h],ax
 16476 00002510 26894515                	MOV	[ES:DI+sf_LRU],AX
 16477                                  ;
 16478                                  ; We have an FCB sft that is now of no use. We release sharing info and then
 16479                                  ; blast it to prevent other reuse.
 16480                                  ;
 16481                                  	;push	ss
 16482                                  	;pop	ds
 16483                                  	
 16484 00002514 C43E[9E05]              	LES	DI,[THISSFT]
 16485 00002518 26FF0D                  	dec	word [es:di]
 16486                                  	;DEC	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count]
 16487                                  					; free the newly allocated SFT
 16488 0000251B E8525C                  	call	ShareEnd
 16489 0000251E B043                    	MOV	AL,'C'	 ; 43h
 16490 00002520 E801FC                  	call	BlastSFT
 16491 00002523 EBDA                    	JMP	short OpenDone

 16517                                  ; SEARCH.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991

 16523

 16526                                  
 16527                                  ;**	Search.asm
 16528                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 16529                                  ;	Directory search system calls.
 16530                                  ;	These will be passed direct text of the pathname from the user. 
 16531                                  ;	They will need to be passed through the macro expander prior to
 16532                                  ;	being sent through the low-level stuff. 
 16533                                  ;	I/O specs are defined in DISPATCH. The system calls are:
 16534                                  ;
 16535                                  ;	$Dir_Search_First	  written
 16536                                  ;	$Dir_Search_Next	  written
 16537                                  ;	$Find_First	  written
 16538                                  ;	$Find_Next		  written
 16539                                  ;	PackName		  written
 16540                                  ;
 16541                                  ;	Modification history:
 16542                                  ;
 16543                                  ;	  Created: ARR 4 April 1983
 16544                                  
 16545                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 16546                                  ; Procedure Name : $DIR_SEARCH_FIRST
 16547                                  ;
 16548                                  ; Inputs:
 16549                                  ;	DS:DX Points to unopenned FCB
 16550                                  ; Function:
 16551                                  ;	Directory is searched for first matching entry and the directory
 16552                                  ;	entry is loaded at the disk transfer address
 16553                                  ; Returns:
 16554                                  ;	AL = -1 if no entries matched, otherwise 0
 16555                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 16556                                  
 16557                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3) - Offset 2B88h
 16558                                  	
 16559                                  	; 24/01/2024
 16560                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:5DCBh
 16561                                  	; MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:5DDFh
 16562                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:647Bh
 16563                                  	; Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:61E5h
 16564                                  
 16565                                  _$DIR_SEARCH_FIRST:
 16566 00002535 368916[A605]            	MOV	[SS:THISFCB],DX
 16567 0000253A 368C1E[A805]            	MOV	[SS:THISFCB+2],DS
 16568 0000253F 89D6                    	MOV	SI,DX
 16569 00002541 803CFF                  	CMP	BYTE [SI],0FFH
 16570 00002544 7503                    	JNZ	short NORMFCB4
 16571 00002546 83C607                  	ADD	SI,7			; Point to drive select byte
 16572                                  NORMFCB4:
 16573 00002549 FF34                    	push	word [SI]		; Save original drive byte for later
 16574                                  
 16575 0000254B 16                      	push	ss
 16576 0000254C 07                      	pop	es			; get es to address DOSGroup
 16577                                  
 16578 0000254D BF[BE03]                	MOV	DI,OPENBUF		; appropriate buffer
 16579 00002550 E8B953                  	call	TransFCB		; convert the FCB, set SATTRIB EXTFCB
 16580 00002553 7304                    	JNC	short SearchIt		; no error, go and look
 16581 00002555 5B                      	pop	bx			; Clean stack
 16582                                  
 16583                                  ; Error code is in AX
 16584                                  
 16585                                  	; 09/11/2022
 16586                                  dcf_errj:
 16587 00002556 E936E1                  	jmp	FCB_RET_ERR		; error
 16588                                  
 16589                                  SearchIt:
 16590 00002559 16                      	push	ss
 16591 0000255A 1F                      	pop	ds			; get ready for search
 16592                                  	;push	word [DMAADD]
 16593                                  	;push	word [DMAADD+2]
 16594                                  	; 24/01/2024
 16595 0000255B C43E[2C03]              	les	di,[DMAADD]
 16596 0000255F 57                      	push	di
 16597 00002560 06                      	push	es
 16598 00002561 C706[2C03][BE04]        	MOV	WORD [DMAADD],SEARCHBUF
 16599 00002567 8C1E[2E03]              	MOV	WORD [DMAADD+2],DS
 16600                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 16601                                  	;call	DOS_SEARCH_FIRST
 16602                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 16603 0000256B E8B70F                  	call	GET_FAST_SEARCH		; search
 16604 0000256E 8F06[2E03]              	pop	word [DMAADD+2]
 16605 00002572 8F06[2C03]              	pop	word [DMAADD]
 16606 00002576 735A                    	JNC	short SearchSet		; no error, transfer info
 16607 00002578 5B                      	pop	bx			; Clean stack
 16608                                  
 16609                                  ; Error code is in AX
 16610                                  
 16611                                  	; 09/11/2022
 16612                                  	;jmp	FCB_RET_ERR
 16613 00002579 EBDB                    	jmp	short dcf_errj
 16614                                  
 16615                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 16616                                  ;
 16617                                  ; Procedure Name : $DIR_SEARCH_NEXT
 16618                                  ;
 16619                                  ; Inputs:
 16620                                  ;	DS:DX points to unopenned FCB returned by $DIR_SEARCH_FIRST
 16621                                  ; Function:
 16622                                  ;	Directory is searched for the next matching entry and the directory
 16623                                  ;	entry is loaded at the disk transfer address
 16624                                  ; Returns:
 16625                                  ;	AL = -1 if no entries matched, otherwise 0
 16626                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 16627                                  
 16628                                  	; 24/01/2024
 16629                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:5E5Fh
 16630                                  	; MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:5E73h
 16631                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:6517h
 16632                                  	; Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:6273h
 16633                                  
 16634                                  _$DIR_SEARCH_NEXT:
 16635 0000257B 368916[A605]            	MOV	[SS:THISFCB],DX
 16636 00002580 368C1E[A805]            	MOV	[SS:THISFCB+2],DS
 16637                                  	; 24/01/2024 (PCDOS 7.1)
 16638                                  	;MOV	byte [SS:SATTRIB],0
 16639                                  	;MOV	byte [SS:EXTFCB],0
 16640 00002585 B000                    	mov	al,0
 16641 00002587 36A2[6D05]              	mov	[SS:SATTRIB],al ; 0
 16642 0000258B 36A2[6D05]              	mov	[SS:SATTRIB],al ; 0
 16643                                  
 16644 0000258F 16                      	push	ss
 16645 00002590 07                      	pop	es
 16646                                  
 16647 00002591 BF[BE04]                	MOV	DI,SEARCHBUF
 16648                                  
 16649 00002594 89D6                    	MOV	SI,DX
 16650 00002596 803CFF                  	CMP	BYTE [SI],0FFh
 16651 00002599 750D                    	JNZ	short NORMFCB6
 16652 0000259B 83C606                  	ADD	SI,6
 16653 0000259E AC                      	LODSB
 16654                                  
 16655 0000259F 36A2[6D05]              	MOV	[SS:SATTRIB],AL
 16656 000025A3 36FE0E[6C05]            	DEC	byte [SS:EXTFCB]
 16657                                  NORMFCB6:
 16658 000025A8 AC                      	LODSB				; Get original user drive byte
 16659 000025A9 50                      	push	ax			; Put it on stack
 16660 000025AA 8A4414                  	MOV	AL,[SI+20]		; Get correct search contin drive byte
 16661 000025AD AA                      	STOSB				; Put in correct place
 16662 000025AE B90A00                  	MOV	CX,20/2
 16663 000025B1 F3A5                    	REP	MOVSW			; Transfer in rest of search contin info
 16664                                  
 16665 000025B3 16                      	push	ss
 16666 000025B4 1F                      	pop	ds
 16667                                  
 16668                                  	;push	word [DMAADD]
 16669                                  	;push	word [DMAADD+2]
 16670                                  	; 24/01/2024
 16671 000025B5 C43E[2C03]              	les	di,[DMAADD]
 16672 000025B9 57                      	push	di
 16673 000025BA 06                      	push	es
 16674 000025BB C706[2C03][BE04]        	MOV	WORD [DMAADD],SEARCHBUF
 16675 000025C1 8C1E[2E03]              	MOV	WORD [DMAADD+2],DS
 16676 000025C5 E85D10                  	call	DOS_SEARCH_NEXT 	; Find it
 16677 000025C8 8F06[2E03]              	pop	word [DMAADD+2]
 16678 000025CC 8F06[2C03]              	pop	word [DMAADD]
 16679 000025D0 724A                    	JC	short SearchNoMore
 16680                                  	; 24/01/2024
 16681                                  	;JMP	SearchSet		; Ok set return
 16682                                  
 16683                                  ;;;	; 24/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 16684                                  
 16685                                  ; The search was successful (or the search-next). We store the information
 16686                                  ; into the user's FCB for continuation.
 16687                                  
 16688                                  SearchSet:
 16689 000025D2 BE[BE04]                	MOV	SI,SEARCHBUF
 16690 000025D5 C43E[A605]              	LES	DI,[THISFCB]		; point to the FCB
 16691 000025D9 F606[6C05]FF            	TEST	byte [EXTFCB],0FFh
 16692 000025DE 7403                    	JZ	short NORMFCB1
 16693 000025E0 83C707                  	ADD	DI,7			; Point past the extension
 16694                                  NORMFCB1:
 16695 000025E3 5B                      	pop	bx			; Get original drive byte
 16696 000025E4 08DB                    	OR	BL,BL
 16697 000025E6 7506                    	JNZ	short SearchDrv
 16698 000025E8 8A1E[3603]              	MOV	BL,[CURDRV]
 16699 000025EC FEC3                    	INC	BL
 16700                                  SearchDrv:
 16701 000025EE AC                      	LODSB				; Get correct search contin drive byte
 16702 000025EF 86C3                    	XCHG	AL,BL			; Search byte to BL, user byte to AL
 16703 000025F1 47                      	INC	DI
 16704                                  	;STOSB				; Store the correct "user" drive byte
 16705                                  					;  at the start of the search info
 16706 000025F2 B90A00                  	MOV	CX,20/2
 16707 000025F5 F3A5                    	REP	MOVSW			; Rest of search cont info, SI -> entry
 16708 000025F7 86C3                    	XCHG	AL,BL			; User drive byte back to BL, search
 16709                                  					;   byte to AL
 16710 000025F9 AA                      	STOSB				; Search contin drive byte at end of
 16711                                  					;   contin info
 16712 000025FA C43E[2C03]              	LES	DI,[DMAADD]
 16713 000025FE F606[6C05]FF            	TEST	byte [EXTFCB],0FFh
 16714 00002603 740D                    	JZ	short NORMFCB2
 16715 00002605 B0FF                    	MOV	AL,0FFh
 16716 00002607 AA                      	STOSB

 16888                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 16889                                  ;**	PackName - Convert file names from FCB to ASCIZ format.
 16890                                  ;
 16891                                  ;	PackName transfers a file name from DS:SI to ES:DI and converts it to
 16892                                  ;	the ASCIZ format.
 16893                                  ;
 16894                                  ;	ENTRY	(DS:SI) = 11 character FCB or dir entry name
 16895                                  ;		(ES:DI) = destination area (13 bytes)
 16896                                  ;	EXIT	(ds:SI) and (es:DI) advanced
 16897                                  ;	USES	al, CX, SI, DI, Flags  (BUGBUG - not verified - jgl)
 16898                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 16899                                  
 16900                                  	; 25/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 16901                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:6627h
 16902                                  
 16903                                  PackName:
 16904                                  ;	Move over 8 characters to cover the name component, then trim it's
 16905                                  ;	trailing blanks.
 16906                                  
 16907                                  	;MOV	CX,8			; Pack the name
 16908                                  	;REP	MOVSB			; Move all of it
 16909                                  	; 25/01/2024
 16910 000026B5 B90400                  	mov	cx,4
 16911 000026B8 F3A5                    	rep	movsw
 16912                                  main_kill_tail:
 16913 000026BA 26807DFF20              	CMP	BYTE [ES:DI-1]," "
 16914 000026BF 7507                    	JNZ	short find_check_dot
 16915 000026C1 4F                      	DEC	DI			; Back up over trailing space
 16916 000026C2 41                      	INC	CX
 16917 000026C3 83F908                  	CMP	CX,8
 16918 000026C6 72F2                    	JB	short main_kill_tail
 16919                                  find_check_dot:
 16920                                  	;CMP	WORD [SI],(" " << 8) | " "
 16921 000026C8 813C2020                	cmp     word [si],2020h 
 16922 000026CC 7506                    	JNZ	short got_ext 		; Some chars in extension
 16923 000026CE 807C0220                	CMP	BYTE [SI+2]," "
 16924 000026D2 740F                    	JZ	short find_done		; No extension
 16925                                  got_ext:
 16926 000026D4 B02E                    	MOV	AL,"."	; 2Eh
 16927 000026D6 AA                      	STOSB
 16928                                  	;MOV	CX,3
 16929                                  	;; 18/12/2022
 16930                                  	;;mov	cl,3
 16931                                  	;;REP	MOVSB
 16932                                  	;movsb
 16933                                  	;movsb
 16934                                  	;movsb
 16935                                  	; 25/01/2024
 16936 000026D7 A5                      	movsw
 16937 000026D8 A4                      	movsb
 16938                                  ext_kill_tail:
 16939 000026D9 26807DFF20              	CMP	BYTE [ES:DI-1]," "
 16940 000026DE 7503                    	JNZ	short find_done
 16941 000026E0 4F                      	DEC	DI			; Back up over trailing space
 16942 000026E1 EBF6                    	JMP	short ext_kill_tail
 16943                                  find_done:

 16974                                  ;**	Directory related system calls. These will be passed direct text of the
 16975                                  ;	pathname from the user. They will need to be passed through the macro
 16976                                  ;	expander prior to being sent through the low-level stuff. I/O specs are
 16977                                  ;	defined in DISPATCH. The system calls are:
 16978                                  ;
 16979                                  ;	$CURRENT_DIR  Written
 16980                                  ;	$RMDIR	  Written
 16981                                  ;	$CHDIR	  Written
 16982                                  ;	$MKDIR	  Written

 16984                                  ;
 16985                                  ;	Modification history:
 16986                                  ;
 16987                                  ;	    Created: ARR 4 April 1983
 16988                                  ;		 MZ 10 May 1983     CurrentDir implemented
 16989                                  ;		 MZ 11 May 1983     RmDir, ChDir, MkDir implemented
 16990                                  ;		 EE 19 Oct 1983     RmDir no longer allows you to delete a
 16991                                  ;				    current directory.
 16992                                  ;		 MZ 19 Jan 1983     Brain damaged applications rely on success

 17013                                  ;	    ; current directory.
 17014                                  ;   Error returns:
 17015                                  ;	    AX = error_invalid_drive
 17016                                  ;
 17017                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------

 17146                                  ;BREAK <$RmDir -- Remove a directory>
 17147                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17148                                  ;
 17149                                  ; Procedure Name : $RmDir
 17150                                  ;
 17151                                  ; Inputs:
 17152                                  ;	DS:DX Points to asciz name
 17153                                  ; Function:
 17154                                  ;	Delete directory if empty
 17155                                  ; Returns:
 17156                                  ;	STD XENIX Return
 17157                                  ;	AX = error_path_not_found If path bad
 17158                                  ;	AX = error_access_denied If
 17159                                  ;		Directory not empty
 17160                                  ;		Path not directory
 17161                                  ;		Root directory specified
 17162                                  ;		Directory malformed (. and .. not first two entries)
 17163                                  ;		User tries to delete a current directory
 17164                                  ;	AX = error_current_directory
 17165                                  ;
 17166                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17167                                  
 17168                                  	; 10/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 17169                                  	; DOSCODE:6015h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 17170                                  
 17171                                  	; 25/01/2025 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 17172                                  	; DOSCODE:66C8h (PCDOS 7.1, IBMDOS.COM)
 17173                                  
 17174                                  _$RMDIR:
 17175 0000274B 52                      	push	dx			; Save ptr to name
 17176 0000274C 1E                      	push	ds
 17177 0000274D 89D6                    	mov	si,dx			; Load ptr into si
 17178 0000274F BF[BE03]                	mov	di,OPENBUF		; di = ptr to buf for trans name
 17179 00002752 57                      	push	di
 17180 00002753 E82452                  	call	TransPathNoSet		; Translate the name
 17181 00002756 5F                      	pop	di			; di = ptr to buf for trans name
 17182 00002757 7306                    	jnc	short rmlset		; If transpath succeeded, continue
 17183 00002759 1F                      	pop	ds
 17184 0000275A 5A                      	pop	dx			; Restore the name
 17185                                  	;mov	al,3
 17186 0000275B B003                    	mov	al,error_path_not_found ; Otherwise, return an error
 17187                                  	; 16/12/2022
 17188                                  rmdir_errj: ; 10/08/2018
 17189                                  chdir_errj:
 17190 0000275D EB9F                    	jmp	short curdir_errj
 17191                                  	;jmp	SYS_RET_ERR
 17192                                  rmlset:
 17193 0000275F 36803E[7A05]FF          	CMP	byte [ss:CMETA],-1	;   if (cMeta >= 0)
 17194 00002765 7518                    	Jnz	short rmerr		;	return (-1);
 17195 00002767 16                      	push	ss

 17200 0000276E 7215                    	jc	short rmcont		; If error, exit loop & cont normally

 17243                                  ; DOSCODE:6065h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 17244                                  
 17245                                  ;BREAK <$ChDir -- Change current directory on a drive>
 17246                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17247                                  ;
 17248                                  ; $ChDir - Top-level change directory system call.  This call is responsible
 17249                                  ; for setting up the CDS for the specified drive appropriately.  There are
 17250                                  ; several cases to consider:
 17251                                  ;
 17252                                  ;   o	Local, simple CDS.  In this case, we take the input path and convert
 17253                                  ;	it into a WFP.	We verify the existance of this directory and then
 17254                                  ;	copy the WFP into the CDS and set up the ID field to point to the
 17255                                  ;	directory cluster.
 17256                                  ;   o	Net CDS.  We form the path from the root (including network prefix)
 17257                                  ;	and verify its existance (via DOS_Chdir).  If successful, we copy the
 17258                                  ;	WFP back into the CDS.
 17259                                  ;   o	SUBST'ed CDS.  This is no different than the local, simple CDS.
 17260                                  ;   o	JOIN'ed CDS.  This is trouble as there are two CDS's at work.  If we
 17261                                  ;	call TransPath, we will get the PHYSICAL CDS that the path refers to
 17262                                  ;	and the PHYSICAL WFP that the input path refers to.  This is perfectly
 17263                                  ;	good for the validation but not for currency.  We call TransPathNoSet
 17264                                  ;	to process the path but to return the logical CDS and the logical
 17265                                  ;	path.  We then copy the logical path into the logical CDS.
 17266                                  ;
 17267                                  ; Inputs:
 17268                                  ;	DS:DX Points to asciz name
 17269                                  ; Returns:
 17270                                  ;	STD XENIX Return
 17271                                  ;	AX = chdir_path_not_found if error
 17272                                  ;
 17273                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17274                                  	
 17275                                  	; 25/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 17276                                  	
 17277                                  _$CHDIR:
 17278                                  	; 25/01/2024
 17279                                  	;;;
 17280 00002798 36C606[7D12]43          	mov	byte [ss:PATHNAMELEN],67 ; Retro DOS v5.0
 17281                                  	;mov	word [ss:PATHNAMELEN],67 ; DIRSTRLEN = 67
 17282                                  	;;;
 17283 0000279E BF[BE03]                	MOV	DI,OPENBUF		; spot for translated name
 17284 000027A1 89D6                    	MOV	SI,DX			; get source
 17285 000027A3 E8C851                  	call	TransPath		; go munge the path and get real CDS
 17286 000027A6 7304                    	JNC	short ChDirCrack	; no errors, try path
 17287                                  ChDirErrP:
 17288                                  	;mov	al,3
 17289 000027A8 B003                    	MOV	AL,error_path_not_found
 17290                                  ChDirErr:
 17291                                  	;jmp	SYS_RET_ERR 	; oops!
 17292                                  	; 10/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 17293 000027AA EBB1                    	jmp	short chdir_errj
 17294                                  
 17295                                  ChDirCrack:

 17297 000027B1 75F5                    	JNZ	short ChDirErrP

 17299                                  ; We cannot do a ChDir (yet) on a raw CDS. This is treated as a path not
 17300                                  ; found.
 17301

 17312                                  ;
 17313                                  ; Get back CDS to see if a join as seen. Set the currency pointer (only if
 17314                                  ; not network). If one was seen, all we need to do is copy in the text
 17315                                  ;
 17316                                  	; 25/01/2024 - Retro DOS V5.0
 17317 000027C1 FF36[E30A]              	push	word [DIRSTART_HW] ; *
 17318                                  
 17319 000027C5 C43E[A205]              	LES	DI,[THISCDS]
 17320                                  	;test	word [es:di+43h],2000h
 17321                                  	; 17/12/2022

 17323                                  	;TEST	word [ES:DI+curdir.flags],curdir_splice
 17324                                  
 17325                                  	; 25/01/2024 (PCDOS 7.1)
 17326                                  	;mov	dx,[DIRSTART_HW]
 17327                                  
 17328 000027CE 742B                    	JZ	short GotCDS
 17329                                  
 17330                                  ; The CDS was joined. Let's go back and grab the logical CDS.
 17331                                  
 17332 000027D0 06                      	push	es	
 17333 000027D1 57                      	push	di
 17334                                  	;push	dx ; 25/01/2024 (PCDOS 7.1)

 17336 000027D3 E8A1DC                  	call	Get_User_Stack		; get original text
 17337

 17339 000027D6 8B7C06                  	MOV	DI,[SI+user_env.user_DX]
 17340                                  	;mov	ds,[si+0Eh]
 17341 000027D9 8E5C0E                  	MOV	DS,[SI+user_env.user_DS]
 17342                                  	
 17343 000027DC BE[BE03]                	MOV	SI,OPENBUF		; spot for translated name
 17344 000027DF 87F7                    	XCHG	SI,DI
 17345 000027E1 30C0                    	XOR	AL,AL			; do no splicing
 17346 000027E3 57                      	push	di
 17347 000027E4 E89351                  	call	TransPathNoSet		; Munge path
 17348 000027E7 5E                      	pop	si

 17351

 17355                                  ;SkipErr:
 17356                                  ;ENDIF

 17358                                  	;mov	word [es:di+49h],-1

 17371

 17537                                  ;============================================================================
 17538                                  ; IOCTL.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 17539                                  ;============================================================================
 17540                                  ; 07/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 17541                                  ; 17/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 17542                                  
 17543                                  ;**	IOCTL system call.
 17544                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17545                                  ;	$IOCTL
 17546                                  ;
 17547                                  ;	  Revision history:
 17548                                  ;
 17549                                  ;		Created: ARR 4 April 1983
 17550                                  ;
 17551                                  ;		GenericIOCTL added:		KGS	22 April 1985
 17552                                  ;
 17553                                  ;		A000	version 4.00	Jan. 1988
 17554                                  ;
 17555                                  ;		Used jump table to dispatch IOCTL functions. HKN 3/12/90
 17556                                  ;
 17557                                  
 17558                                  ;BREAK <IOCTL - munge on a handle to do device specific stuff>
 17559                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17560                                  ;
 17561                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 17562                                  ;	    MOV     BX, Handle
 17563                                  ;	    MOV     DX, Data
 17564                                  ;
 17565                                  ;	(or LDS     DX,BUF
 17566                                  ;	    MOV     CX,COUNT)
 17567                                  ;
 17568                                  ;	    MOV     AH, Ioctl
 17569                                  ;	    MOV     AL, Request
 17570                                  ;	    INT     21h
 17571                                  ;
 17572                                  ;   AH = 0  Return a combination of low byte of sf_flags and device driver
 17573                                  ;	    attribute word in DX, handle in BX:
 17574                                  ;	    DH = high word of device driver attributes
 17575                                  ;	    DL = low byte of sf_flags
 17576                                  ;	 1  Set the bits contained in DX to sf_flags.  DH MUST be 0.  Handle
 17577                                  ;	    in BX.
 17578                                  ;	 2  Read CX bytes from the device control channel for handle in BX
 17579                                  ;	    into DS:DX.  Return number read in AX.
 17580                                  ;	 3  Write CX bytes to the device control channel for handle in BX from
 17581                                  ;	    DS:DX.  Return bytes written in AX.
 17582                                  ;	 4  Read CX bytes from the device control channel for drive in BX
 17583                                  ;	    into DS:DX.  Return number read in AX.
 17584                                  ;	 5  Write CX bytes to the device control channel for drive in BX from
 17585                                  ;	    DS:DX.  Return bytes written in AX.
 17586                                  ;	 6  Return input status of handle in BX. If a read will go to the
 17587                                  ;	    device, AL = 0FFh, otherwise 0.
 17588                                  ;	 7  Return output status of handle in BX. If a write will go to the
 17589                                  ;	    device, AL = 0FFh, otherwise 0.
 17590                                  ;	 8  Given a drive in BX, return 1 if the device contains non-
 17591                                  ;	    removable media, 0 otherwise.
 17592                                  ;	 9  Return the contents of the device attribute word in DX for the
 17593                                  ;	    drive in BX.  0200h is the bit for shared.	1000h is the bit for
 17594                                  ;	    network. 8000h is the bit for local use.
 17595                                  ;	 A  Return 8000h if the handle in BX is for the network or not.
 17596                                  ;	 B  Change the retry delay and the retry count for the system. BX is
 17597                                  ;	    the count and CX is the delay.
 17598                                  ;
 17599                                  ;   Error returns:
 17600                                  ;	    AX = error_invalid_handle
 17601                                  ;	       = error_invalid_function
 17602                                  ;	       = error_invalid_data
 17603                                  ;
 17604                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17605                                  ;
 17606                                  ;   This is the documentation copied from DOS 4.0 it is much better
 17607                                  ;   than the above
 17608                                  ;
 17609                                  ;	There are several basic forms of IOCTL calls:
 17610                                  ;
 17611                                  ;
 17612                                  ;	** Get/Set device information:	**
 17613                                  ;
 17614                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = function code
 17615                                  ;		  0 - Get device information
 17616                                  ;		  1 - Set device information
 17617                                  ;		(BX) = file handle
 17618                                  ;		(DX) = info for "Set Device Information"
 17619                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error
 17620                                  ;		  (AX) = error code
 17621                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 17622                                  ;		  (DX) = info for "Get Device Information"
 17623                                  ;	USES	ALL
 17624                                  ;
 17625                                  ;
 17626                                  ;	**  Read/Write Control Data From/To Handle  **
 17627                                  ;
 17628                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = function code
 17629                                  ;		  2 - Read device control info
 17630                                  ;		  3 - Write device control info
 17631                                  ;		(BX) = file handle
 17632                                  ;		(CX) = transfer count
 17633                                  ;		(DS:DX) = address for data
 17634                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error
 17635                                  ;		  (AX) = error code
 17636                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 17637                                  ;		  (AX) = count of bytes transfered
 17638                                  ;	USES	ALL
 17639                                  ;
 17640                                  ;
 17641                                  ;	**  Read/Write Control Data From/To Block Device  **
 17642                                  ;
 17643                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = function code
 17644                                  ;		  4 - Read device control info
 17645                                  ;		  5 - Write device control info
 17646                                  ;		(BL) = Drive number (0=default, 1='A', 2='B', etc)
 17647                                  ;		(CX) = transfer count
 17648                                  ;		(DS:DX) = address for data
 17649                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error
 17650                                  ;		  (AX) = error code
 17651                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 17652                                  ;		  (AX) = count of bytes transfered
 17653                                  ;	USES	ALL
 17654                                  ;
 17655                                  ;
 17656                                  ;	**  Get Input/Output Status  **
 17657                                  ;
 17658                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = function code
 17659                                  ;		  6 - Get Input status
 17660                                  ;		  7 - Get Output Status
 17661                                  ;		(BX) = file handle
 17662                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error
 17663                                  ;		  (AX) = error code
 17664                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 17665                                  ;		  (AL) = 00 if not ready
 17666                                  ;		  (AL) = FF if ready
 17667                                  ;	USES	ALL
 17668                                  ;
 17669                                  ;
 17670                                  ;	**  Get Drive Information  **
 17671                                  ;
 17672                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = function code
 17673                                  ;		  8 - Check for removable media
 17674                                  ;		  9 - Get device attributes
 17675                                  ;		(BL) = Drive number (0=default, 1='A', 2='B', etc)
 17676                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error
 17677                                  ;		  (AX) = error code
 17678                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 17679                                  ;		  (AX) = 0/1 media is removable/fixed (func. 8)
 17680                                  ;		  (DX) = device attribute word (func. 9)
 17681                                  ;	USES	ALL
 17682                                  ;
 17683                                  ;
 17684                                  ;	**  Get Redirected bit	**
 17685                                  ;
 17686                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = function code
 17687                                  ;		  0Ah - Network stuff
 17688                                  ;		(BX) = file handle
 17689                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error
 17690                                  ;		  (AX) = error code
 17691                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 17692                                  ;		  (DX) = SFT flags word, 8000h set if network file
 17693                                  ;	USES	ALL
 17694                                  ;
 17695                                  ;
 17696                                  ;	**  Change sharer retry parameters  **
 17697                                  ;
 17698                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = function code
 17699                                  ;		  0Bh - Set retry parameters
 17700                                  ;		(CX) = retry loop count
 17701                                  ;		(DX) = number of retries
 17702                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error
 17703                                  ;		  (AX) = error code
 17704                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 17705                                  ;	USES	ALL
 17706                                  ;
 17707                                  ;
 17708                                  ;   =================================================================
 17709                                  ;
 17710                                  ;	**  New Standard Control  **
 17711                                  ;
 17712                                  ;	ALL NEW IOCTL FACILITIES SHOULD USE THIS FORM.	THE OTHER
 17713                                  ;	FORMS ARE OBSOLETE.
 17714                                  ;
 17715                                  ;   =================================================================
 17716                                  ;
 17717                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = function code
 17718                                  ;		  0Ch - Control Function subcode
 17719                                  ;		(BX) = File Handle
 17720                                  ;		(CH) = Category Indicator
 17721                                  ;		(CL) = Function within category
 17722                                  ;		(DS:DX) = address for data, if any
 17723                                  ;		(SI) = Passed to device as argument, use depends upon function
 17724                                  ;		(DI) = Passed to device as argument, use depends upon function
 17725                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error
 17726                                  ;		  (AX) = error code
 17727                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 17728                                  ;		  (SI) = Return value, meaning is function dependent
 17729                                  ;		  (DI) = Return value, meaning is function dependent
 17730                                  ;		  (DS:DX) = Return address, use is function dependent
 17731                                  ;	USES	ALL
 17732                                  ;
 17733                                  ;    ============== Generic IOCTL Definitions for DOS 3.2 ============
 17734                                  ;     (See inc\ioctl.inc for more info)
 17735                                  ;
 17736                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = function code
 17737                                  ;		  0Dh - Control Function subcode
 17738                                  ;		(BL) = Drive Number (0 = Default, 1= 'A')
 17739                                  ;		(CH) = Category Indicator
 17740                                  ;		(CL) = Function within category
 17741                                  ;		(DS:DX) = address for data, if any
 17742                                  ;		(SI) = Passed to device as argument, use depends upon function
 17743                                  ;		(DI) = Passed to device as argument, use depends upon function
 17744                                  ;
 17745                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error
 17746                                  ;		  (AX) = error code
 17747                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 17748                                  ;		  (DS:DX) = Return address, use is function dependent
 17749                                  ;	USES	ALL
 17750                                  ;
 17751                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17752

 17847                                  					;   device bit!! He can muck with the

 17955                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17956                                  ;
 17957                                  ; Generic IOCTL entry point. AL = C, D, 10h, 11h
 17958                                  ;
 17959                                  ;	here we invoke the Generic IOCTL using the IOCTL_Req structure.
 17960                                  ;	SI:DX -> Users Device Parameter Table
 17961                                  ;	IOCALL -> IOCTL_Req structure
 17962                                  ;
 17963                                  ; 	If on entry AL >= IOCTL_QUERY_HANDLE the function is a
 17964                                  ;	QueryIOCtlSupport call ELSE it's a standard generic IOCtl
 17965                                  ;	call.
 17966                                  ;
 17967                                  ; BUGBUG: Don't push anything on the stack between GENERIOCTL: and 
 17968                                  ;         the call to Check_If_Net because Check_If_Net gets our
 17969                                  ;         return address off the stack if the drive is invalid.
 17970                                  ;
 17971                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17972                                  
 17973                                  	; 29/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 17974                                  
 17975                                  query_handle_support:	; Entry point for handles
 17976                                  GENERICIOCTLHANDLE:
 17977 00002926 E84A4B                  	call	SFFromHandle		; Get SFT for device.
 17978 00002929 727E                    	jc	short ioctl_bad_handlej
 17979                                  
 17980                                  	;test	word [es:di+5],8000h
 17981                                  	;TEST	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_flags],sf_isnet	; M031;
 17982                                  	;test	byte [es:di+6],80h
 17983 0000292B 26F6450680              	test	byte [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_flags+1],(sf_isnet>>8)
 17984 00002930 757A                    	jnz	short ioctl_bad_fun	; Cannot do this over net.
 17985                                  
 17986                                  	;mov	byte [EXTERR_LOCUS],errLOC_SerDev ; 4
 17987                                  	; 29/01/2024
 17988                                  	;;;
 17989 00002932 E8B4E9                  	call	set_exerr_locus_ser ; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 17990                                  	;;;
 17991                                  
 17992                                  	;les	di,[es:di+7]
 17993 00002935 26C47D07                	les	di,[es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_devptr]	; Get pointer to device.
 17994                                  	;;;
 17995                                  	; 29/01/2024 - PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 17996 00002939 C606[B103]FF            	mov	byte [IOCTL_drvnum],0FFh	; invalidate drive number
 17997                                  					; (for extended -lock/unlock- functions)
 17998                                  	;;;
 17999 0000293E EB16                    	jmp	short Do_GenIOCTL
 18000                                  
 18001                                  	; 29/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 18002                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:68DAh
 18003                                  	; (WINME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:6612h)
 18004                                  
 18005                                  query_device_support:	; Entry point for devices:
 18006                                  GENERICIOCTL:
 18007                                  	;mov	byte [EXTERR_LOCUS],errLOC_Disk ; 2
 18008                                  	; 29/01/2024
 18009                                  	;;;

 18011 00002943 80FD48                  	cmp	ch,48h			; category (extended, disk lock/unlock)
 18012 00002946 7405                    	je      short GenIOCTL_chk_net	; extended (MSDOS/PCDOS 7)
 18013                                  	;;;
 18014                                  
 18015 00002948 80FD08                  	cmp	ch,IOC_DC ; 8		; Only disk devices are allowed to use
 18016 0000294B 755F                    	jne	short ioctl_bad_fun	; no handles with Generic IOCTL.
 18017                                  
 18018                                  	; 29/01/2024 
 18019                                  	;;;

 18022                                  	;;;

 18026

 18029                                  	;;;

 18032                                  	;cmp	ch,8
 18033 0000295B 80FD08                  	cmp	ch,IOC_DC ; 8          	; disk control
 18034 0000295E 7451                    	je	short GenIOCTL_extended
 18035                                  GenIOCTL_normal:			; MSDOS 5-6.22 functions
 18036                                  	;;;

 18090                                  	
 18091                                  ioctl_bad_handlej:
 18092 000029A9 E901FF                  	jmp	ioctl_bad_handle
 18093                                  
 18094                                  	; 29/01/2024
 18095                                  ioctl_bad_fun:
 18096 000029AC B001                    	mov	al, error_invalid_function  ; 1
 18097 000029AE E9C9DC                  	jmp	SYS_RET_ERR	
 18098                                  
 18099                                  	; 29/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 18100                                  GenIOCTL_extended:
 18101 000029B1 80F96A                  	cmp	cl,6Ah			; UNLOCK LOGICAL VOLUME
 18102                                  	;je	short GenIOCTL_chk_lock
 18103 000029B4 740E                    	je	short GenIOCTL_lock_unlock
 18104 000029B6 80F94A                  	cmp	cl,4Ah			; LOCK LOGICAL VOLUME
 18105 000029B9 75A5                    	jne	short GenIOCTL_normal
 18106                                  ;GenIOCTL_chk_lock:
 18107                                  	;cmp	cl,4Ah			; LOCK LOGICAL VOLUME
 18108                                  	;jne	short GenIOCTL_lock_unlock
 18109 000029BB 80FF04                  	cmp	bh,4			; lock level (0-4)
 18110 000029BE 7404                    	je	short GenIOCTL_lock_unlock
 18111 000029C0 08FF                    	or	bh,bh
 18112 000029C2 75E8                    	jnz	short ioctl_bad_fun
 18113                                  GenIOCTL_lock_unlock:
 18114 000029C4 8A1E[B103]              	mov	bl,[IOCTL_drvnum]	; drive number (1=A:, 2=B: ..)
 18115 000029C8 30FF                    	xor	bh,bh
 18116 000029CA 4B                      	dec	bx
 18117 000029CB 80FB1A                  	cmp	bl,26			; logical disk number limit
 18118 000029CE 73DC                    	jnb	short ioctl_bad_fun
 18119 000029D0 80F96A                  	cmp	cl,6Ah			; UNLOCK LOGICAL VOLUME
 18120 000029D3 7507                    	jne	short GenIOCTL_lock
 18121 000029D5 80A7[3114]7F            	and	byte [bx+drive_flags],7Fh ; UNLOCK
 18122 000029DA EB05                    	jmp	short GenIOCTL_OK
 18123                                  GenIOCTL_lock:
 18124 000029DC 808F[3114]80            	or	byte [bx+drive_flags],80h ; LOCK
 18125                                  GenIOCTL_OK:
 18126 000029E1 E98CDC                  	jmp	SYS_RET_OK

 18133                                  ;

 18507                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 18508                                  ; Proc Name : Check_If_Net:
 18509                                  ;
 18510                                  ;
 18511                                  ; Checks if the device is over the net or not. Returns result in ZERO flag.
 18512                                  ; If no device is found, the return address is popped off the stack, and a
 18513                                  ; jump is made to ioctl_drv_err.
 18514                                  ;
 18515                                  ; On Entry:
 18516                                  ; Registers same as those for Get_Driver_BL
 18517                                  ;
 18518                                  ; On Exit:
 18519                                  ; ZERO flag	- set if not a net device
 18520                                  ;		- reset if net device
 18521                                  ; ES:DI -> the device
 18522                                  ;
 18523                                  ;
 18524                                  ; BUGBUG: This function assumes the following stack setup on entry
 18525                                  ;
 18526                                  ;	  SP+2 -> Error return address
 18527                                  ;	  SP   -> Normal return address
 18528                                  ;
 18529                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 18530                                  
 18531                                  	; 30/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 18532                                  	; MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:639Ch
 18533                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:6A91h
 18534                                  	; Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:68E1h
 18535                                  
 18536                                  Check_If_Net:
 18537                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 18538 00002B17 E8D2FF                  	CALL	Get_Driver_BL
 18539 00002B1A 7201                    	JC	short ioctl_drv_err_pop	; invalid drive letter
 18540                                  
 18541                                  ; 30/01/2024 ('Get_Driver_BL' returns with
 18542                                  ;	      'curdir_isnet' condition/ZF, no need to a second test)
 18543                                  %if 0
 18544                                  	;;;
 18545                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM, Windows ME IO.SYS)
 18546                                  	PUSH	ES
 18547                                  	PUSH	DI
 18548                                  	LES	DI,[THISCDS]
 18549                                  	;test	word [es:di+43h],8000h
 18550                                  	;TEST	word [ES:DI+curdir.flags],curdir_isnet
 18551                                  	;test	byte [es:di+44h],80h
 18552                                  	TEST	byte [ES:DI+curdir.flags+1],(curdir_isnet>>8)
 18553                                  	POP	DI
 18554                                  	POP	ES
 18555                                  	;;;
 18556                                  %endif
 18557 00002B1C C3                      	retn
 18558                                  
 18559                                  ioctl_drv_err_pop:
 18560 00002B1D 58                      	pop	ax			; pop off return address
 18561 00002B1E E951FF                  	jmp	ioctl_drv_err
 18562                                  
 18563                                  ioctl_bad_funj3:
 18564 00002B21 E988FE                  	jmp	ioctl_bad_fun
 18565                                  
 18566                                  ioctl_string_errj:
 18567 00002B24 EBB2                    	jmp	short ioctl_string_err  ; 25/05/2019

 18597                                  SetOwner:

 18640                                  ;**	DELETE.ASM - Low level routine for deleting files
 18641                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------

 18643                                  ;		REN_DEL_Check
 18644                                  ;		FastOpen_Delete	       ; DOS 3.3
 18645                                  ;		FastOpen_Update	       ; DOS 3.3
 18646                                  
 18647                                  ;   Revision history:
 18648                                  ;
 18649                                  ;   A000  version 4.00	Jan. 1988
 18650                                  ;   A001  Fastopen Rename fix	April 1989
 18651                                  
 18652                                  ;Installed = TRUE
 18653                                  
 18654                                  ;	i_need	NoSetDir,BYTE
 18655                                  ;	i_need	Creating,BYTE
 18656                                  ;	i_need	DELALL,BYTE
 18657                                  ;	i_need	THISDPB,DWORD

 18679                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 18680                                  ;
 18681                                  ; Procedure Name : DOS_DELETE
 18682                                  ;
 18683                                  ; Inputs:
 18684                                  ;	[WFP_START] Points to WFP string ("d:/" must be first 3 chars, NUL
 18685                                  ;		terminated)
 18686                                  ;	[CURR_DIR_END] Points to end of Current dir part of string
 18687                                  ;		( = -1 if current dir not involved, else
 18688                                  ;		 Points to first char after last "/" of current dir part)
 18689                                  ;	[THISCDS] Points to CDS being used
 18690                                  ;		(Low word = -1 if NUL CDS (Net direct request))
 18691                                  ;	[SATTRIB] Is attribute of search, determines what files can be found
 18692                                  ; Function:
 18693                                  ;	Delete the specified file(s)
 18694                                  ; Outputs:
 18695                                  ;	CARRY CLEAR
 18696                                  ;		OK
 18697                                  ;	CARRY SET
 18698                                  ;	    AX is error code
 18699                                  ;		error_file_not_found
 18700                                  ;			Last element of path not found
 18701                                  ;		error_path_not_found
 18702                                  ;			Bad path (not in curr dir part if present)
 18703                                  ;		error_bad_curr_dir
 18704                                  ;			Bad path in current directory part of path
 18705                                  ;		error_access_denied
 18706                                  ;			Attempt to delete device or directory
 18707                                  ;		***error_sharing_violation***
 18708                                  ;			Deny both access required, generates an INT 24.
 18709                                  ;			This error is NOT returned. The INT 24H is generated,
 18710                                  ;			  and the file is ignored (not deleted). Delete will
 18711                                  ;			  simply continue on looking for more files.
 18712                                  ;			  Carry will NOT be set in this case.
 18713                                  ; DS preserved, others destroyed
 18714                                  ;
 18715                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 18716                                  
 18717                                  FILEFOUND   equ 01h
 18718                                  FILEDELETED equ 10h
 18719                                  
 18720                                  	; 12/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 18721                                  	; DOSCODE:63E9h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 18722                                  
 18723                                  	; 30/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IBMDOS.COM)
 18724                                  	; DOSCODE:6B11h (PCDOS 7.1, IBMDOS.COM)
 18725                                  
 18726                                  DOS_DELETE:
 18727                                  
 18728                                  ;hkn; DOS_Delete is called from file.asm and fcbio.asm. DS has been set up 
 18729                                  ;hkn; appropriately at this point.
 18730                                  
 18731 00002B6B E8B9EC                  	call	TestNet
 18732 00002B6E 7306                    	JNC	short LOCAL_DELETE
 18733                                  
 18734                                  ;IF NOT Installed
 18735                                  ;	transfer NET_DELETE
 18736                                  ;ELSE
 18737                                  	;MOV	AX,(MultNET SHL 8) | 19
 18738                                  	;INT	2FH
 18739                                  	;return
 18740                                  
 18741 00002B70 B81311                  	mov	ax,1113h
 18742 00002B73 CD2F                    	int     2Fh 	; Multiplex - NETWORK REDIRECTOR - DELETE REMOTE FILE
 18743                                  			; SS = DS = DOS CS, SDA first filename pointer -> 
 18744                                  			;		fully-qualified filename in DOS CS
 18745                                  			; SDA CDS pointer -> current directory structure for drive with file
 18746                                  			; Return: CF set on error
 18747 00002B75 C3                      	retn
 18748                                  ;ENDIF

 18761 00002B90 813C2A2E                	CMP	WORD [SI],2E2Ah ; "*."

 18779 00002BB0 3D2E3F                  	CMP	AX,3F2Eh ; ".?"
 18780 00002BB3 7514                    	JNZ	short NOT_ALL

 18783 00002BB9 750E                    	JNZ	short NOT_ALL

 18790 00002BC0 3C1F                    	CMP	AL,attr_hidden+attr_system+attr_directory+attr_volume_id+attr_read_only
 18791                                  					; All must be set
 18792 00002BC2 7505                    	JNZ	short NOT_ALL
 18793                                  
 18794                                  ; NOTE WARNING DANGER-----
 18795                                  ;    This DELALL stuff is not safe. It allows directories to be deleted.
 18796                                  ;	It should ONLY be used by FORMAT in the ROOT directory.

 18798 00002BC4 C606[7F05]00            	MOV	byte [DELALL],0		; DEL *.* - flag deleting all
 18799                                  NOT_ALL:

 18805 00002BD7 7407                    	JZ	short _bad_path

 18832                                  
 18833                                  DELFILE:

 18835                                  
 18836                                  ; If we are deleting the Volume ID, then we set VOLUME_CHNG flag to make
 18837                                  ; DOS issue a build BPB call the next time this drive is accessed.

 18839 00002BFC 1E                      	PUSH	DS

 18846

 18848 00002C11 7403                    	JZ	short DoDelete		; not read only
 18849

 18862                                  
 18863                                  DEL_SHARE_OK:
 18864                                  	; 17/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 18865                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 18866                                  	;test	byte [di+5],40h
 18867 00002C1B F6450540                	TEST	byte [DI+BUFFINFO.buf_flags],buf_dirty
 18868                                  					;LB. if already dirty		  ;AN000;
 18869 00002C1F 7507                    	JNZ	short yesdirty		;LB.  don't increment dirty count ;AN000;

 18871                                  	;or	byte [di+5],40h
 18872 00002C24 804D0540                	OR	byte [DI+BUFFINFO.buf_flags],buf_dirty
 18873                                  yesdirty:
 18874 00002C28 8827                    	mov	[bx],ah 
 18875                                  	;MOV	[BX+dir_entry.dir_name],AH ; Put in E5H or 0
 18876                                  	;;;
 18877                                  	; 30/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0

 18880                                  	;cmp	[es:bp+0Fh],bx
 18881 00002C2C 26395E0F                	cmp	[es:bp+DPB.FAT_SIZE],bx ; 0
 18882 00002C30 7503                    	jnz     short yesdirty_fc_1	;  not FAT32
 18883 00002C32 8B5CFA                  	mov     bx,[si-6]		;  high word of the first cluster (FAT32)
 18884                                  yesdirty_fc_1:

 18893                                  	;;;

 18899                                  	;;;

 18901                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 18902                                  	;cmp	word [CLUSTNUM_HW],0
 18903 00002C43 21D2                    	and	dx,dx ; 30/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 18904 00002C45 7505                    	jnz	short yesdirty_fc_2

 18907                                  yesdirty_fc_2:
 18908                                  	;cmp	word [es:bp+0Fh],0
 18909 00002C4C 26837E0F00              	cmp	word [es:bp+DPB.FAT_SIZE],0

 18911                                  	;push	bx
