 28733                                  
 28734                                  ;============================================================================
 28735                                  ; DIR2.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 28736                                  ;============================================================================
 28737                                  ; 27/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 28738                                  ; 19/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 28739                                  ; 14/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 28740                                  
 28741                                  ;	TITLE	DIR2 - Directory and path cracking
 28742                                  ;	NAME	Dir2
 28743                                  
 28744                                  ;Break	<GETPATH -- PARSE A WFP>
 28745                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28746                                  ;
 28747                                  ; Procedure Name : GETPATH
 28748                                  ;
 28749                                  ; Inputs:
 28750                                  ;	[WFP_START] Points to WFP string ("d:\" must be first 3 chars, NUL
 28751                                  ;		terminated; d:/ (note forward slash) indicates a real device).
 28752                                  ;	[CURR_DIR_END] Points to end of Current dir part of string
 28753                                  ;		( = -1 if current dir not involved, else
 28754                                  ;		 Points to first char after last "/" of current dir part)
 28755                                  ;	[THISCDS] Points to CDS being used
 28756                                  ;	[SATTRIB] Is attribute of search, determines what files can be found
 28757                                  ;	[NoSetDir] set
 28758                                  ;	[THISDPB] set to DPB if disk otherwise garbage.
 28759                                  ; Function:
 28760                                  ;	Crack the path
 28761                                  ; Outputs:
 28762                                  ;	Sets EXTERR_LOCUS = errLOC_Disk if disk file
 28763                                  ;	Sets EXTERR_LOCUS = errLOC_Unk if char device
 28764                                  ;	ID1 field of [THISCDS] updated appropriately
 28765                                  ;	[ATTRIB] = [SATTRIB]
 28766                                  ;	ES:BP Points to DPB
 28767                                  ;	Carry set if bad path
 28768                                  ;	   SI Points to path element causing failure
 28769                                  ;	   Zero set
 28770                                  ;	      [DIRSTART],[DIRSEC],[CLUSNUM], and [CLUSFAC] are set up to
 28771                                  ;	      start a search on the last directory
 28772                                  ;	      CL is zero if there is a bad name in the path
 28773                                  ;	      CL is non-zero if the name was simply not found
 28774                                  ;		 [ENTFREE] may have free spot in directory
 28775                                  ;		 [NAME1] is the name.
 28776                                  ;		 CL = 81H if '*'s or '?' in NAME1, 80H otherwise
 28777                                  ;	   Zero reset
 28778                                  ;	      File in middle of path or bad name in path or attribute mismatch
 28779                                  ;		or path too long or malformed path
 28780                                  ;	ELSE
 28781                                  ;	   [CurBuf] = -1 if root directory
 28782                                  ;	   [CURBUF] contains directory record with match
 28783                                  ;	   [CURBUF+2]:BX Points into [CURBUF] to start of entry
 28784                                  ;	   [CURBUF+2]:SI Points into [CURBUF] to dir_first field for entry
 28785                                  ;	   AH = device ID
 28786                                  ;	      bit 7 of AH set if device SI and BX
 28787                                  ;	      will point DOSGROUP relative The firclus
 28788                                  ;	      field of the device entry contains the device pointer
 28789                                  ;	   [NAME1] Has name looked for
 28790                                  ;	   If last element is a directory zero is set and:
 28791                                  ;	      [DIRSTART],[SECCLUSPOS],[DIRSEC],[CLUSNUM], and [CLUSFAC]
 28792                                  ;	      are set up to start a search on it.
 28793                                  ;	      unless [NoSetDir] is non zero in which case the return is
 28794                                  ;	      like that for a file (except for zero flag)
 28795                                  ;	   If last element is a file zero is reset
 28796                                  ;	      [DIRSEC],[CLUSNUM],[CLUSFAC],[NXTCLUSNUM],[SECCLUSPOS],
 28797                                  ;	      [LASTENT], [ENTLAST] are set to continue search of last
 28798                                  ;	      directory for furthur matches on NAME1 via the NEXTENT
 28799                                  ;	      entry point in FindEntry (or GETENT entry in GETENTRY in
 28800                                  ;	      which case [NXTCLUSNUM] and [SECCLUSPOS] need not be valid)
 28801                                  ; DS preserved, Others destroyed
 28802                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28803                                  
 28804                                  ;hkn; called from delete.asm, finfo.asm, mknode.asm and rename.asm.
 28805                                  ;hkn; DS already set up at this point.
 28806                                  
 28807                                  	; 21/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 28808                                  
 28809                                  	; 15/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 28810                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:8B99h
 28811                                  
 28812                                  GETPATH:
 28813                                  	;mov	word [CREATING],0E500h
 28814 00004B29 C706[7E05]00E5          	MOV	WORD [CREATING],DIRFREE*256+0 ; Not Creating, not DEL *.*
 28815                                  
 28816                                  ; Same as GetPath only CREATING and DELALL already set
 28817                                  
 28818                                  	;entry	GetPathNoSet
 28819                                  GetPathNoSet:
 28820                                  	;;mov	byte [EXTERR_LOCUS],2
 28821                                  	;MOV	byte [EXTERR_LOCUS],errLOC_Disk
 28822                                  	; 15/02/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 28823 00004B2F E8B2C7                  	call	set_exerr_locus_disk
 28824                                  	;
 28825 00004B32 C706[E205]FFFF          	MOV	word [CURBUF],-1	; initial setting
 28826                                  
 28827                                  ; See if the input indicates a device that has already been detected. If so,
 28828                                  ; go build the guy quickly. Otherwise, let findpath find the device.
 28829                                  
 28830 00004B38 8B3E[B205]              	MOV	DI,[WFP_START]		; point to the beginning of the name
 28831                                  	;cmp	word [DI+1],5C3Ah
 28832                                  	;CMP	WORD [DI+1],'\' << 8 + ':'
 28833 00004B3C 817D013A5C              	cmp	word [DI+1],':\'
 28834 00004B41 7435                    	JZ	short CrackIt
 28835                                  
 28836                                  ; Let ChkDev find it in the device list
 28837                                  
 28838 00004B43 83C703                  	ADD	DI,3
 28839                                  	; 18/08/2018
 28840                                  	;MOV	SI,DI			; let CHKDEV see the original name
 28841                                  	; 21/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 28842                                  	; 16/12/2022
 28843                                  	;mov	si,di ; not required ! (it is written in CHKDEV proc already!)
 28844 00004B46 E8B200                  	CALL	CHKDEV
 28845 00004B49 722B                    	JC	short InternalError
 28846                                  
 28847                                  Build_devJ:
 28848 00004B4B A0[6D05]                	MOV	AL,[SATTRIB]
 28849 00004B4E A2[6B05]                	MOV	[ATTRIB],AL
 28850                                  	; 15/02/2024
 28851                                  	;;mov	byte [EXTERR_LOCUS],1
 28852                                  	;MOV	byte [EXTERR_LOCUS],errLOC_Unk ; In the particular case of
 28853                                  					; "finding" a char device
 28854                                  					; set LOCUS to Unknown. This makes
 28855                                  					; certain idiotic problems reported
 28856                                  					; by a certain 3 letter OEM go away.
 28857                                  	; 15/02/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 28858 00004B51 E887C7                  	call	set_exerr_locus_unk
 28859                                  
 28860                                  
 28861                                  ; Take name in name1 and pack it back into where wfp_start points. This
 28862                                  ; guarantees wfp_start pointing to a canonical representation of a device.
 28863                                  ; We are allowed to do this as GetPath is *ALWAYS* called before entering a
 28864                                  ; wfp into the share set.
 28865                                  ;
 28866                                  ; We copy chars from name1 to wfp_start remembering the position of the last
 28867                                  ; non-space seen +1.  This position is kept in DX.
 28868                                  
 28869                                  ;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 28870 00004B54 16                      	push	ss
 28871 00004B55 07                      	pop	es
 28872                                  
 28873                                  ;hkn; NAME1 is in DOSDATA
 28874 00004B56 BE[4B05]                	mov	si,NAME1
 28875 00004B59 8B3E[B205]              	mov	di,[WFP_START]
 28876 00004B5D 89FA                    	mov	dx,di
 28877 00004B5F B90800                  	mov	cx,8			; 8 chars in device name
 28878                                  MoveLoop:
 28879 00004B62 AC                      	lodsb
 28880 00004B63 AA                      	stosb
 28881 00004B64 3C20                    	cmp	al," "
 28882 00004B66 7402                    	jz	short NoSave
 28883                                  
 28884 00004B68 89FA                    	mov	dx,di
 28885                                  NoSave:
 28886 00004B6A E2F6                    	loop	MoveLoop
 28887                                  
 28888                                  ; DX is the position of the last seen non-space + 1. We terminate the name
 28889                                  ; at this point.
 28890                                  
 28891 00004B6C 89D7                    	mov	di,dx
 28892                                  	;mov	byte [di],0		; end of string
 28893                                  	; 15/02/2024
 28894 00004B6E 880D                    	mov	[di],cl ; 0
 28895 00004B70 E8E102                  	call	Build_device_ent	; Clears carry sets zero
 28896 00004B73 FEC0                    	INC	AL			; reset zero
 28897 00004B75 C3                      	retn
 28898                                  
 28899                                  InternalError:
 28900                                  InternalError_loop:
 28901 00004B76 EBFE                    	JMP	short InternalError_loop ; freeze
 28902                                  
 28903                                  ; Start off at the correct spot. Optimize if the current dir part is valid.
 28904                                  
 28905                                  CrackIt:
 28906                                  ; 15/02/2024
 28907                                  %if 0
 28908                                  	MOV	SI,[CURR_DIR_END]	; get current directory pointer
 28909                                  	CMP	SI,-1			; valid?
 28910                                  	JNZ	short LOOK_SING		; Yes, use it.
 28911                                  	LEA	SI,[DI+3]		; skip D:\.
 28912                                  LOOK_SING:
 28913                                  %endif
 28914                                  	;mov	byte [ATTRIB],16h
 28915 00004B78 C606[6B05]16            	MOV	byte [ATTRIB],attr_directory+attr_system+attr_hidden
 28916                                  					; Attributes to search through Dirs
 28917 00004B7D C43E[A205]              	LES	DI,[THISCDS]
 28918 00004B81 B8FFFF                  	MOV	AX,-1 ; 0FFFFh
 28919                                  	;;;
 28920                                  	; 15/02/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 28921                                  	;mov	bx,[es:di+4Bh]
 28922 00004B84 268B5D4B                	mov	bx,[es:di+curdir.ID+2]
 28923 00004B88 891E[F50A]              	mov	[ROOTCLUST_HW],bx
 28924                                  	;;;
 28925                                  	;mov	bx,[es:di+73]
 28926 00004B8C 268B5D49                	MOV	BX,[ES:DI+curdir.ID]
 28927 00004B90 8B36[B605]              	MOV	SI,[CURR_DIR_END]
 28928                                  
 28929                                  ; AX = -1
 28930                                  ; BX = cluster number of current directory. THis number is -1 if the media
 28931                                  ;      has been uncertainly changed.
 28932                                  ; SI = offset in DOSGroup into path to end of current directory text. This
 28933                                  ;      may be -1 if no current directory part has been used.
 28934                                  
 28935 00004B94 39C6                    	CMP	SI,AX			; if Current directory is not part
 28936 00004B96 7449                    	JZ	short NO_CURR_D		; then we must crack from root
 28937                                  	;;;
 28938                                  	; 15/02/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 28939 00004B98 3906[F50A]              	cmp	[ROOTCLUST_HW],ax ; 0FFFFh
 28940 00004B9C 7504                    	jnz	short CrackIt2
 28941                                  	;;;
 28942 00004B9E 39C3                    	CMP	BX,AX			; is the current directory cluster valid
 28943                                  
 28944                                  ; DOS 3.3  6/25/86
 28945 00004BA0 743F                    	JZ	short NO_CURR_D		; no, crack from the root
 28946                                  
 28947                                  CrackIt2:	; 15/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 28948                                  
 28949                                  	;test	byte [FastOpenFlg],1
 28950 00004BA2 F606[6F12]01            	TEST	byte [FastOpenFlg],FastOpen_Set ; for fastopen ?
 28951 00004BA7 7445                    	JZ	short GOT_SEARCH_CLUSTER	; no
 28952 00004BA9 06                      	PUSH	ES			; save registers
 28953 00004BAA 57                      	PUSH	DI
 28954 00004BAB 51                      	PUSH	CX
 28955 00004BAC FF74FF                  	PUSH	word [SI-1]		; save \ and 1st char of next element
 28956 00004BAF 56                      	PUSH	SI
 28957 00004BB0 53                      	PUSH	BX
 28958                                  	;;; 15/02/2024
 28959 00004BB1 FF36[F50A]              	push	word [ROOTCLUST_HW]
 28960                                  	;;;
 28961 00004BB5 C644FF00                	MOV	BYTE [SI-1],0		; call fastopen to look up cur dir info
 28962 00004BB9 8B36[B205]              	MOV	SI,[WFP_START]
 28963                                  
 28964                                  ;hkn; FastOpenTable, Dir_Info_Buff & FastOpen_Ext_Info are in DOSDATA
 28965 00004BBD BB[6512]                	MOV	BX,FastOpenTable
 28966 00004BC0 BF[990D]                	MOV	DI,Dir_Info_Buff
 28967 00004BC3 B9[8C0D]                	MOV	CX,FastOpen_Ext_Info
 28968                                  	;mov	al,1
 28969 00004BC6 B001                    	MOV	AL,FONC_Look_up
 28970 00004BC8 1E                      	PUSH	DS
 28971 00004BC9 07                      	POP	ES
 28972                                  	;call	far [BX+2]
 28973 00004BCA FF5F02                  	CALL	far [BX+fastopen_entry.name_caching]
 28974 00004BCD 7203                    	JC	short GO_Chk_end1 	;fastopen not installed, or wrong drive.
 28975                                  					; Go to Got_Srch_cluster
 28976                                  	; 29/12/2022
 28977                                  	;CMP	BYTE [SI],0		;fastopen has current dir info?
 28978                                  	;JE	short GO_Chk_end	;yes. Go to got_search_cluster
 28979                                  	;stc
 28980                                  	;jmp	short GO_Chk_end	;Go to No_Curr_D
 28981                                  
 28982 00004BCF 803C01                  	cmp	byte [si],1
 28983                                  GO_Chk_end1:	; 29/12/2022
 28984 00004BD2 F5                      	cmc 
 28985                                  	; [si] = 0 -> cf = 0
 28986                                  	; [si] > 0 -> cf = 1
 28987                                  
 28988                                  ;GO_Chk_end1:
 28989                                  	; 29/12/2022
 28990                                  	;clc
 28991                                  
 28992                                  GO_Chk_end:				; restore registers
 28993                                  	;;; 15/02/2024
 28994 00004BD3 8F06[F50A]              	pop	word [ROOTCLUST_HW]
 28995                                  	;;;
 28996 00004BD7 5B                      	POP	BX
 28997 00004BD8 5E                      	POP	SI
 28998 00004BD9 8F44FF                  	POP	word [SI-1]
 28999 00004BDC 59                      	POP	CX
 29000 00004BDD 5F                      	POP	DI
 29001 00004BDE 07                      	POP	ES
 29002 00004BDF 730D                    	JNC	short GOT_SEARCH_CLUSTER ; crack based on cur dir
 29003                                  
 29004                                  ; DOS 3.3  6/25/86
 29005                                  ;
 29006                                  ; We must cract the path beginning at the root. Advance pointer to beginning
 29007                                  ; of path and go crack from root.
 29008                                  
 29009                                  NO_CURR_D:
 29010 00004BE1 8B36[B205]              	MOV	SI,[WFP_START]
 29011                                  	;LEA	SI,[SI+3]		; Skip "d:/"
 29012                                  	; 15/02/2024
 29013 00004BE5 83C603                  	add	si,3
 29014 00004BE8 C42E[8A05]              	LES	BP,[THISDPB]		; Get ES:BP
 29015 00004BEC EB3B                    	JMP	short ROOTPATH
 29016                                  
 29017                                  ; We are able to crack from the current directory part. Go set up for search
 29018                                  ; of specified cluster.
 29019                                  
 29020                                  GOT_SEARCH_CLUSTER:
 29021 00004BEE C42E[8A05]              	LES	BP,[THISDPB]		; Get ES:BP
 29022 00004BF2 E87CFD                  	call	SETDIRSRCH
 29023                                  	;JC	short SETFERR
 29024                                  	;JMP	short FINDPATH
 29025                                  	; 16/12/2022
 29026 00004BF5 7342                    	jnc	short FINDPATH ; 17/08/2018
 29027                                  	; 21/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 29028                                  	;JC	short SETFERR
 29029                                  	;JMP	short FINDPATH
 29030                                  SETFERR:
 29031 00004BF7 30C9                    	XOR	CL,CL			; set zero
 29032 00004BF9 F9                      	STC
 29033 00004BFA C3                      	retn
 29034                                  
 29035                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29036                                  ;
 29037                                  ; Procedure Name : ChkDev
 29038                                  ;
 29039                                  ; Check to see if the name at DS:DI is a device. Returns carry set if not a
 29040                                  ;   device.
 29041                                  ; Blasts CX,SI,DI,AX,BX
 29042                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29043                                  
 29044                                  CHKDEV:
 29045 00004BFB 89FE                    	MOV	SI,DI
 29046 00004BFD 8CD7                    	MOV	DI,SS
 29047 00004BFF 8EC7                    	MOV	ES,DI
 29048                                  
 29049 00004C01 BF[4B05]                	MOV	DI,NAME1
 29050 00004C04 B90900                  	MOV	CX,9
 29051                                  TESTLOOP:
 29052 00004C07 E8BF11                  	call	GETLET
 29053                                  
 29054 00004C0A 3C2E                    	CMP	AL,'.'
 29055 00004C0C 740E                    	JZ	short TESTDEVICE
 29056 00004C0E E80C12                  	call	PATHCHRCMP
 29057 00004C11 7407                    	JZ	short NOTDEV
 29058 00004C13 08C0                    	OR	AL,AL
 29059 00004C15 7405                    	JZ	short TESTDEVICE
 29060                                  
 29061 00004C17 AA                      	STOSB
 29062 00004C18 E2ED                    	LOOP	TESTLOOP
 29063                                  NOTDEV:
 29064 00004C1A F9                      	STC
 29065 00004C1B C3                      	retn
 29066                                  
 29067                                  TESTDEVICE:
 29068                                  	;ADD	CX,2
 29069                                  	; 24/09/2023
 29070 00004C1C 41                      	inc	cx
 29071 00004C1D 41                      	inc	cx
 29072 00004C1E B020                    	MOV	AL,' '
 29073 00004C20 F3AA                    	REP	STOSB
 29074 00004C22 8CD0                    	MOV	AX,SS
 29075 00004C24 8ED8                    	MOV	DS,AX
 29076                                  	;call	DEVNAME
 29077                                  	;retn
 29078                                  	; 18/12/2022
 29079 00004C26 E9CC01                  	jmp	DEVNAME
 29080                                  
 29081                                  ;Break	<ROOTPATH, FINDPATH -- PARSE A PATH>
 29082                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29083                                  ;
 29084                                  ; Procedure Name : ROOTPATH,FINDPATH
 29085                                  ;
 29086                                  ; Inputs:
 29087                                  ;	Same as FINDPATH but,
 29088                                  ;	SI Points to asciz string of path which is assumed to start at
 29089                                  ;		the root (no leading '/').
 29090                                  ; Function:
 29091                                  ;	Search from root for path
 29092                                  ; Outputs:
 29093                                  ;	Same as FINDPATH but:
 29094                                  ;	If root directory specified, [CURBUF] and [NAME1] are NOT set, and
 29095                                  ;	[NoSetDir] is ignored.
 29096                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29097                                  
 29098                                  	; 21/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 29099                                  	; DOSCODE:7F47h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 29100                                  
 29101                                  	; 15/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 29102                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:8C9Dh
 29103                                  
 29104                                  	; (MSDOS 6.22 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:7F82h)
 29105                                  	; (Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:829Eh)
 29106                                  
 29107                                  ROOTPATH:
 29108 00004C29 E871FD                  	call	SETROOTSRCH
 29109                                  	; 24/09/2023
 29110 00004C2C 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah
 29111                                  	;CMP	BYTE [SI],0
 29112 00004C2E 3824                    	cmp	[si],ah ; 0
 29113 00004C30 7507                    	JNZ	short FINDPATH
 29114                                  
 29115                                  	;;;
 29116                                  	;; 15/02/2024
 29117                                  	; Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:82A6h
 29118                                  	;mov	word [CURBUF],0FFFFh
 29119                                  	;;;
 29120                                  
 29121                                  ; Root dir specified
 29122 00004C32 A0[6D05]                	MOV	AL,[SATTRIB]
 29123 00004C35 A2[6B05]                	MOV	[ATTRIB],AL
 29124                                  	; 24/09/2023
 29125                                  	;XOR	AH,AH			; Sets "device ID" byte, sets zero
 29126                                  					; (dir), clears carry.
 29127 00004C38 C3                      	retn
 29128                                  
 29129                                  ; Inputs:
 29130                                  ;	[ATTRIB] Set to get through directories
 29131                                  ;	[SATTRIB] Set to find last element
 29132                                  ;	ES:BP Points to DPB
 29133                                  ;	SI Points to asciz string of path (no leading '/').
 29134                                  ;	[SECCLUSPOS] = 0
 29135                                  ;	[DIRSEC] = Phys sec # of first sector of directory
 29136                                  ;	[CLUSNUM] = Cluster # of next cluster
 29137                                  ;	[CLUSFAC] = Sectors per cluster
 29138                                  ;	[NoSetDir] set
 29139                                  ;	[CURR_DIR_END] Points to end of Current dir part of string
 29140                                  ;		( = -1 if current dir not involved, else
 29141                                  ;		 Points to first char after last "/" of current dir part)
 29142                                  ;	[THISCDS] Points to CDS being used
 29143                                  ;	[CREATING] and [DELALL] set
 29144                                  ; Function:
 29145                                  ;	Parse path name
 29146                                  ; Outputs:
 29147                                  ;	ID1 field of [THISCDS] updated appropriately
 29148                                  ;	[ATTRIB] = [SATTRIB]
 29149                                  ;	ES:BP Points to DPB
 29150                                  ;	[THISDPB] = ES:BP
 29151                                  ;	Carry set if bad path
 29152                                  ;	   SI Points to path element causing failure
 29153                                  ;	   Zero set
 29154                                  ;	      [DIRSTART],[DIRSEC],[CLUSNUM], and [CLUSFAC] are set up to
 29155                                  ;	      start a search on the last directory
 29156                                  ;	      CL is zero if there is a bad name in the path
 29157                                  ;	      CL is non-zero if the name was simply not found
 29158                                  ;		 [ENTFREE] may have free spot in directory
 29159                                  ;		 [NAME1] is the name.
 29160                                  ;		 CL = 81H if '*'s or '?' in NAME1, 80H otherwise
 29161                                  ;	   Zero reset
 29162                                  ;	      File in middle of path or bad name in path
 29163                                  ;		or path too long or malformed path
 29164                                  ;	ELSE
 29165                                  ;	   [CURBUF] contains directory record with match
 29166                                  ;	   [CURBUF+2]:BX Points into [CURBUF] to start of entry
 29167                                  ;	   [CURBUF+2]:SI Points to fcb_FIRCLUS field for entry
 29168                                  ;	   [NAME1] Has name looked for
 29169                                  ;	   AH = device ID
 29170                                  ;	      bit 7 of AH set if device SI and BX
 29171                                  ;	      will point DOSGROUP relative The firclus
 29172                                  ;	      field of the device entry contains the device pointer
 29173                                  ;	   If last element is a directory zero is set and:
 29174                                  ;	      [DIRSTART],[SECCLUSPOS],[DIRSEC],[CLUSNUM], and [CLUSFAC]
 29175                                  ;	      are set up to start a search on it,
 29176                                  ;	      unless [NoSetDir] is non zero in which case the return is
 29177                                  ;	      like that for a file (except for zero flag)
 29178                                  ;	   If last element is a file zero is reset
 29179                                  ;	      [DIRSEC],[CLUSNUM],[CLUSFAC],[NXTCLUSNUM],[SECCLUSPOS],
 29180                                  ;	      [LASTENT], [ENTLAST] are set to continue search of last
 29181                                  ;	      directory for furthur matches on NAME1 via the NEXTENT
 29182                                  ;	      entry point in FindEntry (or GETENT entry in GETENTRY in
 29183                                  ;	      which case [NXTCLUSNUM] and [SECCLUSPOS] need not be valid)
 29184                                  ; Destroys all other registers
 29185                                  
 29186                                  	; 21/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 29187                                  	; DOSCODE:7F58h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 29188                                  
 29189                                  	; 15/02/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 29190                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:8CAEh
 29191                                  
 29192                                      	;entry	FINDPATH
 29193                                  FINDPATH:
 29194 00004C39 06                      	PUSH	ES			; Save ES:BP
 29195 00004C3A 56                      	PUSH	SI
 29196 00004C3B 89F7                    	MOV	DI,SI
 29197 00004C3D 8B0E[C205]              	MOV	CX,[DIRSTART]		; Get start clus of dir being searched
 29198 00004C41 833E[B605]FF            	CMP	word [CURR_DIR_END],-1
 29199 00004C46 7415                    	JZ	short NOIDS		; No current dir part
 29200 00004C48 3B3E[B605]              	CMP	DI,[CURR_DIR_END]
 29201 00004C4C 750F                    	JNZ	short NOIDS		; Not to current dir end yet
 29202 00004C4E C43E[A205]              	LES	DI,[THISCDS]
 29203                                  	;;;
 29204                                  	; 15/02/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 29205 00004C52 A1[E30A]                	mov	ax,[DIRSTART_HW]
 29206                                  	;mov	[es:di+4Bh],ax
 29207 00004C55 2689454B                	mov	[es:di+curdir.ID+2],ax
 29208                                  	;;;
 29209                                  	;mov	[es:di+73],cx
 29210 00004C59 26894D49                	MOV	[ES:DI+curdir.ID],CX	; Set current directory cluster
 29211                                  NOIDS:
 29212                                  
 29213                                  ; Parse the name off of DS:SI into NAME1. AL = 1 if there was a meta
 29214                                  ; character in the string. CX,DI may be destroyed.
 29215                                  ;
 29216                                  ;	invoke	NAMETRANS
 29217                                  ;	MOV	CL,AL
 29218                                  ;
 29219                                  ; The above is the slow method. The name has *already* been munged by
 29220                                  ; TransPath so no special casing needs to be done. All we do is try to copy
 29221                                  ; the name until ., \ or 0 is hit.
 29222                                  
 29223                                  	;MOV	AX,SS
 29224                                  	;MOV	ES,AX
 29225                                  	; 15/02/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 29226 00004C5D 16                      	push	ss
 29227 00004C5E 07                      	pop	es
 29228                                  
 29229                                  ;hkn; Name1 is in DOSDATA
 29230 00004C5F BF[4B05]                	MOV	DI,NAME1
 29231 00004C62 B82020                  	MOV	AX,'  ' ; 2020h
 29232 00004C65 AA                      	STOSB
 29233 00004C66 AB                      	STOSW
 29234 00004C67 AB                      	STOSW
 29235 00004C68 AB                      	STOSW
 29236 00004C69 AB                      	STOSW
 29237 00004C6A AB                      	STOSW
 29238                                  
 29239                                  ;hkn; Name1 is in DOSDATA
 29240 00004C6B BF[4B05]                	MOV	DI,NAME1
 29241 00004C6E 30E4                    	XOR	AH,AH			; bits for CL
 29242                                  GetNam:
 29243                                  	; 19/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 29244                                  	;INC	CL ; ?*! ; MSDOS 6.0	;AN000; KK increment volid count
 29245                                  
 29246                                  	; 21/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 29247                                  	; 16/12/2022
 29248                                  	;inc	cl ; not required !	
 29249                                  	
 29250 00004C70 AC                      	LODSB
 29251 00004C71 3C2E                    	CMP	AL,'.'	; 2Eh
 29252 00004C73 7412                    	JZ	short _SetExt
 29253 00004C75 08C0                    	OR	AL,AL
 29254 00004C77 7424                    	JZ	short _GetDone
 29255 00004C79 3C5C                    	CMP	AL,'\'	; 5Ch
 29256 00004C7B 7420                    	JZ	short _GetDone
 29257 00004C7D 3C3F                    	CMP	AL,'?'	; 3Fh
 29258 00004C7F 7503                    	JNZ	short StoNam
 29259 00004C81 80CC01                  	OR	AH,1
 29260                                  StoNam: 
 29261 00004C84 AA                      	STOSB
 29262 00004C85 EBE9                    	JMP	short GetNam
 29263                                  _SetExt:
 29264 00004C87 BF[5305]                	MOV	DI,NAME1+8
 29265                                  GetExt:
 29266 00004C8A AC                      	LODSB
 29267 00004C8B 08C0                    	OR	AL,AL
 29268 00004C8D 740E                    	JZ	short _GetDone
 29269 00004C8F 3C5C                    	CMP	AL,'\'
 29270 00004C91 740A                    	JZ	short _GetDone
 29271 00004C93 3C3F                    	CMP	AL,'?'
 29272 00004C95 7503                    	JNZ	short StoExt
 29273 00004C97 80CC01                  	OR	AH,1
 29274                                  StoExt: 
 29275 00004C9A AA                      	STOSB
 29276 00004C9B EBED                    	JMP	short GetExt
 29277                                  _GetDone:
 29278 00004C9D 4E                      	DEC	SI
 29279 00004C9E 88E1                    	MOV	CL,AH  ; 0 or 1 ; 29/12/2022
 29280 00004CA0 80C980                  	OR	CL,80H
 29281 00004CA3 5F                      	POP	DI			; Start of this element
 29282 00004CA4 07                      	POP	ES			; Restore ES:BP
 29283 00004CA5 39FE                    	CMP	SI,DI
 29284 00004CA7 7503                    	JNZ	short check_device
 29285 00004CA9 E9F000                  	JMP	_BADPATH		; NUL parse (two delims most likely)
 29286                                  check_device:
 29287 00004CAC 56                      	PUSH	SI			; Start of next element
 29288                                  	;MOV	AL,[SI]
 29289                                  	; 15/02/2024
 29290 00004CAD 08C0                    	OR	AL,AL
 29291                                  	; 23/09/2023
 29292                                  	;cmp	byte [si],0
 29293 00004CAF 7508                    	JNZ	short NOT_LAST
 29294                                  
 29295                                  ; for last element of the path switch to the correct search attributes
 29296                                  
 29297 00004CB1 8A3E[6D05]              	MOV	BH,[SATTRIB]
 29298 00004CB5 883E[6B05]              	MOV	[ATTRIB],BH
 29299                                  
 29300                                  NOT_LAST:
 29301                                  
 29302                                  ; check name1 to see if we have a device...
 29303                                  
 29304 00004CB9 06                      	PUSH	ES			; Save ES:BP
 29305                                  
 29306                                  ;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 29307                                  	;context ES
 29308 00004CBA 16                      	push	ss
 29309 00004CBB 07                      	pop	es
 29310 00004CBC E83601                  	call	DEVNAME 		; blast BX
 29311 00004CBF 07                      	POP	ES			; Restore ES:BP
 29312 00004CC0 720B                    	JC	short FindFile		; Not a device
 29313 00004CC2 08C0                    	OR	AL,AL			; Test next char again
 29314 00004CC4 7403                    	JZ	short GO_BDEV
 29315 00004CC6 E9D700                  	JMP	FILEINPATH		; Device name in middle of path
 29316                                  
 29317                                  GO_BDEV:
 29318 00004CC9 5E                      	POP	SI			; Points to NUL at end of path
 29319 00004CCA E97EFE                  	JMP	Build_devJ
 29320                                  
 29321                                  FindFile:
 29322                                  ;;;; 7/28/86
 29323 00004CCD 803E[4B05]E5            	CMP	BYTE [NAME1],0E5H	; if 1st char = E5
 29324 00004CD2 7505                    	JNZ	short NOE5		; no
 29325 00004CD4 C606[4B05]05            	MOV	BYTE [NAME1],05H	; change it to 05
 29326                                  NOE5:
 29327                                  ;;;; 7/28/86
 29328 00004CD9 57                      	PUSH	DI			; Start of this element
 29329 00004CDA 06                      	PUSH	ES			; Save ES:BP
 29330 00004CDB 51                      	PUSH	CX			; CL return from NameTrans
 29331                                  ;DOS 3.3 FastOPen 6/12/86 F.C.
 29332                                  
 29333 00004CDC E8B502                  	CALL	LookupPath		; call fastopen to get dir entry
 29334 00004CDF 7303                    	JNC	short DIR_FOUND		; found dir entry
 29335                                  
 29336                                  ;DOS 3.3 FastOPen 6/12/86 F.C.
 29337 00004CE1 E86FFA                  	call	FINDENTRY
 29338                                  DIR_FOUND:
 29339 00004CE4 59                      	POP	CX
 29340 00004CE5 07                      	POP	ES
 29341 00004CE6 5F                      	POP	DI
 29342 00004CE7 7303                    	JNC	short LOAD_BUF
 29343 00004CE9 E9D900                  	JMP	BADPATHPOP
 29344                                  
 29345                                  LOAD_BUF:
 29346 00004CEC C53E[E205]              	LDS	DI,[CURBUF]
 29347                                  	;test	byte [bx+0Bh],10h
 29348 00004CF0 F6470B10                	TEST	BYTE [BX+dir_entry.dir_attr],attr_directory
 29349 00004CF4 7503                    	JNZ	short GO_NEXT 		; DOS 3.3
 29350 00004CF6 E9A700                  	JMP	FILEINPATH		; Error or end of path
 29351                                  
 29352                                  ; if we are not setting the directory, then check for end of string
 29353                                  
 29354                                  GO_NEXT:
 29355                                  ;hkn; SS override
 29356 00004CF9 36803E[4C03]00          	CMP	BYTE [SS:NoSetDir],0
 29357 00004CFF 7423                    	JZ	short SetDir
 29358 00004D01 89FA                    	MOV	DX,DI			; Save pointer to entry
 29359 00004D03 8CD9                    	MOV	CX,DS
 29360                                  
 29361                                  ;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 29362                                  	;context DS
 29363 00004D05 16                      	push	ss
 29364 00004D06 1F                      	pop	ds
 29365 00004D07 5F                      	POP	DI			; Start of next element
 29366                                  	; 19/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 29367                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 29368 00004D08 F606[6F12]01            	TEST	byte [FastOpenFlg],FastOpen_Set ;only DOSOPEN can take advantage of
 29369 00004D0D 740B                    	JZ	short _nofast			; the FastOpen
 29370 00004D0F F606[6F12]02            	TEST	byte [FastOpenFlg],Lookup_Success ; Lookup just happened
 29371 00004D14 7404                    	JZ	short _nofast			; no
 29372 00004D16 8B3E[B90D]              	MOV	DI,[Next_Element_Start]	; no need to insert it again
 29373                                  _nofast:
 29374 00004D1A 803D00                  	CMP	BYTE [DI],0
 29375                                  	;;JNZ	short NEXT_ONE		; DOS 3.3
 29376                                  	;;JMP	_SETRET  ; retn		; Got it
 29377                                  	;retn	; 05/09/2018
 29378                                  	; 21/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 29379                                  	;jmp	_SETRET
 29380                                  	; 16/12/2022
 29381 00004D1D 7431                    	jz	short _SETRET
 29382                                  
 29383                                  NEXT_ONE:
 29384 00004D1F 57                      	PUSH	DI			; Put start of next element back on stack
 29385 00004D20 89D7                    	MOV	DI,DX
 29386 00004D22 8ED9                    	MOV	DS,CX			; Get back pointer to entry
 29387                                  SetDir:
 29388                                  	;;;
 29389                                  	; 15/02/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 29390 00004D24 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx ; 0
 29391                                  	;cmp	[es:bp+0Fh],dx
 29392 00004D26 2639560F                	cmp	[es:bp+DPB.FAT_SIZE],dx ; 0
 29393 00004D2A 7503                    	jnz     short SetDir2 ; not FAT32
 29394 00004D2C 8B54FA                  	mov     dx,[si-6]		; dir_entry.dir_fclus_hi
 29395                                  SetDir2:
 29396 00004D2F 368916[F50A]            	mov	[ss:ROOTCLUST_HW],dx

 29399                                  
 29400                                  ;DOS 3.3 FastOPen 6/12/86 F.C.
 29401 00004D36 1E                      	PUSH	DS		      ; save [curbuf+2]
 29402                                  ;hkn; SS is DOSDATA

 29405                                  	;test	byte [FastOpenFlg],2
 29406 00004D39 F606[6F12]02            	TEST	byte [FastOpenFlg],Lookup_Success
 29407 00004D3E 7411                    	JZ	short DO_NORMAL	      ; fastopen not in memory or path not
 29408 00004D40 89D3                    	MOV	BX,DX		      ; not found

 29413 00004D4B 83C402                  	ADD	SP,2		      ; pop ds in stack
 29414 00004D4E EB36                    	JMP	short FAST_OPEN_SKIP
 29415                                  
 29416                                  	; 16/12/2022
 29417                                  _SETRET:

 29419                                  
 29420                                  DO_NORMAL:
 29421 00004D51 1F                      	POP	DS			; DS = [curbuf + 2]
 29422                                  ;DOS 3.3 FastOPen 6/12/86 F.C.
 29423                                  
 29424 00004D52 29FB                    	SUB	BX,DI			; Offset into sector of start of entry
 29425 00004D54 29FE                    	SUB	SI,DI			; Offset into sector of dir_first
 29426 00004D56 53                      	PUSH	BX

 29429 00004D59 51                      	PUSH	CX
 29430                                  
 29431                                  ; 15/02/2024
 29432                                  %if 0
 29433                                  	;push	word [di+6]

 29579                                  ;	    CH = found attribute

 29594                                  ;
 29595                                  ; the result is non-zero if an attribute is not in the search set
 29596                                  ; and in the found set and in the important set. This means that we do not
 29597                                  ; have a match. Do a JNZ <nomatch> or JZ <match>

 29614                                  ;Break <DevName - Look for name of device>

 29616                                  ;
 29617                                  ; Procedure Name : DevName
 29618                                  ;
 29619                                  ; Inputs:
 29620                                  ;	DS,ES:DOSDATA
 29621                                  ;	Filename in NAME1
 29622                                  ;	ATTRIB set so that we can error out if looking for Volume IDs
 29623                                  ; Function:
 29624                                  ;	Determine if file is in list of I/O drivers
 29625                                  ; Outputs:
 29626                                  ;	Carry set if not a device
 29627                                  ;	ELSE
 29628                                  ;	Zero flag set
 29629                                  ;	BH = Bit 7,6 = 1, bit 5 = 0 (cooked mode)

 29632                                  ; BX destroyed, others preserved

 29634

 29654

 29660                                  	; 17/12/2022
 29661                                  	;test	byte [si+5],80h
 29662 00004E13 F6440580                	test	byte [SI+SYSDEV.ATT+1],(DEVTYP>>8)
 29663                                  	;;test	word [si+4],8000h
 29664                                  	;TEST	word [SI+SYSDEV.ATT],DEVTYP
 29665 00004E17 7411                    	JZ	short SKIPDEV 		; Skip block devices (NET and LOCAL)
 29666 00004E19 89F0                    	MOV	AX,SI
 29667                                  	;add	si,10
 29668 00004E1B 83C60A                  	ADD	SI,SYSDEV.NAME
 29669                                  
 29670                                  ;hkn; NAME1 is in DOSDATA
 29671 00004E1E BF[4B05]                	MOV	DI,NAME1
 29672 00004E21 B90400                  	MOV	CX,4			; All devices are 8 letters

 29704                                  ;BREAK <Build_device_ent - Make a Directory entry>
 29705                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29706                                  ; Procedure Name : Build_device_ent
 29707                                  ;
 29708                                  ; Inputs:
 29709                                  ;	[NAME1] has name
 29710                                  ;	BH is attribute field (supplied by DEVNAME)
 29711                                  ;	[DEVPT] points to device header (supplied by DEVNAME)
 29712                                  ; Function:
 29713                                  ;	Build a directory entry for a device at DEVFCB
 29714                                  ; Outputs:

 29778                                  ;Break	<ValidateCDS - given a CDS, validate the media and the current directory>
 29779                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29780                                  ;
 29781                                  ;   ValidateCDS - Get current CDS. Splice it. Call FatReadCDS to check
 29782                                  ;   media. If media has been changed, do DOS_Chdir to validate path.
 29783                                  ;   If invalid, reset original CDS to root.
 29784                                  ;

 29976                                  ; 28/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 29977                                  ; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - offset 43BDh
 29978                                  
 29979                                  ;Break	<CheckThisDevice - Check for being a device>
 29980                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29981                                  ;
 29982                                  ;   CheckThisDevice - Examine the area at DS:SI to see if there is a valid
 29983                                  ;   device specified. We will return carry if there is a device present. 
 29984                                  ;   The forms of devices we will recognize are:
 29985                                  ;
 29986                                  ;	[path]device
 29987                                  ;
 29988                                  ;   Note that the drive letter has *already* been removed. All other forms
 29989                                  ;   are not considered to be devices. If such a device is found we change
 29990                                  ;   the source pointer to point to the device component.
 29991                                  ;
 29992                                  ;   Inputs:	ES is DOSDATA
 29993                                  ;		DS:SI contains name
 29994                                  ;   Outputs:	ES is DOSDATA
 29995                                  ;		DS:SI point to name or device
 29996                                  ;		Carry flag set if device was found
 29997                                  ;		Carry flag reset otherwise
 29998                                  ;   Registers Modified: all except ES:DI, DS
 29999                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30000                                  
 30001                                  CheckThisDevice:
 30002 00004F4F 57                      	push	di
 30003 00004F50 56                      	push	si
 30004 00004F51 89F7                    	MOV	DI,SI
 30005                                  
 30006                                  ; Check for presence of \dev\ (Dam multiplan!)
 30007                                  
 30008 00004F53 8A04                    	MOV	AL,[SI]
 30009 00004F55 E8C50E                  	call	PATHCHRCMP		; is it a path char?
 30010 00004F58 7517                    	JNZ	short ParseDev		; no, go attempt to parse device
 30011 00004F5A 46                      	INC	SI			; simulate LODSB
 30012                                  
 30013                                  ; We have the leading path separator. Look for DEV part.
 30014                                  
 30015 00004F5B AD                      	LODSW
 30016 00004F5C 0D2020                  	OR	AX,2020h
 30017 00004F5F 3D6465                  	cmp	ax,"de"
 30018                                  	;CMP	AX,"e"<< 8 + "d"
 30019 00004F62 752D                    	JNZ	short NotDevice		; not "de", assume not device
 30020 00004F64 AC                      	LODSB
 30021 00004F65 0C20                    	OR	AL,20h
 30022 00004F67 3C76                    	CMP	AL,"v"                  ; Not "v", assume not device
 30023 00004F69 7526                    	JNZ	short NotDevice
 30024 00004F6B AC                      	LODSB
 30025 00004F6C E8AE0E                  	call	PATHCHRCMP		; do we have the last path separator?
 30026 00004F6F 7520                    	JNZ	short NotDevice		; no. go for it.
 30027                                  
 30028                                  ; DS:SI now points to a potential drive. Preserve them as NameTrans advances
 30029                                  ; SI and DevName may destroy DS.
 30030                                  
 30031                                  ParseDev:
 30032 00004F71 1E                      	push	ds
 30033 00004F72 56                      	push	si			; preserve the source pointer
 30034 00004F73 E8EB0D                  	call	NameTrans		; advance DS:SI
 30035 00004F76 803C00                  	CMP	BYTE [SI],0		; parse entire string?
 30036 00004F79 F9                      	STC				; simulate a Carry return from DevName
 30037 00004F7A 750B                    	JNZ	short SkipSearch	; no parse. simulate a file return.
 30038                                  
 30039                                  ;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 30040 00004F7C 16                      	push	ss
 30041 00004F7D 1F                      	pop	ds
 30042                                  
 30043                                  ; M026 - start - fix ported from ROMDOS2 for bug # 2849
 30044                                  ;
 30045                                  ; SR;
 30046                                  ; We have to set Attrib before invoking DevName. Otherwise, the value from
 30047                                  ; a previous DOS call is used and DevName thinks it is not a device if the
 30048                                  ; old call set the volume attribute bit.
 30049                                  
 30050 00004F7E A0[6D05]                	mov	al,[SATTRIB]
 30051 00004F81 A2[6B05]                	mov	[ATTRIB],al		;set Attrib for DevName
 30052                                  
 30053                                  ; M026 - end
 30054                                  
 30055 00004F84 E86EFE                  	call	DEVNAME
 30056                                  
 30057                                  SkipSearch:
 30058 00004F87 5E                      	pop	si
 30059 00004F88 1F                      	pop	ds
 30060                                  
 30061                                  ; SI points to the beginning of the potential device. If we have a device
 30062                                  ; then we do not change SI. If we have a file, then we reset SI back to the
 30063                                  ; original value. At this point Carry set indicates FILE.
 30064                                  
 30065                                  CheckReturn:
 30066 00004F89 5F                      	pop	di			; get original SI
 30067 00004F8A 7302                    	JNC	short Check_Done	; if device then do not reset pointer
 30068 00004F8C 89FE                    	MOV	SI,DI
 30069                                  Check_Done:
 30070 00004F8E 5F                      	pop	di
 30071 00004F8F F5                      	CMC				; invert carry. Carry => device
 30072 00004F90 C3                      	retn
 30073                                  NotDevice:
 30074 00004F91 F9                      	STC
 30075 00004F92 EBF5                    	JMP	short CheckReturn

 30446                                  ;Break	<IOFUNC -- DO FUNCTION 1-12 I/O>
 30447                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30448                                  ;
 30449                                  ; Procedure Name : IOFUNC
 30450                                  ;
 30451                                  ; Inputs:
 30452                                  ;	DS:SI Points to SFT
 30453                                  ;	AH is function code
 30454                                  ;		= 0 Input
 30455                                  ;		= 1 Input Status
 30456                                  ;		= 2 Output
 30457                                  ;		= 3 Output Status
 30458                                  ;		= 4 Flush
 30459                                  ;		= 5 Input Status - System WAIT invoked for K09 if no char
 30460                                  ;				   present.
 30461                                  ;	AL = character if output
 30462                                  ; Function:
 30463                                  ;	Perform indicated I/O to device or file
 30464                                  ; Outputs:
 30465                                  ;	AL is character if input
 30466                                  ;	If a status call
 30467                                  ;		zero set if not ready
 30468                                  ;		zero reset if ready (character in AL for input status)
 30469                                  ; For regular files:
 30470                                  ;	Input Status
 30471                                  ;		Gets character but restores position
 30472                                  ;		Zero set on EOF
 30473                                  ;	Input
 30474                                  ;		Gets character advances position
 30475                                  ;		Returns ^Z on EOF
 30476                                  ;	Output Status
 30477                                  ;		Always ready
 30478                                  ; AX altered, all other registers preserved
 30479                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30480                                  
 30481                                  ; 21/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)

 30750                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30751                                  ;**	Dev_Open_SFT - Open the Device for an SFT
 30752                                  ;
 30753                                  ;	Dev_Open_SFT issues an open call to the device associated with
 30754                                  ;	the SFT.
 30755                                  ;
 30756                                  ;	ENTRY	(ES:DI) = SFT
 30757                                  ;	EXIT	none
 30758                                  ;	USES	all
 30759                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30760                                  
 30761                                  DEV_OPEN_SFT:
 30762 0000523C 06                      	push	es ; * (MSDOS 6.21)
 30763 0000523D E818B2                  	call	save_world
 30764                                  	;mov	al,0Dh	
 30765 00005240 B00D                    	MOV	AL,DEVOPN
 30766 00005242 EB06                    	JMP	SHORT DO_OPCLS
 30767                                  
 30768                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30769                                  ; Procedure Name : DEV_CLOSE_SFT
 30770                                  ;
 30771                                  ; Inputs:
 30772                                  ;	ES:DI Points to SFT
 30773                                  ; Function:
 30774                                  ;	Issue a CLOSE call to the correct device
 30775                                  ; Outputs:
 30776                                  ;	None
 30777                                  ; ALL preserved
 30778                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30779                                  
 30780                                  DEV_CLOSE_SFT:
 30781 00005244 06                      	push	es ; * (MSDOS 6.21)
 30782 00005245 E810B2                  	call	save_world
 30783                                  	;mov	al,0Eh	
 30784 00005248 B00E                    	MOV	AL,DEVCLS
 30785                                  
 30786                                  	; Main entry for device open and close. AL contains the function 
 30787                                  	; requested. Subtlety: if Sharing is NOT loaded then we do NOT issue 
 30788                                  	; open/close to block devices. This allows networks to function but 
 30789                                  	; does NOT hang up with bogus change-line code.
 30790                                  
 30791                                  	;entry	DO_OPCLS
 30792                                  DO_OPCLS:
 30793                                  	; Is the SFT for the net? If so, no action necessary.
 30794                                  
 30795                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 30796                                  	;test	word [es:di+5],8000h
 30797                                  	;TEST	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_flags],sf_isnet
 30798 0000524A 26F6450680              	test	byte [es:di+SF_ENTRY.sf_flags+1],(sf_isnet>>8)
 30799 0000524F 7564                    	jnz	short OPCLS_DONE	; NOP on net SFTs
 30800 00005251 30E4                    	XOR	AH,AH			; Unit
 30801                                  	;test	byte [es:di+5],80h
 30802 00005253 26F6450580              	TEST	byte [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_flags],devid_device
 30803                                  	;les	di,[es:di+7]
 30804 00005258 26C47D07                	LES	DI,[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_devptr] ; Get DPB or device
 30805 0000525C 7511                    	JNZ	short GOT_DEV_ADDR
 30806                                  
 30807                                  	; We are about to call device open/close on a block driver. If no 
 30808                                  	; sharing then just short circuit to done.
 30809                                  	
 30810                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 30811                                  					; SS override
 30812 0000525E 36803E[0303]01          	CMP	byte [ss:fShare],1	;AN010; /NC or no SHARE
 30813 00005264 764F                    	JBE	short OPCLS_DONE	;AN010; yes
 30814                                  
 30815                                  ; 22/02/2024
 30816                                  %if 0
