 36601                                  ;============================================================================
 36602                                  ; FAT.ASM, MSDOS 6.0, 1991
 36603                                  ;============================================================================
 36604                                  ; 30/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 36605                                  ; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 36606                                  
 36607                                  ;	TITLE	FAT - FAT maintenance routines
 36608                                  ;	NAME	FAT
 36609                                  
 36610                                  ;**	FAT.ASM
 36611                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36612                                  ;	Low level local device routines for performing disk change sequence,
 36613                                  ;	setting cluster validity, and manipulating the FAT
 36614                                  ;
 36615                                  ;	IsEof
 36616                                  ;	UNPACK
 36617                                  ;	PACK
 36618                                  ;	MAPCLUSTER
 36619                                  ;	FATREAD_SFT
 36620                                  ;	FATREAD_CDS
 36621                                  ;	FAT_operation
 36622                                  ;
 36623                                  ;	Revision history:
 36624                                  ;
 36625                                  ;	  AN000  version Jan. 1988
 36626                                  ;	   A001  PTM	      -- disk changed for look ahead buffers
 36627                                  ;
 36628                                  ;	M014 - if a request for pack\unpack cluster 0 is made we write\read
 36629                                  ;	       from CL0FATENTRY rather than disk.
 36630                                  
 36631                                  ; DOSCODE:94FAh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 36632                                  
 36633                                  ;Break <IsEOF - check the quantity in BX for EOF>
 36634                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36635                                  ;
 36636                                  ; Procedure Name : IsEOF
 36637                                  ;
 36638                                  ; IsEOF - check the fat value in BX for eof.
 36639                                  ;
 36640                                  ;   Inputs:	ES:BP point to DPB
 36641                                  ;		BX has fat value
 36642                                  ;   Outputs:	JAE eof
 36643                                  ;   Registers modified: none
 36644                                  ;
 36645                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36646                                  
 36647                                  IsEOF:
 36648                                  	;cmp	word [es:bp+0Dh],0FF6h
 36649 000062ED 26817E0DF60F            	CMP	word [ES:BP+DPB.MAX_CLUSTER],4096-10 ; is this 16 bit fat?
 36650 000062F3 730B                    	JAE	short EOF16			; yes, check for eof there
 36651                                  
 36652                                  ;J.K. 8/27/86
 36653                                  ;Modified to accept 0FF0h as an eof. This is to handle the diskfull case
 36654                                  ;of any media that has "F0"(Other) as a MediaByte.
 36655                                  ;Hopely, this does not create any side effect for those who may use any value
 36656                                  ;other than "FF8-FFF" as an EOF for their own file.
 36657                                  
 36658 000062F5 81FBF00F                	cmp	bx,0FF0h
 36659 000062F9 7404                    	je	short IsEOF_other
 36660                                  
 36661 000062FB 81FBF80F                	CMP	BX,0FF8h		; do the 12 bit compare
 36662                                  IsEOF_other:
 36663 000062FF C3                      	retn
 36664                                  EOF16:
 36665 00006300 83FBF8                  	CMP	BX,0FFF8h		; 16 bit compare
 36666 00006303 C3                      	retn
 36667                                  
 36668                                  ; DOSCODE:9511h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 36669                                  
 36670                                  ;Break	<UNPACK -- UNPACK FAT ENTRIES>
 36671                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36672                                  ;
 36673                                  ; Procedur Name : UNPACK
 36674                                  ;
 36675                                  ; Inputs:
 36676                                  ;	BX = Cluster number (may be full 16-bit quantity)
 36677                                  ;	ES:BP = Base of drive parameters
 36678                                  ; Outputs:
 36679                                  ;	DI = Contents of FAT for given cluster (may be full 16-bit quantity)
 36680                                  ;	Zero set means DI=0 (free cluster)
 36681                                  ;	Carry set means error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 36682                                  ; SI Destroyed, No other registers affected. Fatal error if cluster too big.
 36683                                  ;
 36684                                  ; NOTE: if BX = 0 then DI = contents of CL0FATENTRY
 36685                                  ;
 36686                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36687                                  	
 36688                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 36689                                  	; DOSCODE:94B5h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 36690                                  
 36691                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 36692                                  UNPACK:
 36693                                  	; MSDOS 6.0			; M014 - Start
 36694 00006304 09DB                    	or	bx, bx			; Q: are we unpacking cluster 0
 36695 00006306 7507                    	jnz	short up_cont		; N: proceed with normal unpack
 36696 00006308 8B3E[8100]              	mov	di,[CL0FATENTRY]	; Y: return value in CL0FATENTRY
 36697 0000630C 09FF                    	or	di,di 			; return z if di=0
 36698 0000630E C3                      	retn				; done
 36699                                  up_cont:				; M014 - End
 36700                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 & MSDOS 6.0
 36701                                  	;cmp	bx,[es:bp+0Dh]
 36702 0000630F 263B5E0D                	CMP	BX,[ES:BP+DPB.MAX_CLUSTER]
 36703 00006313 7726                    	JA	short HURTFAT
 36704 00006315 E8D600                  	CALL	MAPCLUSTER
 36705 00006318 721E                    	jc	short _DoContext
 36706 0000631A 8B3D                    	MOV	DI,[DI]
 36707 0000631C 750E                    	JNZ	short High12		; MZ if high 12 bits, go get 'em
 36708 0000631E 268B760D                	MOV	SI,[ES:BP+DPB.MAX_CLUSTER] ; MZ is this 16-bit fat?
 36709 00006322 81FEF60F                	CMP	SI,4096-10
 36710 00006326 720C                    	JB	short Unpack12		; MZ No, go 'AND' off bits
 36711 00006328 09FF                    	OR	DI,DI			; MZ set zero condition code, clears carry
 36712 0000632A EB0C                    	JMP	SHORT _DoContext 	; MZ go do context
 36713                                  High12:
 36714 0000632C D1EF                    	SHR	DI,1
 36715 0000632E D1EF                    	SHR	DI,1
 36716 00006330 D1EF                    	SHR	DI,1
 36717 00006332 D1EF                    	SHR	DI,1
 36718                                  Unpack12:
 36719 00006334 81E7FF0F                	AND	DI,0FFFh		; Clears carry
 36720                                  _DoContext:
 36721 00006338 16                      	PUSH	SS
 36722 00006339 1F                      	POP	DS
 36723 0000633A C3                      	retn
 36724                                  HURTFAT:
 36725                                  	;;mov	word [es:bp+1Eh],0FFFFh
 36726                                  	;mov	word [es:bp+1Fh],0FFFFh  ; MSDOS 6.0
 36727 0000633B 26C7461FFFFF            	MOV	word [ES:BP+DPB.FREE_CNT],-1 ; Err in FAT must force recomp of freespace
 36728 00006341 50                      	PUSH	AX
 36729 00006342 B488                    	MOV	AH,Allowed_FAIL+80h ; 88h
 36730                                  
 36731                                  ;hkn; SS override
 36732 00006344 36C606[4B03]08          	MOV	byte [SS:ALLOWED],Allowed_FAIL ; 8
 36733                                  ;
 36734                                  ; Signal Bad FAT to INT int_fatal_abort handler. We have an invalid cluster.
 36735                                  ;
 36736 0000634A BFFF0F                  	MOV	DI,0FFFh		; In case INT int_fatal_abort returns (it shouldn't)
 36737 0000634D E8BEFD                  	call	FATAL
 36738 00006350 3C03                    	CMP	AL,3
 36739 00006352 F8                      	CLC
 36740 00006353 7501                    	JNZ	short OKU_RET 		; Try to ignore bad FAT
 36741 00006355 F9                      	STC				; User said FAIL
 36742                                  OKU_RET:
 36743 00006356 58                      	POP	AX
 36744                                  hurtfat_retn:
 36745 00006357 C3                      	retn
 36746                                  
 36747                                  ; DOSCODE:9565h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 36748                                  
 36749                                  ;Break	<PACK -- PACK FAT ENTRIES>
 36750                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36751                                  ;
 36752                                  ; Procedure Name : PACK
 36753                                  ;
 36754                                  ; Inputs:
 36755                                  ;	BX = Cluster number
 36756                                  ;	DX = Data
 36757                                  ;	ES:BP = Pointer to drive DPB
 36758                                  ; Outputs:
 36759                                  ;	The data is stored in the FAT at the given cluster.
 36760                                  ;	SI,DX,DI all destroyed
 36761                                  ;	Carry set means error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 36762                                  ;	No other registers affected
 36763                                  ;
 36764                                  ; NOTE: if BX = 0 then data in DX is stored in CL0FATENTRY.
 36765                                  ;
 36766                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36767                                  
 36768                                  	; 25/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 36769                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 36770                                  PACK:
 36771                                  	; MSDOS 6.0			; M014 - start
 36772 00006358 09DB                    	or	bx,bx			; Q: are we packing cluster 0
 36773 0000635A 7505                    	jnz	short p_cont		; N: proceed with normal pack
 36774 0000635C 8916[8100]              	mov	[CL0FATENTRY],dx	; Y: place value in CL0FATENTRY
 36775 00006360 C3                      	retn				; done
 36776                                  p_cont:					; M014 - end
 36777                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 & MSDOS 6.0
 36778 00006361 E88A00                  	CALL	MAPCLUSTER
 36779 00006364 72D2                    	JC	short _DoContext
 36780 00006366 8B35                    	MOV	SI,[DI]
 36781 00006368 740B                    	JZ	short ALIGNED 		; byte (not nibble) aligned
 36782 0000636A 51                      	PUSH	CX			; move data to upper 12 bits
 36783 0000636B B104                    	MOV	CL,4
 36784 0000636D D3E2                    	SHL	DX,CL
 36785 0000636F 59                      	POP	CX
 36786 00006370 83E60F                  	AND	SI,0FH			; leave in original low 4 bits
 36787 00006373 EB14                    	JMP	SHORT PACKIN
 36788                                  ALIGNED:
 36789                                  	;cmp	word [es:bp+0Dh],0FF6h
 36790 00006375 26817E0DF60F            	CMP	word [ES:BP+DPB.MAX_CLUSTER],4096-10 ; MZ 16 bit fats?
 36791 0000637B 730A                    	JAE	short Pack16		; MZ yes, go clobber original data
 36792 0000637D 81E600F0                	AND	SI,0F000h		; MZ leave in upper 4 bits of original
 36793 00006381 81E2FF0F                	AND	DX,0FFFh		; MZ store only 12 bits
 36794 00006385 EB02                    	JMP	SHORT PACKIN		; MZ go store
 36795                                  Pack16:
 36796 00006387 31F6                    	XOR	SI,SI			; MZ no original data
 36797                                  PACKIN:
 36798 00006389 09D6                    	OR	SI,DX
 36799 0000638B 8935                    	MOV	[DI],SI
 36800                                  
 36801                                  ;hkn; SS override
 36802 0000638D 36C536[E205]            	LDS	SI,[SS:CURBUF]
 36803                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 36804 00006392 F6440540                	TEST	byte [SI+BUFFINFO.buf_flags],buf_dirty
 36805                                  					;LB. if already dirty		  ;AN000;
 36806 00006396 7507                    	JNZ	short yesdirty11	;LB.  don't increment dirty count ;AN000;
 36807                                  	; 10/06/2019
 36808 00006398 E8B705                  	call	INC_DIRTY_COUNT		;LB.				  ;AN000;
 36809                                  	
 36810                                  	;or	byte [si+5],40h
 36811 0000639B 804C0540                	OR	byte [SI+BUFFINFO.buf_flags],buf_dirty
 36812                                  yesdirty11:				;LB.				;AN000;
 36813                                  ;hkn; SS override
 36814 0000639F 36803E[7805]00          	CMP	BYTE [SS:CLUSSPLIT],0	; 15/08/2018
 36815                                  ;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 36816 000063A5 16                      	push	ss
 36817 000063A6 1F                      	pop	ds
 36818 000063A7 74AE                    	jz	short hurtfat_retn	; Carry clear
 36819 000063A9 50                      	PUSH	AX
 36820 000063AA 53                      	PUSH	BX
 36821 000063AB 51                      	PUSH	CX
 36822 000063AC A1[8E05]                	MOV	AX,[CLUSSAVE]
 36823 000063AF 8E1E[E405]              	MOV	DS,[CURBUF+2]
 36824                                  	;;;add	si,16 ; MSDOS 3.3
 36825                                  	;;add	si,20 ; MSDOS 6.0
 36826                                  	; 02/01/2024
 36827                                  	;add	si,24 ; PCDOS 7.1 
 36828 000063B3 83C618                  	ADD	SI,BUFINSIZ
 36829 000063B6 8824                    	MOV	[SI],AH
 36830                                  ;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 36831                                  	;Context DS
 36832 000063B8 16                      	push	ss
 36833 000063B9 1F                      	pop	ds
 36834                                  	
 36835 000063BA 50                      	PUSH	AX
 36836                                  	
 36837                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 36838 000063BB 8B16[9205]              	MOV	DX,[CLUSSEC+2]		;F.C. >32mb			;AN000;
 36839 000063BF 8916[0706]              	MOV	[HIGH_SECTOR],DX	;F.C. >32mb			;AN000;
 36840                                  
 36841                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 & MSDOS 6.0
 36842 000063C3 8B16[9005]              	MOV	DX,[CLUSSEC]
 36843                                  
 36844                                  	;MOV	SI,1	  ; *
 36845                                  	;XOR	AL,AL     ; *
 36846                                  	;call	GETBUFFRB ; *
 36847                                  	; 22/09/2023
 36848 000063C7 E86C03                  	call	GETBUFFRA ; *
 36849                                  
 36850 000063CA 58                      	POP	AX
 36851 000063CB 721B                    	JC	short POPP_RET
 36852 000063CD C53E[E205]              	LDS	DI,[CURBUF]
 36853                                  	
 36854                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 36855 000063D1 F6450540                	TEST	byte [DI+BUFFINFO.buf_flags],buf_dirty  
 36856                                  					;LB. if already dirty		  ;AN000;
 36857 000063D5 7507                    	JNZ	short yesdirty12	;LB.  don't increment dirty count ;AN000;
 36858 000063D7 E87805                  	call	INC_DIRTY_COUNT 	;LB.				  ;AN000;
 36859                                  	
 36860                                  	;or	byte [di+5],40h
 36861 000063DA 804D0540                	OR	byte [DI+BUFFINFO.buf_flags],buf_dirty 
 36862                                  yesdirty12:
 36863                                  	;;;add	di,16
 36864                                  	;;add	di,20 ; MSDOS 6.0
 36865                                  	;ADD	DI,BUFINSIZ
 36866                                  	;DEC	DI
 36867                                  	; 02/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 36868                                  	;add	di,23 ; PCDOS 7.1
 36869 000063DE 83C717                  	add	di,BUFINSIZ-1 ; 23 ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM
 36870                                  	
 36871                                  	;add	di,[es:bp+2]
 36872 000063E1 26037E02                	ADD	DI,[ES:BP+DPB.SECTOR_SIZE]
 36873 000063E5 8805                    	MOV	[DI],AL
 36874 000063E7 F8                      	CLC
 36875                                  POPP_RET:
 36876 000063E8 16                      	PUSH	SS
 36877 000063E9 1F                      	POP	DS
 36878 000063EA 59                      	POP	CX
 36879 000063EB 5B                      	POP	BX
 36880 000063EC 58                      	POP	AX
 36881 000063ED C3                      	retn
 36882                                  
 36883                                  ; 31/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 36884                                  
 36885                                  ;Break	<MAPCLUSTER - BUFFER A FAT SECTOR>
 36886                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36887                                  ;
 36888                                  ; Procedure Name : MAPCLUSTER
 36889                                  ;
 36890                                  ; Inputs:
 36891                                  ;	ES:BP Points to DPB
 36892                                  ;	BX Is cluster number
 36893                                  ; Function:
 36894                                  ;	Get a pointer to the cluster
 36895                                  ; Outputs:
 36896                                  ;	DS:DI Points to contents of FAT for given cluster
 36897                                  ;	DS:SI Points to start of buffer
 36898                                  ;	Zero Not set if cluster data is in high 12 bits of word
 36899                                  ;	Zero set if cluster data is in low 12 or 16 bits
 36900                                  ;	Carry set if failed.
 36901                                  ; SI is destroyed.
 36902                                  ;
 36903                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36904                                  
 36905                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 36906                                  	; DOSCODE:9601h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 36907                                  	; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 36908                                  	; DOSCODE:95A5h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 36909                                  
 36910                                  MAPCLUSTER:
 36911                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5A15h
 36912 000063EE C606[7805]00            	MOV	BYTE [CLUSSPLIT],0
 36913                                  	;SAVE	<AX,BX,CX,DX>
 36914 000063F3 50                      	push	ax
 36915 000063F4 53                      	push	bx
 36916 000063F5 51                      	push	cx
 36917 000063F6 52                      	push	dx
 36918 000063F7 89D8                    	MOV	AX,BX			; AX = BX
 36919 000063F9 26817E0DF60F            	CMP	word [ES:BP+DPB.MAX_CLUSTER],4096-10  ; MZ 16 bit fat?
 36920 000063FF 7302                    	JAE	short Map16		; MZ yes, do 16 bit algorithm
 36921 00006401 D1E8                    	SHR	AX,1			; AX = BX/2
 36922                                  Map16:	
 36923                                  	; MSDOS 6.0			; MZ skip prev => AX=2*BX
 36924 00006403 31FF                    	XOR	DI,DI ; *		; >32mb fat ;AN000;
 36925                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 36926 00006405 01D8                    	ADD	AX,BX			; AX = 1.5*fat = byte offset in fat
 36927 00006407 11FF                    	ADC	DI,DI ; * MSDOS 6.0	; >32mb fat ;DI is zero before op;AN000;
 36928 00006409 268B4E02                	MOV	CX,[ES:BP+DPB.SECTOR_SIZE]
 36929                                  
 36930                                  ;IF FastDiv
 36931                                  ;
 36932                                  ; Gross hack: 99% of all disks have 512 bytes per sector. We test for this
 36933                                  ; case and apply a really fast algorithm to get the desired results
 36934                                  ;
 36935                                  ; Divide method takes 157+4*4=173 (MOV and DIV)
 36936                                  ; Fast method takes 39+20*4=119
 36937                                  ;
 36938                                  ; This saves a bunch.
 36939                                  
 36940 0000640D 81F90002                	CMP	CX,512			; 4  Is this 512 byte sector?
 36941 00006411 7510                    	jne	short _DoDiv		; 4  for no jump
 36942 00006413 89C2                    	MOV	DX,AX			; 2  get set for remainder
 36943 00006415 81E2FF01                	AND	DX,512-1		; 4  Form remainder
 36944 00006419 88E0                    	MOV	AL,AH			; 2  Quotient in formation in AL
 36945                                  	; MDOS 3.3
 36946                                  	;shr	al,1	
 36947                                  	; MDOS 6.0
 36948 0000641B D1EF                    	shr	di,1			; 2
 36949 0000641D D0D8                    	rcr	al,1			; 2
 36950                                  	; MDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 36951 0000641F 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah			; 3
 36952 00006421 EB04                    	jmp	short DivDone		; 16
 36953                                  _DoDiv:
 36954                                  ;ENDIF
 36955                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 36956                                  	;xor	dx,dx
 36957                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 36958 00006423 89FA                    	mov	dx,di			; 2
 36959                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)	
 36960 00006425 F7F1                    	DIV	CX			; 155 AX is FAT sector # DX is sector index
 36961                                  ;IF FastDiv
 36962                                  DivDone:
 36963                                  ;ENDIF
 36964                                  	;add	ax,[es:bp+6]
 36965 00006427 26034606                	ADD	AX,[ES:BP+DPB.FIRST_FAT]
 36966 0000642B 49                      	DEC	CX			; CX is sector size - 1
 36967                                  	;SAVE	<AX,DX,CX>
 36968 0000642C 50                      	push	ax
 36969 0000642D 52                      	push	dx
 36970 0000642E 51                      	push	cx
 36971 0000642F 89C2                    	MOV	DX,AX
 36972                                  
 36973                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 36974                                  	; 22/09/2023
 36975                                  	;MOV	word [HIGH_SECTOR],0 ; *! ;F.C. >32mb  low sector #
 36976                                  	;
 36977                                  	; MDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 36978                                  	;XOR	AL,AL	   ; *
 36979                                  	;MOV	SI,1	   ; *
 36980                                  	;;invoke GETBUFFRB ; *
 36981                                  	;call	GETBUFFRB  ; *
 36982                                  	; 22/09/2023
 36983 00006431 E8FC02                  	call	GETBUFFRC  ; *!
 36984                                  
 36985                                  	;RESTORE <CX,AX,DX>		; CX is sec siz-1, AX is offset in sec
 36986 00006434 59                      	pop	cx
 36987 00006435 58                      	pop	ax
 36988 00006436 5A                      	pop	dx
 36989 00006437 724C                    	JC	short MAP_POP
 36990                                  
 36991 00006439 C536[E205]              	LDS	SI,[CURBUF]
 36992                                  	;;lea	di,[si+16]
 36993                                  	;lea	di,[si+20] ; MSDOS 6.0
 36994 0000643D 8D7C18                  	LEA	DI,[SI+BUFINSIZ]
 36995 00006440 01C7                    	ADD	DI,AX
 36996 00006442 39C8                    	CMP	AX,CX
 36997 00006444 752C                    	JNZ	short MAPRET
 36998 00006446 8A05                    	MOV	AL,[DI]
 36999                                  	;Context DS		 	;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 37000 00006448 16                      	push	ss
 37001 00006449 1F                      	pop	ds	
 37002 0000644A FE06[7805]              	INC	BYTE [CLUSSPLIT]
 37003 0000644E A2[8E05]                	MOV	[CLUSSAVE],AL
 37004 00006451 8916[9005]              	MOV	[CLUSSEC],DX
 37005                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 37006 00006455 C706[9205]0000          	MOV	WORD [CLUSSEC+2],0      ;F.C. >32mb	;AN000;
 37007 0000645B 42                      	INC	DX
 37008                                  
 37009                                  	; 22/09/2023
 37010                                  	;MOV	word [HIGH_SECTOR],0 ; *! ;F.C. >32mb FAT sector <32mb ;AN000;
 37011                                  	;
 37012                                  	; MDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 37013                                  	;XOR	AL,AL	   ; *
 37014                                  	;MOV	SI,1	   ; *
 37015                                  	;;invoke GETBUFFRB ; *
 37016                                  	;call	GETBUFFRB  ; *
 37017                                  	; 22/09/2023
 37018 0000645C E8D102                  	call	GETBUFFRC  ; *!
 37019 0000645F 7224                    	JC	short MAP_POP
 37020                                  
 37021 00006461 C536[E205]              	LDS	SI,[CURBUF]
 37022 00006465 8D7C18                  	LEA	DI,[SI+BUFINSIZ]
 37023 00006468 8A05                    	MOV	AL,[DI]
 37024                                  	;Context DS			;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 37025 0000646A 16                      	push	ss
 37026 0000646B 1F                      	pop	ds
 37027 0000646C A2[8F05]                	MOV	[CLUSSAVE+1],AL
 37028                                  
 37029                                  ;hkn; CLUSSAVE is in DOSDATA
 37030 0000646F BF[8E05]                	MOV	DI,CLUSSAVE
 37031                                  MAPRET:
 37032                                  	;RESTORE <DX,CX,BX>
 37033 00006472 5A                      	pop	dx
 37034 00006473 59                      	pop	cx
 37035 00006474 5B                      	pop	bx
 37036 00006475 31C0                    	XOR	AX,AX			; MZ allow shift to clear carry
 37037 00006477 26817E0DF60F            	CMP	word [ES:BP+DPB.MAX_CLUSTER],4096-10 ; MZ is this 16-bit fat?
 37038 0000647D 7302                    	JAE	short MapSet		; MZ no, set flags
 37039 0000647F 89D8                    	MOV	AX,BX
 37040                                  MapSet:
 37041 00006481 A801                    	TEST	AL,1			; set zero flag if not on boundary
 37042                                  	;RESTORE <AX>
 37043 00006483 58                      	pop	ax
 37044 00006484 C3                      	retn
 37045                                  
 37046                                  MAP_POP:
 37047                                  	;RESTORE <DX,CX,BX,AX>
 37048 00006485 5A                      	pop	dx
 37049 00006486 59                      	pop	cx
 37050 00006487 5B                      	pop	bx
 37051 00006488 58                      	pop	ax
 37052                                  fatread_sft_retn: ; 17/12/2022
 37053 00006489 C3                      	retn
 37054                                  
 37055                                  ; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 37056                                  ; DOSCODE:96B3h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 37057                                  ; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 37058                                  ; DOSCODE:9657h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 37059                                  
 37060                                  ;Break	<FATREAD_SFT/FATREAD_CDS -- CHECK DRIVE GET FAT>
 37061                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37062                                  ;
 37063                                  ; Procedure Name : FATREAD_SFT
 37064                                  ;
 37065                                  ; Inputs:
 37066                                  ;	ES:DI points to an SFT for the drive of interest (local only,
 37067                                  ;		giving a NET SFT will produce system crashing results).
 37068                                  ;	DS DOSDATA
 37069                                  ; Function:
 37070                                  ;	Can be used by an SFT routine (like CLOSE) to invalidate buffers
 37071                                  ;	if disk changed.
 37072                                  ;	In other respects, same as FATREAD_CDS.
 37073                                  ;	(note ES:DI destroyed!)
 37074                                  ; Outputs:
 37075                                  ;	Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 37076                                  ; NOTE: This routine may cause FATREAD_CDS to "miss" a disk change
 37077                                  ;	as far as invalidating curdir_ID is concerned.
 37078                                  ;	Since getting a true disk changed on this call is a screw up
 37079                                  ;	anyway, that's the way it goes.
 37080                                  ;
 37081                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37082                                  
 37083                                  FATREAD_SFT:
 37084 0000648A 26C46D07                	LES	BP,[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_devptr]
 37085                                  	; 27/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 37086                                  	;MOV	AL,[ES:BP+DPB.DRIVE] ; [es:bp+0]
 37087                                  	; 15/12/2022
 37088 0000648E 268A4600                	mov	AL,[ES:BP]
 37089 00006492 A2[7605]                	MOV	[THISDRV],AL
 37090 00006495 E8CFA1                  	call	GOTDPB			; Set THISDPB
 37091                                  	;CALL	FAT_GOT_DPB
 37092                                  	; 17/12/2022
 37093 00006498 E99F00                  	jmp	FAT_GOT_DPB
 37094                                  ;fatread_sft_retn:
 37095                                  	;retn
 37096                                  
 37097                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37098                                  ;
 37099                                  ; Procedure Name : FATREAD_CDS
 37100                                  ;
 37101                                  ; Inputs:
 37102                                  ;	DS:DOSDATA
 37103                                  ;	ES:DI points to an CDS for the drive of interest (local only,
 37104                                  ;		giving a NET or NUL CDS will produce system crashing results).
 37105                                  ; Function:
 37106                                  ;	If disk may have been changed, media is determined and buffers are
 37107                                  ;	flagged invalid. If not, no action is taken.
 37108                                  ; Outputs:
 37109                                  ;	ES:BP = Drive parameter block
 37110                                  ;	THISDPB = ES:BP
 37111                                  ;	THISDRV set
 37112                                  ;	Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 37113                                  ; DS preserved , all other registers destroyed
 37114                                  ;
 37115                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37116                                  
 37117                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 37118                                  	; DOSCODE:96C5h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 37119                                  	; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 37120                                  	; DOSCODE:9669h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 37121                                  
 37122                                  FATREAD_CDS:
 37123 0000649B 06                      	PUSH	ES
 37124 0000649C 57                      	PUSH	DI
 37125                                  	;les	bp,[es:di+45h]
 37126 0000649D 26C46D45                	LES	BP,[ES:DI+curdir.devptr]
 37127                                  	; 27/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 37128                                  	;MOV	AL,[ES:BP+DPB.DRIVE] ; [es:bp+0]
 37129                                  	; 15/12/2022
 37130 000064A1 268A4600                	mov	AL,[ES:BP]
 37131 000064A5 A2[7605]                	MOV	[THISDRV],AL
 37132 000064A8 E8BCA1                  	call	GOTDPB			;Set THISDPB
 37133 000064AB E88C00                  	CALL	FAT_GOT_DPB
 37134 000064AE 5F                      	POP	DI			;Get back CDS pointer
 37135 000064AF 07                      	POP	ES
 37136 000064B0 72D7                    	jc	short fatread_sft_retn
 37137 000064B2 7538                    	JNZ	short NO_CHANGE		;Media NOT changed
 37138                                  
 37139                                  ;	Media changed. We now need to find all CDS structures which use this
 37140                                  ;	DPB and invalidate their ID pointers.
 37141                                  
 37142                                  MED_CHANGE:
 37143 000064B4 31C0                    	XOR	AX,AX
 37144 000064B6 48                      	DEC	AX			; AX = -1
 37145 000064B7 1E                      	PUSH	DS
 37146 000064B8 8A0E[4700]              	MOV	CL,[CDSCOUNT]
 37147 000064BC 30ED                    	XOR	CH,CH			; CX is number of structures
 37148                                  	;lds	si,[es:di+45h]
 37149 000064BE 26C57545                	LDS	SI,[ES:DI+curdir.devptr] ; Find all CDS with this devptr
 37150                                  
 37151                                  ;hkn; SS override
 37152                                  
 37153                                  ;	Find all CDSs with this DevPtr
 37154                                  ;
 37155                                  ;	(ax) = -1
 37156                                  ;	(ds:si) = DevPtr
 37157                                  
 37158 000064C2 36C43E[3C00]            	LES	DI,[SS:CDSADDR]		; (es:di) = CDS pointer
 37159                                  frcd20: 
 37160                                  	;;test	word [es:di+43h],8000h
 37161                                  	;TEST	word [ES:DI+curdir.flags],curdir_isnet
 37162 000064C7 26F6454480              	TEST	byte [ES:DI+curdir.flags+1],(curdir_isnet>>8)
 37163 000064CC 7518                    	JNZ	short frcd25		; Leave NET guys alone!!
 37164                                  
 37165                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 37166                                  	;push	es
 37167                                  	;push	di
 37168                                  	;les	di,[es:di+45h]
 37169                                  	;;les	di,[ES:DI+curdir.devptr]
 37170                                  	;call	POINTCOMP
 37171                                  	;pop	di
 37172                                  	;pop	es
 37173                                  	;jnz	short frcd25
 37174                                  
 37175                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 37176 000064CE 263B7545                	cmp	si,[ES:DI+curdir.devptr]
 37177 000064D2 7512                    	jne	short frcd25		; no match
 37178 000064D4 8CDB                    	mov	bx,ds
 37179 000064D6 263B5D47                	cmp	bx,[ES:DI+curdir.devptr+2]
 37180 000064DA 750A                    	jne	short frcd25		; CDS not for this drive
 37181                                  
 37182                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 37183                                  	;test	[es:di+49h],ax
 37184 000064DC 26854549                	test	[ES:DI+curdir.ID],AX
 37185 000064E0 7404                    	JZ	short frcd25		; If root (0), leave root
 37186                                  	;mov	[es:di+49h],ax
 37187 000064E2 26894549                	MOV	[ES:DI+curdir.ID],AX	; else invalid
 37188                                  frcd25:	
 37189                                  	;;add	di,81  ; MSDOS 3.3
 37190                                  	;add	di,88  ; MSDOS 6.0	 
 37191 000064E6 83C758                  	ADD	DI,curdir.size		; Point to next CDS
 37192 000064E9 E2DC                    	LOOP	frcd20
 37193 000064EB 1F                      	POP	DS
 37194                                  NO_CHANGE:
 37195 000064EC C42E[8A05]              	LES	BP,[THISDPB]
 37196 000064F0 F8                      	CLC
 37197 000064F1 C3                      	retn
 37198                                  
 37199                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37200                                  ; 05/01/2024 - Retro DOS 5.0
 37201                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM - DOSCODE:0A7Fh
 37202                                  ;;;
 37203                                  chk_set_first_access:
 37204 000064F2 26837E0F00              	cmp	word [es:bp+0Fh],0	; DPB.FATSIZE
 37205 000064F7 750D                    	jnz	short chk_set_fa_1	; FAT (FAT12 or FAT16)
 37206                                  					; FAT32
 37207 000064F9 26837E21FF              	cmp	word [es:bp+21h],0FFFFh	; DPB.FREE_CNT_HW
 37208 000064FE 26C74621FFFF            	mov	word [es:bp+21h],0FFFFh	; High word of free cluster count
 37209 00006504 7505                    	jne	short chk_set_fa_2
 37210                                  chk_set_fa_1:
 37211 00006506 26837E1FFF              	cmp	word [es:bp+1Fh],0FFFFh	; DPB.FREE_CNT
 37212                                  chk_set_fa_2:
 37213 0000650B 26C7461FFFFF            	mov	word [es:bp+1Fh],0FFFFh	; Count of free clusters, -1 if unknown
 37214 00006511 7405                    	je	short chk_set_fa_3
 37215 00006513 26804E1801              	or	byte [es:bp+18h],1	; DPB.FIRST_ACCESS
 37216                                  chk_set_fa_3:
 37217 00006518 C3                      	retn
 37218                                  ;;;
 37219                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37220

 37222                                  ;Break	<Fat_Operation - miscellaneous fat stuff>
 37223                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37224                                  ;
 37225                                  ; Procedure Name : FAT_operation
 37226                                  ;
 37227                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37228                                  
 37229                                  	; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 37230                                  
 37231                                  FAT_operation:
 37232                                  	; 31/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 37233                                  FATERR:
 37234                                  	;mov	word [es:bp+1Eh],-1
 37235                                  	;mov	word [es:bp+1Fh],-1 ; MSDOS 6.0
 37236 00006519 26C7461FFFFF            	MOV	word [ES:BP+DPB.FREE_CNT],-1 
 37237                                  					; Err in FAT must force recomp of freespace
 37238                                  	;and	di,0FFh
 37239 0000651F 81E7FF00                	AND	DI,STECODE		; Put error code in DI
 37240                                  	;mov	byte [ALLOWED],18h
 37241 00006523 C606[4B03]18            	MOV	byte [ALLOWED],Allowed_FAIL+Allowed_RETRY
 37242                                  	;mov	ah,1Ah
 37243 00006528 B41A                    	MOV	AH,2+Allowed_FAIL+Allowed_RETRY ; While trying to read FAT
 37244 0000652A A0[7605]                	MOV	AL,[THISDRV]		; Tell which drive
 37245 0000652D E8E2FB                  	call	FATAL1
 37246 00006530 C42E[8A05]              	LES	BP,[THISDPB]
 37247 00006534 3C03                    	CMP	AL,3
 37248 00006536 7502                    	JNZ	short FAT_GOT_DPB	; User said retry
 37249 00006538 F9                      	STC				; User said FAIL
 37250 00006539 C3                      	retn
 37251                                  
 37252                                  FAT_GOT_DPB:
 37253                                  	;Context DS			;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 37254 0000653A 16                      	push	ss
 37255 0000653B 1F                      	pop	ds
 37256                                  	;mov	al,0Fh
 37257 0000653C B00F                    	MOV	AL,DMEDHL
 37258                                  	;mov	ah,[es:bp+1]
 37259 0000653E 268A6601                	MOV	AH,[ES:BP+DPB.UNIT]
 37260 00006542 A3[5A03]                	MOV	[DEVCALL_REQLEN],AX ; 09/09/2018 
 37261 00006545 C606[5C03]01            	MOV	BYTE [DEVCALL_REQFUNC],DEVMDCH
 37262 0000654A C706[5D03]0000          	MOV	word [DEVCALL_REQSTAT],0
 37263                                  	;;mov	al,[es:bp+16h]
 37264                                  	;mov	al,[es:bp+17h] ; MSDOS 6.0
 37265 00006550 268A4617                	MOV	AL,[ES:BP+DPB.MEDIA]
 37266 00006554 A2[6703]                	MOV	[CALLMED],AL
 37267 00006557 06                      	PUSH	ES
 37268 00006558 1E                      	PUSH	DS
 37269                                  
 37270                                  ;hkn; DEVCALL is in DOSDATA
 37271 00006559 BB[5A03]                	MOV	BX,DEVCALL
 37272                                  	;;lds	si,[es:bp+12h]
 37273                                  	;lds	si,[es:bp+13h] ; MSDOS 6.0
 37274 0000655C 26C57613                	LDS	SI,[ES:BP+DPB.DRIVER_ADDR] ; DS:SI Points to device header
 37275 00006560 07                      	POP	ES			; ES:BX Points to call header
 37276 00006561 E859ED                  	call	DEVIOCALL2
 37277                                  	;Context DS		 	;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 37278 00006564 16                      	push	ss
 37279 00006565 1F                      	pop	ds
 37280 00006566 07                      	POP	ES			; Restore ES:BP
 37281 00006567 8B3E[5D03]              	MOV	DI,[DEVCALL_REQSTAT]
 37282                                  	;test	di,8000h
 37283                                  	;jnz	short FATERR
 37284 0000656B 09FF                    	or	di,di
 37285 0000656D 78AA                    	js	short FATERR		; have error
 37286 0000656F 30E4                    	XOR	AH,AH
 37287                                  	;xchg	ah,[es:bp+17h] ; MSDOS 3.3
 37288                                  	;xchg	ah,[es:bp+18h] ; MSDOS 6.0
 37289 00006571 26866618                	XCHG	AH,[ES:BP+DPB.FIRST_ACCESS] ; Reset dpb_first_access
 37290 00006575 A0[7605]                	MOV	AL,[THISDRV]		; Use physical unit number
 37291                                  ; See if we had changed volume id by creating one on the diskette
 37292 00006578 3806[A10A]              	cmp	[VOLCHNG_FLAG],AL
 37293 0000657C 7508                    	jnz	short CHECK_BYT
 37294 0000657E C606[A10A]FF            	mov	byte [VOLCHNG_FLAG],-1
 37295 00006583 E9A500                  	jmp	GOGETBPB		; Need to get device driver to read in
 37296                                  					; new volume label.
 37297                                  CHECK_BYT:
 37298 00006586 0A26[6803]              	OR	AH,[CALLRBYT]
 37299                                  	;JNS	short CHECK_ZR		; ns = 0 or 1
 37300                                  	;JMP	short NEWDSK
 37301                                  	; 17/12/2022
 37302 0000658A 7863                    	js	short NEWDSK
 37303                                  	; 27/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 37304                                  	;JNS	short CHECK_ZR		; ns = 0 or 1
 37305                                  	;JMP	short NEWDSK
 37306                                  
 37307                                  CHECK_ZR:
 37308 0000658C 743B                    	JZ	short CHKBUFFDIRT	; jump if I don't know
 37309                                  	; 24/09/2023
 37310                                  	; cf=0 (after 'or' instruction)
 37311                                  	;CLC
 37312 0000658E C3                      	retn				; If Media not changed (NZ)
 37313                                  
 37314                                  DISK_CHNG_ERR:
 37315 0000658F 06                      	PUSH	ES
 37316 00006590 55                      	PUSH	BP
 37317                                  	;;les	bp,[es:bp+12h]
 37318                                  	;les	bp,[es:bp+13h] ; MSDOS 6.0
 37319 00006591 26C46E13                	LES	BP,[ES:BP+DPB.DRIVER_ADDR] ; Get device pointer
 37320                                  	;;test	word [es:bp+4],800h
 37321                                  	;TEST	word [ES:BP+SYSDEV.ATT],DEVOPCL ; Did it set vol id?
 37322 00006595 26F6460508              	test	byte [es:bp+SYSDEV.ATT+1],(DEVOPCL>>8)
 37323 0000659A 5D                      	POP	BP
 37324 0000659B 07                      	POP	ES
 37325 0000659C 7426                    	JZ	short FAIL_OPJ2		; Nope, FAIL
 37326 0000659E 1E                      	PUSH	DS			; Save buffer pointer for ignore
 37327 0000659F 57                      	PUSH	DI
 37328 000065A0 16                      	push	ss			;hkn; SS is DOSDATA
 37329 000065A1 1F                      	pop	ds
 37330                                  	;mov	byte [ALLOWED],18h
 37331 000065A2 C606[4B03]18            	MOV	byte [ALLOWED],Allowed_FAIL+Allowed_RETRY
 37332 000065A7 06                      	PUSH	ES
 37333 000065A8 C43E[6903]              	LES	DI,[CALLVIDM]		; Get volume ID pointer
 37334 000065AC 8C06[2A03]              	MOV	[EXTERRPT+2],ES
 37335 000065B0 07                      	POP	ES
 37336 000065B1 893E[2803]              	MOV	[EXTERRPT],DI
 37337                                  	;mov	ax,0Fh
 37338 000065B5 B80F00                  	MOV	AX,error_I24_wrong_disk
 37339 000065B8 C606[7505]01            	MOV	byte [READOP],1		; Write
 37340                                  	;invoke	HARDERR
 37341 000065BD E8C7FA                  	call	HARDERR
 37342 000065C0 5F                      	POP	DI			; Get back buffer for ignore
 37343 000065C1 1F                      	POP	DS
 37344 000065C2 3C03                    	CMP	AL,3
 37345                                  FAIL_OPJ2:
 37346 000065C4 741C                    	JZ	short FAIL_OP
 37347 000065C6 E971FF                  	JMP	FAT_GOT_DPB		; Retry
 37348                                  
 37349                                  CHKBUFFDIRT:
 37350                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 37351                                  
 37352                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 37353                                  	;lds	di,[BUFFHEAD]
 37354                                  
 37355                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 37356 000065C9 36833E[7100]00          	cmp	word [ss:DirtyBufferCount],0	; any dirty buffers ? ;hkn;
 37357 000065CF 741E                    	je	short NEWDSK			; no, skip the check
 37358 000065D1 E8F700                  	call	GETCURHEAD			; get pointer to first buffer
 37359                                  nbuffer:
 37360                                  	;cmp	al,[di+4]
 37361 000065D4 384504                  	cmp	[di+BUFFINFO.buf_ID],al	; Unit OK ?
 37362 000065D7 750D                    	jne	short lfnxt			; no, go for next buffer
 37363                                  	;test   byte [di+5],40h
 37364 000065D9 F6450540                	TEST	byte [di+BUFFINFO.buf_flags],buf_dirty	; is the buffer dirty ?
 37365 000065DD 7407                    	jz	short lfnxt			; no, go for next buffer
 37366                                  	;Context DS
 37367 000065DF 16                      	push	ss
 37368 000065E0 1F                      	pop	ds
 37369                                  	; 24/09/2023
 37370                                  	; cf=0 (after 'test' instruction)
 37371                                  	;clc
 37372 000065E1 C3                      	retn
 37373                                  
 37374                                  FAIL_OP:					; This label & code is here
 37375                                  	;Context DS				;  for reachability

 37595                                  ;SUBTTL SETVISIT,SKIPVISIT -- MANAGE BUFFER SCANS

 37597                                  ;SETVISIT:
 37598                                  ;	; 31/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 37599                                  ;	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5CAFh
 37600                                  ;; Inputs:
 37601                                  ;;      None
 37602                                  ;; Function:
 37603                                  ;;      Set up a scan of I/O buffers
 37604                                  ;; Outputs:
 37605                                  ;;      All visit flags = 0
 37606                                  ;;              NOTE: This pre-scan is needed because a hard disk error
 37607                                  ;;                    may cause a scan to stop in the middle leaving some
 37608                                  ;;                    visit flags set, and some not set.
 37609                                  ;;      DS:DI Points to [BUFFHEAD]
 37610                                  ;; No other registers altered
 37611                                  ;
 37612                                  ;       LDS     DI,[SS:BUFFHEAD] ; 15/03/2018
 37613                                  ;	PUSH    AX
 37614                                  ;       ;;XOR	AX,AX	  ;; MSDOS 2.11
 37615                                  ;	;mov	al,0DFh
 37616                                  ;	mov	al,~buf_visit
 37617                                  ;SETLOOP:
 37618                                  ;       ;;MOV	[DI+7],AL ;; MSDOS 2.11
 37619                                  ;	;and	[DI+5],al
 37620                                  ;	AND	[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_flags],AL
 37621                                  ;       LDS     DI,[DI]
 37622                                  ;       CMP     DI,-1
 37623                                  ;       JNZ     SHORT SETLOOP
 37624                                  ;       POP     AX ; 09/09/2018
 37625                                  ;	LDS     DI,[SS:BUFFHEAD] ; 15/03/2018
 37626                                  ;SVISIT_RETN:
 37627                                  ;       RETN
 37628                                  ;
 37629                                  ;SKIPVISIT:
 37630                                  ;	; 31/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 37631                                  ;	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5CC8h
 37632                                  ;
 37633                                  ;; Inputs:
 37634                                  ;;      DS:DI Points to a buffer
 37635                                  ;; Function:
 37636                                  ;;      Skip visited buffers
 37637                                  ;; Outputs:
 37638                                  ;;      DS:DI Points to next unvisited buffer
 37639                                  ;;      Zero is set if skip to LAST buffer
 37640                                  ;; No other registers altered
 37641                                  ;
 37642                                  ;       CMP     DI,-1
 37643                                  ;       ;retz
 37644                                  ;       JZ	SHORT SVISIT_RETN
 37645                                  ;
 37646                                  ;	;;CMP	BYTE [DI+7],1 ;; MSDOS 2.11
 37647                                  ;       ;;;retnz
 37648                                  ;       ;;JNZ	SHORT SVISIT_RETN
 37649                                  ;
 37650                                  ;	;test	byte [di+5],20h
 37651                                  ;	TEST	byte [DI+BUFFINFO.buf_flags],buf_visit	
 37652                                  ;	JNZ	short SKIPLOOP
 37653                                  ;	
 37654                                  ;	push	ax
 37655                                  ;	or	al,1
 37656                                  ;	pop	ax
 37657                                  ;	retn	
 37658                                  ;
 37659                                  ;SKIPLOOP:
 37660                                  ;	LDS     DI,[DI]
 37661                                  ;       JMP     SHORT SKIPVISIT

 37669                                  ;	TITLE	BUF - MSDOS buffer management
 37670                                  ;	NAME	BUF
 37671                                  
 37672                                  ;**	BUF.ASM - Low level routines for buffer cache management
 37673                                  ;
 37674                                  ;	GETCURHEAD
 37675                                  ;	ScanPlace
 37676                                  ;	PLACEBUF
 37677                                  ;	PLACEHEAD
 37678                                  ;	PointComp
 37679                                  ;	GETBUFFR
 37680                                  ;	GETBUFFRB
 37681                                  ;	FlushBuf
 37682                                  ;	BufWrite
 37683                                  ;	SET_RQ_SC_PARMS
 37684                                  ;
 37685                                  ;	Revision history:
 37686                                  ;
 37687                                  ;		AN000  version 4.00  Jan. 1988
 37688                                  ;		A004   PTM 3765 -- Disk reset failed
 37689                                  ;		M039 DB 10/17/90 - Disk write optimization
 37690                                  ;		I001   5.0 PTR 722211 - Preserve CY when in buffer in HMA
 37691                                  
 37692                                  ;Break	<GETCURHEAD -- Get current buffer header>
 37693                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37694                                  ; Procedure Name : GetCurHead
 37695                                  ; Inputs:
 37696                                  ;	 No Inputs
 37697                                  ; Function:
 37698                                  ;	Returns the pointer to the first buffer in Queue
 37699                                  ;	and updates FIRST_BUFF_ADDR
 37700                                  ;       and invalidates LASTBUFFER (recency pointer)
 37701                                  ; Outputs:
 37702                                  ;	DS:DI = pointer to the first buffer in Queue
 37703                                  ;	FIRST_BUFF_ADDR = offset ( DI ) of First buffer in Queue
 37704                                  ;       LASTBUFFER = -1
 37705                                  ; No other registers altered
 37706                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37707                                  
 37708                                  ; 04/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 37709                                  ; DOSCODE:98D2h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 37710                                  ; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 37711                                  ; DOSCODE:9876h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 37712                                  
 37713                                  GETCURHEAD:
 37714 000066CB 36C53E[6D00]            	lds	di,[ss:BufferQueue]	; Pointer to the first buffer
 37715 000066D0 36C706[1E00]FFFF        	mov	word [ss:LastBuffer],-1	; invalidate last buffer
 37716 000066D7 36893E[A712]            	mov	[ss:FIRST_BUFF_ADDR],di	; save first buffer address
 37717 000066DC C3                      	retn
 37718                                  
 37719                                  ;Break	<SCANPLACE, PLACEBUF -- PUT A BUFFER BACK IN THE POOL>
 37720                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37721                                  ; Procedure Name : ScanPlace
 37722                                  ; Inputs:
 37723                                  ;	Same as PLACEBUF
 37724                                  ; Function:
 37725                                  ;	Save scan location and call PLACEBUF
 37726                                  ; Outputs:
 37727                                  ;	DS:DI Points to saved scan location
 37728                                  ; All registers, except DS:DI, preserved.
 37729                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37730                                  ;M039: Rewritten to preserve registers.
 37731                                  
 37732                                  ;SCANPLACE:
 37733                                  ;	; 31/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 37734                                  ;	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5DDCh
 37735                                  ;	push	es
 37736                                  ;	les	si,[di]
 37737                                  ;	;les	si,[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_link]
 37738                                  ;	call	PLACEBUF
 37739                                  ;	push	es
 37740                                  ;	pop	ds
 37741                                  ;	mov	di,si
 37742                                  ;	pop	es
 37743                                  ;scanplace_retn:
 37744                                  ;	retn	
 37745                                  	
 37746                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 37747                                  SCANPLACE:
 37748 000066DD FF35                    	push	word [di]
 37749                                  	;push	word [di+BUFFINFO.buf_next] ;Save scan location
 37750 000066DF E80200                  	call	PLACEBUF
 37751 000066E2 5F                      	pop	di
 37752 000066E3 C3                      	retn
 37753                                  
 37754                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37755                                  ; Procedure Name : PlaceBuf
 37756                                  ; Input:
 37757                                  ;	DS:DI points to buffer (DS->BUFFINFO array, DI=offset in array)
 37758                                  ; Function:
 37759                                  ;	Remove buffer from queue and re-insert it in proper place.
 37760                                  ; NO registers altered
 37761                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37762                                  
 37763                                  ;procedure PLACEBUF,NEAR
 37764                                  
 37765                                  	; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 37766                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 37767                                  PLACEBUF:
 37768                                  	; 31/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 37769                                  
 37770                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 37771 000066E4 50                      	push	AX			;Save only regs we modify	;AN000;
 37772 000066E5 53                      	push	BX							;AN000;
 37773                                  	; 23/09/2023
 37774                                  	;push	SI							;AN000;
 37775                                  	
 37776 000066E6 8B05                    	mov	ax,[di]
 37777                                  	;mov	ax,[di+BUFFINFO.buf_next]
 37778 000066E8 368B1E[6D00]            	mov	bx,[ss:BufferQueue]	; bx = offset of head of list;smr;SS Override
 37779                                  	
 37780 000066ED 39D8                    	cmp	ax,bx				;Buf = last?		;AN000;
 37781 000066EF 7422                    	je	short nret			;Yes, special case	;AN000;
 37782 000066F1 39DF                    	cmp	di,bx				;Buf = first?		;AN000;
 37783 000066F3 7506                    	jne	short not_first 		;Yes, special case	;AN000;
 37784 000066F5 36A3[6D00]              	mov	[ss:BufferQueue],ax		;smr;SS Override
 37785 000066F9 EB18                    	jmp	short nret 			;Continue with repositioning;AN000;
 37786                                  not_first:
 37787                                  	; 23/09/2023
 37788 000066FB 56                      	push	si
 37789                                  	;mov	si,[di+2]
 37790 000066FC 8B7502                  	mov	SI,[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_prev]	;No, SI = prior Buf	;AN000;
 37791 000066FF 8904                    	mov	[si],ax
 37792                                  	;mov	[SI+BUFFINFO.buf_next],AX	; ax has di->buf_next	;AN000;
 37793 00006701 96                      	xchg	si,ax
 37794                                  	;mov	[si+2],ax
 37795 00006702 894402                  	mov	[SI+BUFFINFO.buf_prev],AX	;			;AN000;
 37796                                  	
 37797 00006705 8B7702                  	mov	SI,[BX+BUFFINFO.buf_prev]	;SI-> last buffer	;AN000;
 37798 00006708 893C                    	mov	[si],di
 37799                                  	;mov	[SI+BUFFINFO.buf_next],DI	;Add Buf to end of list ;AN000;
 37800 0000670A 897F02                  	mov	[BX+BUFFINFO.buf_prev],DI				;AN000;
 37801 0000670D 897502                  	mov	[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_prev],SI	;Update link in Buf too	;AN000;
 37802 00006710 891D                    	mov	[di],bx
 37803                                  	;mov	[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_next],BX				;AN000;
 37804                                  	; 23/09/2023
 37805 00006712 5E                      	pop	si
 37806                                  nret:	
 37807                                  	; 23/09/2023							;AN000;
 37808                                  	;pop	SI							;AN000;
 37809 00006713 5B                      	pop	BX							;AN000;
 37810 00006714 58                      	pop	AX							;AN000;
 37811                                  									;AN000;
 37812                                  	;cmp	byte [di+4],0FFh
 37813 00006715 807D04FF                	cmp	byte [di+BUFFINFO.buf_ID],-1	; Buffer FREE?		;AN000;
 37814 00006719 7505                            jne	short pbx			; M039: -no, jump.
 37815 0000671B 36893E[6D00]            	mov	[ss:BufferQueue],di		; M039: -yes, make it LRU.
 37816                                  pbx:	
 37817 00006720 C3                      	retn								;AN000;
 37818                                  
 37819                                  	; 31/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 37820                                  
 37821                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 37822                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5DDCh
 37823                                  
 37824                                  ;PLACEBUF:
 37825                                  ;	; 15/03/2018 - Retro DOS v2.0 (MSDOS 2.11)
 37826                                  ;	
 37827                                  ;       CALL	save_world
 37828                                  ;       LES     CX,[DI]
 37829                                  ;       CMP     CX,-1           	; Buf is LAST?
 37830                                  ;       JZ      SHORT NRET		; Buffer already last
 37831                                  ;       MOV     BP,ES           	; Pointsave = Buf.nextbuf
 37832                                  ;       PUSH    DS
 37833                                  ;       POP     ES              	; Buf is ES:DI
 37834                                  ;	; 15/03/2018
 37835                                  ;       LDS     SI,[SS:BUFFHEAD] 	; Curbuf = HEAD
 37836                                  ;       CALL    POINTCOMP       	; Buf == HEAD?
 37837                                  ;       JNZ     SHORT BUFLOOP
 37838                                  ;       MOV     [SS:BUFFHEAD],CX
 37839                                  ;       MOV     [SS:BUFFHEAD+2],BP	; HEAD = Pointsave
 37840                                  ;       JMP     SHORT LOOKEND
 37841                                  ;BUFLOOP:
 37842                                  ;	; 31/07/2018
 37843                                  ;	mov	ax,ds

 37945                                  ;Break	<POINTCOMP -- 20 BIT POINTER COMPARE>
 37946                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37947                                  ;
 37948                                  ; Procedure Name : PointComp
 37949                                  ; Inputs:
 37950                                  ;         DS:SI & ES:DI
 37951                                  ; Function:
 37952                                  ;          Checks for ((SI==DI) && (ES==DS))
 37953                                  ;	   Assumes that pointers are normalized for the
 37954                                  ;	   same segment
 37955                                  ;
 37956                                  ; Compare DS:SI to ES:DI (or DS:DI to ES:SI) for equality
 37957                                  ; DO NOT USE FOR < or >
 37958                                  ; No Registers altered
 37959                                  ;
 37960                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37961                                  
 37962                                  POINTCOMP:
 37963                                  	; 31/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 37964                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5D84h

 37973 0000672D 5A                      	POP	DX
 37974 0000672E 59                      	POP	CX
 37975                                  _ret_label:
 37976 0000672F C3                      	retn

 37978                                  ; 01/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 37979                                  ; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5D93h

 37981                                  ;Break	<GETBUFFR, GETBUFFRB -- GET A SECTOR INTO A BUFFER>
 37982                                  
 37983                                  ;**	GetBuffr - Get a non-FAT Sector into a Buffer
 37984                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 37985                                  ;	GetBuffr does normal ( non-FAT ) sector buffering
 37986                                  ;	It gets the specified local sector into one of the I/O buffers
 37987                                  ;	and shuffles the queue
 37988                                  ; 
 37989                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = 0 means sector must be pre-read
 37990                                  ;		       ELSE no pre-read
 37991                                  ;		(DX) = Desired physical sector number	      (LOW)
 37992                                  ;		HIGH_SECTOR = Desired physical sector number (HIGH)
 37993                                  ;		(ES:BP) = Pointer to drive parameters
 37994                                  ;		ALLOWED set in case of INT 24
 37995                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error (user FAIL response to INT24)
 37996                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 37997                                  ;		CURBUF Points to the Buffer for the sector
 37998                                  ;		    the buffer type bits OF buf_flags = 0, caller must set it
 37999                                  ;	USES	AX, BX, CX, SI, DI, Flags
 38000                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38001                                  
 38002                                  ;**	GetBuffrb - Get a FAT Sector into a Buffer
 38003                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38004                                  ;	GetBuffrb reads a sector from the FAT file system's FAT table.
 38005                                  ;	It gets the specified sector into one of the I/O buffers
 38006                                  ;	and shuffles the queue. We need a special entry point so that
 38007                                  ;	we can read the alternate FAT sector if the first read fails, also
 38008                                  ;	so we can mark the buffer as a FAT sector.
 38009                                  ; 
 38010                                  ;	ENTRY	(AL) = 0 means sector must be pre-read
 38011                                  ;		       ELSE no pre-read
 38012                                  ;		(DX) = Desired physical sector number	     (LOW)
 38013                                  ;		(SI) != 0
 38014                                  ;		HIGH_SECTOR = Desired physical sector number (HIGH)
 38015                                  ;		(ES:BP) = Pointer to drive parameters
 38016                                  ;		ALLOWED set in case of INT 24
 38017                                  ;	EXIT	'C' set if error (user FAIL response to INT24)
 38018                                  ;		'C' clear if OK
 38019                                  ;		CUR ddBUF Points to the Buffer for the sector
 38020                                  ;		    the buffer type bits OF buf_flags = 0, caller must set it
 38021                                  ;	USES	AX, BX, CX, SI, DI, Flags
 38022                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38023

 38367                                  ;Break	<FLUSHBUF -- WRITE OUT DIRTY BUFFERS>
 38368                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38369                                  ; Input:
 38370                                  ;	DS = DOSGROUP
 38371                                  ;	AL = Physical unit number local buffers only
 38372                                  ;	   = -1 for all units and all remote buffers
 38373                                  ; Function:
 38374                                  ;	Write out all dirty buffers for unit, and flag them as clean
 38375                                  ;	Carry set if error (user FAILed to I 24)
 38376                                  ;	    Flush operation completed.
 38377                                  ; DS Preserved, all others destroyed (ES too)
 38378                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38379                                  
 38380                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 38381                                  	; DOSCODE:9A35h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 38382

 38395 0000684C 36833E[7100]00          	cmp	word [ss:DirtyBufferCount],0			;hkn;

 38465                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38466                                  ;
 38467                                  ; Procedure Name : CHECKFLUSH
 38468                                  ;
 38469                                  ; Inputs : AL - Drive number, -1 means do not check for drive
 38470                                  ;	   DS:DI - pointer to buffer
 38471                                  ;
 38472                                  ; Function : Write out a buffer if it is dirty
 38473                                  ;
 38474                                  ; Carry set if problem (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 38475                                  ;
 38476                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38477                                  
 38478                                  CHECKFLUSH:
 38479                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 38480 00006880 B4FF                    	mov	ah,-1	; 01/08/2018 Retro DOS v3.0
 38481                                  	;cmp	[di+4],ah
 38482 00006882 386504                  	CMP	[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_ID],AH
 38483 00006885 74F8                    	jz	short flushbuf_retn	; Skip free buffer, carry clear
 38484 00006887 38C4                    	CMP	AH,AL			; 
 38485 00006889 7406                    	JZ	short DOBUFFER		; do this buffer
 38486                                  	;cmp	al,[di+4]
 38487 0000688B 3A4504                  	CMP	AL,[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_ID]
 38488 0000688E F8                      	CLC
 38489 0000688F 75EE                    	jnz	short flushbuf_retn	; Buffer not for this unit or SFT
 38490                                  DOBUFFER:
 38491                                  	;test	byte [di+5],40h
 38492 00006891 F6450540                	TEST	byte [DI+BUFFINFO.buf_flags],buf_dirty
 38493 00006895 74E8                    	jz	short flushbuf_retn	; Buffer not dirty, carry clear by TEST
 38494 00006897 50                      	PUSH	AX
 38495                                  	;push	word [di+4]
 38496 00006898 FF7504                  	PUSH	WORD [DI+BUFFINFO.buf_ID]
 38497 0000689B E80B00                  	CALL	BUFWRITE
 38498 0000689E 58                      	POP	AX
 38499 0000689F 7206                    	JC	short LEAVE_BUF		; Leave buffer marked free (lost).
 38500                                  	;and	ah,0BFh
 38501 000068A1 80E4BF                  	AND	AH,~buf_dirty		; Buffer is clean, clears carry
 38502                                  	;mov	[di+4],ax
 38503 000068A4 894504                  	MOV	[DI+BUFFINFO.buf_ID],AX
 38504                                  LEAVE_BUF:
 38505 000068A7 58                      	POP	AX			; Search info
 38506                                  checkflush_retn:
 38507 000068A8 C3                      	retn

 38509                                  ;Break	<BUFWRITE -- WRITE OUT A BUFFER IF DIRTY>
 38510                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38511                                  ;
 38512                                  ;	BufWrite writes a buffer to the disk, if it's dirty.
 38513                                  ;
 38514                                  ;	ENTRY	DS:DI Points to the buffer
 38515                                  ;
 38516                                  ;	EXIT	Buffer marked free
 38517                                  ;		Carry set if error (currently user FAILed to I 24)
 38518                                  ;
 38519                                  ;	USES	All buf DS:DI
 38520                                  ;		HIGH_SECTOR
 38521                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38522                                  
 38523                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0

 38525

 38539                                  	;test	ah,40h
 38540 000068B3 F6C440                  	test	AH,buf_dirty

 38542                                  	; MSDOS 6.0

 38544

 38548

 38550                                  	; MSDOS 6.0

 38552

 38554                                  	;les	bp,[di+13] ; MSDOS 6.0

 38556                                  	;;lea	bx,[di+16]
 38557                                  	;lea	bx,[di+20] ; MSDOS 6.0

 38559                                  	;mov	dx,[di+6]

 38586                                  NO_IGNORE:

 38617 00006902 7418                    	jz	short NBUFFINHMA

 38620 00006906 89DE                    	mov	si,bx
 38621 00006908 268B4E02                	mov	cx,[es:bp+DPB.SECTOR_SIZE]
 38622 0000690C D1E9                    	shr	cx,1
 38623 0000690E 36C43E[7A00]            	les	di,[ss:LoMemBuff] ; 10/06/2019

 38625 00006915 FC                      	cld

 38635 00006921 5B                      	pop	bx ; ******
 38636 00006922 58                      	pop	ax ; *****

 38638 00006924 5F                      	pop	di ; ***
 38639 00006925 7201                    	JC	short NOSET
 38640 00006927 47                      	INC	DI		; If at least ONE write succeedes, the operation
 38641                                  NOSET:				;	succeedes.
 38642 00006928 01C2                    	ADD	DX,AX
 38643 0000692A E2C9                    	LOOP	WRTAGAIN
 38644 0000692C 5B                      	pop	bx ; **
 38645 0000692D 1F                      	pop	ds ; *
