 38647                                  	;JNZ	short BWROK	; At least one write worked
 38648                                  	;STC			; DI never got INCed, all writes failed.
 38649                                  	; 22/09/2023
 38650 0000692E 83FF01                  	cmp	di,1
 38651                                  BWROK:	
 38652 00006931 5F                      	POP	DI
 38653 00006932 C3                      	retn

 38655                                  ;**	Set_RQ_SC_Parms - Set Secondary Cache Parameters
 38656                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 38657                                  ;	Set_RQ_SC_Parms sets the sector size and drive number value
 38658                                  ;	for the secondary cache. This updates SC_SECTOR_SIZE &
 38659                                  ;	SC_DRIVE even if SC is disabled to save the testing
 38660                                  ;	code and time
 38661                                  ;

 38685 00006944 58                      	pop	ax

 38750                                  ; (15/04/2018 - RetrO DOS v2.0, MSDOS 2.11 - PROC.ASM - 1983)
 38751                                  
 38752                                  ; Pseudo EXEC system call for DOS
 38753                                  
 38754                                  ;	TITLE	MSPROC - process maintenance
 38755                                  ;	NAME	MSPROC
 38756                                  
 38757                                  ; =========================================================================
 38758                                  ;**	Process related system calls and low level routines for DOS 2.X.
 38759                                  ;	I/O specs are defined in DISPATCH.
 38760                                  ;
 38761                                  ;	$WAIT
 38762                                  ;	$EXEC
 38763                                  ;	$Keep_process
 38764                                  ;	Stay_resident
 38765                                  ;	$EXIT
 38766                                  ;	$ABORT
 38767                                  ;	abort_inner
 38768                                  ;
 38769                                  ;	Modification history:
 38770                                  ;
 38771                                  ;		Created: ARR 30 March 1983
 38772                                  ;		AN000	version 4.0 jan. 1988
 38773                                  ;		A007	PTM 3957 - fake vesrion for IBMCACHE.COM
 38774                                  ;		A008	PTM 4070 - fake version for MS WINDOWS
 38775                                  ;
 38776                                  ;		M000	added support for loading programs into UMBs 7/9/90
 38777                                  ;
 38778                                  ;		M004 - MS PASCAL 3.2 support. Please see under tag M003 in 
 38779                                  ;		       dossym.inc. 7/30/90
 38780                                  ;		M005 - Support for EXE programs with out STACK segment and 
 38781                                  ;		       with resident size < 64K - 256 bytes. A 256 byte 
 38782                                  ;		       stack is provided at the end of the program. Note that
 38783                                  ;		       only SP is changed.
 38784                                  ;		M020 - Fix for Rational bug for details see exepatch.asm
 38785                                  ;
 38786                                  ;		M028 - 4b04 implementation
 38787                                  ;
 38788                                  ;		M029 - Support for EXEs without stack rewritten. If EXE is
 38789                                  ;			in memory block >= 64K, sp = 0. If memory block
 38790                                  ;			obtained is <64K, point sp at the end of the memory
 38791                                  ;			block. For EXEs smaller than 64K, 256 bytes are still
 38792                                  ;			added for a stack segment which may be needed if it
 38793                                  ;			is loaded in low memory situations.
 38794                                  ;
 38795                                  ;		M030 - Fixing bug in EXEPACPATCH & changing 4b04 to 4b05
 38796                                  ;
 38797                                  ;		M040 - Bug #3052. The environment sizing code would flag a
 38798                                  ;			a bad environment if it reached 32767 bytes. Changed
 38799                                  ;			to allow 32768 bytes of environment.
 38800                                  ;
 38801                                  ;		M047 - Release the allocated UMB when we failed to load a 
 38802                                  ;		       COM file high. Also ensure that if the biggest block
 38803                                  ;		       into which we load the com file is less than 64K then
 38804                                  ;		       we provide atleast 256 bytes of stack to the user.
 38805                                  ;
 38806                                  ;		M050 - Made Lie table search CASE insensitive
 38807                                  ;
 38808                                  ;		M060 - Removed special version table from the kernal and
 38809                                  ;                      put it in a device drive which puts the address
 38810                                  ;                      in the DOS DATA area location UU_IFS_DOS_CALL
 38811                                  ;		       as a DWORD.
 38812                                  ;
 38813                                  ;		M063 - Modified UMB support. If the HIGH_ONLY bit is set on
 38814                                  ;		       entry do not try to load low if there is no space in
 38815                                  ;		       UMBs.
 38816                                  ;
 38817                                  ;		M068 - Support for copy protect apps. Call ChkCopyProt to 
 38818                                  ;		       set a20off_count. Set bit EXECA20BIT in DOS_FLAG. Also
 38819                                  ;		       change return address to LeaveDos if AL=5.
 38820                                  ;
 38821                                  ;               20-Jul-1992 bens  Added ifdef RESTRICTED_BUILD code that
 38822                                  ;                      controls building a version of MSDOS.SYS that only
 38823                                  ;                      runs programs from a fixed list (defined in the
 38824                                  ;                      file RESTRICT.INC).  Search for "RESTRICTED_BUILD"
 38825                                  ;                      for details.  This feature is used to build a
 38826                                  ;                      "special" version of DOS that can be handed out to
 38827                                  ;                      OEM/ISV customers as part of a "service" disk.
 38828                                  ;
 38829                                  ; =========================================================================
 38830                                  
 38831                                  ;SAVEXIT  EQU  10
 38832                                  
 38833                                  ;BREAK	<$WAIT - return previous process error code>
 38834                                  ; =========================================================================
 38835                                  ;	$WAIT - Return previous process error code.
 38836                                  ;
 38837                                  ;	Assembler usage:
 38838                                  ;
 38839                                  ;	    MOV     AH, WaitProcess
 38840                                  ;	    INT     int_command
 38841                                  ;
 38842                                  ;	ENTRY	none
 38843                                  ;	EXIT	(ax) = exit code
 38844                                  ;	USES	all
 38845                                  ; =========================================================================
 38846                                  
 38847                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 38848                                  	; DOSCODE:9B55h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 38849                                  
 38850                                  	; 27/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 38851                                  	; DOSCODE:9A5Ah (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)	
 38852                                  _$WAIT:
 38853                                  	; 02/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 38854                                  	; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 5E1h
 38855                                  
 38856 00006966 31C0                    	xor	AX,AX
 38857 00006968 368706[3403]            	xchg	AX,[ss:exit_code]
 38858 0000696D E9009D                  	jmp	SYS_RET_OK
 38859                                  
 38860                                  ; =========================================================================
 38861                                  ;BREAK <$exec - load/go a program>
 38862                                  ;	EXEC.ASM - EXEC System Call
 38863                                  ;
 38864                                  ;
 38865                                  ; Assembler usage:
 38866                                  ;	    lds     DX, Name
 38867                                  ;	    les     BX, Blk
 38868                                  ;	    mov     AH, Exec
 38869                                  ;	    mov     AL, FUNC
 38870                                  ;	    int     INT_COMMAND
 38871                                  ;
 38872                                  ;	AL  Function
 38873                                  ;	--  --------
 38874                                  ;	 0  Load and execute the program.
 38875                                  ;	 1  Load, create the program header but do not
 38876                                  ;	    begin execution.
 38877                                  ;	 3  Load overlay. No header created.
 38878                                  ;
 38879                                  ;	    AL = 0 -> load/execute program
 38880                                  ;
 38881                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 38882                                  ;	    | WORD segment address of	|
 38883                                  ;	    | environment.		|
 38884                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 38885                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to ASCIZ	|
 38886                                  ;	    | command line at 80h	|
 38887                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 38888                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to default	|
 38889                                  ;	    | FCB to be passed at 5Ch	|
 38890                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 38891                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to default	|
 38892                                  ;	    | FCB to be passed at 6Ch	|
 38893                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 38894                                  ;
 38895                                  ;	    AL = 1 -> load program
 38896                                  ;
 38897                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 38898                                  ;	    | WORD segment address of	|
 38899                                  ;	    | environment.		|
 38900                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 38901                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to ASCIZ	|
 38902                                  ;	    | command line at 80h	|
 38903                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 38904                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to default	|
 38905                                  ;	    | FCB to be passed at 5Ch	|
 38906                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 38907                                  ;	    | DWORD pointer to default	|
 38908                                  ;	    | FCB to be passed at 6Ch	|
 38909                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 38910                                  ;	    | DWORD returned value of	|
 38911                                  ;	    | CS:IP			|
 38912                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 38913                                  ;	    | DWORD returned value of	|
 38914                                  ;	    | SS:IP			|
 38915                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 38916                                  ;
 38917                                  ;	    AL = 3 -> load overlay
 38918                                  ;
 38919                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 38920                                  ;	    | WORD segment address where|
 38921                                  ;	    | file will be loaded.	|
 38922                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 38923                                  ;	    | WORD relocation factor to |
 38924                                  ;	    | be applied to the image.	|
 38925                                  ;	    +---------------------------+
 38926                                  ;
 38927                                  ; Returns:
 38928                                  ;	    AX = error_invalid_function
 38929                                  ;	       = error_bad_format
 38930                                  ;	       = error_bad_environment
 38931                                  ;	       = error_not_enough_memory
 38932                                  ;	       = error_file_not_found
 38933                                  ; =========================================================================
 38934                                  ;
 38935                                  ;   Revision history:
 38936                                  ;
 38937                                  ;	 A000	version 4.00  Jan. 1988
 38938                                  ;
 38939                                  ; =========================================================================
 38940                                  
 38941                                  Exec_Internal_Buffer		EQU	OPENBUF

 38951                                  ;%out	RenBuf	    128

 38964

 38966                                  	; DOSCODE:9B04h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)

 38969                                  	; 02/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0

 38972                                  EXEC001S:
 38973                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_Blk		,DWORD
 38974                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_Func		,BYTE
 38975                                  	;LocalVar    Exec_Load_High	,BYTE

 39000                                  	%define		Exec_Size	word [bp-16]

 39012                                  	; ==================================================================
 39013                                  	; validate function
 39014                                  	; ==================================================================
 39015                                  		      	
 39016                                  	; M068 - Start
 39017                                  	;
 39018                                  	; Reset the A20OFF_COUNT to 0. This is done as there is a 
 39019                                  	; possibility that the count may not be decremented all the way to
 39020                                  	; 0. A typical case is if the program for which we intended to keep 
 39021                                  	; the A20  off for a sufficiently long time (A20OFF_COUNT int 21 
 39022                                  	; calls), exits pre-maturely due to error conditions.
 39023                                  
 39024                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 39025 00006970 36C606[8500]00          	mov	byte [SS:A20OFF_COUNT], 0
 39026                                  
 39027                                  	; If al=5 (ExecReady) we'll change the return address on the stack	
 39028                                  	; to be LeaveDos in msdisp.asm. This ensures that the EXECA20OFF
 39029                                  	; bit set in DOS_FLAG by ExceReady is not cleared in msdisp.asm
 39030                                  
 39031 00006976 3C05                    	cmp	al,5			; Q: is this ExecReady call
 39032                                  	;jne	short @f
 39033 00006978 7505                    	jne	short Exec_@f		; N: continue
 39034                                  					; Y: change ret addr. to LeaveDos.
 39035 0000697A 59                      	pop	cx			; Note CX is not input to ExecReady
 39036 0000697B B9[F603]                	mov	cx,LeaveDOS
 39037 0000697E 51                      	push	cx
 39038                                  ;@@:
 39039                                  Exec_@f:
 39040                                  	; M068 - End
 39041                                  	
 39042                                  	;Enter
 39043                                  
 39044 0000697F 55                      	push	bp
 39045 00006980 89E5                    	mov	bp,sp
 39046                                  	;;sub	sp,26	; MSDOS 3.3
 39047                                  	; 30/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS compatibility)	
 39048                                  	;sub	sp,29	; MSDOS 6.0 (& MSDOS 6.21)
 39049                                  	; 17/12/2022
 39050                                  	; 20/05/2019
 39051 00006982 83EC1E                  	sub	sp,30	; Retro DOS v4.0	
 39052                                  
 39053                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 39054 00006985 3C05                    	cmp	AL,5			; only 0, 1, 3 or 5 are allowed ;M028
 39055                                  					; M030
 39056 00006987 7614                    	jna	short Exec_Check_2
 39057                                  
 39058                                  	; MSDOS 3.3
 39059                                  	;cmp	AL,3
 39060                                  	;jna	short Exec_Check_2
 39061                                  
 39062                                  Exec_Bad_Fun:

 40520                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40521                                  ;SUBTTL Terminate and stay resident handler
 40522                                  ;
 40523                                  ; Input:    DX is  an  offset  from  CurrentPDB  at which to
 40524                                  ;	    truncate the current block.
 40525                                  ;
 40526                                  ; output:   The current block is truncated (expanded) to be [DX+15]/16
 40527                                  ;	    paragraphs long.  An exit is simulated via resetting CurrentPDB
 40528                                  ;	    and restoring the vectors.
 40529                                  ;
 40530                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40531                                  
 40532                                  	; 20/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 40533                                  	; DOSCODE:A19Bh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 40534

 40536                                  	; DOSCODE:A13Bh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 40537                                  
 40538                                  _$KEEP_PROCESS:
 40539 00006F96 50                      	push	AX			; keep exit code around
 40540                                  	;mov	byte [SS:EXIT_TYPE],3
 40541 00006F97 36C606[7C05]03          	mov	BYTE [SS:EXIT_TYPE],EXIT_KEEP_PROCESS
 40542 00006F9D 368E06[3003]            	mov	ES,[SS:CurrentPDB]
 40543 00006FA2 83FA06                  	cmp	DX,6h			; keep enough space around for system
 40544 00006FA5 7303                    	jae	short Keep_Shrink	; info
 40545                                  
 40546 00006FA7 BA0600                  	mov	DX,6h
 40547                                  
 40548                                  Keep_Shrink:
 40549 00006FAA 89D3                    	mov	BX,DX
 40550 00006FAC 53                      	push	BX

 40553 00006FB1 1F                      	pop	DS
 40554 00006FB2 5B                      	pop	BX
 40555 00006FB3 7207                    	jc	short Keep_Done		; failed on modification
 40556                                  
 40557 00006FB5 8CD8                    	mov	AX,DS
 40558 00006FB7 01D8                    	add	AX,BX
 40559                                  	;mov	[2],ax

 40617                                  ;BREAK <$ABORT -- Terminate a process>
 40618                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40619                                  ; Inputs:
 40620                                  ;	user_CS:00 must point to valid program header block
 40621                                  ; Function:
 40622                                  ;	Restore terminate and Cntrl-C addresses, flush buffers and transfer
 40623                                  ;	to the terminate address
 40624                                  ; Returns:
 40625                                  ;	TO THE TERMINATE ADDRESS
 40626                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40627                                  
 40628                                  _$ABORT:
 40629 00006FF2 30C0                    	xor	AL,AL

 40633                                  
 40634                                  	; abort_inner must have AL set as the exit code! The exit type
 40635                                  	; is retrieved from exit_type. Also, the PDB at user_CS needs
 40636                                  	; to be correct as the one that is terminating.
 40637                                  
 40638                                  abort_inner:

 40763                                  ;       i_need  CurrentPDB,WORD         ; current process data block addr
 40764                                  ;       i_need  FirstArena,WORD         ; first free block found
 40765                                  ;       i_need  BestArena,WORD          ; best free block found

 40769                                  ;**	Arena_Free_Process
 40770                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40771                                  ;	Free all arena blocks allocated to a prOcess
 40772                                  ;
 40773                                  ;	ENTRY	(bx) = PID of process
 40774                                  ;	EXIT	none
 40775                                  ;	USES	????? BUGBUG
 40776                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40777                                  
 40778                                  	; 01/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 40779                                  	; DOSCODE:A1C2h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 40780                                  
 40781                                  arena_free_process:
 40782                                  	; 14/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 40783                                  	; 04/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 40784 0000701D 36A1[2400]                      MOV	AX,[SS:arena_head]
 40785                                  arena_free_process_start:
 40786 00007021 BF0000                  	MOV     DI,ARENA.SIGNATURE ; 0
 40787                                  	;MOV	AX,[SS:arena_head] ; 15/04/2018  
 40788 00007024 E83000                          CALL	check_signature         ; ES <- AX, check for valid block
 40789                                  
 40790                                  arena_free_process_loop:
 40791                                          ;retc
 40792 00007027 723D                            JC	SHORT AFP_RETN	; Retro DOS v2.0 - 05/03/2018
 40793 00007029 06                      	PUSH    ES
 40794 0000702A 1F                              POP     DS
 40795                                  	;cmp	[1],bx 
 40796 0000702B 391E0100                        CMP     [ARENA.OWNER],BX	; is block owned by pid?
 40797 0000702F 7504                            JNZ     SHORT arena_free_next	; no, skip to next
 40798                                  	;mov	[1],di
 40799 00007031 893E0100                        MOV     [ARENA.OWNER],DI	; yes... free him
 40800                                  
 40801                                  arena_free_next:
 40802                                  	;cmp	byte [di],5Ah ;'Z'
 40803 00007035 803D5A                          CMP     BYTE [DI],arena_signature_end
 40804                                                                          ; end of road, Jack?
 40805                                          ;retz				; never come back no more
 40806                                  	;JZ	SHORT AFP_RETN  ; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 2.11)
 40807                                  	; 14/05/2019
 40808                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 40809 00007038 7405                    	jz	short arena_chk_umbs
 40810                                          
 40811 0000703A E81300                  	CALL    arena_next              ; next item in ES/AX carry set if trash
 40812 0000703D EBE8                            JMP     SHORT arena_free_process_loop
 40813                                  
 40814                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 40815                                  arena_chk_umbs:				; M010 - Start
 40816                                  	; 20/05/2019
 40817 0000703F 36A1[8C00]              	mov	ax,[ss:UMB_HEAD]	; ax = umb_head
 40818 00007043 83F8FF                  	cmp	ax,0FFFFh		; Q: is umb_head initialized
 40819 00007046 741E                    	je	short ret_label		; N: we're done
 40820                                  	
 40821 00007048 8CDF                    	mov	di,ds			; di = last arena
 40822 0000704A 39C7                    	cmp	di,ax			; Q: is last arena above umb_head
 40823 0000704C 7318                    	jae	short ret_label		; Y: we've scanned umbs also. done.
 40824 0000704E EBD1                    	jmp	short arena_free_process_start
 40825                                  					; M010 - End
 40826                                  ;AFP_RETN:
 40827                                  ;	RETN

 40830                                  
 40831                                  ;**	Arena_Next - Find Next item in Arena
 40832                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40833                                  ;	ENTRY	DS - pointer to block head
 40834                                  ;		(di) = 0
 40835                                  ;	EXIT	AX,ES - pointers to next head
 40836                                  ;		'C' set iff arena damaged
 40837                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40838                                  
 40839                                  arena_next:
 40840 00007050 8CD8                            MOV     AX,DS                   ; AX <- current block
 40841 00007052 03060300                        ADD     AX,[ARENA.SIZE]		; AX <- AX + current block length
 40842 00007056 40                              INC     AX                      ; remember that header!
 40843                                  
 40844                                  ;       fall into check_signature and return
 40845                                  ;
 40846                                  ;       CALL    check_signature         ; ES <- AX, carry set if error
 40847                                  ;       RETN
 40848                                  
 40849                                  ;**	Check_Signature - Check Memory Block Signature
 40850                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40851                                  ;	ENTRY	(AX) = address of block header
 40852                                  ;		(di) = 0
 40853                                  ;	EXIT	 ES = AX
 40854                                  ;		'C' clear if signature good
 40855                                  ;		'C' set if signature bad
 40856                                  ;	USES	ES, Flags
 40857                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40858                                  
 40859                                  check_signature:        
 40860                                  
 40861 00007057 8EC0                    	MOV     ES,AX                   ; ES <- AX
 40862                                  	;cmp	byte [es:di],4Dh ; 'M'
 40863 00007059 26803D4D                        CMP     BYTE [ES:DI],arena_signature_normal
 40864                                                                          ; IF next signature = not_end THEN
 40865 0000705D 7407                            JZ      SHORT check_signature_ok ;   GOTO ok
 40866                                  	;cmp 	byte [es:di],5Ah ; 'Z'
 40867 0000705F 26803D5A                        CMP     BYTE [ES:DI],arena_signature_end
 40868                                                                          ; IF next signature = end then
 40869 00007063 7401                            JZ      SHORT check_signature_ok ;   GOTO ok
 40870 00007065 F9                              STC                             ; set error
 40871                                  ret_label: ; MSDOS 6.0
 40872                                  AFP_RETN:
 40873                                   	; Retro DOS v2.0 - 05/03/2018
 40874                                  check_signature_ok:
 40875                                  COALESCE_RETN:
 40876 00007066 C3                      	RETN
 40877                                  
 40878                                  ;**	Coalesce - Combine free blocks ahead with current block
 40879                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40880                                  ;	Coalesce adds the block following the argument to the argument block,
 40881                                  ;	iff it's free.  Coalesce is usually used to join free blocks, but
 40882                                  ;	some callers (such as $setblock) use it to join a free block to it's
 40883                                  ;	preceeding allocated block.
 40884                                  ;
 40885                                  ;	ENTRY	(ds) = pointer to the head of a free block
 40886                                  ;		(di) = 0
 40887                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 40888                                  ;		  (ds) unchanged, this block updated
 40889                                  ;		  (ax) = address of next block, IFF not at end
 40890                                  ;		'C' set if arena trashed
 40891                                  ;	USES	(cx)
 40892                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40893                                          
 40894                                  Coalesce:
 40895                                  	;cmp	byte [di],5Ah ; 'Z'
 40896 00007067 803D5A                  	CMP     BYTE [DI],arena_signature_end
 40897                                                                          ; IF current signature = END THEN
 40898                                          ;retz				;   GOTO ok
 40899 0000706A 74FA                            jz	short COALESCE_RETN
 40900 0000706C E8E1FF                  	CALL    arena_next              ; ES, AX <- next block, Carry set if error
 40901                                          ;retc				; IF no error THEN GOTO check
 40902 0000706F 72F5                    	jc	short COALESCE_RETN
 40903                                  
 40904                                  coalesce_check:
 40905                                  	;cmp	[es:1],di
 40906 00007071 26393E0100                      CMP     [ES:ARENA.OWNER],DI
 40907                                          ;retnz				; IF next block isnt free THEN return
 40908 00007076 75EE                            JNZ	SHORT COALESCE_RETN
 40909                                  	;mov	cx,[ES:3]
 40910 00007078 268B0E0300              	MOV     CX,[ES:ARENA.SIZE]	; CX <- next block size
 40911 0000707D 41                              INC     CX                      ; CX <- CX + 1 (for header size)
 40912                                          ;ADD	[3],CX
 40913 0000707E 010E0300                	ADD     [ARENA.SIZE],CX		; current size <- current size + CX
 40914 00007082 268A0D                          MOV     CL,[ES:DI]              ; move up signature
 40915 00007085 880D                            MOV     [DI],CL
 40916 00007087 EBDE                            JMP     SHORT Coalesce		; try again
 40917                                  
 40918                                  ; 04/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 40919                                  ; IBMDOS.COM (MSDOS 3.3, 1987) - Offset 641Fh
 40920                                  
 40921                                  ;	BREAK  <$Alloc - allocate space in memory>
 40922                                  
 40923                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 40924                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40925                                  ;**	$Alloc - Allocate Memory Space
 40926                                  ;
 40927                                  ;	$Alloc services the INT21 that allocates memory space to a program.
 40928                                  ;	Alloc returns a pointer to a free block of memory that
 40929                                  ;	has the requested size in paragraphs.
 40930                                  ;
 40931                                  ;	If the allocation strategy is HIGH_FIRST or HIGH_ONLY memory is 
 40932                                  ;	scanned from umb_head if not from arena_head. If the strategy is
 40933                                  ; 	HIGH_FIRST the scan is continued from arena_head if a block of 
 40934                                  ;	appropriate size is not found in the UMBs. If the strategy is 
 40935                                  ;	HIGH_FIRST+HIGH_ONLY only the UMBs are scanned for memory.
 40936                                  ;
 40937                                  ;	In either case if bit 0 of UmbFlag is not initialized then the scan
 40938                                  ;	starts from arena_head.
 40939                                  ;
 40940                                  ;	Assembler usage:
 40941                                  ;           MOV     BX,size
 40942                                  ;           MOV     AH,Alloc
 40943                                  ;           INT     21h
 40944                                  ;
 40945                                  ;	BUGBUG - a lot can be done to improve performance. We can set marks
 40946                                  ;	so that we start searching the arena at it's first non-trivial free
 40947                                  ;	block, we can peephole the code, etc. (We can move some subr calls
 40948                                  ;	inline, etc.) I assume that this is called rarely and that the arena
 40949                                  ;	doesn't have too many memory objects in it beyond the first free one.
 40950                                  ;	verify that this is true; if so, this can stay as is
 40951                                  ;
 40952                                  ;	ENTRY	(bx) = requested size, in bytes
 40953                                  ;		(DS) = (ES) = DOSGROUP
 40954                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if memory allocated
 40955                                  ;		  (ax:0) = address of requested memory
 40956                                  ;		'C' set if request failed
 40957                                  ;		  (AX) = error_not_enough_memory
 40958                                  ;		    (bx) = max size we could have allocated
 40959                                  ;		  (ax) = error_arena_trashed
 40960                                  ;	USES	All
 40961                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40962                                  
 40963                                  ; MSDOS 2.11 (& MSDOS 3.3)
 40964                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40965                                  ;SUBTTL $Alloc - allocate space in memory
 40966                                  ;
 40967                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 40968                                  ;           MOV     BX,size
 40969                                  ;           MOV     AH,Alloc
 40970                                  ;           INT     21h
 40971                                  ;         AX:0 is pointer to allocated memory
 40972                                  ;         BX is max size if not enough memory
 40973                                  ;
 40974                                  ;   Description:
 40975                                  ;           Alloc returns  a  pointer  to  a  free  block of
 40976                                  ;       memory that has the requested  size  in  paragraphs.
 40977                                  ;
 40978                                  ;   Error return:
 40979                                  ;           AX = error_not_enough_memory
 40980                                  ;              = error_arena_trashed
 40981                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40982                                  
 40983                                  ; DOSCODE:A28Eh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 40984                                  
 40985                                  ; 01/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 40986                                  ; DOSCODE:A22Eh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 40987

 41016                                  	;cmp	word [UMB_HEAD],-1

 41299                                  ;	BREAK $SETBLOCK - change size of an allocated block (if possible)
 41300                                  
 41301                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 41302                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41303                                  ;**	$SETBLOCK - Change size of an Allocated Block
 41304                                  ;
 41305                                  ;	Setblock changes the size of an allocated block. First, we coalesce
 41306                                  ;	any following free space onto this block; then we try to trim the
 41307                                  ;	block down to the size requested.
 41308                                  ;
 41309                                  ;	Note that if the guy wants to grow the block but that growth fails,
 41310                                  ;	we still go ahead and coalesce any trailing free blocks onto it.
 41311                                  ;	Thus the maximum-size-possible value that we return has already
 41312                                  ;	been allocated! This is a bug, dare we fix it? BUGBUG
 41313                                  ;
 41314                                  ;	NOTE - $SETBLOCK is in bed with $ALLOC and jumps into $ALLOC to
 41315                                  ;		finish it's work. For this reason we build the allocsf
 41316                                  ;		structure on the frame, to make us compatible with $ALLOCs
 41317                                  ;		code.
 41318                                  ;
 41319                                  ;	ENTRY	(es) = segment of old block
 41320                                  ;		(bx) = newsize
 41321                                  ;		(ah) = SETBLOCK
 41322                                  ;
 41323                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 41324                                  ;		'C' set if error
 41325                                  ;		  (ax) = error_invalid_block
 41326                                  ;		       = error_arena_trashed
 41327                                  ;		       = error_not_enough_memory
 41328                                  ;		       = error_invalid_function
 41329                                  ;		  (bx) = maximum size possible, iff (ax) = error_not_enough_memory
 41330                                  ;	USES	???? BUGBUG
 41331                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41332                                  
 41333                                  ; MSDOS 2.11 (& MSDOS 3.3)
 41334                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41335                                  ;SUBTTL $SETBLOCK - change size of an allocated block (if possible)
 41336                                  ;
 41337                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 41338                                  ;           MOV     ES,block
 41339                                  ;           MOV     BX,newsize
 41340                                  ;           MOV     AH,setblock
 41341                                  ;           INT     21h
 41342                                  ;         if setblock fails for growing, BX will have the maximum
 41343                                  ;         size possible
 41344                                  ;   Error return:
 41345                                  ;           AX = error_invalid_block
 41346                                  ;              = error_arena_trashed
 41347                                  ;              = error_not_enough_memory
 41348                                  ;              = error_invalid_function
 41349                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41350                                  
 41351                                  _$SETBLOCK:        
 41352                                  	; 04/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 41353                                  	;EnterCrit   critMem
 41354 000071DF E807A7                  	call	ECritMEM ; MSDOS 3.3 & MSDOS 6.0
 41355

 41445                                  ;	BREAK $AllocOper - get/set allocation mechanism
 41446                                  
 41447                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 41448                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41449                                  ;**	$AllocOper - Get/Set Allocation Mechanism
 41450                                  ;
 41451                                  ;	Assembler usage:
 41452                                  ;           MOV     AH,AllocOper
 41453                                  ;           MOV     BX,method
 41454                                  ;           MOV     AL,func
 41455                                  ;           INT     21h
 41456                                  ;
 41457                                  ;	ENTRY	
 41458                                  ;		(al) = 0
 41459                                  ;		  Get allocation Strategy in (ax)
 41460                                  ;
 41461                                  ;		(al) = 1, (bx) = method = zw0000xy
 41462                                  ;		  Set allocation strategy.
 41463                                  ;		   w  = 1  => HIGH_ONLY
 41464                                  ;		   z  = 1  => HIGH_FIRST
 41465                                  ;		   xy = 00 => FIRST_FIT
 41466                                  ;		      = 01 => BEST_FIT
 41467                                  ;		      = 10 => LAST_FIT
 41468                                  ;
 41469                                  ;		(al) = 2
 41470                                  ;		  Get UMB link state in (al)
 41471                                  ;
 41472                                  ;		(al) = 3
 41473                                  ;		  Set UMB link state
 41474                                  ;		   (bx) = 0 => Unlink UMBs
 41475                                  ;		   (bx) = 1 => Link UMBs
 41476                                  ;
 41477                                  ;
 41478                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 41479                                  ;
 41480                                  ;		 if (al) = 0
 41481                                  ;		  (ax) = existing method
 41482                                  ;		 if (al) = 1
 41483                                  ;		  Sets allocation strategy
 41484                                  ;		 if (al) = 2
 41485                                  ;		  (al) = 0 => UMBs not linked
 41486                                  ;		  (al) = 1 => UMBs linked in
 41487                                  ;		 if (al) = 3
 41488                                  ;		  Links/Unlinks the UMBs into DOS chain
 41489                                  ;
 41490                                  ;		'C' set if error
 41491                                  ;		  AX = error_invalid_function
 41492                                  ;
 41493                                  ;	Rev. M000 - added support for HIGH_FIRST in (al) = 1. 7/9/90
 41494                                  ; 	Rev. M003 - added functions (al) = 2 and (al) = 3. 7/18/90
 41495                                  ;	Rev. M009 - (al) = 3 will return 'invalid function' in ax if
 41496                                  ;		    umbhead has'nt been initialized by sysinit and 'trashed
 41497                                  ;		    arena' if an arena sig is damaged.
 41498                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41499                                  
 41500                                  ; MSDOS 2.11 (& MSDOS 3.3)
 41501                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41502                                  ;SUBTTL $AllocOper - get/set allocation mechanism

 41678                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 41679                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41680                                  ; Procedure Name : GetLastArena		-  M003
 41681                                  ;
 41682                                  ; Inputs	 : cx = umb_head
 41683                                  ;
 41684                                  ;
 41685                                  ; Outputs	 : If UMBs are linked
 41686                                  ;			ES = umb_head
 41687                                  ;			DS = arena before umb_head
 41688                                  ;		   else
 41689                                  ;			DS = last arena
 41690                                  ;			ES = next arena. will be umb_head if NC.
 41691                                  ;
 41692                                  ;		   CY if error
 41693                                  ;
 41694                                  ; Uses		 : DS, ES, DI, BX
 41695                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41696                                  
 41697                                  ; 14/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 41698                                  ; DOSCODE:A4D6h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 41699                                  
 41700                                  ; 01/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 41701                                  ; DOSCODE:A476h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 41702                                  	
 41703                                  GetLastArena:
 41704 000072C3 50                      	push	ax			; save ax
 41705                                  
 41706 000072C4 36A1[2400]              	mov	ax,[ss:arena_head]
 41707 000072C8 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax			; es = arena_head
 41708 000072CA 31FF                    	xor	di,di
 41709                                  
 41710 000072CC 26803D5A                	cmp     byte [es:di],arena_signature_end
 41711                                  					; Q: is this the last arena
 41712 000072D0 7419                    	je	short GLA_done		; Y: return last arena in ES		
 41713                                  					
 41714                                  GLA_next:
 41715 000072D2 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 41716 000072D4 E879FD                  	call	arena_next		; ax, es -> next arena
 41717                                  	; 01/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 41718                                  	;jc	short GLA_err
 41719                                  	; 17/12/2022
 41720 000072D7 7228                    	jc	short GLA_err2
 41721                                  
 41722 000072D9 36F606[8900]01          	test	byte [ss:UMBFLAG],LINKSTATE ; Q: are UMBs linked
 41723 000072DF 7506                    	jnz	short GLA_chkumb	; Y: terminating condition is 
 41724                                  					;    umb_head
 41725                                  					; N: terminating condition is 05Ah
 41726                                  
 41727 000072E1 26803D5A                	cmp     byte [es:di],arena_signature_end
 41728                                  					; Q: is this the last arena
 41729 000072E5 EB02                    	jmp	short GLA_@f
 41730                                  GLA_chkumb:
 41731 000072E7 39C8                    	cmp	ax,cx			; Q: is this umb_head
 41732                                  GLA_@f:
 41733 000072E9 75E7                    	jne	short GLA_next		; N: get next arena
 41734                                  
 41735                                  GLA_done:
 41736                                  					; M061 - Start
 41737 000072EB 36F606[8900]01          	test	byte [ss:UMBFLAG],LINKSTATE ; Q: are UMBs linked
 41738 000072F1 750B                    	jnz	short GLA_ret		; Y: we're done
 41739                                  					; N: let us confirm that the next 
 41740                                  					;    arena is umb_head
 41741 000072F3 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 41742 000072F5 E858FD                  	call	arena_next		; ax, es -> next arena
 41743                                  	;jc	short GLA_err
 41744 000072F8 7207                    	jc	short GLA_err2
 41745 000072FA 39C8                    	cmp	ax,cx			; Q: is this umb_head
 41746 000072FC 7502                    	jne	short GLA_err		; N: error
 41747                                  					; M061 - End
 41748                                  GLA_ret:
 41749                                  	; 17/12/2022				
 41750                                  	;clc
 41751                                  	; 01/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 41752                                  	;clc
 41753 000072FE 58                      	pop	ax			; M061
 41754 000072FF C3                      	retn				; M061
 41755                                  
 41756                                  GLA_err:
 41757 00007300 F9                      	stc				; M061
 41758                                  GLA_err2:
 41759 00007301 58                      	pop	ax
 41760 00007302 C3                      	retn

 41825                                  ; Procedure Name : $ServerCall
 41826                                  ;
 41827                                  ; Inputs:
 41828                                  ;	DS:DX -> DPL  (except calls 7,8,9)
 41829                                  ; Function:
 41830                                  ;	AL=0	Server DOS call
 41831                                  ;	AL=1	Commit All files
 41832                                  ;	AL=2	Close file by name (SHARING LOADED ONLY) DS:DX in DPL -> name
 41833                                  ;	AL=3	Close all files for DPL_UID
 41834                                  ;	AL=4	Close all files for DPL_UID/PID_PID
 41835                                  ;	AL=5	Get open file list entry
 41836                                  ;		    IN: BX File Index
 41837                                  ;			CX User Index
 41838                                  ;		    OUT:ES:DI -> Name
 41839                                  ;			BX = UID
 41840                                  ;		    CX = # locked blocks held by this UID
 41841                                  ;	AL=6	Get DOS data area
 41842                                  ;		    OUT: DS:SI -> Start
 41843                                  ;			CX size in bytes of swap if indos
 41844                                  ;			DX size in bytes of swap always
 41845                                  ;	AL=7	Get truncate flag
 41846                                  ;	AL=8	Set truncate flag
 41847                                  ;	AL=9	Close all spool files
 41848                                  ;	AL=10	SetExtendedError
 41849                                  ;
 41850                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------

 42110                                  ;Break	<$SetExtendedError - set extended error for later retrieval>
 42111                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42112                                  ;
 42113                                  ; Procedure Name : $SetExtendedError
 42114                                  ;
 42115                                  ; $SetExtendedError takes extended error information and loads it up for the
 42116                                  ; next extended error call. This is used by interrupt-level proccessors to
 42117                                  ; mask their actions.
 42118                                  ;
 42119                                  ;   Inputs: DS:SI points to DPL which contains all registers
 42120                                  ;   Outputs: none
 42121                                  ;
 42122                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42123                                  
 42124                                  _$SetExtendedError:

 42164                                  ;	BREAK	<pJFNFromHandle - return pointer to JFN table entry>
 42165                                  
 42166                                  ;**	pJFNFromHandle - Translate Handle to Pointer to JFN
 42167                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42168                                  ;	pJFNFromHandle takes a file handle and turns that into a pointer to
 42169                                  ;	the JFN entry (i.e., to a byte holding the internal file handle #)
 42170                                  ;
 42171                                  ;	NOTE:
 42172                                  ;	  This routine is called from $CREATE_PROCESS_DATA_BLOCK which is called
 42173                                  ;	  at DOSINIT time with SS NOT DOSGROUP
 42174                                  ;
 42175                                  ;	ENTRY	(bx) = handle
 42176                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if ok
 42177                                  ;		  (es:di) = address of JFN value
 42178                                  ;		'C' set if error
 42179                                  ;		  (ax) = error code
 42180                                  ;	USES	AX, DI, ES, Flags
 42181                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42182                                  
 42183                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 42184                                  
 42185                                  pJFNFromHandle:
 42186                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 42187                                  	;getdseg <es>			; es -> dosdata
 42188 00007456 2E8E06[0700]            	mov	es,[cs:DosDSeg]
 42189                                  	
 42190                                  	;MOV	ES,[cs:CurrentPDB]	; get user process data block
 42191 0000745B 268E06[3003]            	mov	es,[es:CurrentPDB]
 42192                                  
 42193                                  	;cmp	bx,[ES:32h]
 42194 00007460 263B1E3200              	CMP	BX,[ES:PDB.JFN_Length]	; is handle greater than allocated
 42195 00007465 7204                    	JB	short pjfn10		; no, get offset
 42196                                  ReturnCarry_inv_hndl: ; 05/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 42197                                  	;mov	al,6
 42198 00007467 B006                    	MOV     AL,error_invalid_handle ; appropriate error
 42199                                  ReturnCarry:
 42200 00007469 F9                      	STC                             ; signal error
 42201 0000746A C3                      	retn				; go back
 42202                                  pjfn10: 
 42203                                  	;les	di,[es:34h]
 42204 0000746B 26C43E3400              	LES	DI,[ES:PDB.JFN_Pointer]	; get pointer to beginning of table
 42205 00007470 01DF                    	ADD	DI,BX			; add in offset, clear 'C'
 42206                                  	;clc
 42207                                  pJFNFromHandle_error:
 42208 00007472 C3                      	retn
 42209                                  
 42210                                  ;BREAK <SFFromHandle - return pointer (or error) to SF entry from handle>
 42211                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42212                                  ;
 42213                                  ; Procedure Name : SFFromHandle
 42214                                  ;
 42215                                  ; SFFromHandle - Given a handle, get JFN and then index into SF table
 42216                                  ;
 42217                                  ;   Input:      BX has handle
 42218                                  ;   Output:     Carry Set
 42219                                  ;                   AX has error code
 42220                                  ;               Carry Reset
 42221                                  ;                   ES:DI has pointer to SF entry
 42222                                  ;   Registers modified: If error, AX,ES, else ES:DI
 42223                                  ; NOTE:
 42224                                  ;   This routine is called from $CREATE_PROCESS_DATA_BLOCK which is called
 42225                                  ;       at DOSINIT time with SS NOT DOSGROUP
 42226                                  ;
 42227                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42228                                  
 42229                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 42230                                  
 42231                                  SFFromHandle:
 42232 00007473 E8E0FF                  	CALL	pJFNFromHandle		; get jfn pointer
 42233                                  	;retc				; return if error
 42234 00007476 72FA                    	jc	short pJFNFromHandle_error
 42235 00007478 26803DFF                	CMP     BYTE [ES:DI],-1		; unused handle
 42236                                  	;JNZ	short GetSF		; nope, suck out SF
 42237                                  	;;mov	al,6
 42238                                  	;MOV	AL,error_invalid_handle ; appropriate error
 42239                                  	;jmp	short ReturnCarry	; signal it
 42240                                  	; 17/12/2022
 42241                                  	; 02/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 42242 0000747C 74E9                    	jz	short ReturnCarry_inv_hndl ; Retro DOS v3.0 modification
 42243                                  	;JNZ	short GetSF		; nope, suck out SF
 42244                                  	;;mov	al,6
 42245                                  	;MOV	AL,error_invalid_handle ; appropriate error
 42246                                  	;jmp	short ReturnCarry	; signal it
 42247                                  GetSF:
 42248 0000747E 53                      	push	bx			; save handle
 42249 0000747F 268A1D                  	MOV     BL,[ES:DI]		; get SFN
 42250 00007482 30FF                    	XOR     BH,BH                   ; ignore upper half
 42251 00007484 E80200                  	CALL    SFFromSFN               ; get real sf spot
 42252 00007487 5B                      	pop	bx			; restore
 42253 00007488 C3                      	retn                        	; say goodbye
 42254                                  
 42255                                  ;BREAK <SFFromSFN - index into SF table for SFN>
 42256                                  
 42257                                  ;**	SFFromSFN - Get an SF Table entry from an SFN
 42258                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42259                                  ;	SFFromSfn uses an SFN to index an entry into the SF table. This
 42260                                  ;	is more than just a simple index instruction because the SF table
 42261                                  ;	can be made up of multiple pieces chained together. We follow the
 42262                                  ;	chain to the right piece and then do the index operation.
 42263                                  ;
 42264                                  ;   NOTE:
 42265                                  ;	This routine is called from SFFromHandle which is called
 42266                                  ;       at DOSINIT time with SS NOT DOSGROUP
 42267                                  ;
 42268                                  ;	ENTRY	BX has SF index
 42269                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 42270                                  ;		  ES:DI points to SF entry
 42271                                  ;		'C' set if index too large
 42272                                  ;	USES	BX, DI, ES
 42273                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42274                                  
 42275                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 42276                                  
 42277                                  SFFromSFN:
 42278                                  	; 05/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 42279                                  	;getdseg <es>			; es -> dosdata
 42280 00007489 2E8E06[0700]            	mov	es,[cs:DosDSeg]
 42281                                  
 42282                                  	;LES	DI,[CS:SFT_ADDR]	; (es:di) = start of SFT table
 42283 0000748E 26C43E[2A00]            	les	di,[es:SFT_ADDR]
 42284                                  sfsfn5:	
 42285                                  	;cmp	bx,[es:di+4]
 42286 00007493 263B5D04                	CMP	BX,[ES:DI+SFT.SFCount]	; is handle in this table?
 42287 00007497 720E                    	JB	short sfsfn7		; yes, go grab it
 42288                                  	;sub	bx,[es:di+4]
 42289 00007499 262B5D04                	SUB     BX,[ES:DI+SFT.SFCount]
 42290 0000749D 26C43D                  	les	di,[es:di] ; 14/08/2018
 42291                                  	;LES	DI,[ES:DI+SFT.SFLink]	; get next table segment
 42292 000074A0 83FFFF                  	CMP     DI,-1                   ; end of tables?
 42293 000074A3 75EE                    	JNZ	short sfsfn5		; no, try again
 42294 000074A5 F9                      	STC
 42295 000074A6 C3                      	retn				; return with error, not found
 42296                                  sfsfn7:
 42297 000074A7 50                      	push	ax
 42298                                  	;mov	ax,53 ; MSDOS 3.3
 42299                                  	;mov	ax,59 ; MSDOS 6.0
 42300                                  	;MOV	AX,SF_ENTRY.size	; put it in a nice place
 42301                                  	
 42302                                  	; 17/12/2022
 42303 000074A8 B03B                    	mov	al,SF_ENTRY.size ; 28/05/2019
 42304                                  	; 07/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 42305                                  	;mov	ax,SF_ENTRY.size ; 59
 42306                                  	
 42307 000074AA F6E3                    	MUL	BL			; (ax) = offset into this SF block
 42308 000074AC 01C7                    	ADD	DI,AX			; add base of SF block
 42309 000074AE 58                      	pop	ax
 42310                                  	;add	di,6
 42311 000074AF 83C706                  	ADD	DI,SFT.SFTable		; offset into structure, 'C' cleared
 42312 000074B2 C3                      	retn				; return with 'C' clear
 42313                                  
 42314                                  ;	BREAK <JFNFree - return a jfn pointer if one is free>
 42315                                  
 42316                                  ;**	JFNFree - Find a Free JFN Slot
 42317                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42318                                  ;	JFNFree scansthrough the JFN table and returnsa pointer to a free slot
 42319                                  ;
 42320                                  ;	ENTRY	(ss) = DOSDATA
 42321                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 42322                                  ;		  (bx) = new handle
 42323                                  ;		  (es:di) = pointer to JFN slot
 42324                                  ;		'C' set if error
 42325                                  ;		  (al) = error code
 42326                                  ;	USES	bx, di, es, flags
 42327                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42328                                  
 42329                                  JFNFree:
 42330 000074B3 31DB                    	XOR	BX,BX			; (bx) = initial JFN to try
 42331                                  jfnf1:	
 42332 000074B5 E89EFF                  	CALL	pJFNFromHandle		; get the appropriate handle
 42333 000074B8 7209                    	JC	short jfnf5		; no more handles
 42334 000074BA 26803DFF                	CMP     BYTE [ES:DI],-1		; free?
 42335 000074BE 7405                    	je	short jfnfx		; yes, carry is clear
 42336 000074C0 43                      	INC     BX                      ; no, next handle
 42337 000074C1 EBF2                    	JMP	short jfnf1		; and try again
 42338                                  
 42339                                  	; Error. 'C' set
 42340                                  jfnf5:	
 42341                                  	;mov	al,4
 42342 000074C3 B004                    	MOV	AL,error_too_many_open_files
 42343                                  jfnfx:	
 42344 000074C5 C3                      	retn				; bye
 42345                                  
 42346                                  ;	BREAK <SFNFree - Allocate a free SFN>
 42347                                  
 42348                                  ;**	SFNFree - Allocate a Free SFN/SFT
 42349                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42350                                  ;	SFNFree scans through the sf table looking for a free entry
 42351                                  ;	If it finds one it partially allocates it by setting SFT_REF_COUNT = -1
 42352                                  ;
 42353                                  ;	The problem is that we want to mark the SFT busy so that other threads
 42354                                  ;	can't allocate the SFT before we're finished marking it up.  However,
 42355                                  ;	we can't just mark it busy because we may get blown out of our open
 42356                                  ;	by INT24 and leave the thing orphaned.	To solve this we mark it
 42357                                  ;	"allocation in progress" by setting SFT_REF_COUNT = -1.  If we see
 42358                                  ;	an SFT with this value we look to see if it belongs to this user
 42359                                  ;	and process.  If it does belong to us then it must be an orphan
 42360                                  ;	and we reclaim it.
 42361                                  ;
 42362                                  ;	BUGBUG - improve the performance. I guess it's smaller to call SFFromSFN
 42363                                  ;		over and over, but we could at least set a high water mark...
 42364                                  ;		cause an N^2 loop calling slow SFFromSFN is real slow, too slow
 42365                                  ;		even though this is not a frequently called routine - jgl
 42366                                  ;
 42367                                  ;	ENTRY	(ss) = DOSDATA
 42368                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if no error
 42369                                  ;		  (bx) = SFN
 42370                                  ;		  (es:di) = pointer to SFT
 42371                                  ;		  es:[di].SFT_REF_COUNT = -1
 42372                                  ;		'C' set if error
 42373                                  ;		  (al) = error code
 42374                                  ;	USES	bx, di, es, Flags
 42375                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42376                                  
 42377                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 42378                                  	; DOSCODE:A682h (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 42379                                  
 42380                                  SFNFree:
 42381                                  	; 12/08/2018
 42382                                  	; 05/08/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 42383                                  	;
 42384                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 42385 000074C6 50                      	push	ax
 42386 000074C7 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx			; (bx) = SFN to consider
 42387                                  sfnf5:	
 42388 000074C9 53                      	push	bx
 42389 000074CA E8BCFF                  	call	SFFromSFN		; get the potential handle
 42390 000074CD 5B                      	pop	bx
 42391 000074CE 723A                    	jc	short sfnf95		; no more free SFNs
 42392 000074D0 26833D00                	cmp	word [ES:DI],0
 42393                                  	;cmp	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_Ref_Count],0 ; free?
 42394 000074D4 741D                    	je	short sfnf20			; yep, got one
 42395                                  	
 42396                                  	;cmp	word [es:di],0FFFFh ; -1
 42397 000074D6 26833DFF                	cmp	word [ES:DI],sf_busy
 42398                                  	;cmp	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count],sf_busy
 42399 000074DA 7403                    	je	short sfnf10		; special busy mark
 42400                                  sfnf7:	
 42401 000074DC 43                      	inc	bx			; try the next one
 42402 000074DD EBEA                    	jmp	short sfnf5
 42403                                  
 42404                                  ;	The SFT has the special "busy" mark; if it belongs to us then
 42405                                  ;	it was abandoned during a earlier call and we can use it.
 42406                                  ;
 42407                                  ;	(bx)	= SFN
 42408                                  ;	(es:di) = pointer to SFT
 42409                                  ;	(TOS)	= caller's (ax)
 42410                                  
 42411                                  sfnf10:	
 42412 000074DF 36A1[3E03]              	mov	ax,[SS:USER_ID]
 42413                                  	;cmp	[es:di+2Fh],ax
 42414 000074E3 2639452F                	cmp	[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_UID],ax
 42415 000074E7 75F3                    	jnz	short sfnf7		; not ours
 42416 000074E9 36A1[3C03]              	mov	ax,[SS:PROC_ID]
 42417                                  	;cmp	[es:di+31h],ax
 42418 000074ED 26394531                	cmp	[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_PID],ax
 42419 000074F1 75E9                    	jnz	short sfnf7		; can't use this one, try the next
 42420                                  
 42421                                  ;	We have an SFT to allocate
 42422                                  ;
 42423                                  ;	(bx)	= SFN
 42424                                  ;	(es:di) = pointer to SFT
 42425                                  ;	(TOS)	= caller's (ax)
 42426                                  
 42427                                  sfnf20:
 42428                                  	; cf = 0 ;; Retro DOS v3.0
 42429                                  
 42430                                  	;mov	word [es:di],0FFFFh
 42431 000074F3 26C705FFFF              	mov	word [ES:DI],sf_busy
 42432                                  					; make sure that this is allocated
 42433                                  	;mov	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count],sf_busy
 42434                                  
 42435 000074F8 36A1[3E03]              	mov	ax,[SS:USER_ID]
 42436                                  	;mov	[es:di+2Fh],ax
 42437 000074FC 2689452F                	mov	[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_UID],ax
 42438 00007500 36A1[3C03]              	mov	ax,[SS:PROC_ID]
 42439                                  	;mov	[es:di+31h],ax
 42440 00007504 26894531                	mov	[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_PID],ax
 42441                                  sfnf21: ;; Retro DOS v3.0
 42442                                  	; 02/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 42443                                  	;pop	ax
 42444                                  	;;clc
 42445                                  	;retn				; return with no error
 42446                                  	; 17/12/2022
 42447 00007508 58                      	pop	ax
 42448                                  	;clc
 42449 00007509 C3                      	retn
 42450                                  
 42451                                  ;**	Error - no more free SFNs
 42452                                  ;
 42453                                  ;	'C' set
 42454                                  ;	(TOS) = saved ax
 42455                                  
 42456                                  sfnf95: 
 42457 0000750A 58                      	pop	ax
 42458                                  	;mov	al,4
 42459 0000750B B004                    	mov	al,error_too_many_open_files
 42460 0000750D C3                      	retn				; return with 'C' and error
 42461
