 42468                                  ; DOSCODE:A72Bh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 42469                                  
 42470                                  ;	BREAK <$Close - return a handle to the system>
 42471                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42472                                  ;
 42473                                  ;**	$Close - Close a file Handle
 42474                                  ;
 42475                                  ;	BUGBUG - close gets called a LOT with invalid handles - sizzle that
 42476                                  ;		path
 42477                                  ;
 42478                                  ;	Assembler usage:
 42479                                  ;	    MOV     BX, handle
 42480                                  ;	    MOV     AH, Close
 42481                                  ;	    INT     int_command
 42482                                  ;
 42483                                  ;	ENTRY	(bx) = handle
 42484                                  ;	EXIT	<normal INT21 return convention>
 42485                                  ;	USES	all
 42486                                  ;
 42487                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42488                                  
 42489                                  ; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 42490                                  ; DOSCODE:A6CBh (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 42491                                  
 42492                                  _$CLOSE:
 42493                                  ;	Grab the SFT pointer from the JFN.
 42494                                  
 42495 0000750E E85A02                  	call	CheckOwner		; get system file entry
 42496 00007511 722B                    	jc	short CloseError	; error return
 42497 00007513 16                      	push	ss
 42498 00007514 1F                      	pop	ds			; For DOS_CLOSE
 42499 00007515 893E[9E05]              	MOV	[THISSFT],DI		; save offset of pointer
 42500 00007519 8C06[A005]              	MOV	[THISSFT+2],ES		; save segment value
 42501                                  
 42502                                  ; DS:SI point to JFN table entry.
 42503                                  ; ES:DI point to SFT
 42504                                  ;
 42505                                  ; We now examine the user's JFN entry; If the file was a 70-mode file (network
 42506                                  ; FCB, we examine the ref count on the SFT;  if it was 1, we free the JFN.
 42507                                  ; If the file was not a net FCB, we free the JFN too.
 42508                                  
 42509                                  	;CMP	word [ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_ref_count],1
 42510 0000751D 26833D01                	cmp	word [ES:DI],1		; will the SFT become free?
 42511 00007521 740A                    	jz	short FreeJFN 		; yes, free JFN anyway.
 42512                                  	;mov	al,[ES:DI+2]
 42513 00007523 268A4502                	MOV	AL,[ES:DI+SF_ENTRY.sf_mode]
 42514                                  	;and	al,0F0h
 42515 00007527 24F0                    	AND	AL,SHARING_MASK
 42516                                  	;cmp	al,70h
 42517 00007529 3C70                    	CMP	AL,SHARING_NET_FCB
 42518 0000752B 7407                    	JZ	short PostFree		; 70-mode and big ref count => free it
 42519                                  
 42520                                  ; The JFN must be freed.  Get the pointer to it and replace the contents with
 42521                                  ; -1.
 42522                                  
 42523                                  FreeJFN:
 42524 0000752D E826FF                  	call	pJFNFromHandle		;   d = pJFN (handle);
 42525 00007530 26C605FF                	MOV	BYTE [ES:DI],0FFh	; release the JFN
 42526                                  PostFree:
 42527                                  
 42528                                  ; ThisSFT is correctly set, we have DS = DOSDATA. Looks OK for a DOS_CLOSE!
 42529                                  
 42530 00007534 E8F0C1                  	call	DOS_CLOSE
 42531                                  
 42532                                  ; DOS_Close may return an error. If we see such an error, we report it but
 42533                                  ; the JFN stays closed because DOS_Close always frees the SFT!
 42534                                  
 42535 00007537 7205                    	JC	short CloseError
 42536                                  	;mov	ah,3Eh
 42537 00007539 B43E                    	MOV	AH,CLOSE		; MZ Bogus multiplan fix
 42538                                  	; 02/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 42539                                  CloseOk:
 42540 0000753B E93291                  	jmp	SYS_RET_OK
 42541                                  CloseError:
 42542 0000753E E93991                  	jmp	SYS_RET_ERR
 42543                                  
 42544                                  ;	BREAK <$Commit - commit the file>
 42545                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42546                                  ;
 42547                                  ;**	$Commit - Commit a File
 42548                                  ;
 42549                                  ;	$Commit "commits" a file to disk - all of it's buffers are
 42550                                  ;	flushed out.  BUGBUG - I'm pretty sure that $Commit doesn't update
 42551                                  ;	the directory entry, etc., so this commit is pretty useless. check
 42552                                  ;	and fix this!! jgl
 42553                                  ;
 42554                                  ;	Assembler usage:
 42555                                  ;	    MOV     BX, handle
 42556                                  ;	    MOV     AH, Commit
 42557                                  ;	    INT     int_command
 42558                                  ;
 42559                                  ;	ENTRY	(bx) = handle
 42560                                  ;	EXIT	none
 42561                                  ;	USES	all
 42562                                  ;;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 42563                                  
 42564                                  _$COMMIT:
 42565                                  ;	Grab the SFT pointer from the JFN.
 42566                                  
 42567 00007541 E82702                  	call	CheckOwner		; get system file entry
 42568 00007544 7213                    	JC	short CommitError	; error return
 42569 00007546 16                      	push	ss
 42570 00007547 1F                      	pop	ds			; For DOS_COMMIT
 42571 00007548 893E[9E05]              	MOV	[THISSFT],DI		; save offset of pointer
 42572 0000754C 8C06[A005]              	MOV	[THISSFT+2],ES		; save segment value
 42573                                  
 42574                                  ;	ThisSFT is correctly set, we have DS = DOSDATA. Looks OK for a DOS_COMMIT
 42575                                  ;
 42576                                  ;	ES:DI point to SFT
 42577                                  
 42578 00007550 E887C3                  	call	DOS_COMMIT
 42579 00007553 7204                    	JC	short CommitError
 42580                                  	; 07/12/2022
 42581                                  	;jc	short CloseError
 42582                                  	;mov	ah,68h
 42583 00007555 B468                    	MOV	AH,COMMIT
 42584                                  	; 02/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 42585                                  	;jmp	SYS_RET_OK
 42586                                  CommitOk:
 42587 00007557 EBE2                    	jmp	short CloseOk	
 42588                                  
 42589                                  CommitError:
 42590                                  	; 07/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)

 43285                                  ;Break	<CheckOwner - verify ownership of handles from server>
 43286                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43287                                  ;   CheckOwner - Due to the ability of the server to close file handles for a
 43288                                  ;   process without the process knowing it (delete/rename of open files, for
 43289                                  ;   example), it is possible for the redirector to issue a call to a handle
 43290                                  ;   that it soes not rightfully own. We check here to make sure that the
 43291                                  ;   issuing process is the owner of the SFT. At the same time, we do a
 43292                                  ;   SFFromHandle to really make sure that the SFT is good.
 43293                                  ;
 43294                                  ;	ENTRY	BX has the handle
 43295                                  ;		User_ID is the current user
 43296                                  ;	EXIT	Carry Clear => ES:DI points to SFT
 43297                                  ;		Carry Set => AX has error code
 43298                                  ;	USES	none
 43299                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43300                                  
 43301                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 43302                                  	; 21/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 43303                                  CheckOwner:
 43304                                  	; 13/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 43305                                  
 43306 0000776B E805FD                  	call	SFFromHandle
 43307 0000776E 721B                    	jc	short co_ret_label	; retc
 43308                                  
 43309 00007770 50                      	push	ax
 43310                                  
 43311                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 43312

 43327 00007785 58                      	pop	ax

 43349                                  ;	TITLE	MACRO - Pathname and macro related internal routines
 43350                                  ;	NAME	MACRO
 43351                                  
 43352                                  ;	Microsoft Confidential
 43353                                  ;	Copyright (C) Microsoft Corporation 1991
 43354                                  ;	All Rights Reserved.
 43355                                  
 43356                                  ;**	MACRO.ASM
 43357                                  ;
 43358                                  ;	$AssignOper
 43359                                  ;	FIND_DPB
 43360                                  ;	InitCDS
 43361                                  ;	$UserOper
 43362                                  ;	GetVisDrv
 43363                                  ;	GetThisDrv
 43364                                  ;	GetCDSFromDrv
 43365                                  ;
 43366                                  ;   Revision history:
 43367                                  ;
 43368                                  ;	Created: MZ 4 April 1983
 43369                                  ;		 MZ 18 April 1983   Make TransFCB handle extended FCBs
 43370                                  ;		 AR 2 June 1983     Define/Delete macro for NET redir.
 43371                                  ;		 MZ 3 Nov 83	    Fix InitCDS to reset length to 2
 43372                                  ;		 MZ 4 Nov 83	    Fix NetAssign to use STRLEN only
 43373                                  ;		 MZ 18 Nov 83	    Rewrite string processing for subtree
 43374                                  ;				    aliasing.
 43375                                  ;
 43376                                  ;   MSDOS performs several types of name translation. First, we maintain for
 43377                                  ;   each valid drive letter the text of the current directory on that drive.
 43378                                  ;   For invalid drive letters, there is no current directory so we pretend to
 43379                                  ;   be at the root. A current directory is either the raw local directory
 43380                                  ;   (consisting of drive:\path) or a local network directory (consisting of
 43381                                  ;   \\machine\path. There is a limit on the point to which a .. is allowed.
 43382                                  ;
 43383                                  ;   Given a path, MSDOS will transform this into a real from-the-root path
 43384                                  ;   without . or .. entries. Any component that is > 8.3 is truncated to
 43385                                  ;   this and all * are expanded into ?'s.
 43386                                  ;
 43387                                  ;   The second part of name translation involves subtree aliasing. A list of
 43388                                  ;   subtree pairs is maintained by the external utility SUBST. The results of
 43389                                  ;   the previous 'canonicalization' are then examined to see if any of the
 43390                                  ;   subtree pairs is a prefix of the user path. If so, then this prefix is
 43391                                  ;   replaced with the other subtree in the pair.
 43392                                  ;
 43393                                  ;   A third part involves mapping this "real" path into a "physical" path.  A
 43394                                  ;   list of drive/subtree pairs are maintained by the external utility JOIN.
 43395                                  ;   The output of the previous translation is examined to see if any of the
 43396                                  ;   subtrees in this list are a prefix of the string. If so, then the prefix
 43397                                  ;   is replaced by the appropriate drive letter. In this manner, we can
 43398                                  ;   'mount' one device under another.
 43399                                  ;
 43400                                  ;   The final form of name translation involves the mapping of a user's
 43401                                  ;   logical drive number into the internal physical drive. This is
 43402                                  ;   accomplished by converting the drive number into letter:CON, performing
 43403                                  ;   the above translation and then converting the character back into a drive
 43404                                  ;   number.
 43405                                  ;
 43406                                  ;   There are two main entry points: TransPath and TransFCB. TransPath will
 43407                                  ;   take a path and form the real text of the pathname with all . and ..
 43408                                  ;   removed. TransFCB will translate an FCB into a path and then invoke
 43409                                  ;   TransPath.
 43410                                  ;
 43411                                  ;	A000	version 4.00  Jan. 1988
 43412                                  
 43413                                  ;Installed = TRUE
 43414                                  
 43415                                  ;	I_need	ThisCDS,DWORD		; pointer to CDS used
 43416                                  ;	I_need	CDSAddr,DWORD		; pointer to CDS table
 43417                                  ;	I_need	CDSCount,BYTE		; number of CDS entries
 43418                                  ;	I_need	CurDrv,BYTE		; current macro assignment (old
 43419                                  ;					; current drive)
 43420                                  ;	I_need	NUMIO,BYTE		; Number of physical drives
 43421                                  ;	I_need	fSharing,BYTE		; TRUE => no redirection allowed
 43422                                  ;	I_need	DummyCDS,80h		; buffer for dummy cds
 43423                                  ;	I_need	DIFFNAM,BYTE		; flag for MyName being set
 43424                                  ;	I_need	MYNAME,16		; machine name
 43425                                  ;	I_need	MYNUM,WORD		; machine number
 43426                                  ;	I_need	DPBHEAD,DWORD		; beginning of DPB chain
 43427                                  ;	I_need	EXTERR_LOCUS,BYTE	; Extended Error Locus
 43428                                  ;	I_need	DrvErr,BYTE		; drive error
 43429                                  
 43430                                  ;BREAK <$AssignOper -- Set up a Macro>
 43431                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43432                                  ; Inputs:
 43433                                  ;	AL = 00 get assign mode 		    (ReturnMode)
 43434                                  ;	AL = 01 set assign mode 		    (SetMode)
 43435                                  ;	AL = 02 get attach list entry		    (GetAsgList)
 43436                                  ;	AL = 03 Define Macro (attch start)
 43437                                  ;	    BL = Macro type
 43438                                  ;	       = 0 alias
 43439                                  ;	       = 1 file/device
 43440                                  ;	       = 2 drive
 43441                                  ;	       = 3 Char device -> network
 43442                                  ;	       = 4 File device -> network
 43443                                  ;	    DS:SI -> ASCIZ source name
 43444                                  ;	    ES:DI -> ASCIZ destination name
 43445                                  ;	AL = 04 Cancel Macro
 43446                                  ;	    DS:SI -> ASCIZ source name
 43447                                  ;	AL = 05 Modified get attach list entry
 43448                                  ;	AL = 06 Get ifsfunc item
 43449                                  ;	AL = 07 set in_use of a drive's CDS
 43450                                  ;	     DL = drive number, 0=default  0=A,,
 43451                                  ;	AL = 08 reset in_use of a drive's CDS
 43452                                  ;	     DL = drive number, 0=A, 1=B,,,
 43453                                  ; Function:
 43454                                  ;	Do macro stuff
 43455                                  ; Returns:
 43456                                  ;	Std Xenix style error return
 43457                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43458                                  
 43459                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 43460                                  	; 21/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 43461                                  _$AssignOper:
 43462                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 43463 0000778C 3C07                    	CMP	AL,7			      ; set in_use ?		;AN000;

 43487 000077AD EB13                    	JMP	SHORT okdone		      ; 			;AN000;
 43488                                  
 43489                                  	; 17/12/2022
 43490                                  baddrv: 								;AN000;
 43491 000077AF B80F00                  	MOV	AX,error_invalid_drive	      ; error			;AN000;
 43492                                  
 43493                                  	; 02/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 43494                                  	;JMP	SHORT ASS_ERR		      ; 			;AN000;
 43495                                  	; 17/12/2022
 43496                                  	; 21/05/2019
 43497                                  ASS_ERR:
 43498 000077B2 E9C58E                  	jmp	SYS_RET_ERR
 43499                                  
 43500                                  chk08:									;AN000;
 43501 000077B5 3C08                    	CMP	AL,8			      ; reset inuse ?		;AN000;
 43502 000077B7 74D7                    	JZ	short srinuse 		      ; yes			;AN000;

 43626                                  ;Break <$UserOper - get/set current user ID (for net)>
 43627                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43628                                  ;   $UserOper - retrieve or initiate a user id string.	MSDOS will only
 43629                                  ;	maintain this string and do no verifications.
 43630                                  ;
 43631                                  ;   Inputs:	AL has function type (0-get 1-set 2-printer-set 3-printer-get
 43632                                  ;				      4-printer-set-flags,5-printer-get-flags)
 43633                                  ;		DS:DX is user string pointer (calls 1,2)
 43634                                  ;		ES:DI is user buffer (call 3)
 43635                                  ;		BX is assign index (calls 2,3,4,5)
 43636                                  ;		CX is user number (call 1)
 43637                                  ;		DX is flag word (call 4)
 43638                                  ;   Outputs:	If AL = 0 then the current user string is written to DS:DX
 43639                                  ;			and user CX is set to the user number
 43640                                  ;		If AL = 3 then CX bytes have been put at input ES:DI
 43641                                  ;		If AL = 5 then DX is flag word
 43642                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43643                                  
 43644                                  	; 02/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)

 43648                                  	; MSDOS 6.0 (& MSDOS 3.3)

 43653 0000782D 742E                    	JZ	short UserSet 		; set the current user

 43693 00007862 89D6                    	MOV	SI,DX			; user space has source

 43902                                  ;BREAK <TransFCB - convert an FCB into a path, doing substitution>
 43903                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43904                                  ;   TransFCB - Copy an FCB from DS:DX into a reserved area doing all of the
 43905                                  ;       gritty substitution.
 43906                                  ;
 43907                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:DX - pointer to FCB
 43908                                  ;               ES:DI - point to destination
 43909                                  ;   Outputs:    Carry Set - invalid path in final map
 43910                                  ;               Carry Clear - FCB has been mapped into ES:DI
 43911                                  ;                   Sattrib is set from possibly extended FCB
 43912                                  ;                   ExtFCB set if extended FCB found
 43913                                  ;   Registers modified: most
 43914                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43915                                  
 43916                                  	; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 43917                                  TransFCB:
 43918                                  	; 22/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 43919                                  	; 12/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 43920                                  	;LocalVar FCBTmp,16
 43921                                  	;ENTER
 43922 0000790C 55                      	push	bp
 43923 0000790D 89E5                    	mov	bp,sp
 43924                                  	;sub	sp,15	; MSDOS 3.3
 43925 0000790F 83EC10                  	sub	sp,16	; MSDOS 6.0
 43926 00007912 16                      	push	ss
 43927 00007913 07                      	pop	es
 43928 00007914 06                      	push	es
 43929 00007915 57                      	push	di
 43930                                  	;lea	di,[bp-15] ; MSDOS 3.3
 43931                                  	;LEA	DI,FCBTmp 
 43932 00007916 8D7EF0                  	lea	di,[bp-16]		; point to FCB temp area
 43933 00007919 36C606[6C05]00          	mov	byte [SS:EXTFCB],0	; no extended FCB found ;smr;SS Override
 43934 0000791F 36C606[6D05]00          	mov	byte [SS:SATTRIB],0	; default search attributes;smr;SS Override
 43935 00007925 E82FA9                  	call	GetExtended             ; get FCB, extended or not
 43936                                  	; 06/12/2022
 43937 00007928 740D                    	jz	short GetDrive		; not an extended FCB, get drive
 43938 0000792A 8A44FF                  	mov	AL,[SI-1]               ; get attributes
 43939 0000792D 36A2[6D05]              	mov	[SS:SATTRIB],AL		; store search attributes;smr;SS Override
 43940 00007931 36C606[6C05]FF          	mov	byte [SS:EXTFCB],-1	; signal extended FCB  ;smr;SS Override
 43941                                  GetDrive:
 43942 00007937 AC                      	lodsb				; get drive byte
 43943 00007938 E85CFF                  	call	GETTHISDRV
 43944 0000793B 722A                    	jc	short BadPack
 43945 0000793D E87303                  	call	TextFromDrive           ; convert 0-based drive to text
 43946                                  
 43947                                  ; Scan the source to see if there are any illegal chars
 43948                                  
 43949                                  	;mov	bx,CharType		; load lookup table
 43950 00007940 B90B00                  	mov	cx,11
 43951 00007943 56                      	push	si			; back over name, ext
 43952                                  FCBScan:
 43953 00007944 AC                      	lodsb				; get a byte
 43954                                  	
 43955                                  	; 09/08/2018
 43956                                  	;;xlat	byte [es:bx]
 43957                                  	;es	xlat
 43958                                  
 43959                                  	; 22/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0	
 43960 00007945 E8BAE4                  	call	GetCharType		; get flags
 43961                                  
 43962                                  	;test	al,8

 43964 0000794A 741B                    	jz	short BadPack
 43965                                  NextCh:

 43967 0000794E 5E                      	pop	si
 43968 0000794F 89FB                    	mov	bx,di
 43969 00007951 E861AD                  	call	PackName                ; crunch the path
 43970 00007954 5F                      	pop	di			; get original destination
 43971 00007955 07                      	pop	es
 43972 00007956 16                      	push	ss			; get DS addressability
 43973 00007957 1F                      	pop	ds
 43974                                  	;lea	si,[bp-15] ; MSDOS 3.3
 43975                                  	;LEA	SI,FCBTmp		; point at new pathname
 43976 00007958 8D76F0                  	lea	si,[bp-16]
 43977 0000795B 803F00                  	cmp	byte [bx],0
 43978 0000795E 7407                    	jz	short BadPack
 43979 00007960 55                      	push	bp
 43980 00007961 E80E00                  	call	TransPathSet            ; convert the path
 43981 00007964 5D                      	pop	bp
 43982 00007965 7303                    	jnc	short FCBRet		; bye with transPath error code
 43983                                  BadPack:

 43985                                  	;mov	al,3
 43986 00007968 B003                    	MOV     AL,error_path_not_found
 43987                                  FCBRet: 
 43988                                  	;LEAVE
 43989 0000796A 89EC                    	mov	sp,bp
 43990 0000796C 5D                      	pop	bp
 43991                                  TransPath_retn:
 43992 0000796D C3                      	retn
 43993                                  
 43994                                  ; 12/07/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 43995                                  
 43996                                  ;BREAK <TransPath - copy a path, do string sub and put in current dir>
 43997                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 43998                                  ;
 43999                                  ;   TransPath - copy a path from DS:SI to ES:DI, performing component string
 44000                                  ;       substitution, insertion of current directory and fixing . and ..
 44001                                  ;       entries. Perform splicing. Allow input string to match splice
 44002                                  ;       exactly.
 44003                                  ;
 44004                                  ;   TransPathSet - Same as above except No splicing is performed if input path
 44005                                  ;       matches splice.
 44006                                  ;
 44007                                  ;   TransPathNoSet - No splicing/local using is performed at all.
 44008                                  ;
 44009                                  ;   The following anomalous behaviour is required:
 44010                                  ;
 44011                                  ;       Drive letters on devices are ignored. (set up DummyCDS)
 44012                                  ;       Paths on devices are ignored. (truncate to 0-length)
 44013                                  ;       Raw net I/O sets ThisCDS => NULL.
 44014                                  ;       fSharing => dummyCDS and no subst/splice. Only canonicalize.
 44015                                  ;
 44016                                  ;   Other behaviour:
 44017                                  ;
 44018                                  ;       ThisCDS set up.
 44019                                  ;       FatRead done on local CDS.
 44020                                  ;       ValidateCDS done on local CDS.
 44021                                  ;
 44022                                  ;   Brief flowchart:
 44023                                  ;
 44024                                  ;       if fSharing then
 44025                                  ;           set up DummyCDS (ThisCDS)
 44026                                  ;           canonicalize (sets cMeta)
 44027                                  ;           splice
 44028                                  ;           fatRead
 44029                                  ;           return
 44030                                  ;       if \\ or d:\\ lead then
 44031                                  ;           set up null CDS (ThisCDS)
 44032                                  ;           canonicalize (sets cMeta)
 44033                                  ;           return
 44034                                  ;       if device then
 44035                                  ;           set up dummyCDS (ThisCDS)
 44036                                  ;           canonicalize (sets cMeta)
 44037                                  ;           return
 44038                                  ;       if file then
 44039                                  ;           getCDS (sets (ThisCDS) from name)
 44040                                  ;           validateCDS (may reset current dir)
 44041                                  ;           Copy current dir
 44042                                  ;           canonicalize (set cMeta)
 44043                                  ;           splice
 44044                                  ;           generate correct CDS (ThisCDS)
 44045                                  ;           if local then
 44046                                  ;               fatread
 44047                                  ;           return
 44048                                  ;
 44049                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI - point to ASCIZ string path
 44050                                  ;               DI - point to buffer in DOSDATA
 44051                                  ;   Outputs:    Carry Set - invalid path specification: too many .., bad
 44052                                  ;                   syntax, etc. or user FAILed to I 24.
 44053                                  ;               WFP_Start - points to beginning of buffer
 44054                                  ;               Curr_Dir_End - points to end of current dir in path
 44055                                  ;               DS - DOSDATA
 44056                                  ;   Registers modified: most
 44057                                  ;
 44058                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44059                                  
 44060                                  ; 22/05/2019
 44061                                  ; 13/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 44062                                  ; DOSCODE:AB99h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 44063                                  
 44064                                  ; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 44065                                  ; DOSCODE:AB39h (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 44066                                  
 44067                                  TransPath:
 44068 0000796E 30C0                    	XOR     AL,AL
 44069 00007970 EB02                    	JMP     SHORT SetSplice
 44070                                  TransPathSet:
 44071 00007972 B0FF                    	MOV     AL,-1
 44072                                  SetSplice:
 44073 00007974 36A2[4C03]              	MOV	[SS:NoSetDir],AL	;   NoSetDir = !fExact; ;smr;SS Override
 44074 00007978 B0FF                    	MOV     AL,-1
 44075                                  TransPathNoSet:
 44076 0000797A 36A2[7105]              	MOV	[SS:FSPLICE],AL		;   fSplice = TRUE;     ;smr;SS Override
 44077 0000797E 36C606[7A05]FF          	MOV	byte [ss:CMETA],-1      			;smr;SS Override
 44078 00007984 36893E[B205]            	MOV     [SS:WFP_START],DI 				;smr;SS Override
 44079 00007989 36C706[B605]FFFF        	MOV	word [SS:CURR_DIR_END],-1 ; crack from start	;smr;SS Override
 44080 00007990 16                      	push	ss
 44081 00007991 07                      	pop	es
 44082                                  	;lea	bp,[di+134]
 44083 00007992 8DAD8600                	LEA     BP,[DI+TEMPLEN]         ; end of buffer
 44084                                  ;
 44085                                  ; if this is through the server dos call, fsharing is set. We set up a
 44086                                  ; dummy cds and let the operation go.
 44087                                  ;
 44088 00007996 36F606[7205]FF          	TEST	byte [SS:FSHARING],-1	; if no sharing		;smr;SS Override
 44089 0000799C 7435                    	JZ	short CheckUNC		; skip to UNC check
 44090                                  ;
 44091                                  ; ES:DI point to buffer
 44092                                  ;
 44093 0000799E E8FC02                  	CALL	DriveFromText           ; get drive and advance DS:SI
 44094 000079A1 E8F3FE                  	call	GETTHISDRV              ; Set ThisCDS and convert to 0-based
 44095 000079A4 722A                    	jc	short NoPath
 44096 000079A6 E80A03                  	CALL	TextFromDrive		; drop in new
 44097 000079A9 8D5D01                  	LEA	BX,[DI+1]               ; backup limit
 44098 000079AC E83401                  	CALL	Canonicalize            ; copy and canonicalize
 44099 000079AF 72BC                    	jc	short TransPath_retn	; errors
 44100                                  ;
 44101                                  ; Perform splices for net guys.
 44102                                  ;
 44103 000079B1 16                      	push	ss
 44104 000079B2 1F                      	pop	ds
 44105 000079B3 8B36[B205]              	MOV     SI,[WFP_START] 		; point to name
 44106 000079B7 F606[7105]FF            	TEST	byte [FSPLICE],-1
 44107 000079BC 7403                    	JZ	short NoServerSplice
 44108 000079BE E83102                  	CALL    Splice
 44109                                  NoServerSplice:
 44110 000079C1 16                      	push	ss
 44111 000079C2 1F                      	pop	ds                      ; for FATREAD
 44112 000079C3 C43E[A205]              	LES     DI,[THISCDS]		; for fatread
 44113 000079C7 E81F9F                  	call	ECritDisk
 44114 000079CA E8CEEA                  	call	FATREAD_CDS
 44115 000079CD E8469F                  	call	LCritDisk
 44116                                  NoPath:
 44117                                  	;mov	al,3
 44118 000079D0 B003                    	MOV     AL,error_path_not_found ; Set up for possible bad path error
 44119 000079D2 C3                      	retn				; any errors are in Carry flag
 44120                                  
 44121                                  ; Let the network decide if the name is for a spooled device. It will map
 44122                                  ; the name if so.
 44123                                  
 44124                                  CheckUNC:
 44125 000079D3 36C706[A205]FFFF        	MOV     WORD [SS:THISCDS],-1	; NULL thisCDS		;smr;SS Override
 44126                                  	;CallInstall NetSpoolCheck,MultNET,35
 44127 000079DA B82311                  	mov	ax,1123h
 44128 000079DD CD2F                    	int	2Fh	; Multiplex - NETWORK REDIRECTOR - QUALIFY REMOTE FILENAME
 44129                                  			; DS:SI -> ASCIZ filename to canonicalize
 44130                                  			; ES:DI -> 128-byte buffer for qualified name
 44131                                  			; Return: CF set if not resolved
 44132 000079DF 7329                    	JNC	short UNCDone
 44133                                  
 44134                                  ; At this point the name is either a UNC-style name (prefixed with two leading
 44135                                  ; \\s) or is a local file/device. Remember that if a net-spooled device was
 44136                                  ; input, then the name has been changed to the remote spooler by the above net
 44137                                  ; call. Also, there may be a drive in front of the \\.
 44138                                  
 44139                                  NO_CHECK:
 44140 000079E1 E8B902                  	CALL    DriveFromText		; eat drive letter
 44141 000079E4 50                      	PUSH    AX                      ; save it
 44142 000079E5 8B04                    	MOV     AX,[SI]			; get first two bytes of path
 44143 000079E7 E833E4                  	call    PATHCHRCMP              ; convert to normal form
 44144 000079EA 86E0                    	XCHG    AH,AL                   ; swap for second byte
 44145 000079EC E82EE4                  	call    PATHCHRCMP              ; convert to normal form
 44146 000079EF 751F                    	JNZ	short CheckDevice	; not a path char
 44147 000079F1 38C4                    	CMP     AH,AL                   ; are they same?
 44148 000079F3 751B                    	JNZ	short CheckDevice	; nope
 44149                                  
 44150                                  ; We have a UNC request. We must copy the string up to the beginning of the
 44151                                  ; local machine root path
 44152                                  
 44153 000079F5 58                      	POP     AX
 44154 000079F6 A5                      	MOVSW                           ; get the lead \\.
 44155                                  UNCCpy:
 44156 000079F7 AC                      	LODSB                           ; get a byte
 44157 000079F8 E8CFE3                   	call	UCase                   ;AN000;; convert the char
 44158 000079FB 08C0                    	OR      AL,AL
 44159 000079FD 740E                    	JZ	short UNCTerm		; end of string. All done.
 44160 000079FF E81BE4                  	call    PATHCHRCMP              ; is it a path char?
 44161 00007A02 89FB                    	MOV     BX,DI                   ; backup position
 44162 00007A04 AA                      	STOSB
 44163 00007A05 75F0                    	JNZ	short UNCCpy		; no, go copy
 44164 00007A07 E8D900                  	CALL    Canonicalize            ; wham (and set cMeta)
 44165                                  UNCDone:
 44166 00007A0A 16                      	push	ss
 44167 00007A0B 1F                      	pop	ds
 44168 00007A0C C3                       	retn				; return error code
 44169                                  UNCTerm:
 44170 00007A0D AA                      	STOSB                           ;AN000;
 44171 00007A0E EBFA                    	JMP	short UNCDone		;AN000;
 44172                                  
 44173                                  CheckDevice:
 44174                                  
 44175                                  ; Check DS:SI for device. First eat any path stuff
 44176                                  
 44177 00007A10 58                      	POP     AX                      ; retrieve drive info
 44178 00007A11 803C00                  	CMP     BYTE [SI],0		; check for null file
 44179 00007A14 7504                    	JNZ	short CheckPath
 44180                                  	;mov	al,2 
 44181 00007A16 B002                    	MOV     AL,error_file_not_found ; bad file error
 44182 00007A18 F9                      	STC                             ; signal error on null input
 44183 00007A19 C3                      	RETN				; bye!
 44184                                  CheckPath:
 44185 00007A1A 50                      	push	ax
 44186 00007A1B 55                      	push	bp			; save drive number
 44187                                  
 44188                                  
 44189                                  ; 04/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 44190                                  %if 0
 44191                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 44192                                  ;;;BUGBUG BUG 10-26-1992 scottq
 44193                                  ;;;This is a hack for the CDROM extensions (2.1) who scan looking
 44194                                  ;;;for the following POP BP == 5Dh (restore <bp,ax>).
 44195                                  ;;;The problem is that a direct call to CheckThisDevice can (and did)
 44196                                  ;;;end up having a 5D in the opcode's displacement field. The
 44197                                  ;;;scanning code would choke on this thinking it was a POP BP instruction.
 44198                                  ;;;
 44199                                  ;;;What we do here is do a call to a function that is less than 5Dh
 44200                                  ;;;bytes away (and assert its not exactly 5D away) that jmps (transfers)
 44201                                  ;;;to the correct function. This cannot accidently insert a 5Dh.
 44202                                  ;;;
 44203                                  ;;;More info:
 44204                                  ;;;  This particular scan is begun at the UNCdone label for 32 bytes
 44205                                  ;;;looking for pop BP, so you cannot put a 5D between here and there.
 44206                                  ;;;
 44207                                  	call	no5Dshere
 44208                                  start5Dhack:
 44209                                  ;following is replaced with 5Dhack code--Invoke CheckThisDevice
 44210                                  backfrom5Dhack:
 44211                                  
 44212                                  %endif
 44213                                  	; 04/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 44214                                  	; Note: 'call no5Dshere' is not required for MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS
 44215 00007A1C E830D5                  	call    CheckThisDevice	; E8h,6Fh,0D6h
 44216                                  
 44217 00007A1F 5D                      	pop	bp
 44218 00007A20 58                      	pop	ax			; get drive letter back
 44219 00007A21 731C                    	JNC	short DoFile		; yes we have a file.
 44220                                  
 44221                                  ; We have a device. AX has drive letter. At this point we may fake a CDS ala
 44222                                  ; sharing DOS call. We know by getting here that we are NOT in a sharing DOS
 44223                                  ; call.
 44224                                  
 44225 00007A23 36C606[7205]FF          	MOV	byte [SS:FSHARING],-1	; simulate sharing dos call;smr;SS Override
 44226 00007A29 E86BFE                  	call	GETTHISDRV              ; set ThisCDS and init DUMMYCDS
 44227 00007A2C 36C606[7205]00          	MOV     byte [SS:FSHARING],0	;                       ;smr;SS Override
 44228                                  
 44229                                  ; Now that we have noted that we have a device, we put it into a form that
 44230                                  ; getpath can understand. Normally getpath requires d:\ to begin the input
 44231                                  ; string. We relax this to state that if the d:\ is present then the path
 44232                                  ; may be a file. If D:/ (note the forward slash) is present then we have
 44233                                  ; a device.
 44234                                  
 44235 00007A32 E87E02                  	CALL    TextFromDrive
 44236 00007A35 B02F                    	MOV     AL,'/'                  ; path sep.
 44237 00007A37 AA                      	STOSB
 44238 00007A38 E8749D                  	call	StrCpy			; move remainder of string
 44239                                  
 44240 00007A3B F8                      	CLC                             ; everything OK.
 44241 00007A3C 16                      	push	ss
 44242 00007A3D 1F                      	pop	ds                      ; remainder of OK stuff
 44243                                  DoFile_retn:
 44244 00007A3E C3                      	retn
 44245                                  
 44246                                  ; 04/12/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS compatibility)
 44247                                  %if 0
 44248                                  
 44249                                  no5Dshere:
 44250                                  	; 10/08/2018
 44251                                  	jmp	CheckThisDevice		; snoop for device
 44252                                  %endif
 44253                                  
 44254                                  ;.erre (no5Dshere - start5Dhack - 5D)
 44255                                  
 44256                                  ; We have a file. Get the raw CDS.
 44257                                  
 44258                                  DoFile:
 44259                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 44260                                  
 44261 00007A3F E839FE                  	call	GetVisDrv               ; get proper CDS
 44262                                  	;mov	al,3 
 44263 00007A42 B003                    	MOV     AL,error_path_not_found ; Set up for possible bad file error
 44264 00007A44 72F8                    	jc	short DoFile_retn  ; CARRY set -> bogus drive/spliced
 44265                                  
 44266                                  ; ThisCDS has correct CDS. DS:SI advanced to point to beginning of path/file.
 44267                                  ; Make sure that CDS has valid directory; ValidateCDS requires a temp buffer
 44268                                  ; Use the one that we are going to use (ES:DI).
 44269                                  
 44270                                  	;SAVE    <DS,SI,ES,DI>		; save all string pointers.
 44271 00007A46 1E                      	push	ds
 44272 00007A47 56                      	push	si
 44273 00007A48 06                      	push	es
 44274 00007A49 57                      	push	di
 44275 00007A4A E835D4                  	call	ValidateCDS             ; poke CDS and make everything OK
 44276                                  	;RESTORE <DI,ES,SI,DS>		; get back pointers
 44277 00007A4D 5F                      	pop	di
 44278 00007A4E 07                      	pop	es
 44279 00007A4F 5E                      	pop	si
 44280 00007A50 1F                      	pop	ds
 44281                                  	;mov	al,3
 44282 00007A51 B003                    	MOV     AL,error_path_not_found ; Set up for possible bad path error
 44283                                  	;retc				; someone failed an operation
 44284 00007A53 72E9                    	jc	short DoFile_retn
 44285                                  
 44286                                  ; ThisCDS points to correct CDS. It contains the correct text of the
 44287                                  ; current directory. Copy it in.
 44288                                  
 44289 00007A55 1E                      	push	ds
 44290 00007A56 56                      	push	si
 44291 00007A57 36C536[A205]            	LDS     SI,[SS:THISCDS]		; point to CDS	;smr;SS Override
 44292 00007A5C 89FB                    	MOV     BX,DI                   ; point to destination
 44293                                  	;add	bx,[si+79] ; MSDOS 6.0
 44294 00007A5E 035C4F                  	ADD     BX,[SI+curdir.end]	; point to backup limit
 44295                                  	;lea	bp,[di+134]
 44296 00007A61 8DAD8600                	LEA     BP,[DI+TEMPLEN]         ; regenerate end of buffer
 44297                                  					;AN000;
 44298 00007A65 E8569D                  	call	FStrCpy                 ; copy string. ES:DI point to end
 44299 00007A68 4F                      	DEC     DI                      ; point to NUL byte
 44300                                  
 44301                                  ; Make sure that there is a path char at end.
 44302                                  
 44303 00007A69 B05C                    	MOV     AL,'\'
 44304 00007A6B 263845FF                	CMP     [ES:DI-1],AL
 44305 00007A6F 7401                    	JZ	short GetOrig
 44306 00007A71 AA                      	STOSB
 44307                                  
 44308                                  ; Now get original string.
 44309                                  
 44310                                  GetOrig:
 44311 00007A72 4F                      	DEC     DI                      ; point to path char
 44312 00007A73 5E                      	pop	si
 44313 00007A74 1F                      	pop	ds
 44314                                  
 44315                                  ; BX points to the end of the root part of the CDS (at where a path char
 44316                                  ; should be). Now, we decide whether we use this root or extend it with the
 44317                                  ; current directory. See if the input string begins with a leading 
 44319 00007A75 E8D000                  	CALL    PathSep                 ; is DS:SI a path sep?
 44320 00007A78 7511                    	JNZ	short PathAssure	; no, DI is correct. Assure a path char
 44321 00007A7A 08C0                    	OR      AL,AL                   ; end of string?
 44322 00007A7C 7410                    	JZ	short DoCanon		; yes, skip.
 44323                                  ;
 44324                                  ; The string does begin with a \. Reset the beginning of the canonicalization
 44325                                  ; to this root. Make sure that there is a path char there and advance the
 44326                                  ; source string over all leading \'s.
 44327                                  ;
 44328 00007A7E 89DF                    	MOV     DI,BX                   ; back up to root point.
 44329                                  SkipPath:
 44330 00007A80 AC                      	LODSB
 44331 00007A81 E899E3                  	call    PATHCHRCMP
 44332 00007A84 74FA                    	JZ	short SkipPath
 44333 00007A86 4E                      	DEC     SI
 44334 00007A87 08C0                    	OR      AL,AL
 44335 00007A89 7403                    	JZ	short DoCanon
 44336                                  
 44337                                  ; DS:SI start at some file name. ES:DI points at some path char. Drop one in
 44338                                  ; for yucks.
 44339                                  
 44340                                  PathAssure:
 44341 00007A8B B05C                    	MOV     AL,'\'	; 5Ch
 44342 00007A8D AA                      	STOSB
 44343                                  
 44344                                  ; ES:DI point to the correct spot for canonicalization to begin.
 44345                                  ; BP is the max extent to advance DI
 44346                                  ; BX is the backup limit for ..
 44347                                  
 44348                                  DoCanon:
 44349 00007A8E E85200                  	CALL    Canonicalize            ; wham.
 44350                                  	;retc				; badly formatted path.
 44351 00007A91 72AB                    	jc	short DoFile_retn
 44352                                  
 44353                                  ; The string has been moved to ES:DI. Reset world to DOS context, pointers
 44354                                  ; to wfp_start and do string substitution. BP is still the max position in
 44355                                  ; buffer.
 44356                                  
 44357 00007A93 16                      	push	ss
 44358 00007A94 1F                      	pop	ds
 44359 00007A95 8B3E[B205]              	MOV     DI,[WFP_START]		; DS:SI point to string
 44360 00007A99 C536[A205]              	LDS     SI,[THISCDS]		; point to CDS
 44361 00007A9D E81B02                  	CALL    PathPref                ; is there a prefix?
 44362 00007AA0 7514                    	JNZ	short DoSplice		; no, do splice
 44363                                  
 44364                                  ; We have a match. Check to see if we ended in a path char.
 44365                                  
 44366 00007AA2 8A44FF                  	MOV     AL,[SI-1]		; last char to match
 44367 00007AA5 E875E3                  	call    PATHCHRCMP              ; did we end on a path char? (root)
 44368 00007AA8 740C                    	JZ	short DoSplice		; yes, no current dir here.
 44369                                  Pathline:                               ; 2/13/KK
 44370 00007AAA 26803D00                	CMP     BYTE [ES:DI],0		; end at NUL?
 44371 00007AAE 7406                    	JZ	short DoSplice
 44372 00007AB0 47                      	INC     DI                      ; point to after current path char
 44373 00007AB1 36893E[B605]            	MOV     [SS:CURR_DIR_END],DI	; point to correct spot ;smr;SS Override
 44374                                  
 44375                                  ; Splice the result.
 44376                                  
 44377                                  DoSplice:
 44378 00007AB6 16                      	push	ss
 44379 00007AB7 1F                      	pop	ds			; back to DOSDATA
 44380 00007AB8 8B36[B205]              	MOV     SI,[WFP_START]		; point to beginning of string
 44381 00007ABC 31C9                    	XOR     CX,CX
 44382 00007ABE F606[7105]FF            	TEST	byte [FSPLICE],-1
 44383 00007AC3 7403                    	JZ	short SkipSplice
 44384 00007AC5 E82A01                  	CALL    Splice                  ; replaces in place.
 44385                                  SkipSplice:
 44386                                  
 44387                                  ; The final thing is to assure ourselves that a FATREAD is done on the local
 44388                                  ; device.
 44389                                  
 44390 00007AC8 16                      	push	ss
 44391 00007AC9 1F                      	pop	ds
 44392 00007ACA C43E[A205]              	LES     DI,[THISCDS]		; point to correct drive
 44393                                  	;test	word [es:di+67],8000h
 44394                                  	; 17/12/2022
 44395                                  	;test	byte [es:di+68],80h

 44410                                  ;BREAK <Canonicalize - copy a path and remove . and .. entries>
 44411                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44412                                  ;   Canonicalize - copy path removing . and .. entries.
 44413                                  ;
 44414                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI - point to ASCIZ string path
 44415                                  ;               ES:DI - point to buffer
 44416                                  ;               BX - backup limit (offset from ES) points to slash
 44417                                  ;               BP - end of buffer
 44418                                  ;   Outputs:    Carry Set - invalid path specification: too many .., bad
 44419                                  ;                   syntax, etc.
 44420                                  ;               Carry Clear -
 44421                                  ;                   DS:DI - advanced to end of string
 44422                                  ;                   ES:DI - advanced to end of canonicalized form after nul
 44423                                  ;   Registers modified: AX CX DX (in addition to those above)
 44424                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44425                                  
 44426                                  	; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 44427                                  
 44428                                  Canonicalize:
 44429                                  
 44430                                  ; We copy all leading path separators.
 44431                                  
 44432 00007AE3 AC                      	LODSB                           ;   while (PathChr (*s))
 44433 00007AE4 E836E3                  	call    PATHCHRCMP
 44434 00007AE7 7507                    	JNZ	short CanonDec
 44435 00007AE9 39EF                    	CMP     DI,BP                   ;       if (d > dlim)
 44436 00007AEB 7319                    	JAE	short CanonBad		;           goto error;
 44437 00007AED AA                      	STOSB
 44438 00007AEE EBF3                    	JMP	short Canonicalize	;           *d++ = *s++;
 44439                                  CanonDec:
 44440 00007AF0 4E                      	DEC     SI
 44441                                  
 44442                                  ; Main canonicalization loop. We come here with DS:SI pointing to a textual
 44443                                  ; component (no leading path separators) and ES:DI being the destination
 44444                                  ; buffer.
 44445                                  
 44446                                  CanonLoop:
 44447                                  
 44448                                  ; If we are at the end of the source string, then we need to check to see that
 44449                                  ; a potential drive specifier is correctly terminated with a path sep char.
 44450                                  ; Otherwise, do nothing
 44451                                  
 44452 00007AF1 31C0                    	XOR     AX,AX
 44453 00007AF3 3804                    	CMP     [SI],AL                 ;       if (*s == 0) {

 44455 00007AF7 26807DFF3A              	CMP     BYTE [ES:DI-1],':'	;           if (d[-1] == ':')
 44456 00007AFC 7505                    	JNZ	short DoTerminate

 44458 00007B00 AA                      	STOSB
 44459 00007B01 88E0                    	MOV     AL,AH

 44478                                  ; it to 8.3

 44485

 44501

 44695                                  ;Break <Splice - pseudo mount by string substitution>
 44696                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44697                                  ;   Splice - take a string and substitute a prefix if one exists. Change
 44698                                  ;       ThisCDS to point to physical drive CDS.
 44699                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI point to string
 44700                                  ;               NoSetDir = TRUE => exact matches with splice fail
 44701                                  ;   Outputs:    DS:SI points to thisCDS
 44702                                  ;               ES:DI points to DPB
 44703                                  ;               String at DS:SI may be reduced in length by removing prefix
 44704                                  ;               and substituting drive letter.
 44705                                  ;               CX = 0 If no splice done
 44706                                  ;               CX <> 0 otherwise

 44708                                  ;                   left alone

 44786                                  ;Break <$NameTrans - partially process a name>
 44787                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44788                                  ;   $NameTrans - allow users to see what names get mapped to. This call
 44789                                  ;   performs only string substitution and canonicalization, not splicing.  Due
 44790                                  ;   to Transpath playing games with devices, we need to insure that the output
 44791                                  ;   has drive letter and : in it.
 44792                                  ;
 44793                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI - source string for translation
 44794                                  ;               ES:DI - pointer to buffer
 44795                                  ;   Outputs:
 44796                                  ;       Carry Clear
 44797                                  ;               Buffer at ES:DI is filled in with data
 44798                                  ;               ES:DI point byte after nul byte at end of dest string in buffer
 44799                                  ;       Carry Set
 44800                                  ;               AX = error_path_not_found
 44801                                  ;   Registers modified: all
 44802                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44803                                  
 44804                                  _$NameTrans:
 44805 00007C78 1E                      	push	ds
 44806 00007C79 56                      	push	si
 44807 00007C7A 06                      	push	es
 44808 00007C7B 57                      	push	di
 44809 00007C7C 51                      	push	cx ; MSDOS 6.0
 44810                                  	
 44811                                  	; MSDOS 6.0	
 44812                                  ; M027 - Start
 44813                                  ;
 44814                                  ; Sattrib must be set up with default values here. Otherwise, the value from
 44815                                  ; a previous DOS call is used for attrib and DevName thinks it is not a 
 44816                                  ; device if the old call set the volume attribute bit. Note that devname in
 44817                                  ; dir2.asm gets ultimately called by Transpath. See also M026. Also save
 44818                                  ; and restore CX.
 44819                                  
 44820                                  	;mov	ch,16h
 44821 00007C7D B516                    	mov     ch,attr_hidden+attr_system+attr_directory
 44822 00007C7F E8B902                  	call	SetAttrib
 44823                                  
 44824                                  ; M027 - End
 44825                                  
 44826                                  	; MSDOS 3.3 (& MSDOS 6.0)
 44827 00007C82 BF[BE03]                	MOV     DI,OPENBUF
 44828 00007C85 E8E6FC                  	CALL    TransPath               ; to translation (everything)
 44829 00007C88 59                      	pop	cx ; MSDOS 6.0
 44830 00007C89 5F                      	pop     di
 44831 00007C8A 07                      	pop	es
 44832 00007C8B 5E                      	pop     si

 44874                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44875                                  ;   TextFromDrive - turn AL into a drive letter: and put it at es:di with
 44876                                  ;   trailing :. TextFromDrive1 takes a 1-based number.
 44877                                  ;

 44889 00007CB9 AB                      	STOSW

 44893                                  ;Break   <PathPref - see if one path is a prefix of another>
 44894                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44895                                  ;   PathPref - compare DS:SI with ES:DI to see if one is the prefix of the
 44896                                  ;   other.  Remember that only at a pathchar break are we allowed to have a
 44897                                  ;   prefix: A:\ and A:\FOO
 44898                                  ;
 44899                                  ;   Inputs:     DS:SI potential prefix
 44900                                  ;               ES:DI string
 44901                                  ;   Outputs:    Zero set => prefix found
 44902                                  ;                   DI/SI advanced past matching part
 44903                                  ;               Zero reset => no prefix, DS/SI garbage
 44904                                  ;   Registers modified: CX
 44905                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44906                                  
 44907                                  PathPref:

 44909 00007CBE 49                      	DEC     CX                      ; do not include nul byte
 44910 00007CBF F3A6                    	REPZ    CMPSB                   ; compare
 44911 00007CC1 75F7                    	jnz	short PathPref_retn	; if NZ then return NZ
 44912 00007CC3 50                      	push	ax			; save char register
 44913 00007CC4 8A44FF                  	MOV     AL,[SI-1]               ; get last byte to match
 44914 00007CC7 E853E1                  	call    PATHCHRCMP              ; is it a path char (Root!)
 44915 00007CCA 7406                    	JZ	short Prefix		; yes, match root (I hope)
 44916                                  NotSep:                                 ; 2/13/KK

 44918 00007CCF E878FE                  	CALL    PathSepGotCh            ; was it a pathchar?
 44919                                  Prefix:
 44920 00007CD2 58                      	pop	ax			; get back original
 44921 00007CD3 C3                      	retn

 44924                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------

 44926                                  ;     a path separator.

 44953                                  
 44954                                  ; MSDOS 2.11
 44955                                  ;BREAK <$Open - open a file handle>
 44956                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44957                                  ;   Assembler usage:
 44958                                  ;           LDS     DX, Name
 44959                                  ;           MOV     AH, Open
 44960                                  ;           MOV     AL, access
 44961                                  ;           INT     int_command
 44962                                  ;
 44963                                  ;       ACCESS          Function
 44964                                  ;       ------          --------
 44965                                  ;       open_for_read   file is opened for reading
 44966                                  ;       open_for_write  file is opened for writing
 44967                                  ;       open_for_both   file is opened for both reading and writing.
 44968                                  ;
 44969                                  ;   Error returns:
 44970                                  ;           AX = error_invalid_access
 44971                                  ;              = error_file_not_found
 44972                                  ;              = error_access_denied
 44973                                  ;              = error_too_many_open_files
 44974                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44975                                  
 44976                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 44977                                  ;	BREAK <$Open - open a file from a path string>
 44978                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44979                                  ;
 44980                                  ;**	$OPen - Open a File
 44981                                  ;
 44982                                  ;	given a path name in DS:DX and an open mode in AL, $Open opens the
 44983                                  ;	file and and returns a handle
 44984                                  ;
 44985                                  ;	ENTRY	(DS:DX) = pointer to asciz name
 44986                                  ;		(AL) = open mode
 44987                                  ;	EXIT	'C' clear if OK
 44988                                  ;		  (ax) = file handle
 44989                                  ;		'C' set if error
 44990                                  ;		  (ax) = error code
 44991                                  ;	USES	all
 44992                                  ;
 44993                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 44994                                  
 44995                                  ; 13/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 44996                                  ; 04/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 44997                                  
 44998                                  _$OPEN:       
 44999 00007CDD 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah  ; MSDOS 6.0	
 45000                                  _$Open2:
 45001                                  	;mov	ch,16h
 45002 00007CDF B516                    	mov	ch,attr_hidden+attr_system+attr_directory
 45003 00007CE1 E85702                  	call	SetAttrib
 45004 00007CE4 B9[0232]                	mov	cx,DOS_OPEN
 45005                                  
 45006                                  	;xor	ah,ah  ; MSDOS 3.3
 45007                                  
 45008 00007CE7 50                      	push	ax
 45009                                  
 45010                                  ;*	General file open/create code. The $CREATE call and the various
 45011                                  ;	$OPEN calls all come here.
 45012                                  ;
 45013                                  ;	We'll share a lot of the standard stuff of allocating SFTs, cracking
 45014                                  ;	path names, etc., and then dispatch to our individual handlers.
 45015                                  ;	WARNING - this info and list is just a guess, not definitive - jgl
 45016                                  ;
 45017                                  ;	(TOS) = create mode
 45018                                  ;	(CX) = address of routine to call to do actual function
 45019                                  ;	(DS:DX) = ASCIZ name
 45020                                  ;	SAttrib = Attribute mask
 45021                                  
 45022                                  ;	Get a free SFT and mark it "being allocated"
 45023                                  
 45024                                  AccessFile:
 45025 00007CE8 E8FE9B                  	call	ECritSFT
 45026 00007CEB E8D8F7                  	call	SFNFree			; get a free sfn
 45027 00007CEE E8259C                  	call	LCritSFT
 45028 00007CF1 7214                    	jc	short OpenFailJ		; oops, no free sft's
 45029 00007CF3 36891E[AA05]            	MOV	[SS:SFN],BX		; save the SFN for later;smr;SS Override
 45030 00007CF8 36893E[9E05]            	MOV	[SS:THISSFT],DI		; save the SF offset	;smr;SS Override
 45031 00007CFD 368C06[A005]            	MOV	[SS:THISSFT+2],ES	; save the SF segment	;smr;SS Override
 45032                                  
 45033                                  ;	Find a free area in the user's JFN table.
 45034                                  
 45035 00007D02 E8AEF7                  	call	JFNFree			; get a free jfn
 45036 00007D05 7303                    	jnc	short SaveJFN
 45037                                  OpenFailJ:
 45038 00007D07 E99300                  	JMP	OpenFail		; there were free JFNs... try SFN
 45039                                  
 45040                                  SaveJFN:
 45041 00007D0A 36893E[AE05]            	mov	[ss:PJFN],DI		; save the jfn offset	;smr;SS Override
 45042 00007D0F 368C06[B005]            	MOV	[ss:PJFN+2],ES		; save the jfn segment	;smr;SS Override
 45043 00007D14 36891E[AC05]            	MOV	[ss:JFN],BX		; save the jfn itself	;smr;SS Override
 45044                                  
 45045                                  ;	We have been given an JFN. We lock it down to prevent other tasks from
 45046                                  ;	reusing the same JFN.
 45047                                  
 45048 00007D19 368B1E[AA05]            	MOV	BX,[ss:SFN]					;smr;SS Override
 45049 00007D1E 26881D                  	MOV	[ES:DI],BL		; assign the JFN
 45050 00007D21 89D6                    	MOV	SI,DX			; get name in appropriate place
 45051 00007D23 BF[BE03]                	MOV	DI,OPENBUF		; appropriate buffer
 45052 00007D26 51                      	push	cx			; save routine to call
 45053 00007D27 E844FC                  	call	TransPath		; convert the path
 45054 00007D2A 5B                      	pop	bx			; (bx) = routine to call
 45055                                  
 45056 00007D2B 36C536[9E05]            	LDS	SI,[SS:THISSFT]					;smr;SS Override
 45057 00007D30 720A                    	JC	short OpenCleanJ	; no error, go and open file
 45058 00007D32 36803E[7A05]FF          	CMP	byte [ss:CMETA],-1				;smr;SS Override
 45059 00007D38 7404                    	JZ	short SetSearch
 45060                                  	;mov	al,2
 45061 00007D3A B002                    	MOV	AL,error_file_not_found ; no meta chars allowed
 45062                                  OpenCleanJ:
 45063 00007D3C EB50                    	JMP	short OpenClean
 45064                                  
 45065                                  SetSearch:

 45067

 45069                                  
 45070 00007D3F 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx

 45076                                  	;

 45095                                  ;	Set_EXT_mode in creat.asm

 45113

 45116 00007D66 59                      	pop	cx

 45128                                  
 45129                                  ; If the open mode is 70, we scan the system for other SFT's with the same
 45130                                  ; contents. If we find one, then we can 'collapse' thissft onto the already
 45131                                  ; opened one. Otherwise we use this new one. We compare uid/pid/mode/mft
 45132                                  ;

 45134                                  ; sharer.

 45138

 45141                                  OpenOkj:

 45143                                  
 45144                                  	; MSDOS 6.0
 45145                                  ;Extended Open hooks check
 45146                                  OpenE2:					;AN000;;EO.

 45150

 45230                                  ;
