 49211                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49212                                  ;
 49213                                  ;	check_XMM: routine to check presence of XMM driver
 49214                                  ;
 49215                                  ;	Exit:   Sets up the XMM entry point in XMMcontrol in DOSDATA
 49216                                  ;
 49217                                  ;	USED:	none
 49218                                  ;
 49219                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49220                                  
 49221                                  check_XMM: ; proc near
 49222                                  ;
 49223                                  ; determine whether or not an XMM driver is installed
 49224                                  ;
 49225 000087AC 50                      	push	ax
 49226                                  	;mov	ax,(XMM_MULTIPLEX<<8)+XMM_INSTALL_CHECK
 49227 000087AD B80043                  	mov	ax,4300h
 49228 000087B0 CD2F                    	int	2Fh
 49229                                  		; - Multiplex - XMS - INSTALLATION CHECK
 49230                                  		; Return: AL = 80h XMS driver installed
 49231                                  		; AL <> 80h no driver
 49232 000087B2 3C80                    	cmp	al,80h			; Q: installed
 49233 000087B4 751D                    	jne	short cXMM_no_driver	; N: set error, quit
 49234                                  ;
 49235                                  ; get the XMM control functions entry point, save it, we
 49236                                  ; need to call it later.
 49237                                  ;
 49238 000087B6 53                      	push	bx
 49239 000087B7 52                      	push	dx
 49240 000087B8 1E                      	push	ds
 49241 000087B9 06                      	push	es
 49242                                  	;mov	ax,(XMM_MULTIPLEX<<8)+XMM_FUNCTION_ADDR
 49243 000087BA B81043                  	mov	ax,4310h
 49244 000087BD CD2F                    	int	2Fh
 49245                                  		; - Multiplex - XMS - GET DRIVER ADDRESS
 49246                                  		; Return: ES:BX -> driver entry point
 49247                                  
 49248 000087BF 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
 49249                                  
 49250 000087C4 891E[AF11]              	mov	[XMMcontrol],bx
 49251 000087C8 8C06[B111]              	mov	[XMMcontrol+2],es
 49252                                  cXMMexit:
 49253 000087CC F8                      	clc
 49254 000087CD 07                      	pop	es
 49255 000087CE 1F                      	pop	ds
 49256 000087CF 5A                      	pop	dx
 49257 000087D0 5B                      	pop	bx
 49258 000087D1 58                      	pop	ax
 49259 000087D2 C3                      	retn				; done
 49260                                  ;
 49261                                  ; set carry if XMM driver not present
 49262                                  ;
 49263                                  cXMM_no_driver:
 49264 000087D3 F9                      	stc
 49265 000087D4 58                      	pop	ax
 49266 000087D5 C3                      	retn

 49268                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49269                                  ;
 49270                                  ; Procedure Name : seg_reinit
 49271                                  ;
 49272                                  ; Inputs	 : ES has final dos code location
 49273                                  ;		   AX = 0 / 1
 49274                                  ;
 49275                                  ; Outputs	 : Patch in the sharer and other tables with seg in ES
 49276                                  ;		   if AX =0
 49277                                  ;		      if first entry
 49278                                  ;			 patch segment & offset of vectors with stub
 49279                                  ;			 and stub with segment in ES
 49280                                  ;		      else
 49281                                  ;			 patch stub with segment in ES
 49282                                  ;
 49283                                  ;		   else if AX = 1
 49284                                  ;			patch segment of vectors with segment in ES
 49285                                  ;
 49286                                  ; NOTE		 : This routine can be called at most twice!
 49287                                  ;
 49288                                  ; Regs Mod.	 : es, ax, di, cx, bx
 49289                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49290                                  
 49291 000087D6 00                      num_entry: db	0		; keeps track of the # of times this routine
 49292                                  				; has been called. (0 or 1)
 49293                                  
 49294                                  	; 04/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (ref: MSDOS 5.0)
 49295                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0BAB7h
 49296                                  	; 25/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (ref: MSDOS 6.21)
 49297                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0BDA5h
 49298                                  
 49299                                  seg_reinit:	; proc	far
 49300 000087D7 1E                      	push	ds
 49301                                  
 49302 000087D8 2E8E1E[0700]            	mov	ds,[cs:DosDSeg]
 49303                                  
 49304 000087DD E88600                  	call	patch_misc_segments	; patch in segments for sharer and 
 49305                                  					; other tables with seg in ES.
 49306                                  	; 17/12/2022
 49307                                  	; cx = 0
 49308 000087E0 39C8                    	cmp	ax,cx ; 0
 49309                                  	;cmp	ax,0
 49310 000087E2 753D                    	jne	short patch_vec_seg	; patch vectors with segment in es
 49311                                  
 49312                                  	; 17/12/2022
 49313 000087E4 2E380E[D687]            	cmp	[cs:num_entry],cl ; 0
 49314                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:num_entry],0	; Q: is it the first call to this
 49315 000087E9 7508                    	jne	short second_entry	; N: just patch the stub with 
 49316                                  					;    segment in ES
 49317                                  					; Y: patch the vectors with stub
 49318 000087EB 8CD8                    	mov	ax,ds
 49319 000087ED E83E00                  	call	patch_vec_segments	; patch the segment of vectors
 49320 000087F0 E8BD00                  	call	patch_offset		; patch the offsets of vectors 
 49321                                  					; with those in the stub.
 49322                                  	; 17/12/2022
 49323                                  	; cx = 0
 49324                                  second_entry:
 49325 000087F3 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es			; patch the stub with segment in es
 49326                                  
 49327                                  	;mov	di,OFFSET DOSDATA:DOSINTTABLE
 49328                                  	;mov	di,1062h	; (same table addr for MSDOS 5.0 and MSDOS 6.21)
 49329 000087F5 BF[AE10]                	mov	di,DOSINTTABLE
 49330                                  	; 17/12/2022
 49331                                  	; cx = 0
 49332                                  	;mov	cx,9
 49333 000087F8 B109                    	mov	cl,9
 49334 000087FA 1E                      	push	ds			
 49335 000087FB 07                      	pop	es			; es:di -> DOSINTTABLE
 49336                                  
 49337                                  dosinttabloop:
 49338                                  	;add	di,2
 49339                                  	; 19/06/2023
 49340 000087FC 47                      	inc	di
 49341 000087FD 47                      	inc	di
 49342 000087FE AB                      	stosw
 49343 000087FF E2FB                    	loop	dosinttabloop	
 49344                                  
 49345                                  ; For ROMDOS, this routine will only be called when the DOS wants to
 49346                                  ; use the HMA, so we don't want to check CS
 49347                                  
 49348                                  ;ifndef ROMDOS
 49349 00008801 3D00F0                  	cmp	ax,0F000h		; Q: is the DOS running in the HMA
 49350 00008804 7220                    	jb	short sr_done		; N: done
 49351                                  ;endif

 49354                                  					; A20 toggling in the stub.
 49355                                  	; 17/12/2022

 49408                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49409                                  ;
 49410                                  ; Procedure Name : WhatCPUType
 49411                                  ;
 49412                                  ; Inputs	 : none
 49413                                  ;
 49414                                  ; Outputs	 : AL = 0 if CPU <  286
 49415                                  ;		      = 1 if CPU == 286
 49416                                  ;		      = 2 if CPU >= 386
 49417                                  ;
 49418                                  ; Regs. Mod.	 : AX
 49419                                  ;
 49420                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49421                                  
 49422                                  WhatCPUType:
 49423                                  	; 25/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 49424                                  	;get_cpu_type	; done with a MACRO which can't be generated > once
 49425                                  
 49426                                  	;CPUTYPE.INC (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
 49427                                  
 49428                                  ; Note: this must be a macro, and not a subroutine in the BIOS since
 49429                                  ; 	it is called from both CODE and SYSINITSEG.
 49430                                  ;
 49431                                  ;------GET_CPU_TYPE-----------------------------------May, 88 by M.Williamson
 49432                                  ;  Returns: AX = 0 if 8086 or 8088
 49433                                  ;              = 1 if 80286
 49434                                  ;              = 2 if 80386
 49435                                  
 49436                                  	; 04/11/2022
 49437                                  	; MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0BB03h
 49438                                  
 49439                                  Get_CPU_Type:	;macro
 49440                                  	pushf
 49441                                  	push	bx			; preserve bx
 49442                                  	xor	bx,bx			; init bx to zero
 49443                                  
 49444                                  	xor	ax,ax			; 0000 into AX
 49445                                  	push	ax			; put it on the stack...
 49446                                  	popf				; ...then shove it into the flags
 49447                                  	pushf				; get it back out of the flags...
 49448                                  	pop	ax			; ...and into ax
 49449                                  	and	ax,0F000h		; mask off high four bits
 49450                                  	cmp	ax,0F000h		; was it all 1's?
 49451                                  	je	short cpu_8086		; aye; it's an 8086 or 8088
 49452                                  
 49453                                  	mov	ax,0F000h		; now try to set the high four bits..
 49454                                  	push	ax
 49455                                  	popf
 49456                                  	pushf
 49457                                  	pop	ax			; ...and see what happens
 49458                                  	and	ax,0F000h		; any high bits set ?
 49459                                  	jz	short cpu_286		; nay; it's an 80286
 49460                                  
 49461                                  cpu_386:				; bx starts as zero
 49462                                  	inc	bx			; inc twice if 386
 49463                                  cpu_286:				; just inc once if 286
 49464                                  	inc	bx
 49465                                  cpu_8086:				; don't inc at all if 086
 49466                                  	mov	ax,bx			; put CPU type value in ax
 49467                                  	pop	bx			; restore original bx
 49468                                  	popf
 49469                                  	
 49470                                  	;endm
 49471                                  
 49472                                  	; 04/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 49473                                  	retn	; 19/09/2023
 49474                                  
 49475                                  ; 19/09/2023
 49476                                  ;	; 04/11/2022
 49477                                  ;	; MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS - DOSCODE:0BB27h
 49478                                  ;	cmp	al,1
 49479                                  ;	jne	short sr_done 		; we need Rational Patch only
 49480                                  ;					;  on 286 systems
 49481                                  ;	mov	word [RationalPatchPtr],RationalPatch
 49482                                  
 49483                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49484                                  %endif	; 28/12/2022
 49485                                  
 49486                                  	; 19/09/2023
 49487                                  	;jmp	short sr_done
 49488                                  
 49489                                  patch_vec_seg:				; patch vectors with segment in es
 49490 00008821 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es
 49491 00008823 E80800                  	call	patch_vec_segments	; patch in DOSCODE for the segments
 49492                                  					; NOTE we don't have to patch the 
 49493                                  					; offsets as they have been already
 49494                                  					; set to the doscode offsets at
 49495                                  					; DOSINIT.
 49496                                  sr_done:
 49497 00008826 2EC606[D687]01          	mov	byte [cs:num_entry],1
 49498 0000882C 1F                      	pop	ds
 49499 0000882D CB                      	retf	; ! far return !
 49500                                  
 49501                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49502                                  ;
 49503                                  ; Procedure Name : patch_vec_segments
 49504                                  ;
 49505                                  ; Inputs	 : ax -> has segment address to patch in
 49506                                  ;		   ds -> DOSDATA
 49507                                  ;
 49508                                  ; Outputs	 : Patches in AX as the segment for the following vectors:
 49509                                  ;			
 49510                                  ;			0,20-28,3a-3f
 49511                                  ;
 49512                                  ; Regs. Mod.	 : DI,CX,DX,AX
 49513                                  ;
 49514                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49515                                  
 49516                                  patch_vec_segments:
 49517                                  
 49518 0000882E 06                      	push	es
 49519                                  
 49520 0000882F 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx ; 0
 49521 00008831 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx
 49522                                  
 49523                                  	;mov	di,82h
 49524 00008833 BF8200                  	mov	di,INTBASE+2		; di -> segment of int 20 vector
 49525                                  
 49526 00008836 26A30200                	mov	[es:2],ax		; segment of default divide trap handler
 49527                                  
 49528                                  					; set vectors 20 & 21
 49529                                  	; 04/11/2022
 49530                                  	;mov	cx,2
 49531                                  	; 17/12/2022
 49532                                  	;mov	cl,2
 49533                                  ps_set1:
 49534 0000883A AB                      	stosw	; int 20h segment
 49535                                  	;add	di,2
 49536                                  	; 17/12/2022
 49537 0000883B 47                      	inc	di
 49538 0000883C 47                      	inc	di
 49539                                  	;loop	ps_set1
 49540                                  
 49541                                  	; 17/12/2022
 49542 0000883D AB                      	stosw	; int 21h segment
 49543                                  	;inc	di
 49544                                  	;inc	di
 49545                                  
 49546                                  	;add	di,4			; skip int 22h vector
 49547 0000883E 83C706                  	add	di,6 ; *
 49548                                  
 49549 00008841 AB                      	stosw				; set int 23h
 49550 00008842 83C706                  	add	di,6			; skip int 24h
 49551                                  
 49552                                  					; set vectors 25-28 and 2a-3f 
 49553                                  	; 04/11/2022
 49554                                  	;mov	cx,4			; set 4 segments
 49555                                  	; 17/12/2022
 49556 00008845 B104                    	mov	cl,4
 49557                                  ps_set2:
 49558 00008847 AB                      	stosw				
 49559                                  	;add	di,2
 49560                                  	; 17/12/2022
 49561 00008848 47                      	inc	di
 49562 00008849 47                      	inc	di
 49563 0000884A E2FB                    	loop	ps_set2
 49564                                  
 49565 0000884C 83C704                  	add	di,4			; skip int 29h vector (fast con) as it may
 49566                                  					;   already be set.
 49567                                  	; 04/11/2022
 49568                                  	;mov	cx,6			; set 6 segs (skip 2 between each)
 49569                                  	; 17/12/2022
 49570 0000884F B106                    	mov	cl,6			;  set segs for ints 2ah-2fh
 49571                                  ps_set3:
 49572 00008851 AB                      	stosw
 49573                                  	;add	di,2
 49574                                  	; 17/12/2022
 49575 00008852 47                      	inc	di
 49576 00008853 47                      	inc	di
 49577 00008854 E2FB                    	loop	ps_set3
 49578                                  
 49579                                  ; 30h & 31H is the CPM call entry point whose segment address is set up by
 49580                                  ; below. So skip it.
 49581                                  
 49582 00008856 83C708                  	add	di,8			; skip vector 30h & 31h 
 49583                                  	
 49584                                  	; 04/11/2022
 49585                                  	;mov	cx,14			; set 14 segs (skip 2 between each)
 49586                                  	; 17/12/2022

 49588                                  ps_set4:

 49594 0000885E E2FB                    	loop	ps_set4
 49595

 49597

 49600                                  ;endif

 49602 00008860 26A3C300                	mov	[es:ENTRYPOINT+3],ax

 49605 00008864 07                      	pop	es

 49608                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49609                                  ;
 49610                                  ; Procedure Name : patch_misc_segments
 49611                                  ;
 49612                                  ; Inputs	 : es = segment to patch in
 49613                                  ;		   ds = dosdata
 49614                                  ;
 49615                                  ; outputs	 : patches in the sharer and other tables in the dos
 49616                                  ;		   with right dos code segment in es
 49617                                  ;
 49618                                  ; Regs Mod	 : DI,SI,CX
 49619                                  ;
 49620                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49621                                  
 49622                                  patch_misc_segments:
 49623

 49848                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49849                                  ;
 49850                                  ; 	Procedure Name	:	patch_in_nops
 49851                                  ;
 49852                                  ; 	Entry		: 	ES -> DOSDATA
 49853                                  ;
 49854                                  ;	Regs Mod	: 	cx, di
 49855                                  ;
 49856                                  ;	Description:
 49857                                  ;		This routine patches in 2 nops at the offsets specified in 
 49858                                  ;	patch_table. This basically enables the low mem stub to start 
 49859                                  ;	making XMS calls.
 49860                                  ;
 49861                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49862                                  
 49863                                  	; 04/11/2022
 49864                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 49865                                  	; DOSCODE:0BC50h
 49866                                  
 49867                                  patch_table:	; label	byte
 49868                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:i0patch
 49869                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:i20patch
 49870                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:i21patch
 49871                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:i25patch
 49872                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:i26patch
 49873                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:i27patch
 49874                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:i2fpatch
 49875                                  	;dw	offset dosdata:cpmpatch
 49876 0000891B [D610]                  	dw	i0patch
 49877 0000891D [E010]                  	dw	i20patch
 49878 0000891F [EA10]                  	dw	i21patch
 49879 00008921 [F410]                  	dw	i25patch
 49880 00008923 [FE10]                  	dw	i26patch
 49881 00008925 [0811]                  	dw	i27patch
 49882 00008927 [1211]                  	dw	i2fpatch
 49883 00008929 [1C11]                  	dw	cpmpatch
 49884                                  
 49885                                  patch_table_size equ ($-patch_table)/2
 49886                                  
 49887                                  patch_in_nops:
 49888 0000892B 50                      	push	ax
 49889 0000892C 56                      	push	si
 49890 0000892D BE[1B89]                	mov	si,patch_table
 49891 00008930 B89090                  	mov	ax,9090h ; nop, nop
 49892                                  	; 17/12/2022
 49893                                  	; cx = 0
 49894                                  	;mov	cx,8
 49895                                  	;mov	cx,patch_table_size ; 8
 49896 00008933 B108                    	mov	cl,patch_table_size ; 8
 49897                                  pin_loop:
 49898 00008935 2E8B3C                  	mov	di,[cs:si]
 49899 00008938 AB                      	stosw
 49900                                  	;add	si,2
 49901                                  	; 17/12/2022
 49902 00008939 46                      	inc	si
 49903 0000893A 46                      	inc	si
 49904 0000893B E2F8                    	loop	pin_loop
 49905 0000893D 5E                      	pop	si
 49906 0000893E 58                      	pop	ax
 49907 0000893F C3                      	retn

 49973                                  
 49974                                  ;align 16
 49975                                  	; DOSDATA (MSDOS.SYS kernel DATA) segment starts here...
 49976                                  	; (4970 bytes for MSDOS 6.21)
 49977                                  	; (4976 bytes for Retro DOS v4.0, 25/05/2019 modification.)
 49978                                  
 49979                                  ;============================================================================
 49980                                  ; MSCONST.ASM (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
 49981                                  ;============================================================================
 49982                                  ; 03/11/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 49983                                  ; 25/04/2019 - Retro DOS 4.0 (MSDOS 6.21)
 49984                                  ; 16/07/2018 - Retro DOS 3.0	
 49985                                  
 49986                                  ;Break <Initialized data and data used at DOS initialization>
 49987                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 49988                                  
 49989                                  ; We need to identify the parts of the data area that are relevant to tasks
 49990                                  ; and those that are relevant to the system as a whole. Under 3.0, the system
 49991                                  ; data will be gathered with the system code. The process data under 2.x will
 49992                                  ; be available for swapping and under 3.0 it will be allocated per-process.
 49993                                  ;
 49994                                  ; The data that is system data will be identified by [SYSTEM] in the comments
 49995                                  ; describing that data item.
 49996                                  
 49997                                  ;DOSDATA SEGMENT
 49998                                  
 49999                                  ; 04/11/2022
 50000                                  ;[ORG 0]
 50001                                  
 50002                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 50003                                  ; 04/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 50004                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 50005                                  ; DOSDATA segment start offset from beginning of MSDOS.SYS file: 32432 (7EB0h)
 50006                                  ; (3DD0h+7EB0h = 0BC80h) - for MSDOS 5.0 kernel file -
 50007                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 50008                                  
 50009                                  ; 04/11/2022
 50010                                  
 50011                                  ;DOSDATA:0000h
 50012                                  
 50013 00008942 90<rep Eh>              align 16

 50017                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 50018

 50025                                  DOSDATASTART:

 50034                                  	;db	4 dup (?)	
 50035 00000000 00<rep 4h>              	times	4 db 0
 50036                                  
 50037                                  	; 29/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 modification
 50038                                  	;dw 	_$STARTCODE ; DOSCODE offset and/or size of DOSDATA
 50039                                  	;dw	0

 50042                                  
 50043                                  ;align 2
 50044                                  
 50045                                  ; WANGO!!! The following word is used by SHARE and REDIR to determin data
 50046                                  ; area compatability. This location must be incremented EACH TIME the data
 50047                                  ; area here gets mucked with.
 50048                                  ;
 50049                                  ; Also, do NOT change this position relative to DOSDATA:0.

 50057                                  ;hkn; been removed to DOSCODE above
 50058

 50063 00000006 00<rep 8h>              	times	8 db 0
 50064                                  
 50065                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 DOSDATA:000Eh
 50066                                  MYNUM:			; Offset 000Eh
 50067 0000000E 0000                    	dw	0	; [SYSTEM] A number that goes with MYNAME
 50068                                  FCBLRU: 		; [SYSTEM] LRU count for FCB cache
 50069 00000010 0000                    	dw	0
 50070                                  OpenLRU:

 50072                                  OEM_HANDLER:

 50074

 50090                                  
 50091                                  ;; 16/07/2018
 50092                                  ;;***************************************************************************
 50093                                  ;; NOTE: INT 21H AH=52H !  (http://stanislavs.org/helppc/int_21-52.html)
 50094                                  ;;***************************************************************************
 50095                                  ;; INT 21,52 - Get Pointer to DOS "INVARS" (Undocumented)
 50096                                  ;;
 50097                                  ;;	AH = 52h
 50098                                  ;;
 50099                                  ;;	on return:
 50100                                  ;;	ES:BX = pointer to DOS "invars", a table of pointers used by DOS.
 50101                                  ;;		Known "invars" fields follow (varies with DOS version):
 50102                                  ;;
 50103                                  ;;	Offset Size		 Description
 50104                                  ;;
 50105                                  ;;	 -12   word   sharing retry count (DOS 3.1-3.3)
 50106                                  ;;	 -10   word   sharing retry delay  (DOS 3.1-3.3)
 50107                                  ;;	  -8   dword  pointer to current disk buffer (DOS 3.x)
 50108                                  ;;	  -4   word   pointer in DOS code segment of unread CON input;
 50109                                  ;;		      0 indicates no unread input (DOS 3.x)
 50110                                  ;;	  -2   word   segment of first Memory Control Block (MCB)
 50111                                  ;;	  00   dword  pointer to first DRIVE PARAMETER TABLE (A:) in chain
 50112                                  ;;	  04   dword  pointer to DOS System File Table (SFT)
 50113                                  ;;	  08   dword  pointer to $CLOCK device driver
 50114                                  ;;	  0C   dword  pointer to CON device driver
 50115                                  ;;	  10   byte   number of logical drives in system
 50116                                  ;;	  11   word   maximum bytes/block of any block device
 50117                                  ;;	  13   dword  pointer to DOS cache buffer header
 50118                                  ;;	  17 18bytes  NUL device header, first 4 bytes of device header
 50119                                  ;;		      point to the next device in device chain
 50120                                  ;;
 50121                                  ;;***************************************************************************
 50122                                  
 50123                                  ; The following block of data is used by SYSINIT. 
 50124                                  ; Do not change the order or size of this block
 50125                                  
 50126                                  ;SYSINITVAR:
 50127                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 50128                                  SYSINITVARS:
 50129                                  DPBHEAD:
 50130 00000026 00000000                	dd	0	; [SYSTEM] Pointer to head of DPB-FAT list
 50131                                  SFT_ADDR:
 50132 0000002A [CC000000]              	dd	SFTABL	; [SYSTEM] Pointer to first SFT table
 50133                                  BCLOCK:

 50259                                  			; asm.

 50274                                  			; M000: from which DOS will

 50329                                  ;============================================================================
 50330                                  ; CONST2.ASM (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
 50331                                  ;============================================================================
 50332                                  ; 25/04/2019 - Retro DOS 4.0 
 50333                                  ; 16/07/2018 - Retro DOS 3.0	
 50334                                  
 50335                                  ;Break <Initialized data and data used at DOS initialization>
 50336                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 50337                                  
 50338                                  ; We need to identify the parts of the data area that are relevant to tasks
 50339                                  ; and those that are relevant to the system as a whole.  Under 3.0, the system
 50340                                  ; data will be gathered with the system code.  The process data under 2.x will
 50341                                  ; be available for swapping and under 3.0 it will be allocated per-process.
 50342                                  ;
 50343                                  ; The data that is system data will be identified by [SYSTEM] in the comments
 50344                                  ; describing that data item.
 50345                                  
 50346                                  ;DOSDATA SEGMENT WORD PUBLIC 'DATA'
 50347                                  
 50348                                  ;
 50349                                  ; Table of routines for assignable devices
 50350                                  ;
 50351                                  ; MSDOS allows assignment if the following standard devices:
 50352                                  ;   stdin  (usually CON input)
 50353                                  ;   stdout (usually CON output)
 50354                                  ;   auxin  (usually AUX input)
 50355                                  ;   auxout (usually AUX output)
 50356                                  ;   stdlpt (usually PRN output)
 50357                                  ;
 50358                                  ; SPECIAL NOTE:
 50359                                  ;   Status of a file is a strange idea. We choose to handle it in this manner:
 50360                                  ;   If we're not at end-of-file, then we always say that we have a character.
 50361                                  ;   Otherwise, we return ^Z as the character and set the ZERO flag. In this
 50362                                  ;   manner we can support program written under the old DOS (they use ^Z as EOF
 50363                                  ;   on devices) and programs written under the new DOS (they use the ZERO flag
 50364                                  ;   as EOF).
 50365                                  
 50366                                  ; Default SFTs for boot up
 50367                                  
 50368                                  		;PUBLIC	SFTABL
 50369                                  
 50370                                  SFTABL:	   ; LABEL   DWORD		; [SYSTEM] file table
 50371 000000CC FFFF                    		DW -1			; [SYSTEM] link to next table
 50372 000000CE FFFF                    		DW -1			; [SYSTEM] link seg to next table
 50373 000000D0 0500                    		DW sf_default_number	; [SYSTEM] Number of entries in table
 50374                                  		;times 295 db 0 ; MSDOS 6.0
 50375 000000D2 00<rep 127h>            		times (sf_default_number*sf_entry_size) db 0
 50376                                  
 50377                                  ; the next two variables relate to the position of the logical stdout/stdin
 50378                                  ; cursor. They are only meaningful when stdin/stdout are assigned to the
 50379                                  ; console.
 50380                                  		; DOSDATA:01F9h (MSDOS 6.21)
 50381 000001F9 00                      CARPOS:		db 0			; [SYSTEM] cursor position in stdin
 50382 000001FA 00                      STARTPOS:	db 0			; [SYSTEM] position of cursor at beginning
 50383                                  					;	   of buffered input call
 50384 000001FB 00<rep 80h>             INBUF:		times 128 db 0		; [SYSTEM] general device input buffer
 50385 0000027B 00<rep 83h>             CONBUF:		times 131 db 0		; [SYSTEM] The rest of INBUF and console buffer
 50386                                  		; DOSDATA:02FEh (MSDOS 6.21)
 50387 000002FE 00                      PFLAG:		db 0			; [SYSTEM] printer echoing flag
 50388 000002FF 00                      VERFLG:		db 0			; [SYSTEM] Initialize with verify off
 50389 00000300 03                      CHARCO:		db 00000011b		; [SYSTEM] Allows statchks every 4 chars...
 50390                                  switch_character:
 50391 00000301 2F                      chSwitch:	db '/'			; UNUSED - obsolete datum, can be reused
 50392 00000302 00                      AllocMethod:	db 0			; [SYSTEM] how to alloc first(best)last
 50393 00000303 00                      fShare:		db 0			; [SYSTEM] TRUE => sharing installed
 50394 00000304 01                      DIFFNAM:	db 1			; [SYSTEM] Indicates when MYNAME has changed
 50395 00000305 20<rep 10h>             MYNAME:		times 16 db 20h		; [SYSTEM] My network name
 50396

 50596                                  ;============================================================================
 50597                                  ; MS_DATA.ASM (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
 50598                                  ;============================================================================
 50599                                  ; 25/04/2019 - Retro DOS 4.0
 50600                                  
 50601                                  ; Retro DOS v4.0 NOTE: (by Erdogan Tan, 25/04/2019)
 50602                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------
 50603                                  ; This data section which was named as uninitialized data
 50604                                  ; (as overlayed by initialization code) but follows 
 50605                                  ; initialized data section from DOSDATA:03B6h address
 50606                                  ; (in otherwords, the method is different than MSDOS 3.3,
 50607                                  ; and there is not overlaying..)
 50608                                  ; **********************************************************
 50609                                  ; Reference: MSDOS 6.21 kernel DOSDATA section (4970 bytes)
 50610                                  ; follows DOSCODE section in the kernel file (MSDOS.SYS) 
 50611                                  ; (it is located at offset 0BF70h, file offset 0BF70h-3DE0h) 
 50612                                  ; but starts from offset 0 (ORG 0) and ends at offset 1370h.
 50613                                  ; TIMEBUF is at offset 03B6h.
 50614                                  ; **********************************************************	
 50615                                  
 50616                                  ;Break <Uninitialized data overlayed by initialization code>
 50617                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 50618                                  ;DOSDATA    SEGMENT WORD PUBLIC 'DATA'
 50619                                  ; Init code overlaps with data area below
 50620                                  
 50621                                  ; 	ORG     0
 50622                                  
 50623                                  MSDAT001S:	; label byte
 50624                                  
 50625                                  ; DOSDATA:03B6h	; MSDOS 6.21 (MSDOS.SYS, file offset 0BF70h-3DE0h+3B6h)
 50626                                  TIMEBUF: ;	times 6 db 0
 50627 000003B6 0000<rep 3h>            	times 3 dw	0		; Time read from clock device
 50628 000003BC 0000                    DEVIOBUF:	dw	0		; Buffer for I/O under file assignment
 50629                                  
 50630                                  ; The following areas are used as temp buffer in EXEC system call
 50631                                  
 50632                                  ; DOSDATA:03BEh
 50633                                  OPENBUF: ;times 64  dw	0
 50634 000003BE 00<rep 80h>             	times	128 db	0		; buffer for name operations
 50635                                  RENBUF:	
 50636 0000043E 00<rep 80h>             	times	128 db	0		; buffer for rename destination
 50637                                  
 50638                                  ; Buffer for search calls
 50639                                  SEARCHBUF:	
 50640 000004BE 00<rep 35h>             	times	53  db	0		; internal search buffer
 50641                                  DUMMYCDS:  ;times 88 db 0
 50642 000004F3 00<rep 58h>             	times	curdirLen db 0
 50643                                  
 50644                                  ; End of contiguous buffer
 50645                                   
 50646                                  ; Temporary directory entry for use by many routines. Device directory
 50647                                  ; entries (bogus) are built here.
 50648                                  
 50649                                  ; DOSDATA:054Bh
 50650                                  
 50651                                  DEVFCB:	; LABEL   BYTE			; Uses NAME1, NAME2, combined
 50652                                  
 50653                                  ; WARNING..  do not alter position of NAME1 relative to DEVFCB
 50654                                  ; without first examining BUILD_DEVICE_ENT. Look carefully at DOS_RENAME
 50655                                  ; as well as it is the only guy who uses NAME2 and DESTSTART.
 50656                                  
 50657                                  NAME1:	
 50658 0000054B 00<rep Ch>                      times 	12 db	0		; File name buffer
 50659                                  NAME2:
 50660 00000557 00<rep Dh>              	times	13 db	0 		;
 50661                                  DESTSTART:
 50662 00000564 0000                    	dw	0			;
 50663                                          ;DB      ((SIZE DIR_ENTRY) - ($ - DEVFCB)) DUP (?)
 50664                                  	;times	5  db	0
 50665 00000566 00<rep 5h>              	times	((dir_entry.size)-($-DEVFCB)) db 0
 50666                                  
 50667                                  ; End Temporary directory entry.
 50668                                  
 50669 0000056B 00                      ATTRIB:	db	0		; storage for file attributes
 50670                                  EXTFCB:	
 50671 0000056C 00                      	db	0		; TRUE => extended FCB in use
 50672                                  SATTRIB:
 50673 0000056D 00                      	db	0		; Storage for search attributes
 50674                                  OPEN_ACCESS:
 50675 0000056E 00                      	db	0		; access of open system call
 50676                                  FOUNDDEL:
 50677 0000056F 00                      	db	0		; true => file was deleted
 50678                                  FOUND_DEV:
 50679 00000570 00                      	db	0		; true => search found a device
 50680                                  FSPLICE:
 50681 00000571 00                      	db	0		; true => do a splice in transpath
 50682                                  FSHARING:
 50683 00000572 00                      	db	0		; TRUE => no redirection
 50684                                  SECCLUSPOS:
 50685 00000573 00                      	db	0		; Position of first sector within cluster
 50686 00000574 00                      TRANS:	db	0		;
 50687 00000575 00                      READOP:	db	0		;
 50688                                  THISDRV:
 50689 00000576 00                      	db	0		;
 50690                                  CLUSFAC:
 50691 00000577 00                      	db	0		;
 50692                                  CLUSSPLIT:
 50693 00000578 00                      	db	0		;
 50694                                  INSMODE:
 50695 00000579 00                      	db	0		; true => insert mode in buffered read
 50696 0000057A 00                      CMETA:	db	0		; count of meta'ed components found
 50697 0000057B 00                      VOLID:	db	0		;
 50698                                  EXIT_TYPE:
 50699 0000057C 00                      	db	0		; type of exit...

 51120                                  ; DOSDATA:0CF5h
 51121                                  
 51122                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51123                                  ;
 51124                                  ;CASE MAPPER ROUTINE FOR 80H-FFH character range, DOS 3.3
 51125                                  ;     ENTRY: AL = Character to map
 51126                                  ;     EXIT:  AL = The converted character
 51127                                  ; Alters no registers except AL and flags.
 51128                                  ; The routine should do nothing to chars below 80H.
 51129                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51130                                  ; Example:
 51131                                  
 51132                                  MAP_CASE:
 51133                                  ;Procedure MAP_CASE,FAR
 51134                                  
 51135 00000D49 3C80                    	CMP	AL,80h
 51136 00000D4B 7301                    	JAE	short Map1	;Map no chars below 80H ever
 51137 00000D4D CB                      	RETF
 51138                                  Map1:
 51139 00000D4E 2C80                    	SUB	AL,80h		;Turn into index value
 51140 00000D50 1E                      	PUSH	DS
 51141 00000D51 53                      	PUSH	BX
 51142 00000D52 BB[030B]                	MOV	BX,UCASE_TAB+2
 51143                                  FINISH:
 51144 00000D55 0E                      	PUSH	CS		;Move to DS
 51145 00000D56 1F                      	POP	DS
 51146 00000D57 D7                      	XLAT			;Get upper case character
 51147 00000D58 5B                      	POP	BX
 51148 00000D59 1F                      	POP	DS
 51149                                  L_RET:	
 51150 00000D5A CB                      	RETF
 51151                                  
 51152                                  ;EndProc MAP_CASE
 51153                                  
 51154                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51155

 51157                                  ; as IBM-DOS and MS-DOS.

 51443                                  ; ** HACK FOR DOS 4.0 REDIR **
 51444                                  ; 
 51445                                  ; The redir requires the following:
 51446                                  ;
 51447                                  ;	ERR_TABLE_21	offset DDBH
 51448                                  ;	ERR_TABLE_24	offset E5BH
 51449                                  ; 	ErrMap24	offset EABH
 51450                                  ;
 51451                                  ; WARNING! WARNING!
 51452                                  ;
 51453                                  ; MARK2 SHOULD NOT BE >= 0DDBH. IF SOME VARIABLE IS TO BE ADDED ABOVE DO SO
 51454                                  ; WITHOUT VIOLATING THIS AND UPDATE THE FOLL. LINE
 51455                                  ;
 51456                                  ; CURRENTLY MARK2 = 0DD0H
 51457                                  ;
 51458                                  ;############################################################################
 51459                                  
 51460                                  	;ORG	0DDBh
 51461                                  
 51462                                  ; DOSDATA:0DDBh (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 51463                                  
 51464                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51465                                  ;
 51466                                  ; The following table defines CLASS ACTION and LOCUS info for the INT 21H
 51467                                  ; errors. Each entry is 4 bytes long:
 51468                                  ;
 51469                                  ;       Err#,Class,Action,Locus
 51470                                  ;
 51471                                  ; A value of 0FFh indicates a call specific value (ie. should already
 51472                                  ; be set). AN ERROR CODE NOT IN THE TABLE FALLS THROUGH TO THE CATCH ALL AT
 51473                                  ; THE END, IT IS ASSUMES THAT CLASS, ACTION, LOCUS IS ALREADY SET.
 51474                                  ;
 51475                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51476                                  
 51477                                  ;ErrTab  Macro   err,class,action,locus
 51478                                  ;ifidn <locus>,<0FFh>
 51479                                  ;    DB  error_&err,errCLASS_&class,errACT_&action,0FFh
 51480                                  ;ELSE
 51481                                  ;    DB  error_&err,errCLASS_&class,errACT_&action,errLOC_&locus
 51482                                  ;ENDIF
 51483                                  ;ENDM
 51484                                  
 51485                                  ERR_TABLE_21: ; LABEL   BYTE
 51486 00000E24 010704FF                    DB  error_invalid_function,       errCLASS_Apperr,    errACT_Abort,    0FFh
 51487 00000E28 02080302                    DB  error_file_not_found,         errCLASS_NotFnd,    errACT_User,     errLOC_Disk
 51488 00000E2C 03080302                    DB  error_path_not_found,         errCLASS_NotFnd,    errACT_User,     errLOC_Disk
 51489 00000E30 04010401                    DB  error_too_many_open_files,    errCLASS_OutRes,    errACT_Abort,    errLOC_Unk
 51490 00000E34 050303FF                    DB  error_access_denied,          errCLASS_Auth,      errACT_User,     0FFh
 51491 00000E38 06070401                    DB  error_invalid_handle,         errCLASS_Apperr,    errACT_Abort,    errLOC_Unk
 51492 00000E3C 07070505                    DB  error_arena_trashed,          errCLASS_Apperr,    errACT_Panic,    errLOC_Mem
 51493 00000E40 08010405                    DB  error_not_enough_memory,      errCLASS_OutRes,    errACT_Abort,    errLOC_Mem

 51804                                  %if 0
 51805                                  
 51806                                  ; 27/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 51807                                  ; 04/11/2022
 51808                                  ; DOSDATA:1044h (MSDOS 6.21 & MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 51809                                  
 51810                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51811                                  ; Patch for Sidekick
 51812                                  ;
 51813                                  ; A documented method for finding the offset of the Errormode flag in the
 51814                                  ; dos swappable data area if for the app to scan in the dos segment (data)
 51815                                  ; for the following sequence of instructions.
 51816                                  ;
 51817                                  ; Ref: Part C, Article 11, pg 356 of MSDOS Encyclopedia
 51818                                  ;
 51819                                  ; The Offset of Errormode flag is 0320h
 51820                                  ;
 51821                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51822                                  
 51823                                  	db	036h, 0F6h, 06h, 020h, 03h, 0FFh ; test ss:[errormode], -1
 51824                                  	db	075h, 0Ch			 ; jnz  NearLabel
 51825                                  	db	036h, 0FFh, 036h, 058h, 03h	 ; push ss:[NearWord]
 51826                                  	db	0CDh, 028h			 ; int  28h
 51827                                  
 51828                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51829                                  ; Patch for PortOfEntry - M036
 51830                                  ;
 51831                                  ; PortOfEntry by Sector Technology uses an un documented way of determining
 51832                                  ; the offset of Errormode flag. The following patch is to support them in
 51833                                  ; DOS 5.0. The corresponding code is actually in msdisp.asm
 51834                                  ;
 51835                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51836                                  
 51837                                  	db 	080h, 03Eh, 020h, 03h, 00h 	 ; cmp 	[errormode], 0
 51838                                  	db	075h, 037h			 ; jnz	NearLabel
 51839                                  	db 	0BCh, 0A0h, 0Ah		  	 ; mov	sp, dosdata:iostack
 51840                                  
 51841                                  %endif ; 29/12/2022
 51842
