 51898                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51899                                  ;
 51900                                  ; LOW MEM STUB:
 51901                                  ;
 51902                                  ; The low mem stub contains the entry points into DOS for all interrupts
 51903                                  ; handled by DOS. This stub is installed if the user specifies that the
 51904                                  ; DOS load in HIMEM. Each entry point does this.
 51905                                  ;
 51906                                  ; 	1. if jmp to 8 has been patched out
 51907                                  ;	   2. if A20 OFF
 51908                                  ;	      3. Enable A20
 51909                                  ;	   4. else 
 51910                                  ;	      5. just go to dos entry
 51911                                  ;	   6. endif
 51912                                  ;	7. else
 51913                                  ;	   8. just go to dos entry
 51914                                  ;	9. endif
 51915                                  ;
 51916                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51917                                  
 51918                                  ; 27/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 51919                                  
 51920                                  ; DOSDATA:108Ah (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 51921                                  
 51922                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51923                                  ;
 51924                                  ; DIVIDE BY 0 handler
 51925                                  ;
 51926                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51927                                  
 51928                                  ldivov:
 51929                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to 
 51930                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is
 51931                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 51932                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 51933                                  i0patch:
 51934 000010D6 EB03                    	jmp	short divov_cont
 51935                                  
 51936 000010D8 E8D800                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF
 51937                                  divov_cont:
 51938 000010DB 2EFF2E[AE10]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE]	; jmp to DOS
 51939                                  
 51940                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51941                                  ;
 51942                                  ; INT 20 Handler
 51943                                  ;
 51944                                  ; Here we do not have to set up the stack to return here as the abort call
 51945                                  ; will return to the address after the int 21 ah=4b call. This would be the
 51946                                  ; common exit point if A20 had been OFF (for TOGGLE DOS) and the A20 line
 51947                                  ; will be restored then.
 51948                                  ;
 51949                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51950                                  
 51951                                  lquit:
 51952                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to 
 51953                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is
 51954                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 51955                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 51956                                  i20patch:
 51957 000010E0 EB03                    	jmp	short quit_cont
 51958                                  
 51959 000010E2 E8CE00                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF
 51960                                  quit_cont:
 51961 000010E5 2EFF2E[B210]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE+4]	; jump to DOS
 51962                                  
 51963                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51964                                  ;
 51965                                  ; INT 21 Handler
 51966                                  ;
 51967                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51968                                  
 51969                                  lcommand:
 51970                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to 
 51971                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is
 51972                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 51973                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 51974                                  i21patch:
 51975 000010EA EB03                    	jmp	short command_cont
 51976                                  
 51977 000010EC E8C400                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF
 51978                                  command_cont:
 51979 000010EF 2EFF2E[B610]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE+8]	; jmp to DOS
 51980                                  
 51981                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51982                                  ;
 51983                                  ; INT 25 
 51984                                  ;
 51985                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 51986                                  
 51987                                  labsdrd:
 51988                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to 
 51989                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is
 51990                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 51991                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 51992                                  i25patch:
 51993 000010F4 EB03                    	jmp	short absdrd_cont
 51994                                  
 51995 000010F6 E8BA00                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF
 51996                                  absdrd_cont:
 51997 000010F9 2EFF2E[BA10]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE+12]	; jmp to DOS
 51998                                  
 51999                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 52000                                  ;
 52001                                  ; INT 26
 52002                                  ;
 52003                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------
 52004                                  
 52005                                  labsdwrt:
 52006                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to 
 52007                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is
 52008                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 52009                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 52010                                  i26patch:
 52011 000010FE EB03                    	jmp	short absdwrt_cont
 52012                                  
 52013 00001100 E8B000                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF
 52014                                  absdwrt_cont:
 52015 00001103 2EFF2E[BE10]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE+16]	; jmp to DOS
 52016                                  
 52017                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------
 52018                                  ;
 52019                                  ; INT 27
 52020                                  ;
 52021                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------
 52022                                  
 52023                                  lstay_resident:
 52024                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to
 52025                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is
 52026                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 52027                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 52028                                  i27patch:
 52029 00001108 EB03                    	jmp	short sr_cont
 52030                                  
 52031 0000110A E8A600                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF
 52032                                  sr_cont:
 52033 0000110D 2EFF2E[C210]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE+20]	; jmp to DOS
 52034                                  
 52035                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 52036                                  ;
 52037                                  ; INT 2f
 52038                                  ;
 52039                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 52040                                  
 52041                                  lint2f:
 52042                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to 
 52043                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is 
 52044                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 52045                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 52046                                  i2fpatch:
 52047 00001112 EB03                    	jmp	short int2f_cont
 52048                                  
 52049 00001114 E89C00                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF
 52050                                  int2f_cont:
 52051 00001117 2EFF2E[C610]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE+24]	; jmp to DOS
 52052                                  
 52053                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 52054                                  ;
 52055                                  ; CPM entry
 52056                                  ;
 52057                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------
 52058                                  
 52059                                  lcall_entry:
 52060                                  	; The following jump, skipping the XMS calls will be patched to 
 52061                                  	; NOPS by SEG_REINIT if DOS successfully loads high. This jump is
 52062                                  	; needed because the stub is installed even before the XMS driver
 52063                                  	; is loaded if the user specifies dos=high in the config.sys
 52064                                  cpmpatch:
 52065 0000111C EB03                    	jmp	short callentry_cont
 52066                                  
 52067 0000111E E89200                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; we must turn on A20 if OFF
 52068                                  callentry_cont:
 52069 00001121 2EFF2E[CA10]            	jmp	far [cs:DOSINTTABLE+28]	; jmp to DOS
 52070                                  
 52071                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 52072                                  
 52073                                  lirett:
 52074 00001126 CF                      	iret
 52075                                  
 52076                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 52077                                  ;
 52078                                  ; LowIntXX:
 52079                                  ;
 52080                                  ; Interrupts from DOS that pass control to a user program must be done from
 52081                                  ; low memory, as the user program may change the state of the A20 line or
 52082                                  ; they may require that the A20 line be OFF. The following piece of code is
 52083                                  ; far call'd from the following places in DOS:
 52084                                  ;
 52085                                  ;	1. msctrlc.asm where dos issues an int 23h (ctrlc)
 52086                                  ;	2. msctrlc.asm where dos issues an int 24h (critical error)
 52087                                  ;	3. msctrlc.asm where dos issues an int 28h (idle int)
 52088                                  ;
 52089                                  ; The int 23 and int 24 handlers may decide to do a far return instead of an
 52090                                  ; IRET ane leave the flags on the stack. Therefore we save the return address
 52091                                  ; before doing the ints and then do a far junp back into DOS.
 52092                                  ;
 52093                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 52094                                  
 52095 00001127 00000000                DosRetAddr23:	dd	0
 52096 0000112B 00000000                DosRetAddr24:	dd	0
 52097 0000112F 00000000                DosRetAddr28:	dd	0
 52098                                  
 52099                                  	; Execute int 23h from low memory
 52100                                  LowInt23:
 52101                                  					; save the return address that is on
 52102                                  					; the stack
 52103 00001133 2E8F06[2711]            	pop	word [cs:DosRetAddr23]
 52104 00001138 2E8F06[2911]            	pop	word [cs:DosRetAddr23+2]
 52105                                  
 52106 0000113D CD23                    	int	23h			; ctrl C
 52107                                  					; turn on A20 it has been turned OFF
 52108                                  					; by int 28/23/24 handler.
 52109                                  
 52110 0000113F E87100                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; M011: we must turn on A20 if OFF 
 52111                                  
 52112 00001142 2EFF2E[2711]            	jmp	far [cs:DosRetAddr23]	; jump back to DOS
 52113                                  
 52114                                  
 52115                                  	; Execute int 24h from low memory
 52116                                  LowInt24:
 52117                                  					; save the return address that is on
 52118                                  					; the stack
 52119 00001147 2E8F06[2B11]            	pop	word [cs:DosRetAddr24]
 52120 0000114C 2E8F06[2D11]            	pop	word [cs:DosRetAddr24+2]
 52121                                  
 52122 00001151 CD24                    	int	24h			; crit error
 52123                                  					; turn on A20 it has been turned OFF
 52124                                  					; by int 28/23/24 handler.
 52125                                  
 52126 00001153 E85D00                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; M011: we must turn on A20 if OFF
 52127                                  
 52128 00001156 2EFF2E[2B11]            	jmp	far [cs:DosRetAddr24]	; jump back to DOS
 52129                                  
 52130                                  
 52131                                   
 52132                                  	; Execute int 28h from low memory
 52133                                  LowInt28:
 52134 0000115B CD28                    	int	28h			; idle int
 52135                                  					; turn on A20 it has been turned OFF
 52136                                  					; by int 28/23/24 handler.
 52137                                  
 52138 0000115D E85300                  	call	EnsureA20ON		; M011: we must turn on A20 if OFF
 52139                                  
 52140 00001160 CB                      	retf
 52141                                  
 52142                                  ; DOSDATA:1115h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 52143                                  
 52144                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 52145                                  ;
 52146                                  ; int 21 ah=4b (exec) call will jump to the following label before xferring
 52147                                  ; control to the exec'd program. We turn off A20 inorder to allow programs
 52148                                  ; that have been packed by the faulty exepack utility to unpack correctly.
 52149                                  ; This is so because exepac'd programs rely on address wrap.
 52150                                  ;
 52151                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------- 
 52152                                  
 52153                                  disa20_xfer:
 52154 00001161 E83F00                  	call	XMMDisableA20		; disable A20
 52155                                  
 52156                                  	; Look at msproc.asm at label exec_go for understanding the following:
 52157                                  
 52158                                  	; DS:SI points to entry point
 52159                                  	; AX:DI points to initial stack
 52160                                  	; DX has PDB pointer
 52161                                  	; BX has initial AX value
 52162                                  
 52163 00001164 FA                      	cli
 52164 00001165 2EC606[2103]00          	mov	byte [cs:INDOS],0	; SS Override
 52165                                  
 52166 0000116B 8ED0                    	mov	SS,AX			; set up user's stack
 52167 0000116D 89FC                    	mov	SP,DI			; and SP
 52168 0000116F FB                      	sti
 52169                                  
 52170 00001170 1E                      	push	DS			; fake long call to entry
 52171 00001171 56                      	push	SI
 52172 00001172 8EC2                    	mov	ES,DX			; set up proper seg registers
 52173 00001174 8EDA                    	mov	DS,DX
 52174 00001176 89D8                    	mov	AX,BX			; set up proper AX
 52175 00001178 CB                      	retf
 52176                                  
 52177                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------
 52178                                  ;
 52179                                  ; M003:
 52180                                  ;
 52181                                  ; If an int 21 ah=25 call is made immediately after an exec call, DOS will
 52182                                  ; come here, turn A20 OFF restore user stack and registers before returning
 52183                                  ; to user. This is done in dos\msdisp.asm. This has been done to support 
 52184                                  ; programs compiled with MS PASCAL 3.2. See under TAG M003 in DOSSYM.INC for
 52185                                  ; more info.	
 52186                                  ;
 52187                                  ; Also at this point DS is DOSDATA. So we can assume DS DOSDATA. Note that
 52188                                  ; SS is also DOS stack. It is important that we do the XMS call on DOS's
 52189                                  ; stack to avoid additional stack overhead for the user.
 52190                                  ;
 52191                                  ; -------------------------------------------------------------------------
 52192                                  
 52193                                  disa20_iret:
 52194 00001179 E82700                  	call	XMMDisableA20
 52195 0000117C FE0E[2103]              	dec	byte [INDOS]
 52196 00001180 8E16[8605]              	mov	SS,[USER_SS]		; restore user stack
 52197 00001184 8B26[8405]              	mov	SP,[USER_SP]
 52198 00001188 89E5                    	mov	BP,SP
 52199                                  	;mov	[BP+user_env.user_AX],AL
 52200 0000118A 884600                  	mov	[bp],al
 52201 0000118D A1[F205]                	mov	AX,[NSP]
 52202 00001190 A3[8405]                	mov	[USER_SP],AX
 52203 00001193 A1[F005]                	mov	AX,[NSS]
 52204 00001196 A3[8605]                	mov	[USER_SS],AX
 52205                                  
 52206 00001199 58                      	pop	AX			; restore user regs
 52207 0000119A 5B                      	pop	BX
 52208 0000119B 59                      	pop	CX
 52209 0000119C 5A                      	pop	DX
 52210 0000119D 5E                      	pop	SI
 52211 0000119E 5F                      	pop	DI
 52212 0000119F 5D                      	pop	BP
 52213 000011A0 1F                      	pop	DS
 52214 000011A1 07                      	pop	ES
 52215 000011A2 CF                      	iret
 52216                                  
 52217                                  ;**************************************************************************
 52218                                  ;***	XMMDisableA20 - switch 20th address line
 52219                                  ;
 52220                                  ;	This routine is used to disable the 20th address line in
 52221                                  ;	the system using XMM calls.
 52222                                  ;
 52223                                  ;	ENTRY	none		;ds = _DATA
 52224                                  ;	EXIT	A20 line disabled
 52225                                  ;	USES	NOTHING
 52226                                  ;
 52227                                  ;**************************************************************************
 52228                                  
 52229                                  XMMDisableA20:
 52230 000011A3 53                      	push	bx
 52231 000011A4 50                      	push	ax
 52232                                  	;mov	ah,XMM_LOCAL_DISABLE_A20
 52233 000011A5 B406                    	mov	ah,6
 52234 000011A7 2EFF1E[AF11]            	call	far [cs:XMMcontrol]
 52235 000011AC 58                      	pop	ax
 52236 000011AD 5B                      	pop	bx
 52237 000011AE C3                      	retn
 52238                                  
 52239                                  ; The entry point in the BIOS XMS driver is defined here.
 52240                                  
 52241                                  XMMcontrol:
 52242 000011AF 00000000                	dd	0
 52243                                  
 52244                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 52245                                  ;
 52246                                  ;***	EnsureA20ON - Ensures that A20 is ON
 52247                                  ;
 52248                                  ;	This routine is used to query the A20 state in
 52249                                  ;	the system using XMM calls.
 52250                                  ;
 52251                                  ;	ENTRY: none
 52252                                  ;
 52253                                  ;	EXIT : A20 will be ON
 52254                                  ;		
 52255                                  ; 	USES : NONE
 52256                                  ;
 52257                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 52258                                  
 52259                                  ; 19/09/2023
 52260                                  ;LowMemory:	; label dword		; Set equal to 0000:0080
 52261                                  ;	dw	00080h
 52262                                  ;	dw	00000h
 52263                                  ;
 52264                                  ;HighMemory:	; label dword
 52265                                  ;	dw	00090h			; Set equal to FFFF:0090
 52266                                  ;	dw	0FFFFh
 52267                                  
 52268                                  EnsureA20ON:
 52269 000011B3 9C                      	pushf
 52270 000011B4 1E                      	push    ds
 52271 000011B5 06                      	push	es
 52272 000011B6 51                      	push	cx
 52273 000011B7 56                      	push	si
 52274 000011B8 57                      	push	di
 52275                                  
 52276                                  	; 19/09/2023
 52277                                  	;lds	si,[cs:LowMemory]	; Compare the 4 words at 0000:0080
 52278                                  	;les	di,[cs:HighMemory]	; with the 4 at FFFF:0090
 52279                                  
 52280 000011B9 31FF                    	xor	di,di
 52281 000011BB 8EC7                    	mov	es,di
 52282 000011BD 4F                      	dec	di
 52283 000011BE BE9000                  	mov	si,90h	; 0FFFFh:0090h	; HighMemory
 52284 000011C1 8EDF                    	mov	ds,di
 52285 000011C3 BF8000                  	mov	di,80h ; 0000h:0080h	; LowMemory
 52286                                  	
 52287 000011C6 B90400                  	mov	cx,4
 52288 000011C9 FC                      	cld
 52289 000011CA F3A7                    	repe    cmpsw
 52290                                  
 52291 000011CC 7407                    	jz	short EA20_OFF
 52292                                  EA20_RET:
 52293 000011CE 5F                      	pop	di
 52294 000011CF 5E                      	pop	si
 52295 000011D0 59                      	pop	cx
 52296 000011D1 07                      	pop	es
 52297 000011D2 1F                      	pop	ds
 52298 000011D3 9D                      	popf
 52299 000011D4 C3                      	retn
 52300                                  
 52301                                  EA20_OFF:
 52302                                  	; We are going to do the XMS call on the DOS's AuxStack.
 52303                                  	; NOTE: ints are disabled at this point.
 52304                                  
 52305 000011D5 53                      	push	bx
 52306 000011D6 50                      	push	ax
 52307                                  
 52308 000011D7 8CD0                    	mov	ax,ss			; save user's stack pointer
 52309 000011D9 2EA3[D210]              	mov	[cs:SS_Save],ax
 52310 000011DD 2E8926[D410]            	mov	[cs:SP_Save],sp
 52311 000011E2 8CC8                    	mov	ax,cs
 52312 000011E4 8ED0                    	mov	ss,ax
 52313 000011E6 BC[A007]                	mov	sp,AUXSTACK
 52314                                  					; ss:sp -> DOSDATA:AuxStack
 52315                                  	;mov	ah,XMM_LOCAL_ENABLE_A20
 52316 000011E9 B405                    	mov	ah,5
 52317 000011EB 2EFF1E[AF11]            	call	far [cs:XMMcontrol]
 52318 000011F0 09C0                    	or	ax,ax
 52319 000011F2 740F                    	jz	short XMMerror		; AX = 0 fatal error
 52320                                  
 52321 000011F4 2EA1[D210]              	mov	ax,[cs:SS_Save]		; restore user stack
 52322 000011F8 8ED0                    	mov	ss,ax
 52323 000011FA 2E8B26[D410]            	mov	sp,[cs:SP_Save]
 52324                                  
 52325 000011FF 58                      	pop	ax
 52326 00001200 5B                      	pop	bx
 52327                                  
 52328 00001201 EBCB                    	jmp	short EA20_RET
 52329                                  
 52330                                  XMMerror:				; M006 - Start
 52331 00001203 B40F                    	mov	ah,0Fh			; get video mode
 52332 00001205 CD10                    	int	10h
 52333 00001207 3C07                    	cmp	al,7			; Q: are we an MDA
 52334 00001209 7406                    	je	short XMMcont			; Y: do not change mode
 52335 0000120B 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah ; 0			; set video mode
 52336 0000120D B002                    	mov	al,02h			; 80 X 25 text
 52337 0000120F CD10                    	int	10h
 52338                                  XMMcont:
 52339 00001211 B405                    	mov	ah,05h			; set display page
 52340 00001213 30C0                    	xor	al,al			; page 0
 52341 00001215 CD10                    	int	10h
 52342                                  	
 52343 00001217 BE[3C13]                	mov	si,XMMERRMSG
 52344 0000121A 0E                      	push	cs
 52345 0000121B 1F                      	pop	ds
 52346 0000121C FC                      	cld				; clear direction flag
 52347                                  XMMprnt:
 52348 0000121D AC                      	lodsb
 52349 0000121E 3C24                    	cmp	al,'$'			; indicates end of XMMERRMSG
 52350 00001220 7409                    	jz	short XMMStall		; function 0Eh	
 52351 00001222 B40E                    	mov	ah,0Eh
 52352 00001224 BB0700                  	mov	bx,7
 52353 00001227 CD10                    	int	10h
 52354 00001229 EBF2                    	jmp	short XMMprnt
 52355                                  
 52356                                  XMMStall:
 52357 0000122B FB                      	sti				; allow the user to warm boot
 52358 0000122C EBFD                    	jmp	short XMMStall		; M006 - End
 52359                                  
 52360                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 52361                                  
 52362                                  ; 27/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 52363                                  
 52364                                  ; retrodos4.s ; offset 0Ch in BIOS segment (0070h)
 52365                                  ALTAH	equ 0Ch
 52366                                  
 52367                                  ;This has been put in for WIN386 2.XX support. The format of the instance 
 52368                                  ;table was different for this. Segments will be patched in at init time.
 52369                                  
 52370                                  OldInstanceJunk:
 52371 0000122E 7000                    	dw	70h	;segment of BIOS
 52372 00001230 0000                    	dw	0	;indicate stacks in SYSINIT area
 52373 00001232 0600                    	dw	6	;6 instance items
 52374

 52388

 52450                                  
 52451                                  ; DOS 3.3 F.C. 6/12/86
 52452                                  ; FASTOPEN communications area DOS 3.3   F.C. 5/29/86
 52453                                  
 52454                                  FastTable:				; a better name
 52455                                  FastOpenTable:
 52456 00001265 0200                    	dw      2                       ; number of entries
 52457 00001267 [8018]                  	dw      FastRet			; pointer to ret instr.
 52458 00001269 0000                    	dw      0                       ; and will be modified by
 52459 0000126B [8018]                  	dw      FastRet			; FASTxxx when loaded in
 52460 0000126D 0000                    	dw      0
 52461                                  
 52462                                  ; DOS 3.3 F.C. 6/12/86
 52463                                  
 52464                                  FastFlg:				; flags

 52763                                  ;
 52764                                  ; The dos 4.X redir requires that country_cdpg is at offset 0122ah. Any new
 52765                                  ; data variable that is to be added to DOSDATA must go in between Mark3
 52766                                  ; COUNTRY_CDPG if it can.

 52785                                  ; The following table is used for DOS 3.3
 52786                                  ;DOS country and code page information is defined here for DOS 3.3.
 52787                                  ;The initial value for ccDosCountry is 1 (USA).
 52788                                  ;The initial value for ccDosCodepage is 850.

 52962                                  
 52963                                  ; 05/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 MSDOS.SYS)
 52964                                  ; DOSDATA:12CFh (MSDOS 5.0, MSDOS.SYS)
 52965                                  
 52966                                  ; first and second DOS patches
 52967                                  ;	Non-console device read/write (system calls 3Fh and 40h)
 52968                                  ;
 52969                                  ; Code in disk.asm, 2 locations, one for read, one for write
 52970                                  ;	DVRDLP:
 52971                                  ;	DVWRTLP:
 52972                                  ;
 52973                                  ;
 52974                                  ; 036h	lds	si,SS:[????]				  ; ThisSFT
 52975                                  ;	lds	si,si+7 				  ; sf_devptr
 52976                                  ; 0E8h	call	????		<- "simulate" int28 event ; DSKSTATCHK
 52977                                  
 52978                                  DOSP1_ID:	db	036h,0C5h,036h
 52979                                  DOSP1_THISSFT:	db	036h,005h,0C5h,074h,007h,0E8h
 52980                                  DOSP1_ID_LEN	equ	$-DOSP1_ID
 52981                                  
 52982                                  		db	90h, 90h
 52983                                  
 52984                                  DOSP12_ID:	db	036h,0C5h,036h
 52985                                  DOSP12_THISSFT:	db	036h,005h,0C5h,074h,007h,0E8h
 52986                                  DOSP12_ID_LEN	equ	$-DOSP1_ID
 52987                                  
 52988                                  ; DOSDATA:12E3h
 52989                                  
 52990                                  ; Third/Fourth DOS patch - System call 3Fh (Read) from console
 52991                                  ;
 52992                                  ; Code in disk.asm, 1 location
 52993                                  ;	GETBUF:
 52994                                  ;
 52995                                  ; 051h	push	cx	<- begin special int28 mode
 52996                                  ;	push	es
 52997                                  ;	push	di
 52998                                  ;	mov	dx,???? ; offset dosgroup:CONBUF
 52999                                  ;	call	????	; $STD_CON_STRING_INPUT
 53000                                  ;	pop	di
 53001                                  ;	pop	es
 53002                                  ; 059h	pop	cx	<- end special int28 mode
 53003                                  
 53004                                  DOSP3_ID:	db	051h,006h,057h,0BAh
 53005                                  DOSP3_CONBUF:	db	029h,002h,0E8h
 53006                                  DOSP3_ID_LEN	equ	$-DOSP3_ID
 53007                                  		db	09Ah,0E3h,05Fh,007h	; ???? , pop di, pop es
 53008                                  DOSP4_ID:	db	059h			; pop cx
 53009                                  DOSP4_ID_OFF	equ	(DOSP4_ID - DOSP3_ID)
 53010                                  	
 53011                                  ; DOSDATA:12EFh
 53012                                  
 53013                                  ; Fifth DOS patch - System call 40h (Write) to console
 53014                                  ;
 53015                                  ; Code in disk.asm, 1 location
 53016                                  ;
 53017                                  ;		push	cx
 53018                                  ;      WRCONLP: lodsb
 53019                                  ;		cmp	al,1Ah
 53020                                  ;		jz	????
 53021                                  ;		call	????	<- "simulate" int28 event
 53022                                  ;		loop	WRCONLP
 53023                                  ;      CONEOF:	pop	ax
 53024                                  
 53025                                  DOSP5_ID:	db	051h			; push cx
 53026                                  		db	0ACh,03Ch,01Ah,074h,005h
 53027                                  		db	0E8h			; call
 53028                                  DOSP5_ID_LEN	equ	$-DOSP5_ID
 53029                                  
 53030                                  ; DOSDATA:12F6h
 53031                                  
 53032                                  ; Seventh DOS patch - System call entry, patch USER_ID with VMid for share
 53033                                  ;
 53034                                  ; Code in disp.asm, 1 location
 53035                                  ;
 53036                                  ;
 53037                                  ;	mov [SaveDS],ds
 53038                                  ;	mov [SaveBX],bx
 53039                                  ;	mov bx,cs
 53040                                  ;	mov ds,bx
 53041                                  ;	inc [indos]
 53042                                  ;	xor ax,ax
 53043                                  ;	mov [USER_ID],AX	<- Patch to set USER_ID to VMID
 53044                                  
 53045                                  DOSP7_ID:	db	02Eh,08Ch,01Eh
 53046                                  DOSP7_SAVEDS:	db	07Eh,05h		; mov [SaveDS],ds
 53047                                  		db	02Eh,089h,01Eh
 53048                                  DOSP7_SAVEBX:	db	07Ch,05h		; mov [SaveBX],bx
 53049                                  		db	08Ch,0CBh		; mov bx,cs
 53050                                  		db	08Eh,0DBh		; mov ds,bx
 53051                                  		db	0FEh,006h
 53052                                  DOSP7_INDOS:	db	0CFh,002h		; inc [indos]
 53053                                  		db	033h,0C0h		; xor ax,ax
 53054                                  DOSP7_ID_LEN	equ	$-DOSP7_ID
 53055                                  
 53056                                  ; DOSDATA:130Ah
 53057                                  
 53058                                  ; Eighth DOS patch - OWNER check in handle calls. For share, need to NOP test
 53059                                  ;
 53060                                  ; Code in handle.asm, 1 location in routine CheckOwner
 53061                                  ;
 53062                                  ;
 53063                                  ;
 53064                                  ;	push	ax
 53065                                  ;	mov	ax,ss:[USER_ID]     <- patch to XOR AX,AX to set zero
 53066                                  ;	cmp	ax,es:[di.sf_UID]   <- NOP
 53067                                  ;	pop	ax
 53068                                  ;	jz	????
 53069                                  
 53070                                  DOSP8_ID:	db	050h			; push ax
 53071                                  		db	036h,0A1h
 53072                                  DOSP8_USER_ID:	db	0EAh,002h		; mov  ax,ss:[USER_ID]
 53073                                  		db	026h,03Bh,045h		; cmp  ax,es:[di+2F]
 53074                                  DOSP8_ID_LEN	equ	$-DOSP8_ID
 53075                                  		db	02Fh,058h		; pop  ax
 53076                                  
 53077                                  ; DOSDATA:1314h
 53078                                  
 53079                                  ; 10th, 11th, 12th DOS patch - System call 3Fh (Read) in raw mode
 53080                                  ;
 53081                                  ;   Take RAW read to STDIN SFT and turn it into a polling loop doing
 53082                                  ;   a yeild when a character is not ready to be read.
 53083                                  ;
 53084                                  ; Code in disk.asm, 3 locations
 53085                                  ;
 53086                                  ;   DVRDRAW:
 53087                                  ;	    PUSH    ES
 53088                                  ;	    POP     DS
 53089                                  ;   ReadRawRetry:				<- Patch 10
 53090                                  ;	    MOV     BX,DI
 53091                                  ;	    XOR     AX,AX			<- Reenter #2
 53092                                  ;	    MOV     DX,AX
 53093                                  ;	    call    SETREAD
 53094                                  ;	    PUSH    DS				<- Reenter #1
 53095                                  ;	    LDS     SI,[THISSFT]
 53096                                  ;	    call    DEVIOCALL
 53097                                  ;	    MOV     DX,DI
 53098                                  ;	    MOV     AH,86H
 53099                                  ;	    MOV     DI,[DEVCALL.REQSTAT]
 53100                                  ;	    TEST    DI,STERR
 53101                                  ;	    JZ	    CRDROK
 53102                                  ;	    call    CHARHARD
 53103                                  ;	    MOV     DI,DX
 53104                                  ;	    OR	    AL,AL
 53105                                  ;	    JZ	    CRDROK
 53106                                  ;	    CMP     AL,3
 53107                                  ;	    JZ	    CRDFERR
 53108                                  ;	    POP     DS
 53109                                  ;	    JMP     ReadRawRetry
 53110                                  ;
 53111                                  ;   CRDFERR:
 53112                                  ;	    POP     DI				<- Patch 11
 53113                                  ;   DEVIOFERR:
 53114                                  ;	    LES     DI,[THISSFT]
 53115                                  ;	    jmp     SET_ACC_ERR_DS
 53116                                  ;
 53117                                  ;   CRDROK:
 53118                                  ;	    POP     DI				<- Patch 12
 53119                                  ;	    MOV     DI,DX
 53120                                  ;	    ADD     DI,[CALLSCNT]
 53121                                  ;	    JMP     SHORT ENDRDDEVJ3
 53122                                  
 53123                                  DOSP10_ID:		db	006H,01FH
 53124                                  DOSP10_LOC_OFFSET	equ	$-DOSP10_ID
 53125                                  DOSP10_LOC:		db	08BH,0DFH
 53126                                  DOSP10_REENT2_OFFSET	equ	$-DOSP10_LOC
 53127                                  			db	033H,0C0H,08BH,0D0H,0E8H
 53128                                  DOSP10_ID_LEN		equ	$-DOSP10_ID
 53129                                  			db	0DFH,00EH
 53130                                  DOSP10_REENT1_OFFSET	equ	$-DOSP10_LOC
 53131                                  			db	01EH,036H,0C5H,036H,036H,005H,0E8H,0AFH,00EH
 53132                                  			db	08BH,0D7H,0B4H,086H,036H,08BH,03EH
 53133                                  DOSP10_PACKVAL_OFFSET	equ	$-DOSP10_ID
 53134                                  			db	009H,003H
 53135                                  			db	0F7H,0C7H,000H,080H,074H,019H,0E8H,047H,017H
 53136                                  			db	08BH,0FAH,00AH,0C0H,074H,010H,03CH,003H,074H,003H
 53137                                  			db	01FH,0EBH,0CFH
 53138                                  DOSP11_LOC_OFFSET	equ	$-DOSP10_ID
 53139                                  			db	05FH
 53140                                  DOSP11_REENT_OFFSET	equ	$-DOSP10_LOC
 53141                                  			db	036H,0C4H,03EH,036H,005H,0E9H,0A1H,004H
 53142                                  
 53143                                  DOSP12_LOC_OFFSET	equ	$-DOSP10_ID
 53144                                  			db	05FH,08BH,0FAH
 53145                                  ; DOSDATA:1353h
 53146                                  
 53147                                  ; 13th DOS patch - Actually a SYSINIT patch. Patches the stack fault code
 53148                                  ;		which prints the fatal stack fault error on DOS >= 3.20.
 53149                                  ;
 53150                                  ;	    Sets focus to current VM so user can see fatal message.
 53151                                  ;
 53152                                  ;
 53153                                  ;	l0: lodsb		<- Setfocus here
 53154                                  ;	    cmp al, '$'
 53155                                  ;	    je l1
 53156                                  ;	    mov bl, 7
 53157                                  ;	    mov ah, 0Eh
 53158                                  ;	    int 10h
 53159                                  ;	    jmp l0
 53160                                  ;	l1: jmp $
 53161                                  
 53162                                  DOSP13_ID:	db	0ACh			; l0: lodsb
 53163                                  		db	03Ch,024h		;     cmp al, '$'
 53164                                  		db	074h,008h		;     je l1
 53165                                  		db	0B3h,007h		;     mov bl, 7
 53166                                  		db	0B4h,00Eh		;     mov ah, 0Eh
 53167                                  		db	0CDh,010h		;     int 10h
 53168                                  		db	0EBh,0F3h		;     jmp l0
 53169                                  		db	0EBh,0FEh		; l1: jmp $
 53170                                  DOSP13_ID_LEN	equ	$-DOSP13_ID
 53171

 53183                                  ;============================================================================
 53184                                  ; MPATCH.ASM (MSDOS 6.0, 1993)
 53185                                  ;============================================================================
 53186                                  ; 27/04/2019 - Retro DOS 4.0
 53187                                  
 53188                                  ;mpatch.asm -- holds data patch location for callouts 
 53189                                  ; -- allocate cluster in rom.asm
 53190                                  ;
 53191                                  ; This area is pointed to by OffsetMagicPatch[609h] in fixed DOS data.
 53192                                  ; Currently, this location is used only by magicdrv.sys's patch to
 53193                                  ; cluster allocation, however it can be expanded to be used by other
 53194                                  ; patches. This is important since we have an easy-access pointer to
 53195                                  ; this location in OffsetMagicPatch. Magicdrv.sys is guaranteed to
 53196                                  ; only patch out a far call/retf, so any space after that could be
 53197                                  ; used as a patch by using OffsetMagicPatch+6. See rom.asm on how
 53198                                  ; to call out here.
 53199                                  ;
 53200                                  ; Currently, we allocate only the minimum space required for the 6
 53201                                  ; byte magicdrv patch, so if you change the dos data, you may want
 53202                                  ; to reserve space here if your new data will be position dependent
 53203                                  ; and would prohibit growing of this table.
 53204                                  ;       
 53205                                  ;history	-	created 8-7-92 by scottq
 53206                                  ;		-	added Rational386PatchPtr 2-1-93 by jimmat
 53207                                  ;
 53208                                  ;Exported Functions
 53209                                  ;==================
 53210                                  ;MagicPatch     -       callout patched by magidrv.sys for cluster allocations
 53211                                  
 53212                                  ; DosData Segment
 53213                                  
 53214                                  ; DOSDATA:1362h (MSDOS 6.21, MSDOS.SYS)
 53215                                  
 53216                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 53217                                  
 53218                                  ; Rational386PatchPtr points to either a RET instruction (80286 or less) or
 53219                                  ; a routine to fix buggy versions of the Rational DOS Extender (80386 or
 53220                                  ; greater). Added to this file because it needed to be somewhere and is
 53221                                  ; 'patch' related.
 53222                                  
 53223                                  Rational386PatchPtr:
 53224 00001467 0000                    	dw	0	; points to patch routine or RET instr.
 53225                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 53226                                  
 53227                                  MagicPatch:
 53228                                  ;MagicPatch proc far
 53229 00001469 CB                              retf            ;default is to just return to allocate
 53230 0000146A 90                              nop             ;however, this code will be patched
 53231 0000146B 90                              nop             ;by magicdrv.sys to
 53232 0000146C 90                              nop             ; call far ?:?     
 53233 0000146D 90                              nop             ; retf or perhaps just jmp far
 53234 0000146E 90                              nop             ;retf/nop take one byte, so we need six instructions
 53235                                                          ;for 6 byte patch
 53236                                  ;MagicPatch endp
 53237                                  
 53238                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 53239                                  
 53240                                  ;DosData Ends
 53241                                  
 53242                                  ; DOSDATA:136Ah
 53243                                  
 53244                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 53245                                  
 53246                                  ;DOSDATALAST SEGMENT
 53247                                  
 53248                                  ; 29/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
